  3591	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  3592	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tNice kind of evening feeling. No more wandering about. Just loll there:
  3593	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tquiet dusk: let everything rip. Forget. Tell about places you have been,
  3594	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tstrange customs. The other one, jar on her head, was getting the supper:
  3595	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfruit, olives, lovely cool water out of a well, stonecold like the hole
  3596	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tin the wall at Ashtown. Must carry a paper goblet next time I go to the
  3597	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttrottingmatches. She listens with big dark soft eyes. Tell her: more and
  3598	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmore: all. Then a sigh: silence. Long long long rest.
  3599	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  3600	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tGoing under the railway arch he took out the envelope, tore it swiftly
  3601	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tin shreds and scattered them towards the road. The shreds fluttered
  3602	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\taway, sank in the dank air: a white flutter, then all sank.
  3603	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  3604	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHenry Flower. You could tear up a cheque for a hundred pounds in the
  3605	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsame way. Simple bit of paper. Lord Iveagh once cashed a sevenfigure
  3606	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcheque for a million in the bank of Ireland. Shows you the money to be
  3607	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmade out of porter. Still the other brother lord Ardilaun has to change
  3608	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\this shirt four times a day, they say. Skin breeds lice or vermin. A
  3609	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmillion pounds, wait a moment. Twopence a pint, fourpence a quart,
  3610	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\teightpence a gallon of porter, no, one and fourpence a gallon of porter.
  3611	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tOne and four into twenty: fifteen about. Yes, exactly. Fifteen millions
  3612	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof barrels of porter.
  3613	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  3614	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tWhat am I saying barrels? Gallons. About a million barrels all the same.
  3615	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  3616	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tAn incoming train clanked heavily above his head, coach after coach.
  3617	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBarrels bumped in his head: dull porter slopped and churned inside.
  3618	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThe bungholes sprang open and a huge dull flood leaked out, flowing
  3619	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttogether, winding through mudflats all over the level land, a lazy
  3620	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpooling swirl of liquor bearing along wideleaved flowers of its froth.
  3621	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t

  3623	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\the doffed his hat, took the card from his pocket and tucked it again
  3624	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbehind the leather headband. Damn it. I might have tried to work M’Coy

  3629	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tconversion of Gladstone they had too when he was almost unconscious. The
  3630	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tprotestants are the same. Convert Dr William J. Walsh D.D. to the true

  3632	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\theathen Chinee. Prefer an ounce of opium. Celestials. Rank heresy for
  3633	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthem. Buddha their god lying on his side in the museum. Taking it easy
  3634	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twith hand under his cheek. Josssticks burning. Not like Ecce Homo. Crown

  3637	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdidn’t work him about getting Molly into the choir instead of that
  3638	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tFather Farley who looked a fool but wasn’t. They’re taught that. He’s
  3639	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tnot going out in bluey specs with the sweat rolling off him to baptise
  3640	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tblacks, is he? The glasses would take their fancy, flashing. Like to see
  3641	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthem sitting round in a ring with blub lips, entranced, listening. Still

  3650	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbenches with crimson halters round their necks, heads bowed. A batch

  3653	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcommunion, shook a drop or two (are they in water?) off it and put it
  3654	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tneatly into her mouth. Her hat and head sank. Then the next one. Her hat
  3655	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsank at once. Then the next one: a small old woman. The priest bent down
  3656	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tto put it into her mouth, murmuring all the time. Latin. The next one.
  3657	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tShut your eyes and open your mouth. What? Corpus: body. Corpse. Good
  3658	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tidea the Latin. Stupefies them first. Hospice for the dying. They
  3659	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdon’t seem to chew it: only swallow it down. Rum idea: eating bits of a
  3660	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcorpse. Why the cannibals cotton to it.

  3664	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tits corner, nursing his hat and newspaper. These pots we have to wear.

  3667	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tit to melt in their stomachs. Something like those mazzoth: it’s that

  3672	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tparty, same in the theatre, all in the same swim. They do. I’m sure of
  3673	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthat. Not so lonely. In our confraternity. Then come out a bit spreeish.

  3676	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfellow asleep near that confessionbox. Hence those snores. Blind faith.

  3723	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tart and statues and pictures of all kinds. Palestrina for example too.
  3724	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThey had a gay old time while it lasted. Healthy too, chanting, regular
  3725	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thours, then brew liqueurs. Benedictine. Green Chartreuse. Still, having
  3726	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\teunuchs in their choir that was coming it a bit thick. What kind of
  3727	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tvoice is it? Must be curious to hear after their own strong basses.

  3754	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMary. Flowers, incense, candles melting. Hide her blushes. Salvation
  3755	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tarmy blatant imitation. Reformed prostitute will address the meeting.
  3756	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHow I found the Lord. Squareheaded chaps those must be in Rome: they
  3757	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twork the whole show. And don’t they rake in the money too? Bequests
  3758	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\talso: to the P.P. for the time being in his absolute discretion.
  3759	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMasses for the repose of my soul to be said publicly with open doors.

  3761	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twitnessbox. No browbeating him. He had his answer pat for everything.
  3762	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tLiberty and exaltation of our holy mother the church. The doctors of the
  3763	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tchurch: they mapped out the whole theology of it.

  3783	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbefore. Still like you better untidy. Good job it wasn’t farther south.

  3787	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe low tide of holy water. Trams: a car of Prescott’s dyeworks: a widow
  3788	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tin her weeds. Notice because I’m in mourning myself. He covered himself.
  3789	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHow goes the time? Quarter past. Time enough yet. Better get that lotion
  3790	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmade up. Where is this? Ah yes, the last time. Sweny’s in Lincoln place.
  3791	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tChemists rarely move. Their green and gold beaconjars too heavy to stir.
  3792	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHamilton Long’s, founded in the year of the flood. Huguenot churchyard
  3793	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tnear there. Visit some day.

  3796	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttrousers. O, and I forgot that latchkey too. Bore this funeral affair.
  3797	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tO well, poor fellow, it’s not his fault. When was it I got it made up
  3798	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlast? Wait. I changed a sovereign I remember. First of the month it must
  3799	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thave been or the second. O, he can look it up in the prescriptions book.
  3800	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  3801	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThe chemist turned back page after page. Sandy shrivelled smell he seems
  3802	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tto have. Shrunken skull. And old. Quest for the philosopher’s stone. The
  3803	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\talchemists. Drugs age you after mental excitement. Lethargy then. Why?
  3804	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tReaction. A lifetime in a night. Gradually changes your character.
  3805	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tLiving all the day among herbs, ointments, disinfectants. All his
  3806	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\talabaster lilypots. Mortar and pestle. Aq. Dist. Fol. Laur. Te Virid.
  3807	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tSmell almost cure you like the dentist’s doorbell. Doctor Whack. He
  3808	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tought to physic himself a bit. Electuary or emulsion. The first fellow
  3809	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthat picked an herb to cure himself had a bit of pluck. Simples. Want to
  3810	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbe careful. Enough stuff here to chloroform you. Test: turns blue
  3811	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlitmus paper red. Chloroform. Overdose of laudanum. Sleeping draughts.
  3812	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tLovephiltres. Paragoric poppysyrup bad for cough. Clogs the pores or the
  3813	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tphlegm. Poisons the only cures. Remedy where you least expect it. Clever
  3814	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof nature.
  3815	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  3816	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—About a fortnight ago, sir?
  3817	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  3818	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Yes, Mr Bloom said.
  3819	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  3820	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHe waited by the counter, inhaling slowly the keen reek of drugs, the
  3821	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdusty dry smell of sponges and loofahs. Lot of time taken up telling
  3822	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tyour aches and pains.
  3823	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  3824	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Sweet almond oil and tincture of benzoin, Mr Bloom said, and then
  3825	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\torangeflower water...
  3826	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  3827	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tIt certainly did make her skin so delicate white like wax.
  3828	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  3829	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—And white wax also, he said.
  3830	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  3831	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBrings out the darkness of her eyes. Looking at me, the sheet up to
  3832	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ther eyes, Spanish, smelling herself, when I was fixing the links in my
  3833	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcuffs. Those homely recipes are often the best: strawberries for the
  3834	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tteeth: nettles and rainwater: oatmeal they say steeped in buttermilk.
  3835	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tSkinfood. One of the old queen’s sons, duke of Albany was it? had only
  3836	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tone skin. Leopold, yes. Three we have. Warts, bunions and pimples to
  3837	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmake it worse. But you want a perfume too. What perfume does your? Peau
  3838	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\td’Espagne. That orangeflower water is so fresh. Nice smell these soaps
  3839	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thave. Pure curd soap. Time to get a bath round the corner. Hammam.
  3840	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTurkish. Massage. Dirt gets rolled up in your navel. Nicer if a nice
  3841	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tgirl did it. Also I think I. Yes I. Do it in the bath. Curious longing
  3842	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tI. Water to water. Combine business with pleasure. Pity no time for
  3843	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmassage. Feel fresh then all the day. Funeral be rather glum.
  3844	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  3845	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Yes, sir, the chemist said. That was two and nine. Have you brought a
  3846	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbottle?
  3847	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  3848	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—No, Mr Bloom said. Make it up, please. I’ll call later in the day and
  3849	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tI’ll take one of these soaps. How much are they?
  3850	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  3851	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Fourpence, sir.
  3852	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  3853	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMr Bloom raised a cake to his nostrils. Sweet lemony wax.
  3854	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  3855	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—I’ll take this one, he said. That makes three and a penny.
  3856	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  3857	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Yes, sir, the chemist said. You can pay all together, sir, when you
  3858	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcome back.
  3859	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  3860	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Good, Mr Bloom said.
  3861	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  3862	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHe strolled out of the shop, the newspaper baton under his armpit, the
  3863	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcoolwrappered soap in his left hand.
  3864	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  3865	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tAt his armpit Bantam Lyons’ voice and hand said:
  3866	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  3867	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Hello, Bloom. What’s the best news? Is that today’s? Show us a minute.
  3868	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  3869	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tShaved off his moustache again, by Jove! Long cold upper lip. To look
  3870	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tyounger. He does look balmy. Younger than I am.
  3871	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  3872	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBantam Lyons’s yellow blacknailed fingers unrolled the baton. Wants a
  3873	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twash too. Take off the rough dirt. Good morning, have you used Pears’
  3874	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsoap? Dandruff on his shoulders. Scalp wants oiling.
  3875	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  3876	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—I want to see about that French horse that’s running today, Bantam
  3877	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tLyons said. Where the bugger is it?
  3878	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  3879	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHe rustled the pleated pages, jerking his chin on his high collar.
  3880	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBarber’s itch. Tight collar he’ll lose his hair. Better leave him the
  3881	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpaper and get shut of him.
  3882	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  3883	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—You can keep it, Mr Bloom said.
  3884	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  3885	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Ascot. Gold cup. Wait, Bantam Lyons muttered. Half a mo. Maximum the
  3886	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsecond.
  3887	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  3888	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—I was just going to throw it away, Mr Bloom said.
  3889	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  3890	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBantam Lyons raised his eyes suddenly and leered weakly.
  3891	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  3892	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—What’s that? his sharp voice said.
  3893	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  3894	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—I say you can keep it, Mr Bloom answered. I was going to throw it away
  3895	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthat moment.
  3896	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  3897	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBantam Lyons doubted an instant, leering: then thrust the outspread
  3898	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsheets back on Mr Bloom’s arms.
  3899	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  3900	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—I’ll risk it, he said. Here, thanks.
  3901	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  3902	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHe sped off towards Conway’s corner. God speed scut.
  3903	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  3904	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMr Bloom folded the sheets again to a neat square and lodged the soap
  3905	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tin it, smiling. Silly lips of that chap. Betting. Regular hotbed of it
  3906	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlately. Messenger boys stealing to put on sixpence. Raffle for large
  3907	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttender turkey. Your Christmas dinner for threepence. Jack Fleming
  3908	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tembezzling to gamble then smuggled off to America. Keeps a hotel now.
  3909	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThey never come back. Fleshpots of Egypt.
  3910	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  3911	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHe walked cheerfully towards the mosque of the baths. Remind you of a
  3912	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmosque, redbaked bricks, the minarets. College sports today I see. He
  3913	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\teyed the horseshoe poster over the gate of college park: cyclist doubled
  3914	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tup like a cod in a pot. Damn bad ad. Now if they had made it round
  3915	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlike a wheel. Then the spokes: sports, sports, sports: and the hub big:
  3916	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcollege. Something to catch the eye.
  3917	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  3918	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThere’s Hornblower standing at the porter’s lodge. Keep him on hands:
  3919	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmight take a turn in there on the nod. How do you do, Mr Hornblower? How
  3920	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdo you do, sir?
  3921	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  3922	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHeavenly weather really. If life was always like that. Cricket weather.
  3923	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tSit around under sunshades. Over after over. Out. They can’t play it
  3924	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\there. Duck for six wickets. Still Captain Culler broke a window in the
  3925	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tKildare street club with a slog to square leg. Donnybrook fair more
  3926	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tin their line. And the skulls we were acracking when M’Carthy took the
  3927	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfloor. Heatwave. Won’t last. Always passing, the stream of life, which
  3928	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tin the stream of life we trace is dearer than them all.
  3929	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  3930	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tEnjoy a bath now: clean trough of water, cool enamel, the gentle tepid
  3931	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tstream. This is my body.
  3932	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  3933	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHe foresaw his pale body reclined in it at full, naked, in a womb of
  3934	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twarmth, oiled by scented melting soap, softly laved. He saw his
  3935	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttrunk and limbs riprippled over and sustained, buoyed lightly upward,
  3936	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlemonyellow: his navel, bud of flesh: and saw the dark tangled curls of
  3937	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\this bush floating, floating hair of the stream around the limp father of
  3938	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthousands, a languid floating flower.

  3944	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t[ 6 ]
  3945	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  3946	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMartin Cunningham, first, poked his silkhatted head into the creaking
  3947	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcarriage and, entering deftly, seated himself. Mr Power stepped in after
  3948	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thim, curving his height with care.
  3949	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  3950	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Come on, Simon.
  3951	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  3952	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—After you, Mr Bloom said.
  3953	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  3954	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMr Dedalus covered himself quickly and got in, saying:
  3955	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  3956	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tYes, yes.
  3957	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  3958	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Are we all here now? Martin Cunningham asked. Come along, Bloom.
  3959	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  3960	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMr Bloom entered and sat in the vacant place. He pulled the door to
  3961	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tafter him and slammed it twice till it shut tight. He passed an arm
  3962	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthrough the armstrap and looked seriously from the open carriagewindow
  3963	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tat the lowered blinds of the avenue. One dragged aside: an old woman
  3964	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpeeping. Nose whiteflattened against the pane. Thanking her stars she
  3965	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twas passed over. Extraordinary the interest they take in a corpse. Glad
  3966	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tto see us go we give them such trouble coming. Job seems to suit them.
  3967	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHuggermugger in corners. Slop about in slipperslappers for fear he’d
  3968	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twake. Then getting it ready. Laying it out. Molly and Mrs Fleming making
  3969	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe bed. Pull it more to your side. Our windingsheet. Never know who
  3970	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twill touch you dead. Wash and shampoo. I believe they clip the nails and
  3971	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe hair. Keep a bit in an envelope. Grows all the same after. Unclean
  3972	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tjob.
  3973	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  3974	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tAll waited. Nothing was said. Stowing in the wreaths probably. I am
  3975	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsitting on something hard. Ah, that soap: in my hip pocket. Better shift
  3976	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tit out of that. Wait for an opportunity.
  3977	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  3978	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tAll waited. Then wheels were heard from in front, turning: then nearer:
  3979	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthen horses’ hoofs. A jolt. Their carriage began to move, creaking and
  3980	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tswaying. Other hoofs and creaking wheels started behind. The blinds of
  3981	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe avenue passed and number nine with its craped knocker, door ajar. At
  3982	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twalking pace.
  3983	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  3984	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThey waited still, their knees jogging, till they had turned and were
  3985	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpassing along the tramtracks. Tritonville road. Quicker. The wheels
  3986	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\trattled rolling over the cobbled causeway and the crazy glasses shook
  3987	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\trattling in the doorframes.
  3988	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  3989	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—What way is he taking us? Mr Power asked through both windows.
  3990	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  3991	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Irishtown, Martin Cunningham said. Ringsend. Brunswick street.
  3992	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  3993	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMr Dedalus nodded, looking out.
  3994	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  3995	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—That’s a fine old custom, he said. I am glad to see it has not died
  3996	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tout.
  3997	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  3998	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tAll watched awhile through their windows caps and hats lifted by
  3999	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpassers. Respect. The carriage swerved from the tramtrack to the
  4000	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsmoother road past Watery lane. Mr Bloom at gaze saw a lithe young man,
  4001	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tclad in mourning, a wide hat.
  4002	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  4003	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—There’s a friend of yours gone by, Dedalus, he said.
  4004	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  4005	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Who is that?
  4006	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  4007	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Your son and heir.
  4008	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  4009	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Where is he? Mr Dedalus said, stretching over across.
  4010	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  4011	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThe carriage, passing the open drains and mounds of rippedup roadway
  4012	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbefore the tenement houses, lurched round the corner and, swerving back
  4013	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tto the tramtrack, rolled on noisily with chattering wheels. Mr Dedalus
  4014	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfell back, saying:
  4015	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  4016	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Was that Mulligan cad with him? His fidus Achates!
  4017	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  4018	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—No, Mr Bloom said. He was alone.
  4019	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  4020	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Down with his aunt Sally, I suppose, Mr Dedalus said, the Goulding
  4021	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfaction, the drunken little costdrawer and Crissie, papa’s little lump
  4022	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof dung, the wise child that knows her own father.
  4023	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  4024	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMr Bloom smiled joylessly on Ringsend road. Wallace Bros: the
  4025	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbottleworks: Dodder bridge.
  4026	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  4027	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tRichie Goulding and the legal bag. Goulding, Collis and Ward he calls
  4028	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe firm. His jokes are getting a bit damp. Great card he was. Waltzing
  4029	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tin Stamer street with Ignatius Gallaher on a Sunday morning, the
  4030	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlandlady’s two hats pinned on his head. Out on the rampage all night.
  4031	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBeginning to tell on him now: that backache of his, I fear. Wife ironing
  4032	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\this back. Thinks he’ll cure it with pills. All breadcrumbs they are.
  4033	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tAbout six hundred per cent profit.
  4034	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  4035	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—He’s in with a lowdown crowd, Mr Dedalus snarled. That Mulligan is a
  4036	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcontaminated bloody doubledyed ruffian by all accounts. His name stinks
  4037	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tall over Dublin. But with the help of God and His blessed mother I’ll
  4038	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmake it my business to write a letter one of those days to his mother
  4039	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tor his aunt or whatever she is that will open her eye as wide as a gate.
  4040	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tI’ll tickle his catastrophe, believe you me.
  4041	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  4042	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHe cried above the clatter of the wheels:
  4043	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  4044	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—I won’t have her bastard of a nephew ruin my son. A counterjumper’s
  4045	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tson. Selling tapes in my cousin, Peter Paul M’Swiney’s. Not likely.
  4046	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  4047	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHe ceased. Mr Bloom glanced from his angry moustache to Mr Power’s mild
  4048	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tface and Martin Cunningham’s eyes and beard, gravely shaking. Noisy
  4049	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tselfwilled man. Full of his son. He is right. Something to hand on. If
  4050	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlittle Rudy had lived. See him grow up. Hear his voice in the house.
  4051	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tWalking beside Molly in an Eton suit. My son. Me in his eyes. Strange
  4052	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfeeling it would be. From me. Just a chance. Must have been that morning
  4053	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tin Raymond terrace she was at the window watching the two dogs at it by
  4054	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe wall of the cease to do evil. And the sergeant grinning up. She had
  4055	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthat cream gown on with the rip she never stitched. Give us a touch,
  4056	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tPoldy. God, I’m dying for it. How life begins.
  4057	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  4058	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tGot big then. Had to refuse the Greystones concert. My son inside her.
  4059	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tI could have helped him on in life. I could. Make him independent. Learn
  4060	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tGerman too.
  4061	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  4062	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Are we late? Mr Power asked.
  4063	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  4064	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Ten minutes, Martin Cunningham said, looking at his watch.
  4065	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  4066	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMolly. Milly. Same thing watered down. Her tomboy oaths. O jumping
  4067	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tJupiter! Ye gods and little fishes! Still, she’s a dear girl. Soon be a
  4068	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twoman. Mullingar. Dearest Papli. Young student. Yes, yes: a woman too.
  4069	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tLife, life.
  4070	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  4071	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThe carriage heeled over and back, their four trunks swaying.
  4072	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  4073	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Corny might have given us a more commodious yoke, Mr Power said.
  4074	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  4075	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—He might, Mr Dedalus said, if he hadn’t that squint troubling him. Do
  4076	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tyou follow me?
  4077	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  4078	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHe closed his left eye. Martin Cunningham began to brush away
  4079	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcrustcrumbs from under his thighs.
  4080	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  4081	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—What is this, he said, in the name of God? Crumbs?
  4082	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  4083	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Someone seems to have been making a picnic party here lately, Mr Power
  4084	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsaid.
  4085	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  4086	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tAll raised their thighs and eyed with disfavour the mildewed buttonless
  4087	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tleather of the seats. Mr Dedalus, twisting his nose, frowned downward
  4088	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand said:
  4089	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  4090	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Unless I’m greatly mistaken. What do you think, Martin?
  4091	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  4092	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—It struck me too, Martin Cunningham said.
  4093	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  4094	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMr Bloom set his thigh down. Glad I took that bath. Feel my feet quite
  4095	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tclean. But I wish Mrs Fleming had darned these socks better.
  4096	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  4097	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMr Dedalus sighed resignedly.
  4098	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  4099	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—After all, he said, it’s the most natural thing in the world.
  4100	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  4101	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Did Tom Kernan turn up? Martin Cunningham asked, twirling the peak of
  4102	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\this beard gently.
  4103	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  4104	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Yes, Mr Bloom answered. He’s behind with Ned Lambert and Hynes.
  4105	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  4106	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—And Corny Kelleher himself? Mr Power asked.
  4107	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  4108	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—At the cemetery, Martin Cunningham said.
  4109	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  4110	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—I met M’Coy this morning, Mr Bloom said. He said he’d try to come.
  4111	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  4112	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThe carriage halted short.
  4113	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  4114	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—What’s wrong?
  4115	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  4116	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—We’re stopped.
  4117	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  4118	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Where are we?
  4119	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  4120	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMr Bloom put his head out of the window.
  4121	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  4122	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—The grand canal, he said.
  4123	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  4124	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tGasworks. Whooping cough they say it cures. Good job Milly never got
  4125	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tit. Poor children! Doubles them up black and blue in convulsions. Shame
  4126	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\treally. Got off lightly with illnesses compared. Only measles. Flaxseed
  4127	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttea. Scarlatina, influenza epidemics. Canvassing for death. Don’t miss
  4128	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthis chance. Dogs’ home over there. Poor old Athos! Be good to Athos,
  4129	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tLeopold, is my last wish. Thy will be done. We obey them in the grave.
  4130	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tA dying scrawl. He took it to heart, pined away. Quiet brute. Old men’s
  4131	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdogs usually are.
  4132	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  4133	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tA raindrop spat on his hat. He drew back and saw an instant of shower
  4134	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tspray dots over the grey flags. Apart. Curious. Like through a colander.
  4135	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tI thought it would. My boots were creaking I remember now.
  4136	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  4137	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—The weather is changing, he said quietly.
  4138	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  4139	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—A pity it did not keep up fine, Martin Cunningham said.
  4140	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  4141	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Wanted for the country, Mr Power said. There’s the sun again coming
  4142	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tout.
  4143	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  4144	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMr Dedalus, peering through his glasses towards the veiled sun, hurled a
  4145	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmute curse at the sky.
  4146	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  4147	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—It’s as uncertain as a child’s bottom, he said.
  4148	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  4149	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—We’re off again.
  4150	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  4151	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThe carriage turned again its stiff wheels and their trunks swayed
  4152	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tgently. Martin Cunningham twirled more quickly the peak of his beard.
  4153	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  4154	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Tom Kernan was immense last night, he said. And Paddy Leonard taking
  4155	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thim off to his face.
  4156	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t

  4158	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tSimon, on Ben Dollard’s singing of The Croppy Boy.
  4159	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  4160	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Immense, Martin Cunningham said pompously. His singing of that simple
  4161	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tballad, Martin, is the most trenchant rendering I ever heard in the
  4162	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twhole course of my experience.
  4163	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  4164	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Trenchant, Mr Power said laughing. He’s dead nuts on that. And the
  4165	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tretrospective arrangement.
  4166	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  4167	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Did you read Dan Dawson’s speech? Martin Cunningham asked.
  4168	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  4169	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—I did not then, Mr Dedalus said. Where is it?
  4170	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  4171	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—In the paper this morning.
  4172	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  4173	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMr Bloom took the paper from his inside pocket. That book I must change
  4174	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfor her.
  4175	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  4176	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—No, no, Mr Dedalus said quickly. Later on please.
  4177	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  4178	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMr Bloom’s glance travelled down the edge of the paper, scanning the
  4179	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdeaths: Callan, Coleman, Dignam, Fawcett, Lowry, Naumann, Peake, what
  4180	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tPeake is that? is it the chap was in Crosbie and Alleyne’s? no, Sexton,
  4181	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tUrbright. Inked characters fast fading on the frayed breaking paper.
  4182	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThanks to the Little Flower. Sadly missed. To the inexpressible grief of
  4183	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\this. Aged 88 after a long and tedious illness. Month’s mind: Quinlan. On
  4184	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twhose soul Sweet Jesus have mercy.
  4185	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  4186	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t      It is now a month since dear Henry fled
  4187	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t      To his home up above in the sky
  4188	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t      While his family weeps and mourns his loss
  4189	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t      Hoping some day to meet him on high.
  4190	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  4191	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tI tore up the envelope? Yes. Where did I put her letter after I read it
  4192	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tin the bath? He patted his waistcoatpocket. There all right. Dear Henry
  4193	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfled. Before my patience are exhausted.
  4194	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  4195	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tNational school. Meade’s yard. The hazard. Only two there now. Nodding.
  4196	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tFull as a tick. Too much bone in their skulls. The other trotting round
  4197	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twith a fare. An hour ago I was passing there. The jarvies raised their
  4198	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thats.
  4199	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  4200	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tA pointsman’s back straightened itself upright suddenly against a
  4201	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttramway standard by Mr Bloom’s window. Couldn’t they invent something
  4202	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tautomatic so that the wheel itself much handier? Well but that fellow
  4203	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twould lose his job then? Well but then another fellow would get a job
  4204	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmaking the new invention?
  4205	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  4206	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tAntient concert rooms. Nothing on there. A man in a buff suit with a
  4207	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcrape armlet. Not much grief there. Quarter mourning. People in law
  4208	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tperhaps.
  4209	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  4210	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThey went past the bleak pulpit of saint Mark’s, under the railway
  4211	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbridge, past the Queen’s theatre: in silence. Hoardings: Eugene
  4212	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tStratton, Mrs Bandmann Palmer. Could I go to see Leah tonight, I wonder.

  4214	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpowerful change. Wet bright bills for next week. Fun on the Bristol.
  4215	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMartin Cunningham could work a pass for the Gaiety. Have to stand a
  4216	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdrink or two. As broad as it’s long.
  4217	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  4218	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHe’s coming in the afternoon. Her songs.
  4219	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  4220	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tPlasto’s. Sir Philip Crampton’s memorial fountain bust. Who was he?
  4221	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t

  4223	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsalute.
  4224	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  4225	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—He doesn’t see us, Mr Power said. Yes, he does. How do you do?
  4226	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  4227	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Who? Mr Dedalus asked.
  4228	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  4229	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Blazes Boylan, Mr Power said. There he is airing his quiff.
  4230	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  4231	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tJust that moment I was thinking.
  4232	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  4233	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMr Dedalus bent across to salute. From the door of the Red Bank the
  4234	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twhite disc of a straw hat flashed reply: spruce figure: passed.
  4235	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  4236	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMr Bloom reviewed the nails of his left hand, then those of his right
  4237	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thand. The nails, yes. Is there anything more in him that they she sees?
  4238	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tFascination. Worst man in Dublin. That keeps him alive. They sometimes
  4239	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfeel what a person is. Instinct. But a type like that. My nails. I
  4240	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tam just looking at them: well pared. And after: thinking alone. Body
  4241	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tgetting a bit softy. I would notice that: from remembering. What causes
  4242	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthat? I suppose the skin can’t contract quickly enough when the flesh
  4243	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfalls off. But the shape is there. The shape is there still. Shoulders.
  4244	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHips. Plump. Night of the dance dressing. Shift stuck between the cheeks
  4245	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbehind.
  4246	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t

  4251	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t

  4253	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  4254	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—O, very well, Mr Bloom said. I hear great accounts of it. It’s a good
  4255	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tidea, you see...

  4260	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcounty Clare on some private business. You see the idea is to tour the
  4261	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tchief towns. What you lose on one you can make up on the other.

  4268	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttopnobbers. J. C. Doyle and John MacCormack I hope and. The best, in

  4283	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tWonder why he was struck off the rolls. Had his office in Hume street.
  4284	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tSame house as Molly’s namesake, Tweedy, crown solicitor for Waterford.
  4285	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHas that silk hat ever since. Relics of old decency. Mourning too.
  4286	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTerrible comedown, poor wretch! Kicked about like snuff at a wake.
  4287	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tO’Callaghan on his last legs.

  4291	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe tips of her hairs to see if they are split. Mi trema un poco il.
  4292	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBeautiful on that tre her voice is: weeping tone. A thrush. A throstle.
  4293	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThere is a word throstle that expresses that.
  4294	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t

  4296	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe ears. Madame: smiling. I smiled back. A smile goes a long way. Only
  4297	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpoliteness perhaps. Nice fellow. Who knows is that true about the woman
  4298	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\the keeps? Not pleasant for the wife. Yet they say, who was it told me,
  4299	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthere is no carnal. You would imagine that would get played out pretty
  4300	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tquick. Yes, it was Crofton met him one evening bringing her a pound of

  4379	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  4380	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tNelson’s pillar.

  4387	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t

  4389	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMany a good one he told himself.
  4390	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t

  4393	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\the was in his usual health that I’d be driving after him like this. He’s
  4394	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tgone from us.
  4395	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  4396	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—As decent a little man as ever wore a hat, Mr Dedalus said. He went
  4397	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tvery suddenly.
  4398	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
