  5567	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThe foreman moved his pencil towards it.
  5568	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  5569	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—But wait, Mr Bloom said. He wants it changed. Keyes, you see. He wants
  5570	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttwo keys at the top.
  5571	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  5572	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHell of a racket they make. He doesn’t hear it. Nannan. Iron nerves.
  5573	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMaybe he understands what I.
  5574	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  5575	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThe foreman turned round to hear patiently and, lifting an elbow, began
  5576	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tto scratch slowly in the armpit of his alpaca jacket.
  5577	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  5578	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Like that, Mr Bloom said, crossing his forefingers at the top.
  5579	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  5580	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tLet him take that in first.
  5581	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  5582	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMr Bloom, glancing sideways up from the cross he had made, saw the
  5583	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tforeman’s sallow face, think he has a touch of jaundice, and beyond the
  5584	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tobedient reels feeding in huge webs of paper. Clank it. Clank it. Miles
  5585	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof it unreeled. What becomes of it after? O, wrap up meat, parcels:
  5586	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tvarious uses, thousand and one things.
  5587	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  5588	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tSlipping his words deftly into the pauses of the clanking he drew
  5589	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tswiftly on the scarred woodwork. HOUSE OF KEY(E)S
  5590	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  5591	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Like that, see. Two crossed keys here. A circle. Then here the name.
  5592	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tAlexander Keyes, tea, wine and spirit merchant. So on.
  5593	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  5594	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBetter not teach him his own business.
  5595	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  5596	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—You know yourself, councillor, just what he wants. Then round the top
  5597	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tin leaded: the house of keys. You see? Do you think that’s a good idea?
  5598	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  5599	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThe foreman moved his scratching hand to his lower ribs and scratched
  5600	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthere quietly.
  5601	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  5602	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—The idea, Mr Bloom said, is the house of keys. You know, councillor,
  5603	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe Manx parliament. Innuendo of home rule. Tourists, you know, from the
  5604	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tisle of Man. Catches the eye, you see. Can you do that?
  5605	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  5606	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tI could ask him perhaps about how to pronounce that voglio. But then if
  5607	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\the didn’t know only make it awkward for him. Better not.
  5608	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  5609	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—We can do that, the foreman said. Have you the design?
  5610	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  5611	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—I can get it, Mr Bloom said. It was in a Kilkenny paper. He has a house
  5612	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthere too. I’ll just run out and ask him. Well, you can do that and just
  5613	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ta little par calling attention. You know the usual. Highclass licensed
  5614	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpremises. Longfelt want. So on.
  5615	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  5616	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThe foreman thought for an instant.
  5617	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  5618	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—We can do that, he said. Let him give us a three months’ renewal.
  5619	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  5620	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tA typesetter brought him a limp galleypage. He began to check it
  5621	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsilently. Mr Bloom stood by, hearing the loud throbs of cranks, watching
  5622	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe silent typesetters at their cases. ORTHOGRAPHICAL
  5623	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  5624	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tWant to be sure of his spelling. Proof fever. Martin Cunningham forgot
  5625	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tto give us his spellingbee conundrum this morning. It is amusing to view
  5626	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe unpar one ar alleled embarra two ars is it? double ess ment of a
  5627	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tharassed pedlar while gauging au the symmetry with a y of a peeled pear
  5628	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tunder a cemetery wall. Silly, isn’t it? Cemetery put in of course on
  5629	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\taccount of the symmetry.
  5630	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  5631	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tI should have said when he clapped on his topper. Thank you. I ought
  5632	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tto have said something about an old hat or something. No. I could have
  5633	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsaid. Looks as good as new now. See his phiz then.
  5634	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t

  5637	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thuman the way it sllt to call attention. Doing its level best to speak.

  5640	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t

  5662	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  5663	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThree months’ renewal. Want to get some wind off my chest first. Try it
  5664	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tanyhow. Rub in August: good idea: horseshow month. Ballsbridge. Tourists
  5665	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tover for the show. A DAYFATHER
  5666	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  5667	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHe walked on through the caseroom passing an old man, bowed, spectacled,
  5668	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\taproned. Old Monks, the dayfather. Queer lot of stuff he must have put
  5669	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthrough his hands in his time: obituary notices, pubs’ ads, speeches,
  5670	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdivorce suits, found drowned. Nearing the end of his tether now. Sober
  5671	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tserious man with a bit in the savingsbank I’d say. Wife a good cook and
  5672	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twasher. Daughter working the machine in the parlour. Plain Jane, no damn
  5673	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tnonsense. AND IT WAS THE FEAST OF THE PASSOVER
  5674	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  5675	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHe stayed in his walk to watch a typesetter neatly distributing type.
  5676	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tReads it backwards first. Quickly he does it. Must require some practice
  5677	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthat. mangiD kcirtaP. Poor papa with his hagadah book, reading backwards
  5678	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twith his finger to me. Pessach. Next year in Jerusalem. Dear, O dear!
  5679	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tAll that long business about that brought us out of the land of Egypt
  5680	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand into the house of bondage alleluia. Shema Israel Adonai Elohenu. No,
  5681	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthat’s the other. Then the twelve brothers, Jacob’s sons. And then
  5682	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe lamb and the cat and the dog and the stick and the water and the
  5683	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbutcher. And then the angel of death kills the butcher and he kills the
  5684	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tox and the dog kills the cat. Sounds a bit silly till you come to look
  5685	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tinto it well. Justice it means but it’s everybody eating everyone else.
  5686	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThat’s what life is after all. How quickly he does that job. Practice
  5687	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmakes perfect. Seems to see with his fingers.
  5688	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  5689	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMr Bloom passed on out of the clanking noises through the gallery on to
  5690	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe landing. Now am I going to tram it out all the way and then catch
  5691	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thim out perhaps. Better phone him up first. Number? Yes. Same as
  5692	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tCitron’s house. Twentyeight. Twentyeight double four. ONLY ONCE MORE
  5693	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTHAT SOAP
  5694	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  5695	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHe went down the house staircase. Who the deuce scrawled all over those
  5696	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twalls with matches? Looks as if they did it for a bet. Heavy greasy
  5697	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsmell there always is in those works. Lukewarm glue in Thom’s next door
  5698	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twhen I was there.
  5699	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t

  5712	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHe entered softly. ERIN, GREEN GEM OF THE SILVER SEA
  5713	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  5714	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—The ghost walks, professor MacHugh murmured softly, biscuitfully to the
  5715	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdusty windowpane.

  5718	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tface, asked of it sourly:
  5719	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t

  5721	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  5722	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tNed Lambert, seated on the table, read on:
  5723	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  5724	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Or again, note the meanderings of some purling rill as it babbles on
  5725	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tits way, tho’ quarrelling with the stony obstacles, to the tumbling
  5726	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twaters of Neptune’s blue domain, ‘mid mossy banks, fanned by gentlest
  5727	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tzephyrs, played on by the glorious sunlight or ‘neath the shadows cast
  5728	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\to’er its pensive bosom by the overarching leafage of the giants of
  5729	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe forest. What about that, Simon? he asked over the fringe of his
  5730	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tnewspaper. How’s that for high?
  5731	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t

  5735	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t

  5737	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t

  5739	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe fireplace and to the window, and Marathon looked on the sea.

  5742	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thear any more of the stuff.

  5745	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thungered, made ready to nibble the biscuit in his other hand.
  5746	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  5747	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHigh falutin stuff. Bladderbags. Ned Lambert is taking a day off I see.
  5748	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tRather upsets a man’s day, a funeral does. He has influence they
  5749	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsay. Old Chatterton, the vicechancellor, is his granduncle or his
  5750	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tgreatgranduncle. Close on ninety they say. Subleader for his death
  5751	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twritten this long time perhaps. Living to spite them. Might go first
  5752	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thimself. Johnny, make room for your uncle. The right honourable Hedges
  5753	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tEyre Chatterton. Daresay he writes him an odd shaky cheque or two on
  5754	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tgale days. Windfall when he kicks out. Alleluia.

  5799	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tin the wind, I wonder. Money worry.

  5812	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpink pages of the file.
  5813	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  5814	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tPractice dwindling. A mighthavebeen. Losing heart. Gambling. Debts of
  5815	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thonour. Reaping the whirlwind. Used to get good retainers from D. and T.
  5816	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tFitzgerald. Their wigs to show the grey matter. Brains on their sleeve
  5817	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlike the statue in Glasnevin. Believe he does some literary work for the
  5818	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tExpress with Gabriel Conroy. Wellread fellow. Myles Crawford began on
  5819	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe Independent. Funny the way those newspaper men veer about when
  5820	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthey get wind of a new opening. Weathercocks. Hot and cold in the same
  5821	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbreath. Wouldn’t know which to believe. One story good till you hear
  5822	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe next. Go for one another baldheaded in the papers and then all blows
  5823	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tover. Hail fellow well met the next moment.

  5826	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbut climb the serried mountain peaks...

  5829	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twindbag!

  5832	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tas it were...

  5835	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttaking anything for it?
  5836	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  5837	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—As ‘twere, in the peerless panorama of Ireland’s portfolio, unmatched,
  5838	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdespite their wellpraised prototypes in other vaunted prize regions,

  5840	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpastureland of vernal green, steeped in the transcendent translucent
  5841	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tglow of our mild mysterious Irish twilight... HIS NATIVE DORIC
  5842	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  5843	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—The moon, professor MacHugh said. He forgot Hamlet.
  5844	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t

  5846	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe moon shine forth to irradiate her silver effulgence...
  5847	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  5848	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—O! Mr Dedalus cried, giving vent to a hopeless groan. Shite and onions!
  5849	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThat’ll do, Ned. Life is too short.
  5850	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  5851	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHe took off his silk hat and, blowing out impatiently his bushy
  5852	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmoustache, welshcombed his hair with raking fingers.

  5855	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tinstant after a hoarse bark of laughter burst over professor MacHugh’s
  5856	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tunshaven blackspectacled face.
  5857	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  5858	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Doughy Daw! he cried. WHAT WETHERUP SAID
  5859	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  5860	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tAll very fine to jeer at it now in cold print but it goes down like hot
  5861	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcake that stuff. He was in the bakery line too, wasn’t he? Why they call
  5862	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thim Doughy Daw. Feathered his nest well anyhow. Daughter engaged to that
  5863	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tchap in the inland revenue office with the motor. Hooked that nicely.
  5864	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tEntertainments. Open house. Big blowout. Wetherup always said that. Get
  5865	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ta grip of them by the stomach.
  5866	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t

  6179	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tday... LOST CAUSES NOBLE MARQUESS MENTIONED
  6180	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6181	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—We were always loyal to lost causes, the professor said. Success for
  6182	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tus is the death of the intellect and of the imagination. We were never
  6183	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tloyal to the successful. We serve them. I teach the blatant Latin
  6184	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlanguage. I speak the tongue of a race the acme of whose mentality is
  6185	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe maxim: time is money. Material domination. Dominus! Lord! Where is
  6186	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe spirituality? Lord Jesus? Lord Salisbury? A sofa in a westend club.
  6187	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBut the Greek! KYRIE ELEISON!
  6188	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6189	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tA smile of light brightened his darkrimmed eyes, lengthened his long
  6190	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlips.
  6191	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6192	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—The Greek! he said again. Kyrios! Shining word! The vowels the Semite
  6193	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand the Saxon know not. Kyrie! The radiance of the intellect. I ought to
  6194	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tprofess Greek, the language of the mind. Kyrie eleison! The closetmaker
  6195	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand the cloacamaker will never be lords of our spirit. We are liege
  6196	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsubjects of the catholic chivalry of Europe that foundered at Trafalgar
  6197	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand of the empire of the spirit, not an imperium, that went under with
  6198	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe Athenian fleets at Aegospotami. Yes, yes. They went under. Pyrrhus,
  6199	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmisled by an oracle, made a last attempt to retrieve the fortunes of
  6200	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tGreece. Loyal to a lost cause.
  6201	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6202	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHe strode away from them towards the window.

  6417	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6418	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMouth, south. Is the mouth south someway? Or the south a mouth? Must be
  6419	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsome. South, pout, out, shout, drouth. Rhymes: two men dressed the same,
  6420	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlooking the same, two by two.
  6421	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6422	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t     ........................ la tua pace
  6423	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t    .................. che parlar ti piace

  6433	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tDAY...
  6434	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t

  6437	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—My dear Myles, he said, flinging his cigarette aside, you put a false
  6438	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tconstruction on my words. I hold no brief, as at present advised, for
  6439	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe third profession qua profession but your Cork legs are running away
  6440	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twith you. Why not bring in Henry Grattan and Flood and Demosthenes and
  6441	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tEdmund Burke? Ignatius Gallaher we all know and his Chapelizod boss,
  6442	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHarmsworth of the farthing press, and his American cousin of the Bowery
  6443	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tguttersheet not to mention Paddy Kelly’s Budget, Pue’s Occurrences
  6444	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand our watchful friend The Skibbereen Eagle. Why bring in a master
  6445	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof forensic eloquence like Whiteside? Sufficient for the day is the
  6446	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tnewspaper thereof. LINKS WITH BYGONE DAYS OF YORE
  6447	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6448	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Grattan and Flood wrote for this very paper, the editor cried in his
  6449	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tface. Irish volunteers. Where are you now? Established 1763. Dr Lucas.
  6450	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tWho have you now like John Philpot Curran? Psha!
  6451	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6452	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Well, J. J. O’Molloy said, Bushe K.C., for example.
  6453	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6454	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Bushe? the editor said. Well, yes: Bushe, yes. He has a strain of it in
  6455	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\this blood. Kendal Bushe or I mean Seymour Bushe.
  6456	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6457	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—He would have been on the bench long ago, the professor said, only for
  6458	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t... But no matter.
  6459	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6460	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tJ. J. O’Molloy turned to Stephen and said quietly and slowly:
  6461	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6462	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—One of the most polished periods I think I ever listened to in my life
  6463	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfell from the lips of Seymour Bushe. It was in that case of fratricide,
  6464	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe Childs murder case. Bushe defended him.
  6465	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6466	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tAnd in the porches of mine ear did pour.
  6467	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6468	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBy the way how did he find that out? He died in his sleep. Or the other
  6469	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tstory, beast with two backs?
  6470	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6471	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—What was that? the professor asked. ITALIA, MAGISTRA ARTIUM
  6472	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6473	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—He spoke on the law of evidence, J. J. O’Molloy said, of Roman justice
  6474	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tas contrasted with the earlier Mosaic code, the lex talionis. And he
  6475	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcited the Moses of Michelangelo in the vatican.
  6476	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6477	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Ha.
  6478	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6479	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—A few wellchosen words, Lenehan prefaced. Silence!
  6480	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6481	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tPause. J. J. O’Molloy took out his cigarettecase.
  6482	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6483	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tFalse lull. Something quite ordinary.
  6484	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6485	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMessenger took out his matchbox thoughtfully and lit his cigar.
  6486	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6487	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tI have often thought since on looking back over that strange time that
  6488	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tit was that small act, trivial in itself, that striking of that match,
  6489	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthat determined the whole aftercourse of both our lives. A POLISHED
  6490	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tPERIOD
  6491	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6492	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tJ. J. O’Molloy resumed, moulding his words:
  6493	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6494	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—He said of it: that stony effigy in frozen music, horned and terrible,
  6495	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof the human form divine, that eternal symbol of wisdom and of prophecy
  6496	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twhich, if aught that the imagination or the hand of sculptor has wrought
  6497	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tin marble of soultransfigured and of soultransfiguring deserves to live,
  6498	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdeserves to live.
  6499	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6500	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHis slim hand with a wave graced echo and fall.
  6501	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6502	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Fine! Myles Crawford said at once.
  6503	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6504	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—The divine afflatus, Mr O’Madden Burke said.
  6505	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6506	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—You like it? J. J. O’Molloy asked Stephen.
  6507	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6508	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tStephen, his blood wooed by grace of language and gesture, blushed. He
  6509	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttook a cigarette from the case. J. J. O’Molloy offered his case to Myles
  6510	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tCrawford. Lenehan lit their cigarettes as before and took his trophy,
  6511	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsaying:
  6512	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6513	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Muchibus thankibus. A MAN OF HIGH MORALE
  6514	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6515	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Professor Magennis was speaking to me about you, J. J. O’Molloy said to
  6516	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tStephen. What do you think really of that hermetic crowd, the opal hush
  6517	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpoets: A. E. the mastermystic? That Blavatsky woman started it. She was
  6518	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ta nice old bag of tricks. A. E. has been telling some yankee interviewer
  6519	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthat you came to him in the small hours of the morning to ask him about
  6520	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tplanes of consciousness. Magennis thinks you must have been pulling A.
  6521	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tE.‘s leg. He is a man of the very highest morale, Magennis.
  6522	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6523	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tSpeaking about me. What did he say? What did he say? What did he say
  6524	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tabout me? Don’t ask.
  6525	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6526	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—No, thanks, professor MacHugh said, waving the cigarettecase aside.
  6527	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tWait a moment. Let me say one thing. The finest display of oratory I
  6528	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tever heard was a speech made by John F Taylor at the college historical
  6529	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsociety. Mr Justice Fitzgibbon, the present lord justice of appeal, had
  6530	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tspoken and the paper under debate was an essay (new for those days),
  6531	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tadvocating the revival of the Irish tongue.
  6532	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6533	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHe turned towards Myles Crawford and said:
  6534	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6535	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—You know Gerald Fitzgibbon. Then you can imagine the style of his
  6536	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdiscourse.
  6537	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6538	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—He is sitting with Tim Healy, J. J. O’Molloy said, rumour has it, on
  6539	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe Trinity college estates commission.
  6540	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6541	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—He is sitting with a sweet thing, Myles Crawford said, in a child’s
  6542	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfrock. Go on. Well?
  6543	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6544	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—It was the speech, mark you, the professor said, of a finished orator,
  6545	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfull of courteous haughtiness and pouring in chastened diction I will
  6546	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tnot say the vials of his wrath but pouring the proud man’s contumely
  6547	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tupon the new movement. It was then a new movement. We were weak,
  6548	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttherefore worthless.
  6549	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6550	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHe closed his long thin lips an instant but, eager to be on, raised
  6551	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tan outspanned hand to his spectacles and, with trembling thumb and
  6552	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tringfinger touching lightly the black rims, steadied them to a new
  6553	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfocus. IMPROMPTU
  6554	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6555	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tIn ferial tone he addressed J. J. O’Molloy:
  6556	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6557	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Taylor had come there, you must know, from a sickbed. That he had
  6558	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tprepared his speech I do not believe for there was not even one
  6559	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tshorthandwriter in the hall. His dark lean face had a growth of shaggy
  6560	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbeard round it. He wore a loose white silk neckcloth and altogether he
  6561	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlooked (though he was not) a dying man.
  6562	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6563	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHis gaze turned at once but slowly from J. J. O’Molloy’s towards
  6564	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tStephen’s face and then bent at once to the ground, seeking. His
  6565	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tunglazed linen collar appeared behind his bent head, soiled by his
  6566	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twithering hair. Still seeking, he said:
  6567	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6568	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—When Fitzgibbon’s speech had ended John F Taylor rose to reply.
  6569	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBriefly, as well as I can bring them to mind, his words were these.
  6570	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6571	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHe raised his head firmly. His eyes bethought themselves once more.
  6572	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tWitless shellfish swam in the gross lenses to and fro, seeking outlet.
  6573	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6574	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHe began:
  6575	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6576	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Mr Chairman, ladies and gentlemen: Great was my admiration in listening
  6577	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tto the remarks addressed to the youth of Ireland a moment since by
  6578	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmy learned friend. It seemed to me that I had been transported into a
  6579	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcountry far away from this country, into an age remote from this age,
  6580	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthat I stood in ancient Egypt and that I was listening to the speech of
  6581	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsome highpriest of that land addressed to the youthful Moses.
  6582	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6583	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHis listeners held their cigarettes poised to hear, their smokes
  6584	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tascending in frail stalks that flowered with his speech. And let our
  6585	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcrooked smokes. Noble words coming. Look out. Could you try your hand at
  6586	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tit yourself?
  6587	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6588	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—And it seemed to me that I heard the voice of that Egyptian highpriest
  6589	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\traised in a tone of like haughtiness and like pride. I heard his words
  6590	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand their meaning was revealed to me. FROM THE FATHERS
  6591	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6592	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tIt was revealed to me that those things are good which yet are corrupted
  6593	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twhich neither if they were supremely good nor unless they were good
  6594	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcould be corrupted. Ah, curse you! That’s saint Augustine.
  6595	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6596	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Why will you jews not accept our culture, our religion and our
  6597	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlanguage? You are a tribe of nomad herdsmen: we are a mighty people. You
  6598	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thave no cities nor no wealth: our cities are hives of humanity and
  6599	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tour galleys, trireme and quadrireme, laden with all manner merchandise
  6600	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfurrow the waters of the known globe. You have but emerged from
  6601	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tprimitive conditions: we have a literature, a priesthood, an agelong
  6602	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thistory and a polity.
  6603	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6604	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tNile.
  6605	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6606	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tChild, man, effigy.
  6607	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6608	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBy the Nilebank the babemaries kneel, cradle of bulrushes: a man supple
  6609	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tin combat: stonehorned, stonebearded, heart of stone.
  6610	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6611	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—You pray to a local and obscure idol: our temples, majestic and
  6612	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmysterious, are the abodes of Isis and Osiris, of Horus and Ammon Ra.
  6613	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tYours serfdom, awe and humbleness: ours thunder and the seas. Israel
  6614	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tis weak and few are her children: Egypt is an host and terrible are her
  6615	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tarms. Vagrants and daylabourers are you called: the world trembles at
  6616	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tour name.
  6617	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6618	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tA dumb belch of hunger cleft his speech. He lifted his voice above it
  6619	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tboldly:
  6620	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6621	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—But, ladies and gentlemen, had the youthful Moses listened to and
  6622	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\taccepted that view of life, had he bowed his head and bowed his will
  6623	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand bowed his spirit before that arrogant admonition he would never have
  6624	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbrought the chosen people out of their house of bondage, nor followed
  6625	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe pillar of the cloud by day. He would never have spoken with the
  6626	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tEternal amid lightnings on Sinai’s mountaintop nor ever have come down
  6627	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twith the light of inspiration shining in his countenance and bearing in
  6628	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\this arms the tables of the law, graven in the language of the outlaw.
  6629	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6630	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHe ceased and looked at them, enjoying a silence. OMINOUS—FOR HIM!
  6631	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6632	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tJ. J. O’Molloy said not without regret:
  6633	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6634	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—And yet he died without having entered the land of promise.
  6635	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6636	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—A sudden—at—the—moment—though—from—lingering—illness—often—
  6637	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpreviously—expectorated—demise, Lenehan added. And with a great future
  6638	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbehind him.
  6639	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6640	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThe troop of bare feet was heard rushing along the hallway and pattering
  6641	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tup the staircase.
  6642	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6643	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—That is oratory, the professor said uncontradicted.
  6644	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6645	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tGone with the wind. Hosts at Mullaghmast and Tara of the kings. Miles of
  6646	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tears of porches. The tribune’s words, howled and scattered to the four
  6647	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twinds. A people sheltered within his voice. Dead noise. Akasic records
  6648	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof all that ever anywhere wherever was. Love and laud him: me no more.
  6649	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6650	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tI have money.
  6651	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6652	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Gentlemen, Stephen said. As the next motion on the agenda paper may I
  6653	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsuggest that the house do now adjourn?
  6654	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6655	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—You take my breath away. It is not perchance a French compliment?
  6656	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMr O’Madden Burke asked. ‘Tis the hour, methinks, when the winejug,
  6657	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmetaphorically speaking, is most grateful in Ye ancient hostelry.
  6658	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6659	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—That it be and hereby is resolutely resolved. All that are in favour
  6660	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsay ay, Lenehan announced. The contrary no. I declare it carried. To
  6661	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twhich particular boosing shed...? My casting vote is: Mooney’s!
  6662	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6663	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHe led the way, admonishing:
  6664	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6665	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—We will sternly refuse to partake of strong waters, will we not? Yes,
  6666	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twe will not. By no manner of means.
  6667	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6668	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMr O’Madden Burke, following close, said with an ally’s lunge of his
  6669	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tumbrella:
  6670	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6671	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Lay on, Macduff!
  6672	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6673	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Chip of the old block! the editor cried, clapping Stephen on the
  6674	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tshoulder. Let us go. Where are those blasted keys?
  6675	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6676	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHe fumbled in his pocket pulling out the crushed typesheets.
  6677	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6678	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Foot and mouth. I know. That’ll be all right. That’ll go in. Where are
  6679	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthey? That’s all right.
  6680	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6681	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHe thrust the sheets back and went into the inner office. LET US HOPE
  6682	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6683	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tJ. J. O’Molloy, about to follow him in, said quietly to Stephen:
  6684	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6685	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—I hope you will live to see it published. Myles, one moment.
  6686	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6687	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHe went into the inner office, closing the door behind him.
  6688	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6689	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Come along, Stephen, the professor said. That is fine, isn’t it? It has
  6690	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe prophetic vision. Fuit Ilium! The sack of windy Troy. Kingdoms of
  6691	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthis world. The masters of the Mediterranean are fellaheen today.
  6692	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6693	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThe first newsboy came pattering down the stairs at their heels and
  6694	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\trushed out into the street, yelling:
  6695	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6696	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Racing special!
  6697	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6698	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tDublin. I have much, much to learn.
  6699	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6700	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThey turned to the left along Abbey street.
  6701	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6702	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—I have a vision too, Stephen said.
  6703	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6704	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Yes? the professor said, skipping to get into step. Crawford will
  6705	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfollow.
  6706	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6707	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tAnother newsboy shot past them, yelling as he ran:
  6708	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6709	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Racing special! DEAR DIRTY DUBLIN
  6710	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6711	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tDubliners.
  6712	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6713	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Two Dublin vestals, Stephen said, elderly and pious, have lived fifty
  6714	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand fiftythree years in Fumbally’s lane.
  6715	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6716	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Where is that? the professor asked.
  6717	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6718	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Off Blackpitts, Stephen said.
  6719	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6720	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tDamp night reeking of hungry dough. Against the wall. Face glistering
  6721	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttallow under her fustian shawl. Frantic hearts. Akasic records. Quicker,
  6722	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdarlint!
  6723	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6724	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tOn now. Dare it. Let there be life.
  6725	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6726	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—They want to see the views of Dublin from the top of Nelson’s pillar.
  6727	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThey save up three and tenpence in a red tin letterbox moneybox. They
  6728	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tshake out the threepenny bits and sixpences and coax out the pennies
  6729	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twith the blade of a knife. Two and three in silver and one and seven
  6730	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tin coppers. They put on their bonnets and best clothes and take their
  6731	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tumbrellas for fear it may come on to rain.
  6732	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6733	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Wise virgins, professor MacHugh said. LIFE ON THE RAW
  6734	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6735	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—They buy one and fourpenceworth of brawn and four slices of panloaf at
  6736	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe north city diningrooms in Marlborough street from Miss Kate Collins,
  6737	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tproprietress... They purchase four and twenty ripe plums from a girl at
  6738	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe foot of Nelson’s pillar to take off the thirst of the brawn. They
  6739	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tgive two threepenny bits to the gentleman at the turnstile and begin
  6740	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tto waddle slowly up the winding staircase, grunting, encouraging each
  6741	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tother, afraid of the dark, panting, one asking the other have you the
  6742	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbrawn, praising God and the Blessed Virgin, threatening to come down,
  6743	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpeeping at the airslits. Glory be to God. They had no idea it was that
  6744	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thigh.
  6745	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6746	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTheir names are Anne Kearns and Florence MacCabe. Anne Kearns has the
  6747	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlumbago for which she rubs on Lourdes water, given her by a lady who got
  6748	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ta bottleful from a passionist father. Florence MacCabe takes a crubeen
  6749	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand a bottle of double X for supper every Saturday.
  6750	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6751	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Antithesis, the professor said nodding twice. Vestal virgins. I can see
  6752	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthem. What’s keeping our friend?
  6753	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6754	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHe turned.
  6755	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6756	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tA bevy of scampering newsboys rushed down the steps, scattering in all
  6757	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdirections, yelling, their white papers fluttering. Hard after them
  6758	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMyles Crawford appeared on the steps, his hat aureoling his scarlet
  6759	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tface, talking with J. J. O’Molloy.
  6760	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6761	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Come along, the professor cried, waving his arm.
  6762	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6763	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHe set off again to walk by Stephen’s side. RETURN OF BLOOM
  6764	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6765	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Yes, he said. I see them.
  6766	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6767	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMr Bloom, breathless, caught in a whirl of wild newsboys near the
  6768	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\toffices of the Irish Catholic and Dublin Penny Journal, called:
  6769	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6770	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Mr Crawford! A moment!
  6771	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6772	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Telegraph! Racing special!
  6773	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6774	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—What is it? Myles Crawford said, falling back a pace.
  6775	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6776	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tA newsboy cried in Mr Bloom’s face:
  6777	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6778	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Terrible tragedy in Rathmines! A child bit by a bellows! INTERVIEW WITH
  6779	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTHE EDITOR
  6780	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6781	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Just this ad, Mr Bloom said, pushing through towards the steps,
  6782	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpuffing, and taking the cutting from his pocket. I spoke with Mr Keyes
  6783	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tjust now. He’ll give a renewal for two months, he says. After he’ll see.
  6784	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBut he wants a par to call attention in the Telegraph too, the Saturday
  6785	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpink. And he wants it copied if it’s not too late I told councillor
  6786	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tNannetti from the Kilkenny People. I can have access to it in the
  6787	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tnational library. House of keys, don’t you see? His name is Keyes. It’s
  6788	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ta play on the name. But he practically promised he’d give the renewal.
  6789	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBut he wants just a little puff. What will I tell him, Mr Crawford?
  6790	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tK.M.A.
  6791	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6792	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Will you tell him he can kiss my arse? Myles Crawford said throwing out
  6793	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\this arm for emphasis. Tell him that straight from the stable.
  6794	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6795	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tA bit nervy. Look out for squalls. All off for a drink. Arm in arm.
  6796	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tLenehan’s yachting cap on the cadge beyond. Usual blarney. Wonder is
  6797	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthat young Dedalus the moving spirit. Has a good pair of boots on him
  6798	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttoday. Last time I saw him he had his heels on view. Been walking in
  6799	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmuck somewhere. Careless chap. What was he doing in Irishtown?
  6800	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6801	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Well, Mr Bloom said, his eyes returning, if I can get the design I
  6802	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsuppose it’s worth a short par. He’d give the ad, I think. I’ll tell
  6803	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thim... K.M.R.I.A.
  6804	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6805	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—He can kiss my royal Irish arse, Myles Crawford cried loudly over his
  6806	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tshoulder. Any time he likes, tell him.

  6809	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tjerkily. RAISING THE WIND

  6812	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\there. I’ve been through the hoop myself. I was looking for a fellow to
  6813	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tback a bill for me no later than last week. Sorry, Jack. You must take
  6814	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe will for the deed. With a heart and a half if I could raise the wind
  6815	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tanyhow.

  6861	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tGorgias, the sophist. It is said of him that none could tell if he were
  6862	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbitterer against others or against himself. He was the son of a noble
  6863	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand a bondwoman. And he wrote a book in which he took away the palm of

  6948	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tinstance. I could see the bluey silver over it. Night I went down to the
  6949	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpantry in the kitchen. Don’t like all the smells in it waiting to rush

  6952	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfor the brain.

  6954	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tFrom Butler’s monument house corner he glanced along Bachelor’s walk.
  6955	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tDedalus’ daughter there still outside Dillon’s auctionrooms. Must be
  6956	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tselling off some old furniture. Knew her eyes at once from the father.
  6957	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tLobbing about waiting for him. Home always breaks up when the mother
  6958	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tgoes. Fifteen children he had. Birth every year almost. That’s in their
  6959	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttheology or the priest won’t give the poor woman the confession, the
  6960	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tabsolution. Increase and multiply. Did you ever hear such an idea? Eat
  6961	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tyou out of house and home. No families themselves to feed. Living on the
  6962	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfat of the land. Their butteries and larders. I’d like to see them do
  6963	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe black fast Yom Kippur. Crossbuns. One meal and a collation for fear
  6964	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\the’d collapse on the altar. A housekeeper of one of those fellows if you
  6965	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcould pick it out of her. Never pick it out of her. Like getting £.
  6966	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ts. d. out of him. Does himself well. No guests. All for number one.
  6967	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tWatching his water. Bring your own bread and butter. His reverence:
  6968	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmum’s the word.
  6969	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6970	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tGood Lord, that poor child’s dress is in flitters. Underfed she looks
  6971	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttoo. Potatoes and marge, marge and potatoes. It’s after they feel it.
  6972	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tProof of the pudding. Undermines the constitution.
  6973	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  6974	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tAs he set foot on O’Connell bridge a puffball of smoke plumed up from
  6975	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe parapet. Brewery barge with export stout. England. Sea air sours it,
  6976	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tI heard. Be interesting some day get a pass through Hancock to see the
  6977	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbrewery. Regular world in itself. Vats of porter wonderful. Rats get in
  6978	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttoo. Drink themselves bloated as big as a collie floating. Dead drunk on
  6979	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe porter. Drink till they puke again like christians. Imagine drinking
  6980	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthat! Rats: vats. Well, of course, if we knew all the things.

  6986	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthings. Knows how to tell a story too.

  7015	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ta penny and broke the brittle paste and threw its fragments down into
  7016	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe Liffey. See that? The gulls swooped silently, two, then all from
  7017	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttheir heights, pouncing on prey. Gone. Every morsel.

  7020	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thands. They never expected that. Manna. Live on fish, fishy flesh they
  7021	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thave, all seabirds, gulls, seagoose. Swans from Anna Liffey swim down
  7022	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\there sometimes to preen themselves. No accounting for tastes. Wonder
  7023	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twhat kind is swanmeat. Robinson Crusoe had to live on them.

  7025	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThey wheeled flapping weakly. I’m not going to throw any more. Penny
  7026	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tquite enough. Lot of thanks I get. Not even a caw. They spread foot and
  7027	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmouth disease too. If you cram a turkey say on chestnutmeal it tastes
  7028	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlike that. Eat pig like pig. But then why is it that saltwater fish are
  7029	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tnot salty? How is that?

  7041	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tplaces are good for ads. That quack doctor for the clap used to be stuck

  7063	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tFascinating little book that is of sir Robert Ball’s. Parallax. I never
  7064	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\texactly understood. There’s a priest. Could ask him. Par it’s Greek:
  7065	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tparallel, parallax. Met him pike hoses she called it till I told her
  7066	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tabout the transmigration. O rocks!
  7067	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  7068	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMr Bloom smiled O rocks at two windows of the ballastoffice. She’s right
  7069	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tafter all. Only big words for ordinary things on account of the sound.
  7070	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tShe’s not exactly witty. Can be rude too. Blurt out what I was thinking.
  7071	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tStill, I don’t know. She used to say Ben Dollard had a base barreltone
  7072	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tvoice. He has legs like barrels and you’d think he was singing into a
  7073	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbarrel. Now, isn’t that wit. They used to call him big Ben. Not half as
  7074	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twitty as calling him base barreltone. Appetite like an albatross. Get
  7075	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\toutside of a baron of beef. Powerful man he was at stowing away number
  7076	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tone Bass. Barrel of Bass. See? It all works out.
  7077	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  7078	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tA procession of whitesmocked sandwichmen marched slowly towards him
  7079	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\talong the gutter, scarlet sashes across their boards. Bargains. Like
  7080	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthat priest they are this morning: we have sinned: we have suffered. He
  7081	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tread the scarlet letters on their five tall white hats: H. E. L. Y. S.
  7082	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tWisdom Hely’s. Y lagging behind drew a chunk of bread from under his
  7083	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tforeboard, crammed it into his mouth and munched as he walked. Our
  7084	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tstaple food. Three bob a day, walking along the gutters, street after
  7085	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tstreet. Just keep skin and bone together, bread and skilly. They are
  7086	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tnot Boyl: no, M’Glade’s men. Doesn’t bring in any business either.
  7087	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tI suggested to him about a transparent showcart with two smart girls
  7088	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsitting inside writing letters, copybooks, envelopes, blottingpaper. I
  7089	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbet that would have caught on. Smart girls writing something catch the
  7090	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\teye at once. Everyone dying to know what she’s writing. Get twenty of
  7091	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthem round you if you stare at nothing. Have a finger in the pie. Women
  7092	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttoo. Curiosity. Pillar of salt. Wouldn’t have it of course because he
  7093	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdidn’t think of it himself first. Or the inkbottle I suggested with a
  7094	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfalse stain of black celluloid. His ideas for ads like Plumtree’s potted
  7095	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tunder the obituaries, cold meat department. You can’t lick ‘em. What?
  7096	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tOur envelopes. Hello, Jones, where are you going? Can’t stop, Robinson,
  7097	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tI am hastening to purchase the only reliable inkeraser Kansell, sold by
  7098	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHely’s Ltd, 85 Dame street. Well out of that ruck I am. Devil of a job
  7099	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tit was collecting accounts of those convents. Tranquilla convent. That
  7100	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twas a nice nun there, really sweet face. Wimple suited her small head.
  7101	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tSister? Sister? I am sure she was crossed in love by her eyes. Very hard
  7102	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tto bargain with that sort of a woman. I disturbed her at her devotions
  7103	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthat morning. But glad to communicate with the outside world. Our
  7104	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tgreat day, she said. Feast of Our Lady of Mount Carmel. Sweet name too:
  7105	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcaramel. She knew I, I think she knew by the way she. If she had married
  7106	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tshe would have changed. I suppose they really were short of money. Fried
  7107	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\teverything in the best butter all the same. No lard for them. My heart’s
  7108	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbroke eating dripping. They like buttering themselves in and out. Molly
  7109	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttasting it, her veil up. Sister? Pat Claffey, the pawnbroker’s daughter.
  7110	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tIt was a nun they say invented barbed wire.
  7111	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  7112	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHe crossed Westmoreland street when apostrophe S had plodded by. Rover
  7113	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcycleshop. Those races are on today. How long ago is that? Year Phil
  7114	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tGilligan died. We were in Lombard street west. Wait: was in Thom’s.
  7115	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tGot the job in Wisdom Hely’s year we married. Six years. Ten years ago:
  7116	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tninetyfour he died yes that’s right the big fire at Arnott’s. Val Dillon
  7117	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twas lord mayor. The Glencree dinner. Alderman Robert O’Reilly emptying
  7118	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe port into his soup before the flag fell. Bobbob lapping it for the
  7119	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tinner alderman. Couldn’t hear what the band played. For what we have
  7120	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\talready received may the Lord make us. Milly was a kiddy then. Molly
  7121	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thad that elephantgrey dress with the braided frogs. Mantailored with
  7122	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tselfcovered buttons. She didn’t like it because I sprained my ankle
  7123	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfirst day she wore choir picnic at the Sugarloaf. As if that. Old
  7124	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tGoodwin’s tall hat done up with some sticky stuff. Flies’ picnic
  7125	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttoo. Never put a dress on her back like it. Fitted her like a glove,
  7126	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tshoulders and hips. Just beginning to plump it out well. Rabbitpie we
  7127	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thad that day. People looking after her.
  7128	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  7129	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHappy. Happier then. Snug little room that was with the red wallpaper.
  7130	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tDockrell’s, one and ninepence a dozen. Milly’s tubbing night. American
  7131	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsoap I bought: elderflower. Cosy smell of her bathwater. Funny she
  7132	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlooked soaped all over. Shapely too. Now photography. Poor papa’s
  7133	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdaguerreotype atelier he told me of. Hereditary taste.

  7140	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t...? Of course it’s years ago. Noise of the trams probably. Well, if he
  7141	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcouldn’t remember the dayfather’s name that he sees every day.

  7145	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthat song Winds that blow from the south.

  7316	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t

  7351	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttight skullpiece, the dangling stickumbrelladustcoat. Going the two
  7352	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdays. Watch him! Out he goes again. One way of getting on in the world.
  7353	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tAnd that other old mosey lunatic in those duds. Hard time she must have
  7354	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twith him.
  7355	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  7356	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tU.P.: up. I’ll take my oath that’s Alf Bergan or Richie Goulding. Wrote
  7357	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tit for a lark in the Scotch house I bet anything. Round to Menton’s
  7358	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\toffice. His oyster eyes staring at the postcard. Be a feast for the
  7359	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tgods.
  7360	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  7361	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHe passed the Irish Times. There might be other answers Iying there.
  7362	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tLike to answer them all. Good system for criminals. Code. At their lunch
  7363	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tnow. Clerk with the glasses there doesn’t know me. O, leave them there
  7364	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tto simmer. Enough bother wading through fortyfour of them. Wanted, smart
  7365	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlady typist to aid gentleman in literary work. I called you naughty
  7366	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdarling because I do not like that other world. Please tell me what is
  7367	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe meaning. Please tell me what perfume does your wife. Tell me who
  7368	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmade the world. The way they spring those questions on you. And the
  7369	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tother one Lizzie Twigg. My literary efforts have had the good fortune to
  7370	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmeet with the approval of the eminent poet A. E. (Mr Geo. Russell). No
  7371	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttime to do her hair drinking sloppy tea with a book of poetry.
  7372	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  7373	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBest paper by long chalks for a small ad. Got the provinces now. Cook
  7374	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand general, exc. cuisine, housemaid kept. Wanted live man for spirit
  7375	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcounter. Resp. girl (R.C.) wishes to hear of post in fruit or pork shop.
  7376	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tJames Carlisle made that. Six and a half per cent dividend. Made a big
  7377	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdeal on Coates’s shares. Ca’ canny. Cunning old Scotch hunks. All the
  7378	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttoady news. Our gracious and popular vicereine. Bought the Irish Field
  7379	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tnow. Lady Mountcashel has quite recovered after her confinement and
  7380	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\trode out with the Ward Union staghounds at the enlargement yesterday
  7381	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tat Rathoath. Uneatable fox. Pothunters too. Fear injects juices make
  7382	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tit tender enough for them. Riding astride. Sit her horse like a man.
  7383	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tWeightcarrying huntress. No sidesaddle or pillion for her, not for Joe.
  7384	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tFirst to the meet and in at the death. Strong as a brood mare some of
  7385	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthose horsey women. Swagger around livery stables. Toss off a glass
  7386	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof brandy neat while you’d say knife. That one at the Grosvenor this
  7387	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmorning. Up with her on the car: wishswish. Stonewall or fivebarred gate
  7388	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tput her mount to it. Think that pugnosed driver did it out of spite. Who
  7389	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tis this she was like? O yes! Mrs Miriam Dandrade that sold me her old
  7390	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twraps and black underclothes in the Shelbourne hotel. Divorced Spanish
  7391	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tAmerican. Didn’t take a feather out of her my handling them. As if I was
  7392	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ther clotheshorse. Saw her in the viceregal party when Stubbs the park
  7393	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tranger got me in with Whelan of the Express. Scavenging what the
  7394	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tquality left. High tea. Mayonnaise I poured on the plums thinking it was
  7395	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcustard. Her ears ought to have tingled for a few weeks after. Want to
  7396	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbe a bull for her. Born courtesan. No nursery work for her, thanks.
  7397	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  7398	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tPoor Mrs Purefoy! Methodist husband. Method in his madness. Saffron bun
  7399	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand milk and soda lunch in the educational dairy. Y. M. C. A. Eating
  7400	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twith a stopwatch, thirtytwo chews to the minute. And still his
  7401	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmuttonchop whiskers grew. Supposed to be well connected. Theodore’s
  7402	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcousin in Dublin Castle. One tony relative in every family. Hardy
  7403	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tannuals he presents her with. Saw him out at the Three Jolly Topers
  7404	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmarching along bareheaded and his eldest boy carrying one in a
  7405	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmarketnet. The squallers. Poor thing! Then having to give the breast
  7406	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tyear after year all hours of the night. Selfish those t.t’s are. Dog in
  7407	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe manger. Only one lump of sugar in my tea, if you please.

  7409	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHe stood at Fleet street crossing. Luncheon interval. A sixpenny at
  7410	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tRowe’s? Must look up that ad in the national library. An eightpenny in
  7411	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe Burton. Better. On my way.

  7416	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tSss. Dth, dth, dth! Three days imagine groaning on a bed with a
  7417	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tvinegared handkerchief round her forehead, her belly swollen out. Phew!
  7418	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tDreadful simply! Child’s head too big: forceps. Doubled up inside her
  7419	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttrying to butt its way out blindly, groping for the way out. Kill me
  7420	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthat would. Lucky Molly got over hers lightly. They ought to invent
  7421	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsomething to stop that. Life with hard labour. Twilight sleep idea:
  7422	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tqueen Victoria was given that. Nine she had. A good layer. Old
  7423	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twoman that lived in a shoe she had so many children. Suppose he was
  7424	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tconsumptive. Time someone thought about it instead of gassing about the
  7425	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twhat was it the pensive bosom of the silver effulgence. Flapdoodle to
  7426	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfeed fools on. They could easily have big establishments whole thing
  7427	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tquite painless out of all the taxes give every child born five quid at
  7428	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcompound interest up to twentyone five per cent is a hundred shillings
  7429	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand five tiresome pounds multiply by twenty decimal system encourage
  7430	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpeople to put by money save hundred and ten and a bit twentyone years
  7431	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twant to work it out on paper come to a tidy sum more than you think.
  7432	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  7433	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tNot stillborn of course. They are not even registered. Trouble for
  7434	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tnothing.

  7436	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tFunny sight two of them together, their bellies out. Molly and Mrs
  7437	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMoisel. Mothers’ meeting. Phthisis retires for the time being, then
  7438	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\treturns. How flat they look all of a sudden after. Peaceful eyes. Weight
  7439	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\toff their mind. Old Mrs Thornton was a jolly old soul. All my babies,
  7440	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tshe said. The spoon of pap in her mouth before she fed them. O, that’s
  7441	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tnyumnyum. Got her hand crushed by old Tom Wall’s son. His first bow to
  7442	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe public. Head like a prize pumpkin. Snuffy Dr Murren. People knocking

  7444	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tkeep them waiting months for their fee. To attendance on your wife. No
  7445	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tgratitude in people. Humane doctors, most of them.

  7447	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBefore the huge high door of the Irish house of parliament a flock of
  7448	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpigeons flew. Their little frolic after meals. Who will we do it on? I
  7449	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpick the fellow in black. Here goes. Here’s good luck. Must be thrilling
  7450	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfrom the air. Apjohn, myself and Owen Goldberg up in the trees near
  7451	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tGoose green playing the monkeys. Mackerel they called me.

  7453	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tA squad of constables debouched from College street, marching in Indian
  7454	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfile. Goosestep. Foodheated faces, sweating helmets, patting their
  7455	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttruncheons. After their feed with a good load of fat soup under their
  7456	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbelts. Policeman’s lot is oft a happy one. They split up in groups and
  7457	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tscattered, saluting, towards their beats. Let out to graze. Best moment
  7458	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tto attack one in pudding time. A punch in his dinner. A squad of others,
  7459	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmarching irregularly, rounded Trinity railings making for the station.
  7460	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBound for their troughs. Prepare to receive cavalry. Prepare to receive

  7464	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tup over a urinal: meeting of the waters. Ought to be places for women.
  7465	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tRunning into cakeshops. Settle my hat straight. There is not in this
  7466	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twide world a vallee. Great song of Julia Morkan’s. Kept her voice up to
  7467	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe very last. Pupil of Michael Balfe’s, wasn’t she?

  7470	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tPower could a tale unfold: father a G man. If a fellow gave them trouble
  7471	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbeing lagged they let him have it hot and heavy in the bridewell.
  7472	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tCan’t blame them after all with the job they have especially the young
  7473	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thornies. That horsepoliceman the day Joe Chamberlain was given his
  7474	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdegree in Trinity he got a run for his money. My word he did! His
  7475	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thorse’s hoofs clattering after us down Abbey street. Lucky I had the
  7476	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpresence of mind to dive into Manning’s or I was souped. He did come a
  7477	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twallop, by George. Must have cracked his skull on the cobblestones. I
  7478	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\toughtn’t to have got myself swept along with those medicals. And the
  7479	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTrinity jibs in their mortarboards. Looking for trouble. Still I got to
  7480	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tknow that young Dixon who dressed that sting for me in the Mater and now

  7483	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcharge. Right here it began.

  7538	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHis smile faded as he walked, a heavy cloud hiding the sun slowly,
  7539	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tshadowing Trinity’s surly front. Trams passed one another, ingoing,
  7540	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\toutgoing, clanging. Useless words. Things go on same, day after day:
  7541	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsquads of police marching out, back: trams in, out. Those two loonies
  7542	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmooching about. Dignam carted off. Mina Purefoy swollen belly on a
  7543	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbed groaning to have a child tugged out of her. One born every second
  7544	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsomewhere. Other dying every second. Since I fed the birds five minutes.
  7545	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThree hundred kicked the bucket. Other three hundred born, washing the
  7546	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tblood off, all are washed in the blood of the lamb, bawling maaaaaa.
  7547	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  7548	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tCityful passing away, other cityful coming, passing away too: other
  7549	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcoming on, passing on. Houses, lines of houses, streets, miles of
  7550	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpavements, piledup bricks, stones. Changing hands. This owner, that.
  7551	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tLandlord never dies they say. Other steps into his shoes when he gets
  7552	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\this notice to quit. They buy the place up with gold and still they have
  7553	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tall the gold. Swindle in it somewhere. Piled up in cities, worn away age
  7554	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tafter age. Pyramids in sand. Built on bread and onions. Slaves Chinese
  7555	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twall. Babylon. Big stones left. Round towers. Rest rubble, sprawling
  7556	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsuburbs, jerrybuilt. Kerwan’s mushroom houses built of breeze. Shelter,
  7557	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfor the night.

  7559	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tNo-one is anything.

  7561	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThis is the very worst hour of the day. Vitality. Dull, gloomy: hate
  7562	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthis hour. Feel as if I had been eaten and spewed.

  7564	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tProvost’s house. The reverend Dr Salmon: tinned salmon. Well tinned in
  7565	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthere. Like a mortuary chapel. Wouldn’t live in it if they paid me. Hope
  7566	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthey have liver and bacon today. Nature abhors a vacuum.

  7569	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\topposite in Walter Sexton’s window by which John Howard Parnell passed,
  7570	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tunseeing.
  7571	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  7572	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThere he is: the brother. Image of him. Haunting face. Now that’s a
  7573	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcoincidence. Course hundreds of times you think of a person and don’t
  7574	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmeet him. Like a man walking in his sleep. No-one knows him. Must be a
  7575	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcorporation meeting today. They say he never put on the city marshal’s
  7576	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tuniform since he got the job. Charley Kavanagh used to come out on
  7577	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\this high horse, cocked hat, puffed, powdered and shaved. Look at the
  7578	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twoebegone walk of him. Eaten a bad egg. Poached eyes on ghost. I have a
  7579	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpain. Great man’s brother: his brother’s brother. He’d look nice on the
  7580	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcity charger. Drop into the D.B.C. probably for his coffee, play chess
  7581	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthere. His brother used men as pawns. Let them all go to pot. Afraid to
  7582	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpass a remark on him. Freeze them up with that eye of his. That’s the
  7583	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfascination: the name. All a bit touched. Mad Fanny and his other sister
  7584	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMrs Dickinson driving about with scarlet harness. Bolt upright lik
  7585	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsurgeon M’Ardle. Still David Sheehy beat him for south Meath. Apply
  7586	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfor the Chiltern Hundreds and retire into public life. The patriot’s
  7587	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbanquet. Eating orangepeels in the park. Simon Dedalus said when they
  7588	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tput him in parliament that Parnell would come back from the grave and
  7589	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlead him out of the house of commons by the arm.
  7590	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  7591	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Of the twoheaded octopus, one of whose heads is the head upon which the
  7592	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tends of the world have forgotten to come while the other speaks with a
  7593	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tScotch accent. The tentacles...

  7595	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThey passed from behind Mr Bloom along the curbstone. Beard and bicycle.
  7596	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tYoung woman.
  7597	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  7598	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tAnd there he is too. Now that’s really a coincidence: second time.
  7599	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tComing events cast their shadows before. With the approval of the
  7600	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\teminent poet, Mr Geo. Russell. That might be Lizzie Twigg with him. A.
  7601	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tE.: what does that mean? Initials perhaps. Albert Edward, Arthur Edmund,
  7602	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tAlphonsus Eb Ed El Esquire. What was he saying? The ends of the world
  7603	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twith a Scotch accent. Tentacles: octopus. Something occult: symbolism.
  7604	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHolding forth. She’s taking it all in. Not saying a word. To aid
  7605	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tgentleman in literary work.
  7606	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  7607	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHis eyes followed the high figure in homespun, beard and bicycle,
  7608	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ta listening woman at his side. Coming from the vegetarian. Only
  7609	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tweggebobbles and fruit. Don’t eat a beefsteak. If you do the eyes of
  7610	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthat cow will pursue you through all eternity. They say it’s healthier.
  7611	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tWindandwatery though. Tried it. Keep you on the run all day. Bad as
  7612	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ta bloater. Dreams all night. Why do they call that thing they gave me
  7613	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tnutsteak? Nutarians. Fruitarians. To give you the idea you are eating
  7614	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\trumpsteak. Absurd. Salty too. They cook in soda. Keep you sitting by the
  7615	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttap all night.
  7616	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  7617	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHer stockings are loose over her ankles. I detest that: so tasteless.
  7618	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThose literary etherial people they are all. Dreamy, cloudy,
  7619	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsymbolistic. Esthetes they are. I wouldn’t be surprised if it was that
  7620	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tkind of food you see produces the like waves of the brain the poetical.
  7621	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tFor example one of those policemen sweating Irish stew into their shirts
  7622	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tyou couldn’t squeeze a line of poetry out of him. Don’t know what poetry
  7623	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tis even. Must be in a certain mood.
  7624	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  7625	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t     The dreamy cloudy gull
  7626	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t     Waves o’er the waters dull.
  7627	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  7628	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHe crossed at Nassau street corner and stood before the window of Yeates
  7629	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand Son, pricing the fieldglasses. Or will I drop into old Harris’s and
  7630	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thave a chat with young Sinclair? Wellmannered fellow. Probably at his
  7631	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlunch. Must get those old glasses of mine set right. Goerz lenses six
  7632	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tguineas. Germans making their way everywhere. Sell on easy terms to
  7633	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcapture trade. Undercutting. Might chance on a pair in the railway lost
  7634	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tproperty office. Astonishing the things people leave behind them in
  7635	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttrains and cloakrooms. What do they be thinking about? Women too.
  7636	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tIncredible. Last year travelling to Ennis had to pick up that farmer’s
  7637	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdaughter’s bag and hand it to her at Limerick junction. Unclaimed money
  7638	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttoo. There’s a little watch up there on the roof of the bank to test
  7639	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthose glasses by.

  7642	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\timagine it’s there you can almost see it. Can’t see it.
  7643	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  7644	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHe faced about and, standing between the awnings, held out his right
  7645	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thand at arm’s length towards the sun. Wanted to try that often. Yes:
  7646	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcompletely. The tip of his little finger blotted out the sun’s disk.
  7647	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMust be the focus where the rays cross. If I had black glasses.
  7648	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tInteresting. There was a lot of talk about those sunspots when we
  7649	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twere in Lombard street west. Looking up from the back garden. Terrific
  7650	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\texplosions they are. There will be a total eclipse this year: autumn
  7651	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsome time.
  7652	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
  7653	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tNow that I come to think of it that ball falls at Greenwich time. It’s
  7654	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe clock is worked by an electric wire from Dunsink. Must go out there
  7655	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsome first Saturday of the month. If I could get an introduction to
  7656	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tprofessor Joly or learn up something about his family. That would do to:
  7657	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tman always feels complimented. Flattery where least expected. Nobleman
  7658	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tproud to be descended from some king’s mistress. His foremother. Lay it
  7659	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ton with a trowel. Cap in hand goes through the land. Not go in and blurt
  7660	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tout what you know you’re not to: what’s parallax? Show this gentleman
  7661	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe door.

  7669	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthen world: then cold: then dead shell drifting around, frozen rock,

  7881	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tSardines on the shelves. Almost taste them by looking. Sandwich? Ham
  7882	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand his descendants musterred and bred there. Potted meats. What is home
  7883	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twithout Plumtree’s potted meat? Incomplete. What a stupid ad! Under the
  7884	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tobituary notices they stuck it. All up a plumtree. Dignam’s potted meat.
  7885	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tCannibals would with lemon and rice. White missionary too salty. Like
  7886	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpickled pork. Expect the chief consumes the parts of honour. Ought to be
  7887	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttough from exercise. His wives in a row to watch the effect. There was
  7888	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ta right royal old nigger. Who ate or something the somethings of the
  7889	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\treverend Mr MacTrigger. With it an abode of bliss. Lord knows what
  7890	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tconcoction. Cauls mouldy tripes windpipes faked and minced up. Puzzle
  7891	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfind the meat. Kosher. No meat and milk together. Hygiene that was what
  7892	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthey call now. Yom Kippur fast spring cleaning of inside. Peace and
  7893	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twar depend on some fellow’s digestion. Religions. Christmas turkeys and
  7894	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tgeese. Slaughter of innocents. Eat drink and be merry. Then casual wards
  7895	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfull after. Heads bandaged. Cheese digests all but itself. Mity cheese.

  8177	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
