 17366	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tit went out of sight a moment and she was trembling in every limb from
 17367	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbeing bent so far back that he had a full view high up above her knee
 17368	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twhere no-one ever not even on the swing or wading and she wasn’t ashamed
 17369	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand he wasn’t either to look in that immodest way like that because he
 17370	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcouldn’t resist the sight of the wondrous revealment half offered like
 17371	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthose skirtdancers behaving so immodest before gentlemen looking and he

 17373	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\theld out her snowy slender arms to him to come, to feel his lips laid on
 17374	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ther white brow, the cry of a young girl’s love, a little strangled cry,
 17375	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twrung from her, that cry that has rung through the ages. And then a
 17376	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\trocket sprang and bang shot blind blank and O! then the Roman candle
 17377	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tburst and it was like a sigh of O! and everyone cried O! O! in raptures
 17378	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand it gushed out of it a stream of rain gold hair threads and they
 17379	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tshed and ah! they were all greeny dewy stars falling with golden, O so
 17380	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlovely, O, soft, sweet, soft!
 17381	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 17382	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThen all melted away dewily in the grey air: all was silent. Ah! She
 17383	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tglanced at him as she bent forward quickly, a pathetic little glance of
 17384	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpiteous protest, of shy reproach under which he coloured like a girl. He
 17385	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twas leaning back against the rock behind. Leopold Bloom (for it is he)
 17386	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tstands silent, with bowed head before those young guileless eyes. What a
 17387	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbrute he had been! At it again? A fair unsullied soul had called to him
 17388	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand, wretch that he was, how had he answered? An utter cad he had been!
 17389	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHe of all men! But there was an infinite store of mercy in those eyes,
 17390	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfor him too a word of pardon even though he had erred and sinned and
 17391	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twandered. Should a girl tell? No, a thousand times no. That was their
 17392	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsecret, only theirs, alone in the hiding twilight and there was none to
 17393	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tknow or tell save the little bat that flew so softly through the evening
 17394	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tto and fro and little bats don’t tell.
 17395	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 17396	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tCissy Caffrey whistled, imitating the boys in the football field to show
 17397	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twhat a great person she was: and then she cried:
 17398	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 17399	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Gerty! Gerty! We’re going. Come on. We can see from farther up.
 17400	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 17401	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tGerty had an idea, one of love’s little ruses. She slipped a hand into
 17402	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ther kerchief pocket and took out the wadding and waved in reply of
 17403	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcourse without letting him and then slipped it back. Wonder if he’s too
 17404	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfar to. She rose. Was it goodbye? No. She had to go but they would meet
 17405	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tagain, there, and she would dream of that till then, tomorrow, of her
 17406	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdream of yester eve. She drew herself up to her full height. Their souls
 17407	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmet in a last lingering glance and the eyes that reached her heart, full
 17408	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof a strange shining, hung enraptured on her sweet flowerlike face. She
 17409	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thalf smiled at him wanly, a sweet forgiving smile, a smile that verged
 17410	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ton tears, and then they parted.
 17411	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 17412	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tSlowly, without looking back she went down the uneven strand to Cissy,
 17413	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tto Edy to Jacky and Tommy Caffrey, to little baby Boardman. It was
 17414	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdarker now and there were stones and bits of wood on the strand and
 17415	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tslippy seaweed. She walked with a certain quiet dignity characteristic
 17416	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof her but with care and very slowly because—because Gerty MacDowell
 17417	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twas...
 17418	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 17419	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTight boots? No. She’s lame! O!
 17420	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 17421	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMr Bloom watched her as she limped away. Poor girl! That’s why she’s
 17422	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tleft on the shelf and the others did a sprint. Thought something was
 17423	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twrong by the cut of her jib. Jilted beauty. A defect is ten times worse
 17424	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tin a woman. But makes them polite. Glad I didn’t know it when she was on
 17425	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tshow. Hot little devil all the same. I wouldn’t mind. Curiosity like a
 17426	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tnun or a negress or a girl with glasses. That squinty one is delicate.
 17427	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tNear her monthlies, I expect, makes them feel ticklish. I have such
 17428	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ta bad headache today. Where did I put the letter? Yes, all right. All
 17429	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tkinds of crazy longings. Licking pennies. Girl in Tranquilla convent
 17430	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthat nun told me liked to smell rock oil. Virgins go mad in the end I
 17431	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsuppose. Sister? How many women in Dublin have it today? Martha, she.
 17432	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tSomething in the air. That’s the moon. But then why don’t all women
 17433	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmenstruate at the same time with the same moon, I mean? Depends on the
 17434	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttime they were born I suppose. Or all start scratch then get out of
 17435	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tstep. Sometimes Molly and Milly together. Anyhow I got the best of that.
 17436	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tDamned glad I didn’t do it in the bath this morning over her silly I
 17437	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twill punish you letter. Made up for that tramdriver this morning. That
 17438	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tgouger M’Coy stopping me to say nothing. And his wife engagement in the
 17439	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcountry valise, voice like a pickaxe. Thankful for small mercies.
 17440	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tCheap too. Yours for the asking. Because they want it themselves. Their
 17441	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tnatural craving. Shoals of them every evening poured out of offices.
 17442	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tReserve better. Don’t want it they throw it at you. Catch em alive, O.
 17443	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tPity they can’t see themselves. A dream of wellfilled hose. Where was
 17444	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthat? Ah, yes. Mutoscope pictures in Capel street: for men only. Peeping
 17445	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTom. Willy’s hat and what the girls did with it. Do they snapshot those
 17446	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tgirls or is it all a fake? Lingerie does it. Felt for the curves inside
 17447	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ther déshabillé. Excites them also when they’re. I’m all clean come and
 17448	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdirty me. And they like dressing one another for the sacrifice. Milly
 17449	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdelighted with Molly’s new blouse. At first. Put them all on to take
 17450	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthem all off. Molly. Why I bought her the violet garters. Us too: the
 17451	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttie he wore, his lovely socks and turnedup trousers. He wore a pair
 17452	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof gaiters the night that first we met. His lovely shirt was shining
 17453	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbeneath his what? of jet. Say a woman loses a charm with every pin she
 17454	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttakes out. Pinned together. O, Mairy lost the pin of her. Dressed up to
 17455	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe nines for somebody. Fashion part of their charm. Just changes when
 17456	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tyou’re on the track of the secret. Except the east: Mary, Martha: now as
 17457	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthen. No reasonable offer refused. She wasn’t in a hurry either. Always
 17458	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\toff to a fellow when they are. They never forget an appointment. Out on
 17459	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tspec probably. They believe in chance because like themselves. And the
 17460	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tothers inclined to give her an odd dig. Girl friends at school, arms
 17461	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tround each other’s necks or with ten fingers locked, kissing and
 17462	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twhispering secrets about nothing in the convent garden. Nuns with
 17463	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twhitewashed faces, cool coifs and their rosaries going up and down,
 17464	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tvindictive too for what they can’t get. Barbed wire. Be sure now and
 17465	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twrite to me. And I’ll write to you. Now won’t you? Molly and Josie
 17466	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tPowell. Till Mr Right comes along, then meet once in a blue moon.
 17467	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTableau! O, look who it is for the love of God! How are you at all? What
 17468	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thave you been doing with yourself? Kiss and delighted to, kiss, to see
 17469	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tyou. Picking holes in each other’s appearance. You’re looking splendid.
 17470	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tSister souls. Showing their teeth at one another. How many have you
 17471	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tleft? Wouldn’t lend each other a pinch of salt.
 17472	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 17473	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tAh!
 17474	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 17475	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tDevils they are when that’s coming on them. Dark devilish appearance.
 17476	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMolly often told me feel things a ton weight. Scratch the sole of my
 17477	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfoot. O that way! O, that’s exquisite! Feel it myself too. Good to rest
 17478	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tonce in a way. Wonder if it’s bad to go with them then. Safe in one way.
 17479	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTurns milk, makes fiddlestrings snap. Something about withering plants I
 17480	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tread in a garden. Besides they say if the flower withers she wears she’s
 17481	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ta flirt. All are. Daresay she felt I. When you feel like that you often
 17482	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmeet what you feel. Liked me or what? Dress they look at. Always know a
 17483	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfellow courting: collars and cuffs. Well cocks and lions do the same
 17484	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand stags. Same time might prefer a tie undone or something. Trousers?
 17485	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tSuppose I when I was? No. Gently does it. Dislike rough and tumble. Kiss
 17486	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tin the dark and never tell. Saw something in me. Wonder what. Sooner
 17487	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thave me as I am than some poet chap with bearsgrease plastery hair,
 17488	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlovelock over his dexter optic. To aid gentleman in literary. Ought to
 17489	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tattend to my appearance my age. Didn’t let her see me in profile. Still,
 17490	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tyou never know. Pretty girls and ugly men marrying. Beauty and the
 17491	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbeast. Besides I can’t be so if Molly. Took off her hat to show her
 17492	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thair. Wide brim. Bought to hide her face, meeting someone might know
 17493	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ther, bend down or carry a bunch of flowers to smell. Hair strong in rut.
 17494	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTen bob I got for Molly’s combings when we were on the rocks in Holles
 17495	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tstreet. Why not? Suppose he gave her money. Why not? All a prejudice.
 17496	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tShe’s worth ten, fifteen, more, a pound. What? I think so. All that for
 17497	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tnothing. Bold hand: Mrs Marion. Did I forget to write address on
 17498	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthat letter like the postcard I sent to Flynn? And the day I went to
 17499	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tDrimmie’s without a necktie. Wrangle with Molly it was put me off. No,
 17500	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tI remember. Richie Goulding: he’s another. Weighs on his mind. Funny
 17501	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmy watch stopped at half past four. Dust. Shark liver oil they use to
 17502	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tclean. Could do it myself. Save. Was that just when he, she?
 17503	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 17504	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tO, he did. Into her. She did. Done.
 17505	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 17506	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tAh!
 17507	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 17508	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMr Bloom with careful hand recomposed his wet shirt. O Lord, that little
 17509	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlimping devil. Begins to feel cold and clammy. Aftereffect not pleasant.
 17510	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tStill you have to get rid of it someway. They don’t care. Complimented
 17511	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tperhaps. Go home to nicey bread and milky and say night prayers with the
 17512	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tkiddies. Well, aren’t they? See her as she is spoil all. Must have the
 17513	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tstage setting, the rouge, costume, position, music. The name too. Amours
 17514	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof actresses. Nell Gwynn, Mrs Bracegirdle, Maud Branscombe. Curtain
 17515	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tup. Moonlight silver effulgence. Maiden discovered with pensive bosom.
 17516	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tLittle sweetheart come and kiss me. Still, I feel. The strength it gives
 17517	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ta man. That’s the secret of it. Good job I let off there behind the wall
 17518	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcoming out of Dignam’s. Cider that was. Otherwise I couldn’t have. Makes
 17519	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tyou want to sing after. Lacaus esant taratara. Suppose I spoke to
 17520	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ther. What about? Bad plan however if you don’t know how to end the
 17521	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tconversation. Ask them a question they ask you another. Good idea if
 17522	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tyou’re stuck. Gain time. But then you’re in a cart. Wonderful of course
 17523	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tif you say: good evening, and you see she’s on for it: good evening. O
 17524	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbut the dark evening in the Appian way I nearly spoke to Mrs Clinch O
 17525	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthinking she was. Whew! Girl in Meath street that night. All the dirty
 17526	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthings I made her say. All wrong of course. My arks she called it. It’s
 17527	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tso hard to find one who. Aho! If you don’t answer when they solicit must
 17528	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbe horrible for them till they harden. And kissed my hand when I gave
 17529	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ther the extra two shillings. Parrots. Press the button and the bird will
 17530	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsqueak. Wish she hadn’t called me sir. O, her mouth in the dark! And you
 17531	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ta married man with a single girl! That’s what they enjoy. Taking a man
 17532	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfrom another woman. Or even hear of it. Different with me. Glad to get
 17533	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\taway from other chap’s wife. Eating off his cold plate. Chap in the
 17534	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBurton today spitting back gumchewed gristle. French letter still in
 17535	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmy pocketbook. Cause of half the trouble. But might happen sometime,
 17536	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tI don’t think. Come in, all is prepared. I dreamt. What? Worst is
 17537	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbeginning. How they change the venue when it’s not what they like. Ask
 17538	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tyou do you like mushrooms because she once knew a gentleman who. Or ask
 17539	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tyou what someone was going to say when he changed his mind and stopped.
 17540	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tYet if I went the whole hog, say: I want to, something like that.
 17541	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBecause I did. She too. Offend her. Then make it up. Pretend to want
 17542	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsomething awfully, then cry off for her sake. Flatters them. She must
 17543	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thave been thinking of someone else all the time. What harm? Must since
 17544	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tshe came to the use of reason, he, he and he. First kiss does the trick.
 17545	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThe propitious moment. Something inside them goes pop. Mushy like, tell
 17546	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tby their eye, on the sly. First thoughts are best. Remember that till
 17547	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttheir dying day. Molly, lieutenant Mulvey that kissed her under the
 17548	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMoorish wall beside the gardens. Fifteen she told me. But her breasts
 17549	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twere developed. Fell asleep then. After Glencree dinner that was when we
 17550	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdrove home. Featherbed mountain. Gnashing her teeth in sleep. Lord mayor
 17551	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thad his eye on her too. Val Dillon. Apoplectic.
 17552	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 17553	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThere she is with them down there for the fireworks. My fireworks. Up
 17554	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlike a rocket, down like a stick. And the children, twins they must
 17555	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbe, waiting for something to happen. Want to be grownups. Dressing in
 17556	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmother’s clothes. Time enough, understand all the ways of the world. And
 17557	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe dark one with the mop head and the nigger mouth. I knew she could
 17558	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twhistle. Mouth made for that. Like Molly. Why that highclass whore in
 17559	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tJammet’s wore her veil only to her nose. Would you mind, please, telling
 17560	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tme the right time? I’ll tell you the right time up a dark lane.
 17561	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tSay prunes and prisms forty times every morning, cure for fat lips.
 17562	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tCaressing the little boy too. Onlookers see most of the game. Of course
 17563	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthey understand birds, animals, babies. In their line.
 17564	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 17565	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tDidn’t look back when she was going down the strand. Wouldn’t give that
 17566	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsatisfaction. Those girls, those girls, those lovely seaside girls. Fine
 17567	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\teyes she had, clear. It’s the white of the eye brings that out not so
 17568	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmuch the pupil. Did she know what I? Course. Like a cat sitting beyond
 17569	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ta dog’s jump. Women never meet one like that Wilkins in the high school
 17570	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdrawing a picture of Venus with all his belongings on show. Call that
 17571	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tinnocence? Poor idiot! His wife has her work cut out for her. Never see
 17572	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthem sit on a bench marked Wet Paint. Eyes all over them. Look under
 17573	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe bed for what’s not there. Longing to get the fright of their lives.
 17574	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tSharp as needles they are. When I said to Molly the man at the corner of
 17575	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tCuffe street was goodlooking, thought she might like, twigged at once he
 17576	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thad a false arm. Had, too. Where do they get that? Typist going up Roger
 17577	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tGreene’s stairs two at a time to show her understandings. Handed down
 17578	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfrom father to, mother to daughter, I mean. Bred in the bone. Milly for
 17579	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\texample drying her handkerchief on the mirror to save the ironing. Best
 17580	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tplace for an ad to catch a woman’s eye on a mirror. And when I sent
 17581	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ther for Molly’s Paisley shawl to Prescott’s by the way that ad I must,
 17582	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcarrying home the change in her stocking! Clever little minx. I never
 17583	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttold her. Neat way she carries parcels too. Attract men, small thing
 17584	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlike that. Holding up her hand, shaking it, to let the blood flow back
 17585	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twhen it was red. Who did you learn that from? Nobody. Something the
 17586	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tnurse taught me. O, don’t they know! Three years old she was in front of
 17587	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMolly’s dressingtable, just before we left Lombard street west. Me have
 17588	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ta nice pace. Mullingar. Who knows? Ways of the world. Young student.
 17589	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tStraight on her pins anyway not like the other. Still she was game.
 17590	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tLord, I am wet. Devil you are. Swell of her calf. Transparent stockings,
 17591	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tstretched to breaking point. Not like that frump today. A. E. Rumpled
 17592	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tstockings. Or the one in Grafton street. White. Wow! Beef to the heel.
 17593	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 17594	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tA monkey puzzle rocket burst, spluttering in darting crackles. Zrads and
 17595	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tzrads, zrads, zrads. And Cissy and Tommy and Jacky ran out to see and
 17596	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tEdy after with the pushcar and then Gerty beyond the curve of the rocks.
 17597	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tWill she? Watch! Watch! See! Looked round. She smelt an onion. Darling,
 17598	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tI saw, your. I saw all.
 17599	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 17600	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tLord!
 17601	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 17602	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tDid me good all the same. Off colour after Kiernan’s, Dignam’s. For
 17603	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthis relief much thanks. In Hamlet, that is. Lord! It was all things
 17604	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcombined. Excitement. When she leaned back, felt an ache at the butt
 17605	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof my tongue. Your head it simply swirls. He’s right. Might have made a
 17606	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tworse fool of myself however. Instead of talking about nothing. Then
 17607	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tI will tell you all. Still it was a kind of language between us. It
 17608	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcouldn’t be? No, Gerty they called her. Might be false name however like
 17609	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmy name and the address Dolphin’s barn a blind.
 17610	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 17611	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t      Her maiden name was Jemina Brown
 17612	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t      And she lived with her mother in Irishtown.
 17613	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 17614	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tPlace made me think of that I suppose. All tarred with the same brush.
 17615	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tWiping pens in their stockings. But the ball rolled down to her as if
 17616	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tit understood. Every bullet has its billet. Course I never could throw
 17617	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tanything straight at school. Crooked as a ram’s horn. Sad however
 17618	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbecause it lasts only a few years till they settle down to potwalloping
 17619	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand papa’s pants will soon fit Willy and fuller’s earth for the baby
 17620	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twhen they hold him out to do ah ah. No soft job. Saves them. Keeps
 17621	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthem out of harm’s way. Nature. Washing child, washing corpse. Dignam.
 17622	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tChildren’s hands always round them. Cocoanut skulls, monkeys, not even
 17623	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tclosed at first, sour milk in their swaddles and tainted curds. Oughtn’t
 17624	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tto have given that child an empty teat to suck. Fill it up with wind.
 17625	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMrs Beaufoy, Purefoy. Must call to the hospital. Wonder is nurse Callan
 17626	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthere still. She used to look over some nights when Molly was in the
 17627	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tCoffee Palace. That young doctor O’Hare I noticed her brushing his coat.
 17628	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tAnd Mrs Breen and Mrs Dignam once like that too, marriageable. Worst
 17629	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof all at night Mrs Duggan told me in the City Arms. Husband rolling in
 17630	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdrunk, stink of pub off him like a polecat. Have that in your nose in
 17631	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe dark, whiff of stale boose. Then ask in the morning: was I drunk
 17632	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlast night? Bad policy however to fault the husband. Chickens come home
 17633	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tto roost. They stick by one another like glue. Maybe the women’s fault
 17634	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\talso. That’s where Molly can knock spots off them. It’s the blood of the
 17635	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsouth. Moorish. Also the form, the figure. Hands felt for the opulent.
 17636	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tJust compare for instance those others. Wife locked up at home, skeleton
 17637	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tin the cupboard. Allow me to introduce my. Then they trot you out some
 17638	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tkind of a nondescript, wouldn’t know what to call her. Always see a
 17639	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfellow’s weak point in his wife. Still there’s destiny in it, falling
 17640	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tin love. Have their own secrets between them. Chaps that would go to the
 17641	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdogs if some woman didn’t take them in hand. Then little chits of girls,
 17642	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\theight of a shilling in coppers, with little hubbies. As God made them
 17643	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\the matched them. Sometimes children turn out well enough. Twice nought
 17644	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmakes one. Or old rich chap of seventy and blushing bride. Marry in May
 17645	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand repent in December. This wet is very unpleasant. Stuck. Well the
 17646	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tforeskin is not back. Better detach.
 17647	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 17648	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tOw!
 17649	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 17650	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tOther hand a sixfooter with a wifey up to his watchpocket. Long and
 17651	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe short of it. Big he and little she. Very strange about my watch.
 17652	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tWristwatches are always going wrong. Wonder is there any magnetic
 17653	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tinfluence between the person because that was about the time he. Yes, I
 17654	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsuppose, at once. Cat’s away, the mice will play. I remember looking
 17655	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tin Pill lane. Also that now is magnetism. Back of everything magnetism.
 17656	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tEarth for instance pulling this and being pulled. That causes movement.
 17657	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tAnd time, well that’s the time the movement takes. Then if one thing
 17658	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tstopped the whole ghesabo would stop bit by bit. Because it’s all
 17659	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tarranged. Magnetic needle tells you what’s going on in the sun, the
 17660	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tstars. Little piece of steel iron. When you hold out the fork. Come.
 17661	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tCome. Tip. Woman and man that is. Fork and steel. Molly, he. Dress up
 17662	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand look and suggest and let you see and see more and defy you if you’re
 17663	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ta man to see that and, like a sneeze coming, legs, look, look and if you
 17664	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thave any guts in you. Tip. Have to let fly.
 17665	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 17666	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tWonder how is she feeling in that region. Shame all put on before third
 17667	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tperson. More put out about a hole in her stocking. Molly, her underjaw
 17668	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tstuck out, head back, about the farmer in the ridingboots and spurs at
 17669	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe horse show. And when the painters were in Lombard street west.
 17670	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tFine voice that fellow had. How Giuglini began. Smell that I did. Like
 17671	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tflowers. It was too. Violets. Came from the turpentine probably in the
 17672	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpaint. Make their own use of everything. Same time doing it scraped her
 17673	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tslipper on the floor so they wouldn’t hear. But lots of them can’t kick
 17674	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe beam, I think. Keep that thing up for hours. Kind of a general all
 17675	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tround over me and half down my back.
 17676	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 17677	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tWait. Hm. Hm. Yes. That’s her perfume. Why she waved her hand. I leave
 17678	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tyou this to think of me when I’m far away on the pillow. What is it?
 17679	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHeliotrope? No. Hyacinth? Hm. Roses, I think. She’d like scent of that
 17680	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tkind. Sweet and cheap: soon sour. Why Molly likes opoponax. Suits her,
 17681	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twith a little jessamine mixed. Her high notes and her low notes. At the
 17682	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdance night she met him, dance of the hours. Heat brought it out. She
 17683	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twas wearing her black and it had the perfume of the time before. Good
 17684	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tconductor, is it? Or bad? Light too. Suppose there’s some connection.
 17685	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tFor instance if you go into a cellar where it’s dark. Mysterious thing
 17686	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttoo. Why did I smell it only now? Took its time in coming like herself,
 17687	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tslow but sure. Suppose it’s ever so many millions of tiny grains
 17688	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tblown across. Yes, it is. Because those spice islands, Cinghalese this
 17689	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmorning, smell them leagues off. Tell you what it is. It’s like a fine
 17690	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfine veil or web they have all over the skin, fine like what do you
 17691	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcall it gossamer, and they’re always spinning it out of them, fine as
 17692	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tanything, like rainbow colours without knowing it. Clings to everything
 17693	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tshe takes off. Vamp of her stockings. Warm shoe. Stays. Drawers: little
 17694	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tkick, taking them off. Byby till next time. Also the cat likes to sniff
 17695	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tin her shift on the bed. Know her smell in a thousand. Bathwater too.
 17696	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tReminds me of strawberries and cream. Wonder where it is really. There
 17697	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tor the armpits or under the neck. Because you get it out of all holes
 17698	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand corners. Hyacinth perfume made of oil of ether or something.
 17699	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMuskrat. Bag under their tails. One grain pour off odour for years. Dogs
 17700	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tat each other behind. Good evening. Evening. How do you sniff? Hm. Hm.
 17701	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tVery well, thank you. Animals go by that. Yes now, look at it that way.
 17702	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tWe’re the same. Some women, instance, warn you off when they have their
 17703	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tperiod. Come near. Then get a hogo you could hang your hat on. Like
 17704	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twhat? Potted herrings gone stale or. Boof! Please keep off the grass.
 17705	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 17706	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tPerhaps they get a man smell off us. What though? Cigary gloves long
 17707	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tJohn had on his desk the other day. Breath? What you eat and drink gives
 17708	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthat. No. Mansmell, I mean. Must be connected with that because priests
 17709	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthat are supposed to be are different. Women buzz round it like flies
 17710	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tround treacle. Railed off the altar get on to it at any cost. The tree
 17711	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof forbidden priest. O, father, will you? Let me be the first to. That
 17712	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdiffuses itself all through the body, permeates. Source of life. And
 17713	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tit’s extremely curious the smell. Celery sauce. Let me.
 17714	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 17715	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMr Bloom inserted his nose. Hm. Into the. Hm. Opening of his waistcoat.
 17716	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tAlmonds or. No. Lemons it is. Ah no, that’s the soap.
 17717	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 17718	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tO by the by that lotion. I knew there was something on my mind. Never
 17719	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twent back and the soap not paid. Dislike carrying bottles like that hag
 17720	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthis morning. Hynes might have paid me that three shillings. I could
 17721	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmention Meagher’s just to remind him. Still if he works that paragraph.
 17722	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTwo and nine. Bad opinion of me he’ll have. Call tomorrow. How much do
 17723	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tI owe you? Three and nine? Two and nine, sir. Ah. Might stop him giving
 17724	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcredit another time. Lose your customers that way. Pubs do. Fellows run
 17725	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tup a bill on the slate and then slinking around the back streets into
 17726	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsomewhere else.
 17727	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 17728	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHere’s this nobleman passed before. Blown in from the bay. Just went as
 17729	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfar as turn back. Always at home at dinnertime. Looks mangled out: had a
 17730	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tgood tuck in. Enjoying nature now. Grace after meals. After supper walk
 17731	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ta mile. Sure he has a small bank balance somewhere, government sit. Walk
 17732	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tafter him now make him awkward like those newsboys me today. Still you
 17733	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlearn something. See ourselves as others see us. So long as women don’t
 17734	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmock what matter? That’s the way to find out. Ask yourself who is he
 17735	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tnow. The Mystery Man on the Beach, prize titbit story by Mr Leopold
 17736	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBloom. Payment at the rate of one guinea per column. And that fellow
 17737	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttoday at the graveside in the brown macintosh. Corns on his kismet

 17740	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tatmosphere. Old Betty’s joints are on the rack. Mother Shipton’s
 17741	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tprophecy that is about ships around they fly in the twinkling. No. Signs
 17742	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof rain it is. The royal reader. And distant hills seem coming nigh.
 17743	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 17744	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHowth. Bailey light. Two, four, six, eight, nine. See. Has to change or
 17745	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthey might think it a house. Wreckers. Grace Darling. People afraid of
 17746	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe dark. Also glowworms, cyclists: lightingup time. Jewels diamonds
 17747	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tflash better. Women. Light is a kind of reassuring. Not going to hurt
 17748	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tyou. Better now of course than long ago. Country roads. Run you through
 17749	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe small guts for nothing. Still two types there are you bob against.
 17750	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tScowl or smile. Pardon! Not at all. Best time to spray plants too in
 17751	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe shade after the sun. Some light still. Red rays are longest. Roygbiv
 17752	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tVance taught us: red, orange, yellow, green, blue, indigo, violet. A
 17753	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tstar I see. Venus? Can’t tell yet. Two. When three it’s night. Were
 17754	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthose nightclouds there all the time? Looks like a phantom ship. No.
 17755	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tWait. Trees are they? An optical illusion. Mirage. Land of the setting
 17756	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsun this. Homerule sun setting in the southeast. My native land,
 17757	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tgoodnight.
 17758	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 17759	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tDew falling. Bad for you, dear, to sit on that stone. Brings on white
 17760	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfluxions. Never have little baby then less he was big strong fight his
 17761	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tway up through. Might get piles myself. Sticks too like a summer cold,
 17762	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsore on the mouth. Cut with grass or paper worst. Friction of the
 17763	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tposition. Like to be that rock she sat on. O sweet little, you don’t
 17764	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tknow how nice you looked. I begin to like them at that age. Green
 17765	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tapples. Grab at all that offer. Suppose it’s the only time we cross
 17766	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlegs, seated. Also the library today: those girl graduates. Happy chairs
 17767	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tunder them. But it’s the evening influence. They feel all that. Open

 17771	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\toilpainting of her then. June that was too I wooed. The year returns.
 17772	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHistory repeats itself. Ye crags and peaks I’m with you once again.
 17773	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tLife, love, voyage round your own little world. And now? Sad about her
 17774	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlame of course but must be on your guard not to feel too much pity. They
 17775	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttake advantage.
 17776	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 17777	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tAll quiet on Howth now. The distant hills seem. Where we. The
 17778	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\trhododendrons. I am a fool perhaps. He gets the plums, and I the
 17779	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tplumstones. Where I come in. All that old hill has seen. Names change:
 17780	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthat’s all. Lovers: yum yum.
 17781	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 17782	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTired I feel now. Will I get up? O wait. Drained all the manhood out of
 17783	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tme, little wretch. She kissed me. Never again. My youth. Only once it
 17784	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcomes. Or hers. Take the train there tomorrow. No. Returning not the
 17785	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsame. Like kids your second visit to a house. The new I want. Nothing
 17786	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tnew under the sun. Care of P. O. Dolphin’s Barn. Are you not happy in
 17787	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tyour? Naughty darling. At Dolphin’s barn charades in Luke Doyle’s house.

 17789	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHetty. Molly too. Eightyseven that was. Year before we. And the old
 17790	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmajor, partial to his drop of spirits. Curious she an only child, I an
 17791	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tonly child. So it returns. Think you’re escaping and run into yourself.
 17792	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tLongest way round is the shortest way home. And just when he and she.
 17793	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tCircus horse walking in a ring. Rip van Winkle we played. Rip: tear in
 17794	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHenny Doyle’s overcoat. Van: breadvan delivering. Winkle: cockles and
 17795	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tperiwinkles. Then I did Rip van Winkle coming back. She leaned on the
 17796	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsideboard watching. Moorish eyes. Twenty years asleep in Sleepy Hollow.
 17797	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tAll changed. Forgotten. The young are old. His gun rusty from the dew.
 17798	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 17799	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBa. What is that flying about? Swallow? Bat probably. Thinks I’m a tree,
 17800	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tso blind. Have birds no smell? Metempsychosis. They believed you could
 17801	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbe changed into a tree from grief. Weeping willow. Ba. There he goes.
 17802	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tFunny little beggar. Wonder where he lives. Belfry up there. Very
 17803	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlikely. Hanging by his heels in the odour of sanctity. Bell scared him
 17804	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tout, I suppose. Mass seems to be over. Could hear them all at it. Pray
 17805	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfor us. And pray for us. And pray for us. Good idea the repetition. Same
 17806	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthing with ads. Buy from us. And buy from us. Yes, there’s the light in
 17807	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe priest’s house. Their frugal meal. Remember about the mistake in the
 17808	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tvaluation when I was in Thom’s. Twentyeight it is. Two houses they have.

 17810	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tat night like mice. They’re a mixed breed. Birds are like hopping mice.
 17811	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tWhat frightens them, light or noise? Better sit still. All instinct
 17812	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlike the bird in drouth got water out of the end of a jar by throwing
 17813	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tin pebbles. Like a little man in a cloak he is with tiny hands. Weeny

 17822	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tburning glass. Then the heather goes on fire. It can’t be tourists’
 17823	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmatches. What? Perhaps the sticks dry rub together in the wind and
 17824	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlight. Or broken bottles in the furze act as a burning glass in the sun.
 17825	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tArchimedes. I have it! My memory’s not so bad.

 17827	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBa. Who knows what they’re always flying for. Insects? That bee last
 17828	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tweek got into the room playing with his shadow on the ceiling. Might
 17829	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbe the one bit me, come back to see. Birds too. Never find out. Or what
 17830	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthey say. Like our small talk. And says she and says he. Nerve they have
 17831	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tto fly over the ocean and back. Lots must be killed in storms, telegraph
 17832	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twires. Dreadful life sailors have too. Big brutes of oceangoing steamers

 17836	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twinds do blow. Married too. Sometimes away for years at the ends of the
 17837	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tearth somewhere. No ends really because it’s round. Wife in every port
 17838	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthey say. She has a good job if she minds it till Johnny comes marching
 17839	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thome again. If ever he does. Smelling the tail end of ports. How can

 17841	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ta scapular or a medal on him for luck. Well. And the tephilim no what’s
 17842	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthis they call it poor papa’s father had on his door to touch. That
 17843	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbrought us out of the land of Egypt and into the house of bondage.
 17844	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tSomething in all those superstitions because when you go out never know

 17847	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttill the sharks catch hold of him. Do fish ever get seasick?

 17850	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcrew and cargo in smithereens, Davy Jones’ locker, moon looking down so
 17851	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpeaceful. Not my fault, old cockalorum.

 17863	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tDignam’s house a boy ran out and called. Twittering the bat flew here,
 17864	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tflew there. Far out over the sands the coming surf crept, grey. Howth

 17869	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttwinkled, winked at Mr Bloom.

 17871	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tLife those chaps out there must have, stuck in the same spot. Irish

 17873	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbreeches buoy and lifeboat. Day we went out for the pleasure cruise in
 17874	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe Erin’s King, throwing them the sack of old papers. Bears in the zoo.
 17875	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tFilthy trip. Drunkards out to shake up their livers. Puking overboard
 17876	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tto feed the herrings. Nausea. And the women, fear of God in their faces.
 17877	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMilly, no sign of funk. Her blue scarf loose, laughing. Don’t know what
 17878	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdeath is at that age. And then their stomachs clean. But being lost they
 17879	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfear. When we hid behind the tree at Crumlin. I didn’t want to. Mamma!
 17880	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMamma! Babes in the wood. Frightening them with masks too. Throwing them
 17881	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tup in the air to catch them. I’ll murder you. Is it only half fun? Or
 17882	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tchildren playing battle. Whole earnest. How can people aim guns at each
 17883	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tother. Sometimes they go off. Poor kids! Only troubles wildfire and
 17884	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tnettlerash. Calomel purge I got her for that. After getting better
 17885	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tasleep with Molly. Very same teeth she has. What do they love? Another
 17886	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthemselves? But the morning she chased her with the umbrella. Perhaps so
 17887	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tas not to hurt. I felt her pulse. Ticking. Little hand it was: now big.
 17888	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tDearest Papli. All that the hand says when you touch. Loved to count
 17889	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmy waistcoat buttons. Her first stays I remember. Made me laugh to see.
 17890	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tLittle paps to begin with. Left one is more sensitive, I think. Mine
 17891	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttoo. Nearer the heart? Padding themselves out if fat is in fashion. Her
 17892	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tgrowing pains at night, calling, wakening me. Frightened she was when
 17893	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ther nature came on her first. Poor child! Strange moment for the mother
 17894	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttoo. Brings back her girlhood. Gibraltar. Looking from Buena Vista.
 17895	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tO’Hara’s tower. The seabirds screaming. Old Barbary ape that gobbled all
 17896	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\this family. Sundown, gunfire for the men to cross the lines. Looking
 17897	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tout over the sea she told me. Evening like this, but clear, no clouds.
 17898	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tI always thought I’d marry a lord or a rich gentleman coming with
 17899	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ta private yacht. Buenas noches, señorita. El hombre ama la muchacha
 17900	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thermosa. Why me? Because you were so foreign from the others.
 17901	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t

 17903	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdull. Must be getting on for nine by the light. Go home. Too late for
 17904	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tLeah, Lily of Killarney. No. Might be still up. Call to the hospital
 17905	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tto see. Hope she’s over. Long day I’ve had. Martha, the bath, funeral,
 17906	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thouse of Keyes, museum with those goddesses, Dedalus’ song. Then that
 17907	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbawler in Barney Kiernan’s. Got my own back there. Drunken ranters what
 17908	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tI said about his God made him wince. Mistake to hit back. Or? No.
 17909	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tOught to go home and laugh at themselves. Always want to be swilling in
 17910	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcompany. Afraid to be alone like a child of two. Suppose he hit me. Look
 17911	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tat it other way round. Not so bad then. Perhaps not to hurt he meant.
 17912	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThree cheers for Israel. Three cheers for the sister-in-law he hawked
 17913	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tabout, three fangs in her mouth. Same style of beauty. Particularly nice
 17914	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\told party for a cup of tea. The sister of the wife of the wild man of
 17915	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBorneo has just come to town. Imagine that in the early morning at close
 17916	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\trange. Everyone to his taste as Morris said when he kissed the cow. But
 17917	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tDignam’s put the boots on it. Houses of mourning so depressing because
 17918	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tyou never know. Anyhow she wants the money. Must call to those Scottish
 17919	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tWidows as I promised. Strange name. Takes it for granted we’re going to
 17920	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpop off first. That widow on Monday was it outside Cramer’s that
 17921	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlooked at me. Buried the poor husband but progressing favourably on
 17922	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe premium. Her widow’s mite. Well? What do you expect her to do? Must
 17923	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twheedle her way along. Widower I hate to see. Looks so forlorn. Poor man
 17924	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tO’Connor wife and five children poisoned by mussels here. The sewage.
 17925	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHopeless. Some good matronly woman in a porkpie hat to mother him. Take
 17926	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thim in tow, platter face and a large apron. Ladies’ grey flannelette
 17927	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbloomers, three shillings a pair, astonishing bargain. Plain and loved,
 17928	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tloved for ever, they say. Ugly: no woman thinks she is. Love, lie and be
 17929	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thandsome for tomorrow we die. See him sometimes walking about trying to
 17930	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfind out who played the trick. U.P.: up. Fate that is. He, not me. Also
 17931	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ta shop often noticed. Curse seems to dog it. Dreamt last night? Wait.
 17932	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tSomething confused. She had red slippers on. Turkish. Wore the breeches.
 17933	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tSuppose she does? Would I like her in pyjamas? Damned hard to answer.
 17934	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tNannetti’s gone. Mailboat. Near Holyhead by now. Must nail that ad
 17935	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof Keyes’s. Work Hynes and Crawford. Petticoats for Molly. She has
 17936	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsomething to put in them. What’s that? Might be money.
 17937	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 17938	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMr Bloom stooped and turned over a piece of paper on the strand. He
 17939	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbrought it near his eyes and peered. Letter? No. Can’t read. Better go.
 17940	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBetter. I’m tired to move. Page of an old copybook. All those holes and
 17941	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpebbles. Who could count them? Never know what you find. Bottle with
 17942	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tstory of a treasure in it, thrown from a wreck. Parcels post. Children
 17943	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\talways want to throw things in the sea. Trust? Bread cast on the waters.
 17944	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tWhat’s this? Bit of stick.

 17946	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tO! Exhausted that female has me. Not so young now. Will she come here
 17947	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttomorrow? Wait for her somewhere for ever. Must come back. Murderers do.

 18030	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 18031	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tUniversally that person’s acumen is esteemed very little perceptive
 18032	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tconcerning whatsoever matters are being held as most profitably by
 18033	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmortals with sapience endowed to be studied who is ignorant of that
 18034	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twhich the most in doctrine erudite and certainly by reason of that in
 18035	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthem high mind’s ornament deserving of veneration constantly maintain
 18036	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twhen by general consent they affirm that other circumstances being
 18037	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tequal by no exterior splendour is the prosperity of a nation more
 18038	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tefficaciously asserted than by the measure of how far forward may
 18039	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thave progressed the tribute of its solicitude for that proliferent
 18040	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcontinuance which of evils the original if it be absent when fortunately
 18041	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpresent constitutes the certain sign of omnipollent nature’s incorrupted
 18042	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbenefaction. For who is there who anything of some significance has
 18043	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tapprehended but is conscious that that exterior splendour may be the
 18044	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsurface of a downwardtending lutulent reality or on the contrary anyone
 18045	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tso is there unilluminated as not to perceive that as no nature’s boon
 18046	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcan contend against the bounty of increase so it behoves every most just
 18047	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcitizen to become the exhortator and admonisher of his semblables and
 18048	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tto tremble lest what had in the past been by the nation excellently
 18049	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcommenced might be in the future not with similar excellence
 18050	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\taccomplished if an inverecund habit shall have gradually traduced
 18051	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe honourable by ancestors transmitted customs to that thither of
 18052	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tprofundity that that one was audacious excessively who would have the
 18053	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thardihood to rise affirming that no more odious offence can for anyone
 18054	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbe than to oblivious neglect to consign that evangel simultaneously
 18055	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcommand and promise which on all mortals with prophecy of abundance
 18056	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tor with diminution’s menace that exalted of reiteratedly procreating
 18057	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfunction ever irrevocably enjoined?
 18058	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 18059	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tIt is not why therefore we shall wonder if, as the best historians
 18060	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\trelate, among the Celts, who nothing that was not in its nature
 18061	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tadmirable admired, the art of medicine shall have been highly honoured.
 18062	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tNot to speak of hostels, leperyards, sweating chambers, plaguegraves,
 18063	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttheir greatest doctors, the O’Shiels, the O’Hickeys, the O’Lees,
 18064	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thave sedulously set down the divers methods by which the sick and the
 18065	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\trelapsed found again health whether the malady had been the trembling
 18066	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twithering or loose boyconnell flux. Certainly in every public work which
 18067	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tin it anything of gravity contains preparation should be with importance
 18068	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcommensurate and therefore a plan was by them adopted (whether by having
 18069	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpreconsidered or as the maturation of experience it is difficult in
 18070	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbeing said which the discrepant opinions of subsequent inquirers are not
 18071	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tup to the present congrued to render manifest) whereby maternity was so
 18072	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfar from all accident possibility removed that whatever care the patient
 18073	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tin that allhardest of woman hour chiefly required and not solely for the
 18074	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcopiously opulent but also for her who not being sufficiently moneyed
 18075	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tscarcely and often not even scarcely could subsist valiantly and for an
 18076	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tinconsiderable emolument was provided.
 18077	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 18078	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTo her nothing already then and thenceforward was anyway able to be
 18079	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmolestful for this chiefly felt all citizens except with proliferent
 18080	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmothers prosperity at all not to can be and as they had received
 18081	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\teternity gods mortals generation to befit them her beholding, when the
 18082	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcase was so hoving itself, parturient in vehicle thereward carrying
 18083	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdesire immense among all one another was impelling on of her to be
 18084	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\treceived into that domicile. O thing of prudent nation not merely in
 18085	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbeing seen but also even in being related worthy of being praised that
 18086	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthey her by anticipation went seeing mother, that she by them suddenly
 18087	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tto be about to be cherished had been begun she felt!
 18088	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 18089	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBefore born bliss babe had. Within womb won he worship. Whatever in that
 18090	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tone case done commodiously done was. A couch by midwives attended with
 18091	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twholesome food reposeful, cleanest swaddles as though forthbringing were
 18092	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tnow done and by wise foresight set: but to this no less of what drugs
 18093	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthere is need and surgical implements which are pertaining to her

 18095	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlatitudes by our terrestrial orb offered together with images, divine
 18096	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand human, the cogitation of which by sejunct females is to tumescence
 18097	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tconducive or eases issue in the high sunbright wellbuilt fair home of
 18098	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmothers when, ostensibly far gone and reproductitive, it is come by her
 18099	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthereto to lie in, her term up.
 18100	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 18101	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tSome man that wayfaring was stood by housedoor at night’s oncoming. Of
 18102	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tIsrael’s folk was that man that on earth wandering far had fared. Stark
 18103	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\truth of man his errand that him lone led till that house.
 18104	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 18105	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tOf that house A. Horne is lord. Seventy beds keeps he there teeming
 18106	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmothers are wont that they lie for to thole and bring forth bairns hale
 18107	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tso God’s angel to Mary quoth. Watchers tway there walk, white sisters
 18108	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tin ward sleepless. Smarts they still, sickness soothing: in twelve moons
 18109	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthrice an hundred. Truest bedthanes they twain are, for Horne holding
 18110	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twariest ward.
 18111	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 18112	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tIn ward wary the watcher hearing come that man mildhearted eft rising
 18113	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twith swire ywimpled to him her gate wide undid. Lo, levin leaping
 18114	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlightens in eyeblink Ireland’s westward welkin. Full she drad that
 18115	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tGod the Wreaker all mankind would fordo with water for his evil sins.
 18116	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tChrist’s rood made she on breastbone and him drew that he would rathe
 18117	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tinfare under her thatch. That man her will wotting worthful went in
 18118	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHorne’s house.

 18120	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tLoth to irk in Horne’s hall hat holding the seeker stood. On her stow he

 18122	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand seafloor nine years had long outwandered. Once her in townhithe
 18123	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmeeting he to her bow had not doffed. Her to forgive now he craved with

 18125	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tyoung then had looked. Light swift her eyes kindled, bloom of blushes

 18128	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tAs her eyes then ongot his weeds swart therefor sorrow she feared. Glad
 18129	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tafter she was that ere adread was. Her he asked if O’Hare Doctor tidings

 18131	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tDoctor in heaven was. Sad was the man that word to hear that him so

 18133	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfriend so young, algate sore unwilling God’s rightwiseness to withsay.
 18134	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tShe said that he had a fair sweet death through God His goodness with
 18135	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmasspriest to be shriven, holy housel and sick men’s oil to his limbs.
 18136	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThe man then right earnest asked the nun of which death the dead man was
 18137	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdied and the nun answered him and said that he was died in Mona Island
 18138	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthrough bellycrab three year agone come Childermas and she prayed to God
 18139	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe Allruthful to have his dear soul in his undeathliness. He heard her
 18140	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsad words, in held hat sad staring. So stood they there both awhile in
 18141	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twanhope sorrowing one with other.
 18142	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 18143	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTherefore, everyman, look to that last end that is thy death and the

 18145	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tnaked forth from his mother’s womb so naked shall he wend him at the
 18146	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlast for to go as he came.
 18147	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 18148	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThe man that was come in to the house then spoke to the nursingwoman and
 18149	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\the asked her how it fared with the woman that lay there in childbed.
 18150	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThe nursingwoman answered him and said that that woman was in throes
 18151	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tnow full three days and that it would be a hard birth unneth to bear
 18152	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbut that now in a little it would be. She said thereto that she had
 18153	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tseen many births of women but never was none so hard as was that woman’s
 18154	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbirth. Then she set it all forth to him for because she knew the man
 18155	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthat time was had lived nigh that house. The man hearkened to her words
 18156	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfor he felt with wonder women’s woe in the travail that they have of
 18157	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmotherhood and he wondered to look on her face that was a fair face for
 18158	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tany man to see but yet was she left after long years a handmaid. Nine
 18159	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttwelve bloodflows chiding her childless.
 18160	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 18161	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tAnd whiles they spake the door of the castle was opened and there nighed
 18162	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthem a mickle noise as of many that sat there at meat. And there came
 18163	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tagainst the place as they stood a young learningknight yclept Dixon. And
 18164	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe traveller Leopold was couth to him sithen it had happed that they
 18165	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thad had ado each with other in the house of misericord where this
 18166	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlearningknight lay by cause the traveller Leopold came there to be
 18167	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thealed for he was sore wounded in his breast by a spear wherewith a
 18168	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thorrible and dreadful dragon was smitten him for which he did do make
 18169	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ta salve of volatile salt and chrism as much as he might suffice. And he
 18170	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsaid now that he should go in to that castle for to make merry with
 18171	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthem that were there. And the traveller Leopold said that he should go
 18172	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\totherwhither for he was a man of cautels and a subtile. Also the lady
 18173	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twas of his avis and repreved the learningknight though she trowed well
 18174	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthat the traveller had said thing that was false for his subtility. But
 18175	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe learningknight would not hear say nay nor do her mandement ne have
 18176	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thim in aught contrarious to his list and he said how it was a marvellous
 18177	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcastle. And the traveller Leopold went into the castle for to rest him
 18178	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfor a space being sore of limb after many marches environing in divers
 18179	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlands and sometime venery.
 18180	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 18181	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tAnd in the castle was set a board that was of the birchwood of Finlandy
 18182	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand it was upheld by four dwarfmen of that country but they durst not
 18183	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmove more for enchantment. And on this board were frightful swords and
 18184	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tknives that are made in a great cavern by swinking demons out of white
 18185	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tflames that they fix then in the horns of buffalos and stags that there
 18186	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tabound marvellously. And there were vessels that are wrought by magic of
 18187	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMahound out of seasand and the air by a warlock with his breath that he
 18188	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tblases in to them like to bubbles. And full fair cheer and rich was on
 18189	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe board that no wight could devise a fuller ne richer. And there was
 18190	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ta vat of silver that was moved by craft to open in the which lay strange
 18191	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfishes withouten heads though misbelieving men nie that this be possible
 18192	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthing without they see it natheless they are so. And these fishes lie
 18193	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tin an oily water brought there from Portugal land because of the fatness
 18194	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthat therein is like to the juices of the olivepress. And also it was
 18195	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ta marvel to see in that castle how by magic they make a compost out of
 18196	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfecund wheatkidneys out of Chaldee that by aid of certain angry spirits
 18197	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthat they do in to it swells up wondrously like to a vast mountain. And
 18198	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthey teach the serpents there to entwine themselves up on long sticks
 18199	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tout of the ground and of the scales of these serpents they brew out a
 18200	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbrewage like to mead.
 18201	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 18202	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tAnd the learning knight let pour for childe Leopold a draught and halp
 18203	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthereto the while all they that were there drank every each. And childe
 18204	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tLeopold did up his beaver for to pleasure him and took apertly somewhat
 18205	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tin amity for he never drank no manner of mead which he then put by and
 18206	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tanon full privily he voided the more part in his neighbour glass and
 18207	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\this neighbour nist not of this wile. And he sat down in that castle with
 18208	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthem for to rest him there awhile. Thanked be Almighty God.
 18209	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 18210	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThis meanwhile this good sister stood by the door and begged them at the
 18211	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\treverence of Jesu our alther liege Lord to leave their wassailing for
 18212	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthere was above one quick with child, a gentle dame, whose time hied
 18213	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfast. Sir Leopold heard on the upfloor cry on high and he wondered what
 18214	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcry that it was whether of child or woman and I marvel, said he, that it
 18215	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbe not come or now. Meseems it dureth overlong. And he was ware and saw
 18216	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ta franklin that hight Lenehan on that side the table that was older than
 18217	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tany of the tother and for that they both were knights virtuous in the
 18218	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tone emprise and eke by cause that he was elder he spoke to him full
 18219	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tgently. But, said he, or it be long too she will bring forth by God His
 18220	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbounty and have joy of her childing for she hath waited marvellous long.
 18221	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tAnd the franklin that had drunken said, Expecting each moment to be her
 18222	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tnext. Also he took the cup that stood tofore him for him needed never
 18223	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tnone asking nor desiring of him to drink and, Now drink, said he, fully
 18224	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdelectably, and he quaffed as far as he might to their both’s health for
 18225	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\the was a passing good man of his lustiness. And sir Leopold that was the
 18226	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tgoodliest guest that ever sat in scholars’ hall and that was the meekest
 18227	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tman and the kindest that ever laid husbandly hand under hen and that was
 18228	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe very truest knight of the world one that ever did minion service
 18229	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tto lady gentle pledged him courtly in the cup. Woman’s woe with wonder
 18230	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpondering.
 18231	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 18232	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tNow let us speak of that fellowship that was there to the intent to be
 18233	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdrunken an they might. There was a sort of scholars along either side
 18234	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe board, that is to wit, Dixon yclept junior of saint Mary Merciable’s
 18235	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twith other his fellows Lynch and Madden, scholars of medicine, and the
 18236	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfranklin that hight Lenehan and one from Alba Longa, one Crotthers, and
 18237	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tyoung Stephen that had mien of a frere that was at head of the board
 18238	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand Costello that men clepen Punch Costello all long of a mastery of
 18239	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thim erewhile gested (and of all them, reserved young Stephen, he was the
 18240	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmost drunken that demanded still of more mead) and beside the meek sir
 18241	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tLeopold. But on young Malachi they waited for that he promised to have
 18242	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcome and such as intended to no goodness said how he had broke his avow.
 18243	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tAnd sir Leopold sat with them for he bore fast friendship to sir Simon
 18244	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand to this his son young Stephen and for that his languor becalmed him
 18245	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthere after longest wanderings insomuch as they feasted him for that
 18246	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttime in the honourablest manner. Ruth red him, love led on with will to
 18247	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twander, loth to leave.
 18248	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 18249	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tFor they were right witty scholars. And he heard their aresouns each gen
 18250	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tother as touching birth and righteousness, young Madden maintaining that
 18251	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tput such case it were hard the wife to die (for so it had fallen out a
 18252	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmatter of some year agone with a woman of Eblana in Horne’s house that
 18253	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tnow was trespassed out of this world and the self night next before her
 18254	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdeath all leeches and pothecaries had taken counsel of her case). And
 18255	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthey said farther she should live because in the beginning, they said,
 18256	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe woman should bring forth in pain and wherefore they that were of
 18257	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthis imagination affirmed how young Madden had said truth for he had
 18258	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tconscience to let her die. And not few and of these was young Lynch
 18259	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twere in doubt that the world was now right evil governed as it was never
 18260	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tother howbeit the mean people believed it otherwise but the law nor his
 18261	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tjudges did provide no remedy. A redress God grant. This was scant said
 18262	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbut all cried with one acclaim nay, by our Virgin Mother, the wife
 18263	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tshould live and the babe to die. In colour whereof they waxed hot
 18264	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tupon that head what with argument and what for their drinking but the
 18265	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfranklin Lenehan was prompt each when to pour them ale so that at the
 18266	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tleast way mirth might not lack. Then young Madden showed all the whole
 18267	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\taffair and said how that she was dead and how for holy religion sake by
 18268	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\trede of palmer and bedesman and for a vow he had made to Saint Ultan of
 18269	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tArbraccan her goodman husband would not let her death whereby they were
 18270	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tall wondrous grieved. To whom young Stephen had these words following:
 18271	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMurmur, sirs, is eke oft among lay folk. Both babe and parent now
 18272	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tglorify their Maker, the one in limbo gloom, the other in purgefire.
 18273	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBut, gramercy, what of those Godpossibled souls that we nightly
 18274	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\timpossibilise, which is the sin against the Holy Ghost, Very God, Lord
 18275	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand Giver of Life? For, sirs, he said, our lust is brief. We are means
 18276	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tto those small creatures within us and nature has other ends than we.
 18277	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThen said Dixon junior to Punch Costello wist he what ends. But he had
 18278	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tovermuch drunken and the best word he could have of him was that he
 18279	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twould ever dishonest a woman whoso she were or wife or maid or leman if
 18280	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tit so fortuned him to be delivered of his spleen of lustihead. Whereat
 18281	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tCrotthers of Alba Longa sang young Malachi’s praise of that beast the
 18282	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tunicorn how once in the millennium he cometh by his horn, the other all
 18283	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthis while, pricked forward with their jibes wherewith they did malice
 18284	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thim, witnessing all and several by saint Foutinus his engines that
 18285	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\the was able to do any manner of thing that lay in man to do. Thereat
 18286	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlaughed they all right jocundly only young Stephen and sir Leopold which
 18287	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tnever durst laugh too open by reason of a strange humour which he would
 18288	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tnot bewray and also for that he rued for her that bare whoso she might
 18289	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbe or wheresoever. Then spake young Stephen orgulous of mother Church
 18290	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthat would cast him out of her bosom, of law of canons, of Lilith,
 18291	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpatron of abortions, of bigness wrought by wind of seeds of brightness
 18292	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tor by potency of vampires mouth to mouth or, as Virgilius saith, by the
 18293	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tinfluence of the occident or by the reek of moonflower or an she
 18294	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlie with a woman which her man has but lain with, effectu secuto, or
 18295	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tperadventure in her bath according to the opinions of Averroes and Moses
 18296	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMaimonides. He said also how at the end of the second month a human soul
 18297	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twas infused and how in all our holy mother foldeth ever souls for God’s
 18298	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tgreater glory whereas that earthly mother which was but a dam to bear
 18299	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbeastly should die by canon for so saith he that holdeth the fisherman’s
 18300	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tseal, even that blessed Peter on which rock was holy church for all ages
 18301	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfounded. All they bachelors then asked of sir Leopold would he in like
 18302	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcase so jeopard her person as risk life to save life. A wariness of
 18303	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmind he would answer as fitted all and, laying hand to jaw, he said
 18304	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdissembling, as his wont was, that as it was informed him, who had ever
 18305	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tloved the art of physic as might a layman, and agreeing also with his
 18306	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\texperience of so seldomseen an accident it was good for that mother
 18307	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tChurch belike at one blow had birth and death pence and in such sort
 18308	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdeliverly he scaped their questions. That is truth, pardy, said Dixon,
 18309	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand, or I err, a pregnant word. Which hearing young Stephen was a
 18310	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmarvellous glad man and he averred that he who stealeth from the poor
 18311	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlendeth to the Lord for he was of a wild manner when he was drunken and
 18312	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthat he was now in that taking it appeared eftsoons.
 18313	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 18314	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBut sir Leopold was passing grave maugre his word by cause he still had
 18315	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpity of the terrorcausing shrieking of shrill women in their labour
 18316	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand as he was minded of his good lady Marion that had borne him an only
 18317	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmanchild which on his eleventh day on live had died and no man of art
 18318	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcould save so dark is destiny. And she was wondrous stricken of heart
 18319	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfor that evil hap and for his burial did him on a fair corselet of
 18320	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlamb’s wool, the flower of the flock, lest he might perish utterly and
 18321	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlie akeled (for it was then about the midst of the winter) and now sir
 18322	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tLeopold that had of his body no manchild for an heir looked upon him his
 18323	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfriend’s son and was shut up in sorrow for his forepassed happiness and
 18324	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tas sad as he was that him failed a son of such gentle courage (for all
