 19120	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof songs and himself after me the like of a soulth or a bullawurrus? My
 19121	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thell, and Ireland’s, is in this life. It is what I tried to obliterate
 19122	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmy crime. Distractions, rookshooting, the Erse language (he recited
 19123	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsome), laudanum (he raised the phial to his lips), camping out. In vain!
 19124	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHis spectre stalks me. Dope is my only hope... Ah! Destruction! The
 19125	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tblack panther! With a cry he suddenly vanished and the panel slid back.
 19126	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tAn instant later his head appeared in the door opposite and said: Meet
 19127	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tme at Westland Row station at ten past eleven. He was gone. Tears
 19128	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tgushed from the eyes of the dissipated host. The seer raised his hand
 19129	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tto heaven, murmuring: The vendetta of Mananaun! The sage repeated: Lex
 19130	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttalionis. The sentimentalist is he who would enjoy without incurring
 19131	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe immense debtorship for a thing done. Malachias, overcome by emotion,
 19132	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tceased. The mystery was unveiled. Haines was the third brother. His
 19133	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\treal name was Childs. The black panther was himself the ghost of his own
 19134	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfather. He drank drugs to obliterate. For this relief much thanks. The
 19135	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlonely house by the graveyard is uninhabited. No soul will live there.
 19136	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThe spider pitches her web in the solitude. The nocturnal rat peers from
 19137	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\this hole. A curse is on it. It is haunted. Murderer’s ground.
 19138	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 19139	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tWhat is the age of the soul of man? As she hath the virtue of the
 19140	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tchameleon to change her hue at every new approach, to be gay with the
 19141	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmerry and mournful with the downcast, so too is her age changeable as
 19142	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ther mood. No longer is Leopold, as he sits there, ruminating, chewing
 19143	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe cud of reminiscence, that staid agent of publicity and holder of a
 19144	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmodest substance in the funds. A score of years are blown away. He is
 19145	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tyoung Leopold. There, as in a retrospective arrangement, a mirror within
 19146	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ta mirror (hey, presto!), he beholdeth himself. That young figure of then
 19147	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tis seen, precociously manly, walking on a nipping morning from the old
 19148	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thouse in Clanbrassil street to the high school, his booksatchel on
 19149	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thim bandolierwise, and in it a goodly hunk of wheaten loaf, a mother’s
 19150	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthought. Or it is the same figure, a year or so gone over, in his first
 19151	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thard hat (ah, that was a day!), already on the road, a fullfledged
 19152	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttraveller for the family firm, equipped with an orderbook, a scented
 19153	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thandkerchief (not for show only), his case of bright trinketware (alas!
 19154	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ta thing now of the past!) and a quiverful of compliant smiles for this
 19155	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tor that halfwon housewife reckoning it out upon her fingertips or for
 19156	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ta budding virgin, shyly acknowledging (but the heart? tell me!) his
 19157	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tstudied baisemoins. The scent, the smile, but, more than these, the dark
 19158	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\teyes and oleaginous address, brought home at duskfall many a commission
 19159	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tto the head of the firm, seated with Jacob’s pipe after like labours in
 19160	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe paternal ingle (a meal of noodles, you may be sure, is aheating),
 19161	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\treading through round horned spectacles some paper from the Europe of a
 19162	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmonth before. But hey, presto, the mirror is breathed on and the young
 19163	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tknighterrant recedes, shrivels, dwindles to a tiny speck within the
 19164	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmist. Now he is himself paternal and these about him might be his
 19165	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsons. Who can say? The wise father knows his own child. He thinks of a
 19166	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdrizzling night in Hatch street, hard by the bonded stores there, the
 19167	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfirst. Together (she is a poor waif, a child of shame, yours and mine
 19168	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand of all for a bare shilling and her luckpenny), together they hear
 19169	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe heavy tread of the watch as two raincaped shadows pass the new royal
 19170	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tuniversity. Bridie! Bridie Kelly! He will never forget the name, ever
 19171	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tremember the night: first night, the bridenight. They are entwined
 19172	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tin nethermost darkness, the willer with the willed, and in an instant
 19173	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(fiat!) light shall flood the world. Did heart leap to heart? Nay, fair
 19174	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\treader. In a breath ‘twas done but—hold! Back! It must not be! In terror
 19175	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe poor girl flees away through the murk. She is the bride of darkness,
 19176	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ta daughter of night. She dare not bear the sunnygolden babe of day. No,
 19177	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tLeopold. Name and memory solace thee not. That youthful illusion of
 19178	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthy strength was taken from thee—and in vain. No son of thy loins is by
 19179	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthee. There is none now to be for Leopold, what Leopold was for Rudolph.
 19180	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 19181	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThe voices blend and fuse in clouded silence: silence that is the
 19182	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tinfinite of space: and swiftly, silently the soul is wafted over regions
 19183	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof cycles of generations that have lived. A region where grey twilight
 19184	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tever descends, never falls on wide sagegreen pasturefields, shedding her
 19185	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdusk, scattering a perennial dew of stars. She follows her mother with
 19186	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tungainly steps, a mare leading her fillyfoal. Twilight phantoms
 19187	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tare they, yet moulded in prophetic grace of structure, slim shapely
 19188	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thaunches, a supple tendonous neck, the meek apprehensive skull. They
 19189	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfade, sad phantoms: all is gone. Agendath is a waste land, a home of
 19190	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tscreechowls and the sandblind upupa. Netaim, the golden, is no more. And
 19191	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ton the highway of the clouds they come, muttering thunder of rebellion,
 19192	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe ghosts of beasts. Huuh! Hark! Huuh! Parallax stalks behind and goads
 19193	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthem, the lancinating lightnings of whose brow are scorpions. Elk and
 19194	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tyak, the bulls of Bashan and of Babylon, mammoth and mastodon, they come
 19195	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttrooping to the sunken sea, Lacus Mortis. Ominous revengeful zodiacal
 19196	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thost! They moan, passing upon the clouds, horned and capricorned, the
 19197	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttrumpeted with the tusked, the lionmaned, the giantantlered, snouter
 19198	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand crawler, rodent, ruminant and pachyderm, all their moving moaning
 19199	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmultitude, murderers of the sun.
 19200	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 19201	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tOnward to the dead sea they tramp to drink, unslaked and with horrible
 19202	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tgulpings, the salt somnolent inexhaustible flood. And the equine portent
 19203	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tgrows again, magnified in the deserted heavens, nay to heaven’s own
 19204	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmagnitude, till it looms, vast, over the house of Virgo. And lo, wonder
 19205	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof metempsychosis, it is she, the everlasting bride, harbinger of the
 19206	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdaystar, the bride, ever virgin. It is she, Martha, thou lost one,
 19207	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMillicent, the young, the dear, the radiant. How serene does she now
 19208	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tarise, a queen among the Pleiades, in the penultimate antelucan hour,
 19209	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tshod in sandals of bright gold, coifed with a veil of what do you call
 19210	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tit gossamer. It floats, it flows about her starborn flesh and loose it
 19211	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tstreams, emerald, sapphire, mauve and heliotrope, sustained on currents
 19212	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof the cold interstellar wind, winding, coiling, simply swirling,
 19213	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twrithing in the skies a mysterious writing till, after a myriad
 19214	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmetamorphoses of symbol, it blazes, Alpha, a ruby and triangled sign
 19215	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tupon the forehead of Taurus.
 19216	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 19217	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tFrancis was reminding Stephen of years before when they had been at
 19218	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tschool together in Conmee’s time. He asked about Glaucon, Alcibiades,
 19219	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tPisistratus. Where were they now? Neither knew. You have spoken of the
 19220	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpast and its phantoms, Stephen said. Why think of them? If I call them
 19221	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tinto life across the waters of Lethe will not the poor ghosts troop to
 19222	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmy call? Who supposes it? I, Bous Stephanoumenos, bullockbefriending
 19223	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbard, am lord and giver of their life. He encircled his gadding hair
 19224	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twith a coronal of vineleaves, smiling at Vincent. That answer and those
 19225	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tleaves, Vincent said to him, will adorn you more fitly when something
 19226	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmore, and greatly more, than a capful of light odes can call your genius
 19227	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfather. All who wish you well hope this for you. All desire to see
 19228	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tyou bring forth the work you meditate, to acclaim you Stephaneforos. I
 19229	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\theartily wish you may not fail them. O no, Vincent Lenehan said, laying
 19230	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ta hand on the shoulder near him. Have no fear. He could not leave his
 19231	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmother an orphan. The young man’s face grew dark. All could see how hard
 19232	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tit was for him to be reminded of his promise and of his recent loss. He
 19233	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twould have withdrawn from the feast had not the noise of voices allayed
 19234	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe smart. Madden had lost five drachmas on Sceptre for a whim of the
 19235	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\trider’s name: Lenehan as much more. He told them of the race. The flag
 19236	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfell and, huuh! off, scamper, the mare ran out freshly with O. Madden
 19237	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tup. She was leading the field. All hearts were beating. Even Phyllis
 19238	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcould not contain herself. She waved her scarf and cried: Huzzah!
 19239	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tSceptre wins! But in the straight on the run home when all were in close
 19240	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\torder the dark horse Throwaway drew level, reached, outstripped her. All
 19241	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twas lost now. Phyllis was silent: her eyes were sad anemones. Juno, she
 19242	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcried, I am undone. But her lover consoled her and brought her a bright
 19243	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcasket of gold in which lay some oval sugarplums which she partook. A
 19244	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttear fell: one only. A whacking fine whip, said Lenehan, is W. Lane.
 19245	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tFour winners yesterday and three today. What rider is like him? Mount
 19246	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thim on the camel or the boisterous buffalo the victory in a hack canter
 19247	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tis still his. But let us bear it as was the ancient wont. Mercy on the
 19248	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tluckless! Poor Sceptre! he said with a light sigh. She is not the filly
 19249	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthat she was. Never, by this hand, shall we behold such another. By gad,
 19250	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsir, a queen of them. Do you remember her, Vincent? I wish you could
 19251	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thave seen my queen today, Vincent said. How young she was and radiant
 19252	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(Lalage were scarce fair beside her) in her yellow shoes and frock of
 19253	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmuslin, I do not know the right name of it. The chestnuts that shaded
 19254	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tus were in bloom: the air drooped with their persuasive odour and with
 19255	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpollen floating by us. In the sunny patches one might easily have
 19256	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcooked on a stone a batch of those buns with Corinth fruit in them that
 19257	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tPeriplipomenes sells in his booth near the bridge. But she had nought
 19258	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfor her teeth but the arm with which I held her and in that she nibbled
 19259	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmischievously when I pressed too close. A week ago she lay ill, four
 19260	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdays on the couch, but today she was free, blithe, mocked at peril.
 19261	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tShe is more taking then. Her posies too! Mad romp that she is, she had
 19262	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpulled her fill as we reclined together. And in your ear, my friend, you
 19263	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twill not think who met us as we left the field. Conmee himself! He was
 19264	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twalking by the hedge, reading, I think a brevier book with, I doubt not,
 19265	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ta witty letter in it from Glycera or Chloe to keep the page. The sweet
 19266	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcreature turned all colours in her confusion, feigning to reprove a
 19267	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tslight disorder in her dress: a slip of underwood clung there for the
 19268	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tvery trees adore her. When Conmee had passed she glanced at her lovely
 19269	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\techo in that little mirror she carries. But he had been kind. In going
 19270	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tby he had blessed us. The gods too are ever kind, Lenehan said. If I had
 19271	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpoor luck with Bass’s mare perhaps this draught of his may serve me more
 19272	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpropensely. He was laying his hand upon a winejar: Malachi saw it and
 19273	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twithheld his act, pointing to the stranger and to the scarlet label.
 19274	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tWarily, Malachi whispered, preserve a druid silence. His soul is far
 19275	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\taway. It is as painful perhaps to be awakened from a vision as to be
 19276	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tborn. Any object, intensely regarded, may be a gate of access to the
 19277	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tincorruptible eon of the gods. Do you not think it, Stephen? Theosophos
 19278	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttold me so, Stephen answered, whom in a previous existence Egyptian
 19279	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpriests initiated into the mysteries of karmic law. The lords of the
 19280	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmoon, Theosophos told me, an orangefiery shipload from planet Alpha
 19281	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof the lunar chain would not assume the etheric doubles and these
 19282	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twere therefore incarnated by the rubycoloured egos from the second
 19283	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tconstellation.
 19284	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 19285	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHowever, as a matter of fact though, the preposterous surmise about him
 19286	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbeing in some description of a doldrums or other or mesmerised which was
 19287	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tentirely due to a misconception of the shallowest character, was not
 19288	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe case at all. The individual whose visual organs while the above
 19289	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twas going on were at this juncture commencing to exhibit symptoms of
 19290	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tanimation was as astute if not astuter than any man living and anybody
 19291	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthat conjectured the contrary would have found themselves pretty
 19292	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tspeedily in the wrong shop. During the past four minutes or thereabouts
 19293	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\the had been staring hard at a certain amount of number one Bass bottled
 19294	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tby Messrs Bass and Co at Burton-on-Trent which happened to be situated
 19295	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tamongst a lot of others right opposite to where he was and which was
 19296	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcertainly calculated to attract anyone’s remark on account of its
 19297	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tscarlet appearance. He was simply and solely, as it subsequently
 19298	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttranspired for reasons best known to himself, which put quite an
 19299	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\taltogether different complexion on the proceedings, after the moment
 19300	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbefore’s observations about boyhood days and the turf, recollecting two
 19301	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tor three private transactions of his own which the other two were as
 19302	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmutually innocent of as the babe unborn. Eventually, however, both
 19303	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttheir eyes met and as soon as it began to dawn on him that the other was
 19304	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tendeavouring to help himself to the thing he involuntarily determined
 19305	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tto help him himself and so he accordingly took hold of the neck of the
 19306	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmediumsized glass recipient which contained the fluid sought after and
 19307	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmade a capacious hole in it by pouring a lot of it out with, also at the
 19308	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsame time, however, a considerable degree of attentiveness in order not
 19309	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tto upset any of the beer that was in it about the place.
 19310	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 19311	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThe debate which ensued was in its scope and progress an epitome of the
 19312	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcourse of life. Neither place nor council was lacking in dignity. The
 19313	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdebaters were the keenest in the land, the theme they were engaged on
 19314	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe loftiest and most vital. The high hall of Horne’s house had never
 19315	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbeheld an assembly so representative and so varied nor had the
 19316	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\told rafters of that establishment ever listened to a language so
 19317	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tencyclopaedic. A gallant scene in truth it made. Crotthers was there at
 19318	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe foot of the table in his striking Highland garb, his face glowing
 19319	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfrom the briny airs of the Mull of Galloway. There too, opposite to him,
 19320	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twas Lynch whose countenance bore already the stigmata of early depravity
 19321	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand premature wisdom. Next the Scotchman was the place assigned to
 19322	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tCostello, the eccentric, while at his side was seated in stolid repose
 19323	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe squat form of Madden. The chair of the resident indeed stood vacant
 19324	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbefore the hearth but on either flank of it the figure of Bannon in
 19325	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\texplorer’s kit of tweed shorts and salted cowhide brogues contrasted
 19326	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsharply with the primrose elegance and townbred manners of Malachi
 19327	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tRoland St John Mulligan. Lastly at the head of the board was the young
 19328	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpoet who found a refuge from his labours of pedagogy and metaphysical
 19329	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tinquisition in the convivial atmosphere of Socratic discussion, while
 19330	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tto right and left of him were accommodated the flippant prognosticator,
 19331	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfresh from the hippodrome, and that vigilant wanderer, soiled by the
 19332	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdust of travel and combat and stained by the mire of an indelible
 19333	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdishonour, but from whose steadfast and constant heart no lure or peril
 19334	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tor threat or degradation could ever efface the image of that voluptuous
 19335	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tloveliness which the inspired pencil of Lafayette has limned for ages
 19336	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tyet to come.
 19337	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 19338	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tIt had better be stated here and now at the outset that the perverted
 19339	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttranscendentalism to which Mr S. Dedalus’ (Div. Scep.) contentions
 19340	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twould appear to prove him pretty badly addicted runs directly counter to
 19341	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\taccepted scientific methods. Science, it cannot be too often repeated,
 19342	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdeals with tangible phenomena. The man of science like the man in the
 19343	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tstreet has to face hardheaded facts that cannot be blinked and explain
 19344	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthem as best he can. There may be, it is true, some questions which
 19345	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tscience cannot answer—at present—such as the first problem submitted
 19346	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tby Mr L. Bloom (Pubb. Canv.) regarding the future determination of sex.
 19347	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMust we accept the view of Empedocles of Trinacria that the right ovary
 19348	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(the postmenstrual period, assert others) is responsible for the birth
 19349	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof males or are the too long neglected spermatozoa or nemasperms the
 19350	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdifferentiating factors or is it, as most embryologists incline to
 19351	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\topine, such as Culpepper, Spallanzani, Blumenbach, Lusk, Hertwig,
 19352	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tLeopold and Valenti, a mixture of both? This would be tantamount to
 19353	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ta cooperation (one of nature’s favourite devices) between the nisus
 19354	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tformativus of the nemasperm on the one hand and on the other a happily
 19355	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tchosen position, succubitus felix, of the passive element. The other
 19356	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tproblem raised by the same inquirer is scarcely less vital: infant
 19357	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmortality. It is interesting because, as he pertinently remarks, we
 19358	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tare all born in the same way but we all die in different ways. Mr M.
 19359	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMulligan (Hyg. et Eug. Doc.) blames the sanitary conditions in which
 19360	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tour greylunged citizens contract adenoids, pulmonary complaints etc. by
 19361	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tinhaling the bacteria which lurk in dust. These factors, he alleged,
 19362	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand the revolting spectacles offered by our streets, hideous publicity
 19363	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tposters, religious ministers of all denominations, mutilated soldiers
 19364	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand sailors, exposed scorbutic cardrivers, the suspended carcases of
 19365	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdead animals, paranoic bachelors and unfructified duennas—these, he
 19366	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsaid, were accountable for any and every fallingoff in the calibre of
 19367	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe race. Kalipedia, he prophesied, would soon be generally adopted
 19368	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand all the graces of life, genuinely good music, agreeable literature,
 19369	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlight philosophy, instructive pictures, plastercast reproductions of
 19370	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe classical statues such as Venus and Apollo, artistic coloured
 19371	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tphotographs of prize babies, all these little attentions would enable
 19372	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tladies who were in a particular condition to pass the intervening months
 19373	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tin a most enjoyable manner. Mr J. Crotthers (Disc. Bacc.) attributes
 19374	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsome of these demises to abdominal trauma in the case of women workers
 19375	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsubjected to heavy labours in the workshop and to marital discipline in
 19376	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe home but by far the vast majority to neglect, private or official,
 19377	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tculminating in the exposure of newborn infants, the practice of criminal
 19378	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tabortion or in the atrocious crime of infanticide. Although the former
 19379	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(we are thinking of neglect) is undoubtedly only too true the case he
 19380	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcites of nurses forgetting to count the sponges in the peritoneal cavity
 19381	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tis too rare to be normative. In fact when one comes to look into it the
 19382	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twonder is that so many pregnancies and deliveries go off so well as they
 19383	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdo, all things considered and in spite of our human shortcomings which
 19384	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\toften baulk nature in her intentions. An ingenious suggestion is
 19385	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthat thrown out by Mr V. Lynch (Bacc. Arith.) that both natality and
 19386	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmortality, as well as all other phenomena of evolution, tidal movements,
 19387	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlunar phases, blood temperatures, diseases in general, everything, in
 19388	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfine, in nature’s vast workshop from the extinction of some remote sun
 19389	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tto the blossoming of one of the countless flowers which beautify our
 19390	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpublic parks is subject to a law of numeration as yet unascertained.
 19391	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tStill the plain straightforward question why a child of normally healthy
 19392	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tparents and seemingly a healthy child and properly looked after succumbs
 19393	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tunaccountably in early childhood (though other children of the same
 19394	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmarriage do not) must certainly, in the poet’s words, give us pause.
 19395	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tNature, we may rest assured, has her own good and cogent reasons for
 19396	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twhatever she does and in all probability such deaths are due to some law
 19397	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof anticipation by which organisms in which morbous germs have taken
 19398	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tup their residence (modern science has conclusively shown that only the
 19399	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tplasmic substance can be said to be immortal) tend to disappear at an
 19400	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tincreasingly earlier stage of development, an arrangement which, though
 19401	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tproductive of pain to some of our feelings (notably the maternal), is
 19402	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tnevertheless, some of us think, in the long run beneficial to the
 19403	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\trace in general in securing thereby the survival of the fittest. Mr S.
 19404	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tDedalus’ (Div. Scep.) remark (or should it be called an interruption?)
 19405	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthat an omnivorous being which can masticate, deglute, digest and
 19406	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tapparently pass through the ordinary channel with pluterperfect
 19407	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\timperturbability such multifarious aliments as cancrenous females
 19408	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\temaciated by parturition, corpulent professional gentlemen, not to speak
 19409	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof jaundiced politicians and chlorotic nuns, might possibly find gastric
 19410	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\trelief in an innocent collation of staggering bob, reveals as nought
 19411	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\telse could and in a very unsavoury light the tendency above alluded to.
 19412	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tFor the enlightenment of those who are not so intimately acquainted with
 19413	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe minutiae of the municipal abattoir as this morbidminded esthete and
 19414	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tembryo philosopher who for all his overweening bumptiousness in things
 19415	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tscientific can scarcely distinguish an acid from an alkali prides
 19416	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thimself on being, it should perhaps be stated that staggering bob in
 19417	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe vile parlance of our lowerclass licensed victuallers signifies the
 19418	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcookable and eatable flesh of a calf newly dropped from its mother. In
 19419	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ta recent public controversy with Mr L. Bloom (Pubb. Canv.) which took
 19420	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tplace in the commons’ hall of the National Maternity Hospital, 29, 30
 19421	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand 31 Holles street, of which, as is well known, Dr A. Horne (Lic. in
 19422	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMidw., F. K. Q. C. P. I.) is the able and popular master, he is reported
 19423	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tby eyewitnesses as having stated that once a woman has let the cat
 19424	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tinto the bag (an esthete’s allusion, presumably, to one of the most
 19425	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcomplicated and marvellous of all nature’s processes—the act of sexual
 19426	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcongress) she must let it out again or give it life, as he phrased it,
 19427	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tto save her own. At the risk of her own, was the telling rejoinder of
 19428	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\this interlocutor, none the less effective for the moderate and measured
 19429	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttone in which it was delivered.
 19430	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 19431	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMeanwhile the skill and patience of the physician had brought about a
 19432	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thappy accouchement. It had been a weary weary while both for patient and
 19433	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdoctor. All that surgical skill could do was done and the brave woman
 19434	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thad manfully helped. She had. She had fought the good fight and now she
 19435	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twas very very happy. Those who have passed on, who have gone before,
 19436	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tare happy too as they gaze down and smile upon the touching scene.
 19437	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tReverently look at her as she reclines there with the motherlight in
 19438	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ther eyes, that longing hunger for baby fingers (a pretty sight it is
 19439	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tto see), in the first bloom of her new motherhood, breathing a silent
 19440	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tprayer of thanksgiving to One above, the Universal Husband. And as her
 19441	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tloving eyes behold her babe she wishes only one blessing more, to have
 19442	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ther dear Doady there with her to share her joy, to lay in his arms that
 19443	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmite of God’s clay, the fruit of their lawful embraces. He is older now
 19444	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(you and I may whisper it) and a trifle stooped in the shoulders yet
 19445	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tin the whirligig of years a grave dignity has come to the conscientious
 19446	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsecond accountant of the Ulster bank, College Green branch. O Doady,
 19447	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tloved one of old, faithful lifemate now, it may never be again, that
 19448	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfaroff time of the roses! With the old shake of her pretty head she
 19449	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\trecalls those days. God! How beautiful now across the mist of years! But
 19450	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttheir children are grouped in her imagination about the bedside, hers
 19451	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand his, Charley, Mary Alice, Frederick Albert (if he had lived), Mamy,
 19452	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBudgy (Victoria Frances), Tom, Violet Constance Louisa, darling little
 19453	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBobsy (called after our famous hero of the South African war, lord Bobs
 19454	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof Waterford and Candahar) and now this last pledge of their union, a
 19455	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tPurefoy if ever there was one, with the true Purefoy nose. Young hopeful
 19456	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twill be christened Mortimer Edward after the influential third cousin of
 19457	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMr Purefoy in the Treasury Remembrancer’s office, Dublin Castle. And so
 19458	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttime wags on: but father Cronion has dealt lightly here. No, let no sigh
 19459	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbreak from that bosom, dear gentle Mina. And Doady, knock the ashes from
 19460	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tyour pipe, the seasoned briar you still fancy when the curfew rings for
 19461	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tyou (may it be the distant day!) and dout the light whereby you read
 19462	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tin the Sacred Book for the oil too has run low, and so with a tranquil
 19463	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\theart to bed, to rest. He knows and will call in His own good time. You
 19464	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttoo have fought the good fight and played loyally your man’s part. Sir,
 19465	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tto you my hand. Well done, thou good and faithful servant!
 19466	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 19467	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThere are sins or (let us call them as the world calls them) evil
 19468	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmemories which are hidden away by man in the darkest places of the heart
 19469	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbut they abide there and wait. He may suffer their memory to grow dim,
 19470	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlet them be as though they had not been and all but persuade himself
 19471	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthat they were not or at least were otherwise. Yet a chance word will
 19472	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcall them forth suddenly and they will rise up to confront him in the
 19473	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmost various circumstances, a vision or a dream, or while timbrel
 19474	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand harp soothe his senses or amid the cool silver tranquility of the
 19475	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tevening or at the feast, at midnight, when he is now filled with wine.
 19476	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tNot to insult over him will the vision come as over one that lies under
 19477	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ther wrath, not for vengeance to cut him off from the living but shrouded
 19478	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tin the piteous vesture of the past, silent, remote, reproachful.
 19479	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 19480	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThe stranger still regarded on the face before him a slow recession of
 19481	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthat false calm there, imposed, as it seemed, by habit or some studied
 19482	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttrick, upon words so embittered as to accuse in their speaker an
 19483	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tunhealthiness, a flair, for the cruder things of life. A scene
 19484	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdisengages itself in the observer’s memory, evoked, it would seem, by
 19485	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ta word of so natural a homeliness as if those days were really present
 19486	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthere (as some thought) with their immediate pleasures. A shaven space
 19487	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof lawn one soft May evening, the wellremembered grove of lilacs at

 19489	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twith much real interest in the pellets as they run slowly forward over
 19490	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe sward or collide and stop, one by its fellow, with a brief alert
 19491	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tshock. And yonder about that grey urn where the water moves at times

 19493	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tAtty, Tiny and their darker friend with I know not what of arresting in
 19494	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ther pose then, Our Lady of the Cherries, a comely brace of them pendent

 19496	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tagainst the cool ardent fruit. A lad of four or five in linseywoolsey

 19498	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe bowls are gathered and hutched) is standing on the urn secured by

 19502	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpiazzetta giving upon the flowerclose with a faint shadow of remoteness

 19504	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 19505	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMark this farther and remember. The end comes suddenly. Enter that
 19506	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tantechamber of birth where the studious are assembled and note their
 19507	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfaces. Nothing, as it seems, there of rash or violent. Quietude of
 19508	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcustody, rather, befitting their station in that house, the vigilant
 19509	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twatch of shepherds and of angels about a crib in Bethlehem of Juda long
 19510	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tago. But as before the lightning the serried stormclouds, heavy with
 19511	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpreponderant excess of moisture, in swollen masses turgidly distended,

 19515	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthunder the cloudburst pours its torrent, so and not otherwise was the
 19516	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttransformation, violent and instantaneous, upon the utterance of the

 19693	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof lonely canyon. Tuck and turn in. Schedule time. Nix for the hornies.
 19694	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tPardon? Seen him today at a runefal? Chum o’ yourn passed in his checks?
 19695	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tLudamassy! Pore piccaninnies! Thou’ll no be telling me thot, Pold veg!
 19696	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tDid ums blubble bigsplash crytears cos fren Padney was took off in black
 19697	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbag? Of all de darkies Massa Pat was verra best. I never see the like
 19698	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsince I was born. Tiens, tiens, but it is well sad, that, my faith, yes.
 19699	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tO, get, rev on a gradient one in nine. Live axle drives are souped. Lay
 19700	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tyou two to one Jenatzy licks him ruddy well hollow. Jappies? High angle
 19701	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfire, inyah! Sunk by war specials. Be worse for him, says he, nor any
 19702	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tRooshian. Time all. There’s eleven of them. Get ye gone. Forward, woozy
 19703	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twobblers! Night. Night. May Allah the Excellent One your soul this night
 19704	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tever tremendously conserve.

 19715	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBawdyhouse. We two, she said, will seek the kips where shady Mary is.
 19716	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tRighto, any old time. Laetabuntur in cubilibus suis. You coming long?

 19727	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tyanked to glory most half this planet from Frisco beach to Vladivostok.

 19891	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcresset.

 19893	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tSnakes of river fog creep slowly. From drains, clefts, cesspools,
 19894	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmiddens arise on all sides stagnant fumes. A glow leaps in the south
 19895	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbeyond the seaward reaches of the river. The navvy, staggering forward,
 19896	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcleaves the crowd and lurches towards the tramsiding. On the farther
 19897	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tside under the railway bridge Bloom appears, flushed, panting, cramming

 19899	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twindow a composite portrait shows him gallant Nelson’s image. A concave
 19900	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmirror at the side presents to him lovelorn longlost lugubru Booloohoom.
 19901	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tGrave Gladstone sees him level, Bloom for Bloom. He passes, struck
 19902	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tby the stare of truculent Wellington, but in the convex mirror grin
 19903	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tunstruck the bonham eyes and fatchuck cheekchops of Jollypoldy the
 19904	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\trixdix doldy.

 19962	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: No thoroughfare. Close shave that but cured the stitch. Must take
 19963	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tup Sandow’s exercises again. On the hands down. Insure against street
 19964	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\taccident too. The Providential. (He feels his trouser pocket.) Poor
 19965	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmamma’s panacea. Heel easily catch in track or bootlace in a cog. Day
 19966	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe wheel of the black Maria peeled off my shoe at Leonard’s corner.
 19967	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThird time is the charm. Shoe trick. Insolent driver. I ought to report
 19968	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thim. Tension makes them nervous. Might be the fellow balked me this
 19969	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmorning with that horsey woman. Same style of beauty. Quick of him all
 19970	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe same. The stiff walk. True word spoken in jest. That awful cramp in
 19971	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tLad lane. Something poisonous I ate. Emblem of luck. Why? Probably lost
 19972	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcattle. Mark of the beast. (He closes his eyes an instant.) Bit light
 19973	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tin the head. Monthly or effect of the other. Brainfogfag. That tired
 19974	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfeeling. Too much for me now. Ow!
 19975	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 19976	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(A sinister figure leans on plaited legs against O’Beirne’s wall, a
 19977	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tvisage unknown, injected with dark mercury. From under a wideleaved
 19978	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsombrero the figure regards him with evil eye.)
 19979	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 19980	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: Buenas noches, señorita Blanca, que calle es esta?
 19981	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t

 19983	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t

 19985	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tspy, sent by that fireeater.

 19999	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tby the Touring Club at Stepaside who procured that public boon? I who
 20000	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlost my way and contributed to the columns of the Irish Cyclist the
 20001	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tletter headed In darkest Stepaside. Keep, keep, keep to the right. Rags
 20002	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand bones at midnight. A fence more likely. First place murderer makes
 20003	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfor. Wash off his sins of the world.

 20191	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthis time of year. Black refracts heat. Short cut home here. Interesting

 20274	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: When you made your present choice they said it was beauty and
 20275	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe beast. I can never forgive you for that. (His clenched fist at his
 20276	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbrow.) Think what it means. All you meant to me then. (Hoarsely.) Woman,
 20277	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tit’s breaking me!
 20278	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20279	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(Denis Breen, whitetallhatted, with Wisdom Hely’s sandwichboards,
 20280	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tshuffles past them in carpet slippers, his dull beard thrust out,
 20281	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmuttering to right and left. Little Alf Bergan, cloaked in the pall of
 20282	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe ace of spades, dogs him to left and right, doubled in laughter.)

 20285	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20286	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMRS BREEN: (To Bloom.) High jinks below stairs. (She gives him the glad
 20287	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\teye.) Why didn’t you kiss the spot to make it well? You wanted to.
 20288	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20289	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: (Shocked.) Molly’s best friend! Could you?
 20290	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20291	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMRS BREEN: (Her pulpy tongue between her lips, offers a pigeon kiss.)
 20292	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHnhn. The answer is a lemon. Have you a little present for me there?
 20293	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20294	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: (Offhandedly.) Kosher. A snack for supper. The home without
 20295	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpotted meat is incomplete. I was at Leah, Mrs Bandmann Palmer. Trenchant
 20296	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\texponent of Shakespeare. Unfortunately threw away the programme.
 20297	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tRattling good place round there for pigs’ feet. Feel.

 20320	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20321	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: (Points to the navvy.) A spy. Don’t attract attention. I hate
 20322	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tstupid crowds. I am not on pleasure bent. I am in a grave predicament.
 20323	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20324	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMRS BREEN: Humbugging and deluthering as per usual with your cock and
 20325	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbull story.

 20328	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBut you must never tell. Not even Molly. I have a most particular
 20329	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\treason.

 20339	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20340	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTHE BAWD: Jewman’s melt!
 20341	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20342	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: (In an oatmeal sporting suit, a sprig of woodbine in the lapel,
 20343	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttony buff shirt, shepherd’s plaid Saint Andrew’s cross scarftie, white
 20344	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tspats, fawn dustcoat on his arm, tawny red brogues, fieldglasses in
 20345	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbandolier and a grey billycock hat.) Do you remember a long long time,
 20346	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tyears and years ago, just after Milly, Marionette we called her, was
 20347	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tweaned when we all went together to Fairyhouse races, was it?
 20348	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t

 20350	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tveil.) Leopardstown.

 20352	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: I mean, Leopardstown. And Molly won seven shillings on a three
 20353	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tyear old named Nevertell and coming home along by Foxrock in that old
 20354	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfiveseater shanderadan of a waggonette you were in your heyday then and
 20355	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tyou had on that new hat of white velours with a surround of molefur that
 20356	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMrs Hayes advised you to buy because it was marked down to nineteen and
 20357	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\televen, a bit of wire and an old rag of velveteen, and I’ll lay you what
 20358	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tyou like she did it on purpose...
 20359	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20360	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMRS BREEN: She did, of course, the cat! Don’t tell me! Nice adviser!
 20361	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20362	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: Because it didn’t suit you one quarter as well as the other ducky
 20363	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlittle tammy toque with the bird of paradise wing in it that I admired
 20364	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ton you and you honestly looked just too fetching in it though it was a
 20365	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpity to kill it, you cruel naughty creature, little mite of a thing with
 20366	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ta heart the size of a fullstop.

 20372	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthough she had her advisers or admirers, I never cared much for her
 20373	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tstyle. She was...

 20379	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe tea merchant, drove past us in a gig with his daughter, Dancer Moses
 20380	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twas her name, and the poodle in her lap bridled up and you asked me if I
 20381	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tever heard or read or knew or came across...

 20388	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlisten to a tale which their brokensnouted gaffer rasps out with raucous
 20389	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thumour. An armless pair of them flop wrestling, growling, in maimed

 20394	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tit into only into the bucket of porter that was there waiting on the

 20401	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20402	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: Coincidence too. They think it funny. Anything but that. Broad
 20403	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdaylight. Trying to walk. Lucky no woman.

 20405	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTHE LOITERERS: Jays, that’s a good one. Glauber salts. O jays, into the
 20406	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmen’s porter.

 20450	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(He staggers forward, dragging them with him. Bloom stops, at fault. The
 20451	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdog approaches, his tongue outlolling, panting.)
 20452	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20453	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: Wildgoose chase this. Disorderly houses. Lord knows where they
 20454	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tare gone. Drunks cover distance double quick. Nice mixup. Scene at
 20455	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tWestland row. Then jump in first class with third ticket. Then too far.
 20456	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTrain with engine behind. Might have taken me to Malahide or a siding
 20457	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfor the night or collision. Second drink does it. Once is a dose. What
 20458	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tam I following him for? Still, he’s the best of that lot. If I hadn’t
 20459	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\theard about Mrs Beaufoy Purefoy I wouldn’t have gone and wouldn’t have
 20460	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmet. Kismet. He’ll lose that cash. Relieving office here. Good biz for
 20461	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcheapjacks, organs. What do ye lack? Soon got, soon gone. Might have
 20462	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlost my life too with that mangongwheeltracktrolleyglarejuggernaut only
 20463	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfor presence of mind. Can’t always save you, though. If I had passed
 20464	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTruelock’s window that day two minutes later would have been shot.
 20465	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tAbsence of body. Still if bullet only went through my coat get damages
 20466	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfor shock, five hundred pounds. What was he? Kildare street club toff.
 20467	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tGod help his gamekeeper.
 20468	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
