 20470	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand a phallic design.) Odd! Molly drawing on the frosted carriagepane
 20471	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tat Kingstown. What’s that like? (Gaudy dollwomen loll in the lighted
 20472	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdoorways, in window embrasures, smoking birdseye cigarettes. The
 20473	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\todour of the sicksweet weed floats towards him in slow round ovalling
 20474	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twreaths.)
 20475	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20476	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTHE WREATHS: Sweet are the sweets. Sweets of sin.
 20477	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20478	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: My spine’s a bit limp. Go or turn? And this food? Eat it and get
 20479	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tall pigsticky. Absurd I am. Waste of money. One and eightpence too much.
 20480	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(The retriever drives a cold snivelling muzzle against his hand, wagging
 20481	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\this tail.) Strange how they take to me. Even that brute today. Better
 20482	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tspeak to him first. Like women they like rencontres. Stinks like a
 20483	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpolecat. Chacun son goût. He might be mad. Dogdays. Uncertain in his
 20484	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmovements. Good fellow! Fido! Good fellow! Garryowen! (The wolfdog
 20485	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsprawls on his back, wriggling obscenely with begging paws, his long
 20486	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tblack tongue lolling out.) Influence of his surroundings. Give and have
 20487	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdone with it. Provided nobody. (Calling encouraging words he shambles
 20488	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tback with a furtive poacher’s tread, dogged by the setter into a dark
 20489	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tstalestunk corner. He unrolls one parcel and goes to dump the crubeen
 20490	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsoftly but holds back and feels the trotter.) Sizeable for threepence.
 20491	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBut then I have it in my left hand. Calls for more effort. Why? Smaller
 20492	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfrom want of use. O, let it slide. Two and six.
 20493	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20494	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(With regret he lets the unrolled crubeen and trotter slide. The
 20495	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmastiff mauls the bundle clumsily and gluts himself with growling greed,
 20496	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcrunching the bones. Two raincaped watch approach, silent, vigilant.
 20497	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThey murmur together.)
 20498	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20499	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTHE WATCH: Bloom. Of Bloom. For Bloom. Bloom.
 20500	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20501	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(Each lays hand on Bloom’s shoulder.)
 20502	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20503	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tFIRST WATCH: Caught in the act. Commit no nuisance.
 20504	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20505	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: (Stammers.) I am doing good to others.
 20506	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20507	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(A covey of gulls, storm petrels, rises hungrily from Liffey slime with
 20508	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBanbury cakes in their beaks.)
 20509	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20510	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTHE GULLS: Kaw kave kankury kake.
 20511	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20512	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: The friend of man. Trained by kindness.
 20513	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20514	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(He points. Bob Doran, toppling from a high barstool, sways over the
 20515	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmunching spaniel.)
 20516	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20517	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBOB DORAN: Towser. Give us the paw. Give the paw.
 20518	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20519	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(The bulldog growls, his scruff standing, a gobbet of pig’s knuckle
 20520	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbetween his molars through which rabid scumspittle dribbles. Bob Doran
 20521	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfalls silently into an area.)
 20522	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20523	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tSECOND WATCH: Prevention of cruelty to animals.
 20524	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20525	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: (Enthusiastically.) A noble work! I scolded that tramdriver on
 20526	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHarold’s cross bridge for illusing the poor horse with his harness scab.
 20527	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBad French I got for my pains. Of course it was frosty and the last
 20528	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttram. All tales of circus life are highly demoralising.
 20529	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20530	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(Signor Maffei, passionpale, in liontamer’s costume with diamond studs
 20531	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tin his shirtfront, steps forward, holding a circus paperhoop, a curling
 20532	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcarriagewhip and a revolver with which he covers the gorging boarhound.)
 20533	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20534	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tSIGNOR MAFFEI: (With a sinister smile.) Ladies and gentlemen, my
 20535	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\teducated greyhound. It was I broke in the bucking broncho Ajax with my
 20536	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpatent spiked saddle for carnivores. Lash under the belly with a knotted
 20537	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthong. Block tackle and a strangling pulley will bring your lion
 20538	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tto heel, no matter how fractious, even Leo ferox there, the Libyan
 20539	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmaneater. A redhot crowbar and some liniment rubbing on the burning part
 20540	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tproduced Fritz of Amsterdam, the thinking hyena. (He glares.) I possess
 20541	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe Indian sign. The glint of my eye does it with these breastsparklers.
 20542	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(With a bewitching smile.) I now introduce Mademoiselle Ruby, the pride
 20543	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof the ring.
 20544	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20545	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tFIRST WATCH: Come. Name and address.
 20546	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20547	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: I have forgotten for the moment. Ah, yes! (He takes off his high
 20548	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tgrade hat, saluting.) Dr Bloom, Leopold, dental surgeon. You have heard
 20549	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof von Blum Pasha. Umpteen millions. Donnerwetter! Owns half Austria.
 20550	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tEgypt. Cousin.
 20551	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20552	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tFIRST WATCH: Proof.
 20553	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20554	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(A card falls from inside the leather headband of Bloom’s hat.)
 20555	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20556	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: (In red fez, cadi’s dress coat with broad green sash, wearing
 20557	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ta false badge of the Legion of Honour, picks up the card hastily and
 20558	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\toffers it.) Allow me. My club is the Junior Army and Navy. Solicitors:
 20559	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMessrs John Henry Menton, 27 Bachelor’s Walk.
 20560	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20561	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tFIRST WATCH: (Reads.) Henry Flower. No fixed abode. Unlawfully watching
 20562	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand besetting.
 20563	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20564	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tSECOND WATCH: An alibi. You are cautioned.
 20565	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20566	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: (Produces from his heartpocket a crumpled yellow flower.) This is
 20567	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe flower in question. It was given me by a man I don’t know his name.
 20568	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(Plausibly.) You know that old joke, rose of Castile. Bloom. The change
 20569	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof name. Virag. (He murmurs privately and confidentially.) We are
 20570	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tengaged you see, sergeant. Lady in the case. Love entanglement. (He
 20571	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tshoulders the second watch gently.) Dash it all. It’s a way we gallants
 20572	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thave in the navy. Uniform that does it. (He turns gravely to the first
 20573	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twatch.) Still, of course, you do get your Waterloo sometimes. Drop in
 20574	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsome evening and have a glass of old Burgundy. (To the second watch
 20575	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tgaily.) I’ll introduce you, inspector. She’s game. Do it in the shake of
 20576	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ta lamb’s tail.
 20577	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20578	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(A dark mercurialised face appears, leading a veiled figure.)
 20579	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20580	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTHE DARK MERCURY: The Castle is looking for him. He was drummed out of
 20581	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe army.
 20582	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20583	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMARTHA: (Thickveiled, a crimson halter round her neck, a copy of the
 20584	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tIrish Times in her hand, in tone of reproach, pointing.) Henry! Leopold!
 20585	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tLionel, thou lost one! Clear my name.
 20586	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20587	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tFIRST WATCH: (Sternly.) Come to the station.
 20588	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20589	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: (Scared, hats himself, steps back, then, plucking at his heart
 20590	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand lifting his right forearm on the square, he gives the sign and
 20591	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdueguard of fellowcraft.) No, no, worshipful master, light of love.
 20592	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMistaken identity. The Lyons mail. Lesurques and Dubosc. You remember
 20593	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe Childs fratricide case. We medical men. By striking him dead with
 20594	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ta hatchet. I am wrongfully accused. Better one guilty escape than
 20595	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tninetynine wrongfully condemned.
 20596	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20597	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMARTHA: (Sobbing behind her veil.) Breach of promise. My real name
 20598	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tis Peggy Griffin. He wrote to me that he was miserable. I’ll tell my
 20599	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbrother, the Bective rugger fullback, on you, heartless flirt.
 20600	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20601	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: (Behind his hand.) She’s drunk. The woman is inebriated. (He
 20602	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmurmurs vaguely the pass of Ephraim.) Shitbroleeth.
 20603	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20604	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tSECOND WATCH: (Tears in his eyes, to Bloom.) You ought to be thoroughly
 20605	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twell ashamed of yourself.
 20606	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20607	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: Gentlemen of the jury, let me explain. A pure mare’s nest. I am
 20608	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ta man misunderstood. I am being made a scapegoat of. I am a respectable
 20609	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmarried man, without a stain on my character. I live in Eccles street.
 20610	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMy wife, I am the daughter of a most distinguished commander, a gallant
 20611	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tupstanding gentleman, what do you call him, Majorgeneral Brian Tweedy,
 20612	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tone of Britain’s fighting men who helped to win our battles. Got his
 20613	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmajority for the heroic defence of Rorke’s Drift.
 20614	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20615	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tFIRST WATCH: Regiment.
 20616	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20617	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: (Turns to the gallery.) The royal Dublins, boys, the salt of the
 20618	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tearth, known the world over. I think I see some old comrades in arms
 20619	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tup there among you. The R. D. F., with our own Metropolitan police,
 20620	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tguardians of our homes, the pluckiest lads and the finest body of men,
 20621	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tas physique, in the service of our sovereign.
 20622	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20623	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tA VOICE: Turncoat! Up the Boers! Who booed Joe Chamberlain?
 20624	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20625	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: (His hand on the shoulder of the first watch.) My old dad too was
 20626	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ta J. P. I’m as staunch a Britisher as you are, sir. I fought with the
 20627	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcolours for king and country in the absentminded war under general
 20628	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tGough in the park and was disabled at Spion Kop and Bloemfontein,
 20629	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twas mentioned in dispatches. I did all a white man could. (With quiet
 20630	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfeeling.) Jim Bludso. Hold her nozzle again the bank.
 20631	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20632	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tFIRST WATCH: Profession or trade.
 20633	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20634	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: Well, I follow a literary occupation, author-journalist. In fact
 20635	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twe are just bringing out a collection of prize stories of which I am the
 20636	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tinventor, something that is an entirely new departure. I am connected
 20637	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twith the British and Irish press. If you ring up...
 20638	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20639	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(Myles Crawford strides out jerkily, a quill between his teeth. His
 20640	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tscarlet beak blazes within the aureole of his straw hat. He dangles
 20641	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ta hank of Spanish onions in one hand and holds with the other hand a
 20642	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttelephone receiver nozzle to his ear.)
 20643	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20644	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMYLES CRAWFORD: (His cock’s wattles wagging.) Hello, seventyseven
 20645	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\teightfour. Hello. Freeman’s Urinal and Weekly Arsewipe here. Paralyse
 20646	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tEurope. You which? Bluebags? Who writes? Is it Bloom?
 20647	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20648	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(Mr Philip Beaufoy, palefaced, stands in the witnessbox, in accurate
 20649	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmorning dress, outbreast pocket with peak of handkerchief showing,
 20650	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcreased lavender trousers and patent boots. He carries a large portfolio
 20651	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlabelled Matcham’s Masterstrokes.)
 20652	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20653	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBEAUFOY: (Drawls.) No, you aren’t. Not by a long shot if I know it.
 20654	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tI don’t see it, that’s all. No born gentleman, no-one with the most
 20655	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\trudimentary promptings of a gentleman would stoop to such particularly
 20656	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tloathsome conduct. One of those, my lord. A plagiarist. A soapy sneak
 20657	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmasquerading as a literateur. It’s perfectly obvious that with the most
 20658	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tinherent baseness he has cribbed some of my bestselling copy, really
 20659	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tgorgeous stuff, a perfect gem, the love passages in which are beneath
 20660	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsuspicion. The Beaufoy books of love and great possessions, with which
 20661	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tyour lordship is doubtless familiar, are a household word throughout the
 20662	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tkingdom.
 20663	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20664	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: (Murmurs with hangdog meekness glum.) That bit about the laughing
 20665	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twitch hand in hand I take exception to, if I may...
 20666	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20667	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBEAUFOY: (His lip upcurled, smiles superciliously on the court.) You
 20668	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfunny ass, you! You’re too beastly awfully weird for words! I don’t
 20669	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthink you need over excessively disincommodate yourself in that regard.
 20670	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMy literary agent Mr J. B. Pinker is in attendance. I presume, my
 20671	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlord, we shall receive the usual witnesses’ fees, shan’t we? We are
 20672	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tconsiderably out of pocket over this bally pressman johnny, this jackdaw
 20673	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof Rheims, who has not even been to a university.
 20674	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20675	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: (Indistinctly.) University of life. Bad art.
 20676	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20677	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBEAUFOY: (Shouts.) It’s a damnably foul lie, showing the moral
 20678	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\trottenness of the man! (He extends his portfolio.) We have here damning
 20679	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tevidence, the corpus delicti, my lord, a specimen of my maturer work
 20680	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdisfigured by the hallmark of the beast.
 20681	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20682	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tA VOICE FROM THE GALLERY:
 20683	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20684	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t      Moses, Moses, king of the jews,
 20685	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t      Wiped his arse in the Daily News.
 20686	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20687	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: (Bravely.) Overdrawn.
 20688	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20689	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBEAUFOY: You low cad! You ought to be ducked in the horsepond, you
 20690	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\trotter! (To the court.) Why, look at the man’s private life! Leading
 20691	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ta quadruple existence! Street angel and house devil. Not fit to be
 20692	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmentioned in mixed society! The archconspirator of the age!
 20693	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20694	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: (To the court.) And he, a bachelor, how...
 20695	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20696	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tFIRST WATCH: The King versus Bloom. Call the woman Driscoll.
 20697	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20698	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTHE CRIER: Mary Driscoll, scullerymaid!
 20699	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20700	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(Mary Driscoll, a slipshod servant girl, approaches. She has a bucket on
 20701	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe crook of her arm and a scouringbrush in her hand.)
 20702	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20703	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tSECOND WATCH: Another! Are you of the unfortunate class?
 20704	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20705	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMARY DRISCOLL: (Indignantly.) I’m not a bad one. I bear a respectable
 20706	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcharacter and was four months in my last place. I was in a situation,
 20707	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsix pounds a year and my chances with Fridays out and I had to leave
 20708	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\towing to his carryings on.
 20709	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20710	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tFIRST WATCH: What do you tax him with?
 20711	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20712	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMARY DRISCOLL: He made a certain suggestion but I thought more of myself
 20713	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tas poor as I am.
 20714	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20715	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: (In housejacket of ripplecloth, flannel trousers, heelless
 20716	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tslippers, unshaven, his hair rumpled: softly.) I treated you white.
 20717	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tI gave you mementos, smart emerald garters far above your station.
 20718	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tIncautiously I took your part when you were accused of pilfering.
 20719	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThere’s a medium in all things. Play cricket.
 20720	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20721	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMARY DRISCOLL: (Excitedly.) As God is looking down on me this night if
 20722	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tever I laid a hand to them oylsters!
 20723	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20724	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tFIRST WATCH: The offence complained of? Did something happen?
 20725	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20726	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMARY DRISCOLL: He surprised me in the rere of the premises, Your honour,
 20727	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twhen the missus was out shopping one morning with a request for a safety
 20728	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpin. He held me and I was discoloured in four places as a result. And he
 20729	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tinterfered twict with my clothing.
 20730	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20731	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: She counterassaulted.
 20732	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20733	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMARY DRISCOLL: (Scornfully.) I had more respect for the scouringbrush,
 20734	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tso I had. I remonstrated with him, Your lord, and he remarked: keep it
 20735	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tquiet.
 20736	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20737	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(General laughter.)
 20738	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20739	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tGEORGE FOTTRELL: (Clerk of the crown and peace, resonantly.) Order in
 20740	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcourt! The accused will now make a bogus statement.
 20741	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20742	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(Bloom, pleading not guilty and holding a fullblown waterlily, begins a
 20743	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlong unintelligible speech. They would hear what counsel had to say in
 20744	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\this stirring address to the grand jury. He was down and out but, though
 20745	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbranded as a black sheep, if he might say so, he meant to reform, to
 20746	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tretrieve the memory of the past in a purely sisterly way and return to
 20747	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tnature as a purely domestic animal. A sevenmonths’ child, he had been
 20748	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcarefully brought up and nurtured by an aged bedridden parent. There
 20749	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmight have been lapses of an erring father but he wanted to turn over
 20750	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ta new leaf and now, when at long last in sight of the whipping post,
 20751	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tto lead a homely life in the evening of his days, permeated by the
 20752	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\taffectionate surroundings of the heaving bosom of the family. An
 20753	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tacclimatised Britisher, he had seen that summer eve from the footplate
 20754	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof an engine cab of the Loop line railway company while the rain
 20755	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\trefrained from falling glimpses, as it were, through the windows of
 20756	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tloveful households in Dublin city and urban district of scenes truly
 20757	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\trural of happiness of the better land with Dockrell’s wallpaper at one
 20758	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand ninepence a dozen, innocent Britishborn bairns lisping prayers to
 20759	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe Sacred Infant, youthful scholars grappling with their pensums or
 20760	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmodel young ladies playing on the pianoforte or anon all with fervour
 20761	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\treciting the family rosary round the crackling Yulelog while in the
 20762	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tboreens and green lanes the colleens with their swains strolled what
 20763	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttimes the strains of the organtoned melodeon Britannia metalbound with
 20764	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfour acting stops and twelvefold bellows, a sacrifice, greatest bargain
 20765	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tever...
 20766	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20767	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(Renewed laughter. He mumbles incoherently. Reporters complain that they
 20768	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcannot hear.)
 20769	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20770	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tLONGHAND AND SHORTHAND: (Without looking up from their notebooks.)
 20771	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tLoosen his boots.
 20772	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20773	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tPROFESSOR MACHUGH: (From the presstable, coughs and calls.) Cough it up,
 20774	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tman. Get it out in bits.
 20775	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20776	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(The crossexamination proceeds re Bloom and the bucket. A large bucket.
 20777	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBloom himself. Bowel trouble. In Beaver street. Gripe, yes. Quite bad.
 20778	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tA plasterer’s bucket. By walking stifflegged. Suffered untold misery.
 20779	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tDeadly agony. About noon. Love or burgundy. Yes, some spinach. Crucial
 20780	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmoment. He did not look in the bucket. Nobody. Rather a mess. Not
 20781	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcompletely. A Titbits back number.)
 20782	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20783	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(Uproar and catcalls. Bloom in a torn frockcoat stained with whitewash,
 20784	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdinged silk hat sideways on his head, a strip of stickingplaster across
 20785	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\this nose, talks inaudibly.)
 20786	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20787	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tJ. J. O’MOLLOY: (In barrister’s grey wig and stuffgown, speaking with
 20788	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ta voice of pained protest.) This is no place for indecent levity at
 20789	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe expense of an erring mortal disguised in liquor. We are not in a
 20790	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbeargarden nor at an Oxford rag nor is this a travesty of justice. My
 20791	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tclient is an infant, a poor foreign immigrant who started scratch as
 20792	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ta stowaway and is now trying to turn an honest penny. The trumped up
 20793	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmisdemeanour was due to a momentary aberration of heredity, brought on
 20794	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tby hallucination, such familiarities as the alleged guilty occurrence
 20795	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbeing quite permitted in my client’s native place, the land of the
 20796	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tPharaoh. Prima facie, I put it to you that there was no attempt at
 20797	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcarnally knowing. Intimacy did not occur and the offence complained of
 20798	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tby Driscoll, that her virtue was solicited, was not repeated. I would
 20799	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdeal in especial with atavism. There have been cases of shipwreck and
 20800	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsomnambulism in my client’s family. If the accused could speak he could
 20801	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ta tale unfold—one of the strangest that have ever been narrated between
 20802	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe covers of a book. He himself, my lord, is a physical wreck from
 20803	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcobbler’s weak chest. His submission is that he is of Mongolian
 20804	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\textraction and irresponsible for his actions. Not all there, in fact.
 20805	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20806	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: (Barefoot, pigeonbreasted, in lascar’s vest and trousers,
 20807	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tapologetic toes turned in, opens his tiny mole’s eyes and looks about
 20808	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thim dazedly, passing a slow hand across his forehead. Then he hitches
 20809	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\this belt sailor fashion and with a shrug of oriental obeisance salutes
 20810	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe court, pointing one thumb heavenward.) Him makee velly muchee fine
 20811	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tnight. (He begins to lilt simply.)
 20812	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20813	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t     Li li poo lil chile
 20814	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t     Blingee pigfoot evly night
 20815	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t     Payee two shilly...
 20816	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20817	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(He is howled down.)
 20818	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20819	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tJ. J. O’MOLLOY: (Hotly to the populace.) This is a lonehand fight. By
 20820	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHades, I will not have any client of mine gagged and badgered in this
 20821	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfashion by a pack of curs and laughing hyenas. The Mosaic code has
 20822	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsuperseded the law of the jungle. I say it and I say it emphatically,
 20823	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twithout wishing for one moment to defeat the ends of justice, accused
 20824	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twas not accessory before the act and prosecutrix has not been tampered
 20825	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twith. The young person was treated by defendant as if she were his very
 20826	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\town daughter. (Bloom takes J. J. O’Molloy’s hand and raises it to his
 20827	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlips.) I shall call rebutting evidence to prove up to the hilt that the
 20828	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thidden hand is again at its old game. When in doubt persecute Bloom. My
 20829	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tclient, an innately bashful man, would be the last man in the world to
 20830	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdo anything ungentlemanly which injured modesty could object to or
 20831	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcast a stone at a girl who took the wrong turning when some dastard,
 20832	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tresponsible for her condition, had worked his own sweet will on her. He
 20833	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twants to go straight. I regard him as the whitest man I know. He is down
 20834	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ton his luck at present owing to the mortgaging of his extensive property
 20835	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tat Agendath Netaim in faraway Asia Minor, slides of which will now be
 20836	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tshown. (To Bloom.) I suggest that you will do the handsome thing.
 20837	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20838	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: A penny in the pound.
 20839	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20840	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(The image of the lake of Kinnereth with blurred cattle cropping in
 20841	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsilver haze is projected on the wall. Moses Dlugacz, ferreteyed albino,
 20842	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tin blue dungarees, stands up in the gallery, holding in each hand an
 20843	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\torange citron and a pork kidney.)
 20844	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20845	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tDLUGACZ: (Hoarsely.) Bleibtreustrasse, Berlin, W. 13.
 20846	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20847	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(J. J. O’Molloy steps on to a low plinth and holds the lapel of his coat
 20848	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twith solemnity. His face lengthens, grows pale and bearded, with sunken
 20849	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\teyes, the blotches of phthisis and hectic cheekbones of John F. Taylor.
 20850	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHe applies his handkerchief to his mouth and scrutinises the galloping
 20851	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttide of rosepink blood.)
 20852	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20853	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tJ. J. O’MOLLOY: (Almost voicelessly.) Excuse me. I am suffering from a
 20854	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsevere chill, have recently come from a sickbed. A few wellchosen words.
 20855	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(He assumes the avine head, foxy moustache and proboscidal eloquence of
 20856	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tSeymour Bushe.) When the angel’s book comes to be opened if aught
 20857	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthat the pensive bosom has inaugurated of soultransfigured and of
 20858	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsoultransfiguring deserves to live I say accord the prisoner at the bar
 20859	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe sacred benefit of the doubt.
 20860	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20861	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(A paper with something written on it is handed into court.)
 20862	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20863	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: (In court dress.) Can give best references. Messrs Callan,
 20864	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tColeman. Mr Wisdom Hely J. P. My old chief Joe Cuffe. Mr V. B. Dillon,
 20865	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tex lord mayor of Dublin. I have moved in the charmed circle of the
 20866	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thighest... Queens of Dublin society. (Carelessly.) I was just chatting
 20867	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthis afternoon at the viceregal lodge to my old pals, sir Robert and
 20868	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlady Ball, astronomer royal, at the levee. Sir Bob, I said...
 20869	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20870	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMRS YELVERTON BARRY: (In lowcorsaged opal balldress and elbowlength
 20871	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tivory gloves, wearing a sabletrimmed brickquilted dolman, a comb of
 20872	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbrilliants and panache of osprey in her hair.) Arrest him, constable. He
 20873	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twrote me an anonymous letter in prentice backhand when my husband was
 20874	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tin the North Riding of Tipperary on the Munster circuit, signed James
 20875	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tLovebirch. He said that he had seen from the gods my peerless globes
 20876	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tas I sat in a box of the Theatre Royal at a command performance of La
 20877	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tCigale. I deeply inflamed him, he said. He made improper overtures to me
 20878	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tto misconduct myself at half past four p.m. on the following Thursday,
 20879	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tDunsink time. He offered to send me through the post a work of fiction
 20880	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tby Monsieur Paul de Kock, entitled The Girl with the Three Pairs of
 20881	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tStays.
 20882	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20883	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMRS BELLINGHAM: (In cap and seal coney mantle, wrapped up to the
 20884	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tnose, steps out of her brougham and scans through tortoiseshell
 20885	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tquizzing-glasses which she takes from inside her huge opossum muff.)
 20886	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tAlso to me. Yes, I believe it is the same objectionable person. Because
 20887	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\the closed my carriage door outside sir Thornley Stoker’s one sleety day
 20888	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tduring the cold snap of February ninetythree when even the grid of the
 20889	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twastepipe and the ballstop in my bath cistern were frozen. Subsequently
 20890	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\the enclosed a bloom of edelweiss culled on the heights, as he said,
 20891	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tin my honour. I had it examined by a botanical expert and elicited
 20892	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe information that it was a blossom of the homegrown potato plant
 20893	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpurloined from a forcingcase of the model farm.
 20894	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20895	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMRS YELVERTON BARRY: Shame on him!
 20896	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20897	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(A crowd of sluts and ragamuffins surges forward.)
 20898	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20899	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTHE SLUTS AND RAGAMUFFINS: (Screaming.) Stop thief! Hurrah there,
 20900	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBluebeard! Three cheers for Ikey Mo!
 20901	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20902	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tSECOND WATCH: (Produces handcuffs.) Here are the darbies.
 20903	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20904	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMRS BELLINGHAM: He addressed me in several handwritings with fulsome
 20905	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcompliments as a Venus in furs and alleged profound pity for my
 20906	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfrostbound coachman Palmer while in the same breath he expressed himself
 20907	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tas envious of his earflaps and fleecy sheepskins and of his fortunate
 20908	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tproximity to my person, when standing behind my chair wearing my livery
 20909	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand the armorial bearings of the Bellingham escutcheon garnished sable,
 20910	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ta buck’s head couped or. He lauded almost extravagantly my nether
 20911	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\textremities, my swelling calves in silk hose drawn up to the limit, and
 20912	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\teulogised glowingly my other hidden treasures in priceless lace which,
 20913	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\the said, he could conjure up. He urged me (Stating that he felt it
 20914	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\this mission in life to urge me.) to defile the marriage bed, to commit
 20915	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tadultery at the earliest possible opportunity.
 20916	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20917	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTHE HONOURABLE MRS MERVYN TALBOYS: (In amazon costume, hard hat,
 20918	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tjackboots cockspurred, vermilion waistcoat, fawn musketeer gauntlets
 20919	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twith braided drums, long train held up and hunting crop with which she
 20920	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tstrikes her welt constantly.) Also me. Because he saw me on the polo
 20921	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tground of the Phoenix park at the match All Ireland versus the Rest of
 20922	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tIreland. My eyes, I know, shone divinely as I watched Captain Slogger
 20923	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tDennehy of the Inniskillings win the final chukkar on his darling cob
 20924	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tCentaur. This plebeian Don Juan observed me from behind a hackney car
 20925	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand sent me in double envelopes an obscene photograph, such as are sold
 20926	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tafter dark on Paris boulevards, insulting to any lady. I have it still.
 20927	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tIt represents a partially nude señorita, frail and lovely (his wife, as
 20928	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\the solemnly assured me, taken by him from nature), practising illicit
 20929	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tintercourse with a muscular torero, evidently a blackguard. He urged me
 20930	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tto do likewise, to misbehave, to sin with officers of the garrison. He
 20931	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\timplored me to soil his letter in an unspeakable manner, to chastise
 20932	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thim as he richly deserves, to bestride and ride him, to give him a most
 20933	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tvicious horsewhipping.
 20934	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20935	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMRS BELLINGHAM: Me too.
 20936	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20937	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMRS YELVERTON BARRY: Me too.
 20938	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20939	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(Several highly respectable Dublin ladies hold up improper letters
 20940	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\treceived from Bloom.)
 20941	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20942	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTHE HONOURABLE MRS MERVYN TALBOYS: (Stamps her jingling spurs in a
 20943	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsudden paroxysm of fury.) I will, by the God above me. I’ll scourge the
 20944	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpigeonlivered cur as long as I can stand over him. I’ll flay him alive.
 20945	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20946	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: (His eyes closing, quails expectantly.) Here? (He squirms.)
 20947	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tAgain! (He pants cringing.) I love the danger.
 20948	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20949	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTHE HONOURABLE MRS MERVYN TALBOYS: Very much so! I’ll make it hot for
 20950	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tyou. I’ll make you dance Jack Latten for that.
 20951	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20952	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMRS BELLINGHAM: Tan his breech well, the upstart! Write the stars and
 20953	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tstripes on it!
 20954	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20955	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMRS YELVERTON BARRY: Disgraceful! There’s no excuse for him! A married
 20956	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tman!
 20957	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20958	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: All these people. I meant only the spanking idea. A warm tingling
 20959	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tglow without effusion. Refined birching to stimulate the circulation.
 20960	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20961	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTHE HONOURABLE MRS MERVYN TALBOYS: (Laughs derisively.) O, did you, my
 20962	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfine fellow? Well, by the living God, you’ll get the surprise of your
 20963	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlife now, believe me, the most unmerciful hiding a man ever bargained
 20964	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfor. You have lashed the dormant tigress in my nature into fury.
 20965	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20966	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMRS BELLINGHAM: (Shakes her muff and quizzing-glasses vindictively.)
 20967	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMake him smart, Hanna dear. Give him ginger. Thrash the mongrel within
 20968	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tan inch of his life. The cat-o’-nine-tails. Geld him. Vivisect him.
 20969	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20970	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: (Shuddering, shrinking, joins his hands: with hangdog mien.) O
 20971	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcold! O shivery! It was your ambrosial beauty. Forget, forgive. Kismet.
 20972	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tLet me off this once. (He offers the other cheek.)
 20973	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20974	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMRS YELVERTON BARRY: (Severely.) Don’t do so on any account, Mrs
 20975	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTalboys! He should be soundly trounced!
 20976	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20977	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTHE HONOURABLE MRS MERVYN TALBOYS: (Unbuttoning her gauntlet violently.)
 20978	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tI’ll do no such thing. Pigdog and always was ever since he was pupped!
 20979	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTo dare address me! I’ll flog him black and blue in the public streets.
 20980	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tI’ll dig my spurs in him up to the rowel. He is a wellknown cuckold.
 20981	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(She swishes her huntingcrop savagely in the air.) Take down his
 20982	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttrousers without loss of time. Come here, sir! Quick! Ready?
 20983	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 20984	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: (Trembling, beginning to obey.) The weather has been so warm.

 21030	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tassizes the most honourable...

 21038	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tDublin of this odious pest. Scandalous! (He dons the black cap.) Let him
 21039	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbe taken, Mr Subsheriff, from the dock where he now stands and detained
 21040	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tin custody in Mountjoy prison during His Majesty’s pleasure and there be

 21065	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tGirl in the monkeyhouse. Zoo. Lewd chimpanzee. (Breathlessly.) Pelvic
 21066	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbasin. Her artless blush unmanned me. (Overcome with emotion.) I left
 21067	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe precincts. (He turns to a figure in the crowd, appealing.) Hynes,
 21068	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmay I speak to you? You know me. That three shillings you can keep. If
 21069	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tyou want a little more...
 21070	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21071	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHYNES: (Coldly.) You are a perfect stranger.
 21072	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21073	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tSECOND WATCH: (Points to the corner.) The bomb is here.
 21074	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t

 21076	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21077	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: No, no. Pig’s feet. I was at a funeral.

 21079	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tFIRST WATCH: (Draws his truncheon.) Liar!
 21080	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21081	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(The beagle lifts his snout, showing the grey scorbutic face of Paddy
 21082	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tDignam. He has gnawed all. He exhales a putrid carcasefed breath.
 21083	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHe grows to human size and shape. His dachshund coat becomes a brown
 21084	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmortuary habit. His green eye flashes bloodshot. Half of one ear, all
 21085	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe nose and both thumbs are ghouleaten.)
 21086	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21087	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tPADDY DIGNAM: (In a hollow voice.) It is true. It was my funeral. Doctor
 21088	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tFinucane pronounced life extinct when I succumbed to the disease from
 21089	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tnatural causes.
 21090	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21091	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(He lifts his mutilated ashen face moonwards and bays lugubriously.)
 21092	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21093	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: (In triumph.) You hear?
 21094	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21095	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tPADDY DIGNAM: Bloom, I am Paddy Dignam’s spirit. List, list, O list!
 21096	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21097	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: The voice is the voice of Esau.
 21098	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21099	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tSECOND WATCH: (Blesses himself.) How is that possible?
 21100	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21101	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tFIRST WATCH: It is not in the penny catechism.
 21102	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21103	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tPADDY DIGNAM: By metempsychosis. Spooks.
 21104	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21105	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tA VOICE: O rocks.
 21106	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21107	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tPADDY DIGNAM: (Earnestly.) Once I was in the employ of Mr J. H. Menton,
 21108	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsolicitor, commissioner for oaths and affidavits, of 27 Bachelor’s Walk.
 21109	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tNow I am defunct, the wall of the heart hypertrophied. Hard lines. The
 21110	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpoor wife was awfully cut up. How is she bearing it? Keep her off that
 21111	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbottle of sherry. (He looks round him.) A lamp. I must satisfy an animal
 21112	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tneed. That buttermilk didn’t agree with me.
 21113	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21114	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(The portly figure of John O’Connell, caretaker, stands forth, holding
 21115	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ta bunch of keys tied with crape. Beside him stands Father Coffey,
 21116	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tchaplain, toadbellied, wrynecked, in a surplice and bandanna nightcap,
 21117	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tholding sleepily a staff of twisted poppies.)
 21118	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21119	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tFATHER COFFEY: (Yawns, then chants with a hoarse croak.) Namine. Jacobs.
 21120	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tVobiscuits. Amen.
 21121	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21122	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tJOHN O’CONNELL: (Foghorns stormily through his megaphone.) Dignam,
 21123	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tPatrick T, deceased.
 21124	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21125	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tPADDY DIGNAM: (With pricked up ears, winces.) Overtones. (He wriggles
 21126	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tforward and places an ear to the ground.) My master’s voice!
 21127	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21128	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tJOHN O’CONNELL: Burial docket letter number U. P. eightyfive thousand.
 21129	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tField seventeen. House of Keys. Plot, one hundred and one.
 21130	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21131	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(Paddy Dignam listens with visible effort, thinking, his tail
 21132	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tstiffpointed, his ears cocked.)
 21133	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21134	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tPADDY DIGNAM: Pray for the repose of his soul.
 21135	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21136	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(He worms down through a coalhole, his brown habit trailing its tether
 21137	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tover rattling pebbles. After him toddles an obese grandfather rat on
 21138	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfungus turtle paws under a grey carapace. Dignam’s voice, muffled, is
 21139	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\theard baying under ground: Dignam’s dead and gone below. Tom Rochford,
 21140	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\trobinredbreasted, in cap and breeches, jumps from his twocolumned
 21141	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmachine.)
 21142	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21143	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTOM ROCHFORD: (A hand to his breastbone, bows.) Reuben J. A florin I
 21144	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfind him. (He fixes the manhole with a resolute stare.) My turn now on.
 21145	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tFollow me up to Carlow.
 21146	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21147	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(He executes a daredevil salmon leap in the air and is engulfed in the
 21148	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcoalhole. Two discs on the columns wobble, eyes of nought. All recedes.
 21149	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBloom plodges forward again through the sump. Kisses chirp amid
 21150	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe rifts of fog. A piano sounds. He stands before a lighted house,
 21151	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlistening. The kisses, winging from their bowers fly about him,
 21152	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttwittering, warbling, cooing.)
 21153	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21154	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTHE KISSES: (Warbling.) Leo! (Twittering.) Icky licky micky sticky for
 21155	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tLeo! (Cooing.) Coo coocoo! Yummyyum, Womwom! (Warbling.) Big comebig!
 21156	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tPirouette! Leopopold! (Twittering.) Leeolee! (Warbling.) O Leo!
 21157	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21158	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(They rustle, flutter upon his garments, alight, bright giddy flecks,
 21159	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsilvery sequins.)
 21160	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21161	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: A man’s touch. Sad music. Church music. Perhaps here.
 21162	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21163	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(Zoe Higgins, a young whore in a sapphire slip, closed with three bronze
 21164	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbuckles, a slim black velvet fillet round her throat, nods, trips down
 21165	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe steps and accosts him.)
 21166	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21167	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tZOE: Are you looking for someone? He’s inside with his friend.
 21168	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21169	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: Is this Mrs Mack’s?
 21170	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21171	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tZOE: No, eightyone. Mrs Cohen’s. You might go farther and fare worse.
 21172	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMother Slipperslapper. (Familiarly.) She’s on the job herself tonight
 21173	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twith the vet her tipster that gives her all the winners and pays for
 21174	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ther son in Oxford. Working overtime but her luck’s turned today.
 21175	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(Suspiciously.) You’re not his father, are you?
 21176	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21177	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: Not I!
 21178	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21179	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tZOE: You both in black. Has little mousey any tickles tonight?
 21180	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21181	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(His skin, alert, feels her fingertips approach. A hand glides over his
 21182	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tleft thigh.)
 21183	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21184	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tZOE: How’s the nuts?
 21185	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21186	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: Off side. Curiously they are on the right. Heavier, I suppose.
 21187	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tOne in a million my tailor, Mesias, says.
 21188	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21189	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tZOE: (In sudden alarm.) You’ve a hard chancre.
 21190	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21191	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: Not likely.
 21192	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21193	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tZOE: I feel it.
 21194	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21195	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(Her hand slides into his left trouser pocket and brings out a hard
 21196	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tblack shrivelled potato. She regards it and Bloom with dumb moist lips.)
 21197	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21198	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: A talisman. Heirloom.
 21199	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21200	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tZOE: For Zoe? For keeps? For being so nice, eh?
 21201	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21202	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(She puts the potato greedily into a pocket then links his arm, cuddling
 21203	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thim with supple warmth. He smiles uneasily. Slowly, note by note,
 21204	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\toriental music is played. He gazes in the tawny crystal of her eyes,
 21205	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tringed with kohol. His smile softens.)
 21206	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21207	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tZOE: You’ll know me the next time.
 21208	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21209	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: (Forlornly.) I never loved a dear gazelle but it was sure to...
 21210	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21211	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(Gazelles are leaping, feeding on the mountains. Near are lakes. Round
 21212	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttheir shores file shadows black of cedargroves. Aroma rises, a strong
 21213	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thairgrowth of resin. It burns, the orient, a sky of sapphire, cleft by
 21214	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe bronze flight of eagles. Under it lies the womancity, nude, white,
 21215	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tstill, cool, in luxury. A fountain murmurs among damask roses. Mammoth
 21216	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\troses murmur of scarlet winegrapes. A wine of shame, lust, blood exudes,
 21217	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tstrangely murmuring.)
 21218	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21219	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tZOE: (Murmuring singsong with the music, her odalisk lips lusciously
 21220	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsmeared with salve of swinefat and rosewater.) Schorach ani wenowach,
 21221	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbenoith Hierushaloim.
 21222	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21223	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: (Fascinated.) I thought you were of good stock by your accent.
 21224	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21225	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tZOE: And you know what thought did?
 21226	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21227	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(She bites his ear gently with little goldstopped teeth, sending on
 21228	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thim a cloying breath of stale garlic. The roses draw apart, disclose a
 21229	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsepulchre of the gold of kings and their mouldering bones.)
 21230	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21231	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: (Draws back, mechanically caressing her right bub with a flat
 21232	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tawkward hand.) Are you a Dublin girl?
 21233	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21234	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tZOE: (Catches a stray hair deftly and twists it to her coil.) No bloody
 21235	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfear. I’m English. Have you a swaggerroot?
 21236	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21237	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: (As before.) Rarely smoke, dear. Cigar now and then. Childish
 21238	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdevice. (Lewdly.) The mouth can be better engaged than with a cylinder
 21239	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof rank weed.
 21240	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21241	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tZOE: Go on. Make a stump speech out of it.
 21242	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21243	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: (In workman’s corduroy overalls, black gansy with red floating
 21244	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttie and apache cap.) Mankind is incorrigible. Sir Walter Ralegh brought
 21245	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfrom the new world that potato and that weed, the one a killer of
 21246	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpestilence by absorption, the other a poisoner of the ear, eye, heart,
 21247	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmemory, will, understanding, all. That is to say he brought the poison
 21248	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ta hundred years before another person whose name I forget brought the
 21249	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfood. Suicide. Lies. All our habits. Why, look at our public life!
 21250	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21251	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(Midnight chimes from distant steeples.)
 21252	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21253	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTHE CHIMES: Turn again, Leopold! Lord mayor of Dublin!
 21254	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21255	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: (In alderman’s gown and chain.) Electors of Arran Quay, Inns
 21256	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tQuay, Rotunda, Mountjoy and North Dock, better run a tramline, I say,
 21257	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfrom the cattlemarket to the river. That’s the music of the future.
 21258	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThat’s my programme. Cui bono? But our bucaneering Vanderdeckens in
 21259	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttheir phantom ship of finance...
 21260	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21261	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tAN ELECTOR: Three times three for our future chief magistrate!
 21262	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21263	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(The aurora borealis of the torchlight procession leaps.)
 21264	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21265	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTHE TORCHBEARERS: Hooray!
 21266	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21267	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(Several wellknown burgesses, city magnates and freemen of the city
 21268	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tshake hands with Bloom and congratulate him. Timothy Harrington, late
 21269	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthrice Lord Mayor of Dublin, imposing in mayoral scarlet, gold chain and
 21270	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twhite silk tie, confers with councillor Lorcan Sherlock, locum tenens.
 21271	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThey nod vigorously in agreement.)
 21272	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21273	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tLATE LORD MAYOR HARRINGTON: (In scarlet robe with mace, gold mayoral
 21274	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tchain and large white silk scarf.) That alderman sir Leo Bloom’s speech
 21275	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbe printed at the expense of the ratepayers. That the house in which
 21276	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\the was born be ornamented with a commemorative tablet and that the
 21277	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthoroughfare hitherto known as Cow Parlour off Cork street be henceforth
 21278	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdesignated Boulevard Bloom.
 21279	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21280	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tCOUNCILLOR LORCAN SHERLOCK: Carried unanimously.
 21281	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21282	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: (Impassionedly.) These flying Dutchmen or lying Dutchmen as
 21283	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthey recline in their upholstered poop, casting dice, what reck they?
 21284	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMachines is their cry, their chimera, their panacea. Laboursaving
 21285	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tapparatuses, supplanters, bugbears, manufactured monsters for mutual
 21286	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmurder, hideous hobgoblins produced by a horde of capitalistic lusts
 21287	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tupon our prostituted labour. The poor man starves while they are
 21288	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tgrassing their royal mountain stags or shooting peasants and phartridges
 21289	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tin their purblind pomp of pelf and power. But their reign is rover for
 21290	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\trever and ever and ev...
 21291	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21292	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(Prolonged applause. Venetian masts, maypoles and festal arches spring
 21293	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tup. A streamer bearing the legends Cead Mile Failte and Mah Ttob Melek
 21294	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tIsrael spans the street. All the windows are thronged with sightseers,
 21295	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tchiefly ladies. Along the route the regiments of the Royal Dublin
 21296	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tFusiliers, the King’s own Scottish Borderers, the Cameron Highlanders
 21297	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand the Welsh Fusiliers, standing to attention, keep back the crowd.
 21298	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBoys from High school are perched on the lampposts, telegraph poles,
 21299	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twindowsills, cornices, gutters, chimneypots, railings, rainspouts,
 21300	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twhistling and cheering. The pillar of the cloud appears. A fife and
 21301	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdrum band is heard in the distance playing the Kol Nidre. The beaters
 21302	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tapproach with imperial eagles hoisted, trailing banners and waving
 21303	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\toriental palms. The chryselephantine papal standard rises high,
 21304	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsurrounded by pennons of the civic flag. The van of the procession
 21305	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tappears headed by John Howard Parnell, city marshal, in a chessboard
 21306	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttabard, the Athlone Poursuivant and Ulster King of Arms. They are
 21307	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfollowed by the Right Honourable Joseph Hutchinson, lord mayor of
 21308	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tDublin, his lordship the lord mayor of Cork, their worships the
 21309	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmayors of Limerick, Galway, Sligo and Waterford, twentyeight Irish
 21310	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\trepresentative peers, sirdars, grandees and maharajahs bearing the cloth
 21311	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof estate, the Dublin Metropolitan Fire Brigade, the chapter of the
 21312	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsaints of finance in their plutocratic order of precedence, the bishop
 21313	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof Down and Connor, His Eminence Michael cardinal Logue, archbishop of
 21314	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tArmagh, primate of all Ireland, His Grace, the most reverend Dr William
 21315	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tAlexander, archbishop of Armagh, primate of all Ireland, the chief
 21316	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\trabbi, the presbyterian moderator, the heads of the baptist, anabaptist,
 21317	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmethodist and Moravian chapels and the honorary secretary of the society
 21318	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof friends. After them march the guilds and trades and trainbands
 21319	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twith flying colours: coopers, bird fanciers, millwrights, newspaper
 21320	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcanvassers, law scriveners, masseurs, vintners, trussmakers,
 21321	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tchimneysweeps, lard refiners, tabinet and poplin weavers, farriers,
 21322	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tItalian warehousemen, church decorators, bootjack manufacturers,
 21323	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tundertakers, silk mercers, lapidaries, salesmasters, corkcutters,
 21324	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tassessors of fire losses, dyers and cleaners, export bottlers,
 21325	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfellmongers, ticketwriters, heraldic seal engravers, horse repository
 21326	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thands, bullion brokers, cricket and archery outfitters, riddlemakers,
 21327	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tegg and potato factors, hosiers and glovers, plumbing contractors. After
 21328	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthem march gentlemen of the bedchamber, Black Rod, Deputy Garter,
 21329	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tGold Stick, the master of horse, the lord great chamberlain, the earl
 21330	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmarshal, the high constable carrying the sword of state, saint Stephen’s
 21331	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tiron crown, the chalice and bible. Four buglers on foot blow a sennet.
 21332	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBeefeaters reply, winding clarions of welcome. Under an arch of triumph
 21333	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBloom appears, bareheaded, in a crimson velvet mantle trimmed with
 21334	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\termine, bearing Saint Edward’s staff, the orb and sceptre with the dove,
 21335	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe curtana. He is seated on a milkwhite horse with long flowing crimson
 21336	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttail, richly caparisoned, with golden headstall. Wild excitement. The
 21337	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tladies from their balconies throw down rosepetals. The air is perfumed
 21338	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twith essences. The men cheer. Bloom’s boys run amid the bystanders with
 21339	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbranches of hawthorn and wrenbushes.)
 21340	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21341	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM’S BOYS:
 21342	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21343	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t     The wren, the wren,
 21344	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t     The king of all birds,
 21345	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t     Saint Stephen’s his day
 21346	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t     Was caught in the furze.
 21347	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21348	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tA BLACKSMITH: (Murmurs.) For the honour of God! And is that Bloom? He
 21349	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tscarcely looks thirtyone.
 21350	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21351	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tA PAVIOR AND FLAGGER: That’s the famous Bloom now, the world’s greatest
 21352	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\treformer. Hats off!
 21353	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21354	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(All uncover their heads. Women whisper eagerly.)
 21355	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21356	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tA MILLIONAIRESS: (Richly.) Isn’t he simply wonderful?
 21357	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21358	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tA NOBLEWOMAN: (Nobly.) All that man has seen!
 21359	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21360	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tA FEMINIST: (Masculinely.) And done!
 21361	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21362	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tA BELLHANGER: A classic face! He has the forehead of a thinker.
 21363	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21364	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(Bloom’s weather. A sunburst appears in the northwest.)
 21365	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21366	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTHE BISHOP OF DOWN AND CONNOR: I here present your undoubted
 21367	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\temperor-president and king-chairman, the most serene and potent and very
 21368	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpuissant ruler of this realm. God save Leopold the First!
 21369	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21370	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tALL: God save Leopold the First!
 21371	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21372	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: (In dalmatic and purple mantle, to the bishop of Down and Connor,
 21373	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twith dignity.) Thanks, somewhat eminent sir.
 21374	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21375	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tWILLIAM, ARCHBISHOP OF ARMAGH: (In purple stock and shovel hat.)
 21376	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tWill you to your power cause law and mercy to be executed in all your
 21377	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tjudgments in Ireland and territories thereunto belonging?
 21378	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21379	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: (Placing his right hand on his testicles, swears.) So may the
 21380	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tCreator deal with me. All this I promise to do.
 21381	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21382	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMICHAEL, ARCHBISHOP OF ARMAGH: (Pours a cruse of hairoil over Bloom’s
 21383	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thead.) Gaudium magnum annuntio vobis. Habemus carneficem. Leopold,
 21384	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tPatrick, Andrew, David, George, be thou anointed!
 21385	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21386	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(Bloom assumes a mantle of cloth of gold and puts on a ruby ring. He
 21387	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tascends and stands on the stone of destiny. The representative peers put
 21388	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ton at the same time their twentyeight crowns. Joybells ring in Christ
 21389	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tchurch, Saint Patrick’s, George’s and gay Malahide. Mirus bazaar
 21390	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfireworks go up from all sides with symbolical phallopyrotechnic
 21391	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdesigns. The peers do homage, one by one, approaching and genuflecting.)
 21392	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21393	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTHE PEERS: I do become your liege man of life and limb to earthly
 21394	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tworship.
 21395	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21396	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(Bloom holds up his right hand on which sparkles the Koh-i-Noor diamond.
 21397	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHis palfrey neighs. Immediate silence. Wireless intercontinental and
 21398	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tinterplanetary transmitters are set for reception of message.)
 21399	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21400	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: My subjects! We hereby nominate our faithful charger Copula Felix
 21401	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thereditary Grand Vizier and announce that we have this day repudiated
 21402	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tour former spouse and have bestowed our royal hand upon the princess
 21403	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tSelene, the splendour of night.
 21404	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21405	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(The former morganatic spouse of Bloom is hastily removed in the Black
 21406	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMaria. The princess Selene, in moonblue robes, a silver crescent on her
 21407	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thead, descends from a Sedan chair, borne by two giants. An outburst of
 21408	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcheering.)
 21409	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21410	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tJOHN HOWARD PARNELL: (Raises the royal standard.) Illustrious Bloom!
 21411	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tSuccessor to my famous brother!
 21412	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21413	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: (Embraces John Howard Parnell.) We thank you from our heart,
 21414	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tJohn, for this right royal welcome to green Erin, the promised land of
 21415	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tour common ancestors.
 21416	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21417	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(The freedom of the city is presented to him embodied in a charter. The
 21418	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tkeys of Dublin, crossed on a crimson cushion, are given to him. He shows
 21419	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tall that he is wearing green socks.)
 21420	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21421	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTOM KERNAN: You deserve it, your honour.
 21422	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21423	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: On this day twenty years ago we overcame the hereditary enemy at
 21424	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tLadysmith. Our howitzers and camel swivel guns played on his lines with
 21425	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttelling effect. Half a league onward! They charge! All is lost now! Do
 21426	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twe yield? No! We drive them headlong! Lo! We charge! Deploying to the
 21427	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tleft our light horse swept across the heights of Plevna and, uttering
 21428	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttheir warcry Bonafide Sabaoth, sabred the Saracen gunners to a man.
 21429	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21430	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTHE CHAPEL OF FREEMAN TYPESETTERS: Hear! Hear!
 21431	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21432	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tJOHN WYSE NOLAN: There’s the man that got away James Stephens.
 21433	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21434	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tA BLUECOAT SCHOOLBOY: Bravo!
 21435	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21436	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tAN OLD RESIDENT: You’re a credit to your country, sir, that’s what you
 21437	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tare.
 21438	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21439	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tAN APPLEWOMAN: He’s a man like Ireland wants.
 21440	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21441	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: My beloved subjects, a new era is about to dawn. I, Bloom, tell
 21442	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tyou verily it is even now at hand. Yea, on the word of a Bloom, ye shall
 21443	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tere long enter into the golden city which is to be, the new Bloomusalem
 21444	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tin the Nova Hibernia of the future.
 21445	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21446	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(Thirtytwo workmen, wearing rosettes, from all the counties of Ireland,
 21447	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tunder the guidance of Derwan the builder, construct the new Bloomusalem.
 21448	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tIt is a colossal edifice with crystal roof, built in the shape of a
 21449	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thuge pork kidney, containing forty thousand rooms. In the course of its
 21450	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\textension several buildings and monuments are demolished. Government
 21451	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\toffices are temporarily transferred to railway sheds. Numerous houses
 21452	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tare razed to the ground. The inhabitants are lodged in barrels and
 21453	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tboxes, all marked in red with the letters: L. B. Several paupers
 21454	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfall from a ladder. A part of the walls of Dublin, crowded with loyal
 21455	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsightseers, collapses.)
 21456	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21457	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTHE SIGHTSEERS: (Dying.) Morituri te salutant. (They die.)
 21458	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21459	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(A man in a brown macintosh springs up through a trapdoor. He points an
 21460	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\telongated finger at Bloom.)
 21461	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21462	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTHE MAN IN THE MACINTOSH: Don’t you believe a word he says. That man is
 21463	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tLeopold M’Intosh, the notorious fireraiser. His real name is Higgins.
 21464	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t

 21466	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21467	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(A cannonshot. The man in the macintosh disappears. Bloom with his
 21468	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsceptre strikes down poppies. The instantaneous deaths of many
 21469	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpowerful enemies, graziers, members of parliament, members of standing
 21470	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcommittees, are reported. Bloom’s bodyguard distribute Maundy money,
 21471	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcommemoration medals, loaves and fishes, temperance badges, expensive
 21472	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHenry Clay cigars, free cowbones for soup, rubber preservatives in
 21473	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsealed envelopes tied with gold thread, butter scotch, pineapple rock,
 21474	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbillets doux in the form of cocked hats, readymade suits, porringers
 21475	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof toad in the hole, bottles of Jeyes’ Fluid, purchase stamps, 40 days’
 21476	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tindulgences, spurious coins, dairyfed pork sausages, theatre passes,
 21477	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tseason tickets available for all tramlines, coupons of the royal and
 21478	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tprivileged Hungarian lottery, penny dinner counters, cheap reprints of
 21479	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe World’s Twelve Worst Books: Froggy And Fritz (politic), Care of the
 21480	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBaby (infantilic), 50 Meals for 7/6 (culinic), Was Jesus a Sun Myth?

 21482	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tUniverse (cosmic), Let’s All Chortle (hilaric), Canvasser’s Vade Mecum

 21484	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tSpace (astric), Songs that Reached Our Heart (melodic), Pennywise’s Way

 21486	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tto touch the hem of Bloom’s robe. The lady Gwendolen Dubedat bursts
 21487	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthrough the throng, leaps on his horse and kisses him on both cheeks

 21504	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfriends! (He plays pussy fourcorners with ragged boys and girls.)

 21506	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twouldyousetashoe? (He performs juggler’s tricks, draws red, orange,
 21507	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tyellow, green, blue, indigo and violet silk handkerchiefs from his
 21508	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmouth.) Roygbiv. 32 feet per second. (He consoles a widow.) Absence
 21509	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmakes the heart grow younger. (He dances the Highland fling with
 21510	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tgrotesque antics.) Leg it, ye devils! (He kisses the bedsores of a

 21513	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlaughs kindly.) Ah, naughty, naughty! (He eats a raw turnip offered
 21514	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thim by Maurice Butterly, farmer.) Fine! Splendid! (He refuses to accept
 21515	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthree shillings offered him by Joseph Hynes, journalist.) My dear
 21516	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfellow, not at all! (He gives his coat to a beggar.) Please accept. (He
 21517	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttakes part in a stomach race with elderly male and female cripples.)

 21583	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof stout for the missus.

 21586	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpresents.
 21587	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t

 21590	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: (Solemnly.) You call it a festivity. I call it a sacrament.
 21591	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21592	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tALEXANDER KEYES: When will we have our own house of keys?
 21593	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21594	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: I stand for the reform of municipal morals and the plain ten
 21595	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcommandments. New worlds for old. Union of all, jew, moslem and gentile.
 21596	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThree acres and a cow for all children of nature. Saloon motor hearses.
 21597	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tCompulsory manual labour for all. All parks open to the public day and
 21598	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tnight. Electric dishscrubbers. Tuberculosis, lunacy, war and mendicancy
 21599	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmust now cease. General amnesty, weekly carnival with masked licence,
 21600	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbonuses for all, esperanto the universal language with universal
 21601	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbrotherhood. No more patriotism of barspongers and dropsical impostors.
 21602	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tFree money, free rent, free love and a free lay church in a free lay
 21603	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tstate.
 21604	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t

 21650	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tI believe in him in spite of all. I’d give my life for him, the funniest
 21651	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tman on earth.
