 21655	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTHEODORE PUREFOY: (In fishingcap and oilskin jacket.) He employs a
 21656	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmechanical device to frustrate the sacred ends of nature.
 21657	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21658	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTHE VEILED SIBYL: (Stabs herself.) My hero god! (She dies.)
 21659	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21660	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(Many most attractive and enthusiastic women also commit suicide by
 21661	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tstabbing, drowning, drinking prussic acid, aconite, arsenic, opening
 21662	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttheir veins, refusing food, casting themselves under steamrollers, from
 21663	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe top of Nelson’s Pillar, into the great vat of Guinness’s brewery,
 21664	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tasphyxiating themselves by placing their heads in gasovens, hanging
 21665	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthemselves in stylish garters, leaping from windows of different
 21666	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tstoreys.)
 21667	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21668	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tALEXANDER J DOWIE: (Violently.) Fellowchristians and antiBloomites, the
 21669	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tman called Bloom is from the roots of hell, a disgrace to christian
 21670	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmen. A fiendish libertine from his earliest years this stinking goat
 21671	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof Mendes gave precocious signs of infantile debauchery, recalling the
 21672	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcities of the plain, with a dissolute granddam. This vile hypocrite,
 21673	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbronzed with infamy, is the white bull mentioned in the Apocalypse.
 21674	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tA worshipper of the Scarlet Woman, intrigue is the very breath of his
 21675	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tnostrils. The stake faggots and the caldron of boiling oil are for him.
 21676	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tCaliban!
 21677	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21678	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTHE MOB: Lynch him! Roast him! He’s as bad as Parnell was. Mr Fox!
 21679	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21680	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(Mother Grogan throws her boot at Bloom. Several shopkeepers from upper
 21681	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand lower Dorset street throw objects of little or no commercial value,
 21682	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thambones, condensed milk tins, unsaleable cabbage, stale bread, sheep’s
 21683	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttails, odd pieces of fat.)
 21684	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21685	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: (Excitedly.) This is midsummer madness, some ghastly joke again.
 21686	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBy heaven, I am guiltless as the unsunned snow! It was my brother Henry.
 21687	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHe is my double. He lives in number 2 Dolphin’s Barn. Slander, the
 21688	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tviper, has wrongfully accused me. Fellowcountrymen, sgenl inn ban bata
 21689	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcoisde gan capall. I call on my old friend, Dr Malachi Mulligan, sex
 21690	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tspecialist, to give medical testimony on my behalf.
 21691	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21692	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tDR MULLIGAN: (In motor jerkin, green motorgoggles on his brow.) Dr
 21693	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBloom is bisexually abnormal. He has recently escaped from Dr Eustace’s
 21694	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tprivate asylum for demented gentlemen. Born out of bedlock hereditary
 21695	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tepilepsy is present, the consequence of unbridled lust. Traces of
 21696	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\telephantiasis have been discovered among his ascendants. There are
 21697	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmarked symptoms of chronic exhibitionism. Ambidexterity is also
 21698	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlatent. He is prematurely bald from selfabuse, perversely idealistic in
 21699	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tconsequence, a reformed rake, and has metal teeth. In consequence of a
 21700	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfamily complex he has temporarily lost his memory and I believe him
 21701	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tto be more sinned against than sinning. I have made a pervaginal
 21702	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\texamination and, after application of the acid test to 5427 anal,
 21703	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\taxillary, pectoral and pubic hairs, I declare him to be virgo intacta.
 21704	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21705	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(Bloom holds his high grade hat over his genital organs.)
 21706	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21707	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tDR MADDEN: Hypsospadia is also marked. In the interest of coming
 21708	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tgenerations I suggest that the parts affected should be preserved in
 21709	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tspirits of wine in the national teratological museum.
 21710	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21711	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tDR CROTTHERS: I have examined the patient’s urine. It is albuminoid.
 21712	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tSalivation is insufficient, the patellar reflex intermittent.
 21713	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21714	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tDR PUNCH COSTELLO: The fetor judaicus is most perceptible.
 21715	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21716	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tDR DIXON: (Reads a bill of health.) Professor Bloom is a finished
 21717	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\texample of the new womanly man. His moral nature is simple and lovable.
 21718	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMany have found him a dear man, a dear person. He is a rather quaint
 21719	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfellow on the whole, coy though not feebleminded in the medical sense.
 21720	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHe has written a really beautiful letter, a poem in itself, to the court
 21721	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmissionary of the Reformed Priests’ Protection Society which clears up
 21722	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\teverything. He is practically a total abstainer and I can affirm that
 21723	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\the sleeps on a straw litter and eats the most Spartan food, cold dried
 21724	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tgrocer’s peas. He wears a hairshirt of pure Irish manufacture winter and
 21725	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsummer and scourges himself every Saturday. He was, I understand, at one
 21726	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttime a firstclass misdemeanant in Glencree reformatory. Another report
 21727	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tstates that he was a very posthumous child. I appeal for clemency in the
 21728	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tname of the most sacred word our vocal organs have ever been called upon
 21729	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tto speak. He is about to have a baby.
 21730	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21731	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(General commotion and compassion. Women faint. A wealthy American makes
 21732	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ta street collection for Bloom. Gold and silver coins, blank cheques,
 21733	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbanknotes, jewels, treasury bonds, maturing bills of exchange, I. O.
 21734	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tU’s, wedding rings, watchchains, lockets, necklaces and bracelets are
 21735	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\trapidly collected.)
 21736	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21737	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: O, I so want to be a mother.
 21738	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21739	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMRS THORNTON: (In nursetender’s gown.) Embrace me tight, dear. You’ll be
 21740	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsoon over it. Tight, dear.
 21741	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21742	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(Bloom embraces her tightly and bears eight male yellow and white
 21743	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tchildren. They appear on a redcarpeted staircase adorned with expensive
 21744	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tplants. All the octuplets are handsome, with valuable metallic faces,
 21745	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twellmade, respectably dressed and wellconducted, speaking five modern
 21746	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlanguages fluently and interested in various arts and sciences. Each
 21747	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thas his name printed in legible letters on his shirtfront: Nasodoro,
 21748	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tGoldfinger, Chrysostomos, Maindorée, Silversmile, Silberselber,
 21749	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tVifargent, Panargyros. They are immediately appointed to positions of
 21750	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thigh public trust in several different countries as managing directors
 21751	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof banks, traffic managers of railways, chairmen of limited liability
 21752	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcompanies, vicechairmen of hotel syndicates.)

 21967	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(She crosses the threshold. He hesitates. She turns and, holding out her
 21968	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thands, draws him over. He hops. On the antlered rack of the hall hang
 21969	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ta man ‘s hat and waterproof. Bloom uncovers himself but, seeing them,
 21970	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfrowns, then smiles, preoccupied. A door on the return landing is flung
 21971	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\topen. A man in purple shirt and grey trousers, brownsocked, passes with
 21972	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tan ape’s gait, his bald head and goatee beard upheld, hugging a full
 21973	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twaterjugjar, his twotailed black braces dangling at heels. Averting his
 21974	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tface quickly Bloom bends to examine on the halltable the spaniel eyes
 21975	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof a running fox: then, his lifted head sniffing, follows Zoe into
 21976	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe musicroom. A shade of mauve tissuepaper dims the light of the
 21977	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tchandelier. Round and round a moth flies, colliding, escaping. The
 21978	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfloor is covered with an oilcloth mosaic of jade and azure and cinnabar
 21979	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\trhomboids. Footmarks are stamped over it in all senses, heel to heel,
 21980	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\theel to hollow, toe to toe, feet locked, a morris of shuffling feet
 21981	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twithout body phantoms, all in a scrimmage higgledypiggledy. The walls
 21982	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tare tapestried with a paper of yewfronds and clear glades. In the grate
 21983	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tis spread a screen of peacock feathers. Lynch squats crosslegged on
 21984	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe hearthrug of matted hair, his cap back to the front. With a wand he
 21985	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbeats time slowly. Kitty Ricketts, a bony pallid whore in navy costume,
 21986	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdoeskin gloves rolled back from a coral wristlet, a chain purse in
 21987	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ther hand, sits perched on the edge of the table swinging her leg and
 21988	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tglancing at herself in the gilt mirror over the mantelpiece. A tag
 21989	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof her corsetlace hangs slightly below her jacket. Lynch indicates
 21990	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmockingly the couple at the piano.)
 21991	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 21992	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tKITTY: (Coughs behind her hand.) She’s a bit imbecillic. (She signs with
 21993	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ta waggling forefinger.) Blemblem. (Lynch lifts up her skirt and white

 21995	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tyourself. (She hiccups, then bends quickly her sailor hat under which
 21996	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ther hair glows, red with henna.) O, excuse!

 22007	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(The wand in Lynch’s hand flashes: a brass poker. Stephen stands at

 22009	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\trepeats once more the series of empty fifths. Florry Talbot, a blond
 22010	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfeeble goosefat whore in a tatterdemalion gown of mildewed strawberry,
 22011	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlolls spreadeagle in the sofacorner, her limp forearm pendent over the
 22012	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbolster, listening. A heavy stye droops over her sleepy eyelid.)
 22013	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t

 22023	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tSTEPHEN: As a matter of fact it is of no importance whether Benedetto
 22024	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMarcello found it or made it. The rite is the poet’s rest. It may be an
 22025	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\told hymn to Demeter or also illustrate Cœla enarrant gloriam Domini.
 22026	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tIt is susceptible of nodes or modes as far apart as hyperphrygian and
 22027	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmixolydian and of texts so divergent as priests haihooping round David’s
 22028	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthat is Circe’s or what am I saying Ceres’ altar and David’s tip
 22029	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfrom the stable to his chief bassoonist about the alrightness of his
 22030	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\talmightiness. Mais nom de nom, that is another pair of trousers. Jetez
 22031	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tla gourme. Faut que jeunesse se passe. (He stops, points at Lynch’s cap,

 22034	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTHE CAP: (With saturnine spleen.) Bah! It is because it is. Woman’s
 22035	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\treason. Jewgreek is greekjew. Extremes meet. Death is the highest form
 22036	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof life. Bah!

 22059	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmoment. Wait a second. Damn that fellow’s noise in the street. Self

 22154	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand I am some vibrator. Joking apart and, getting down to bedrock, A.

 22278	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tgopherwood, is in walking costume and tightly staysed by her sit, I
 22279	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tshould opine. Backbone in front, so to say. Correct me but I always

 22287	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpockets of the skirt and slightly pegtop effect are devised to suggest
 22288	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbunchiness of hip. A new purchase at some monster sale for which a gull
 22289	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thas been mulcted. Meretricious finery to deceive the eye. Observe the
 22290	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tattention to details of dustspecks. Never put on you tomorrow what you
 22291	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcan wear today. Parallax! (With a nervous twitch of his head.) Did you
 22292	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thear my brain go snap? Pollysyllabax!
 22293	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22294	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: (An elbow resting in a hand, a forefinger against his cheek.) She
 22295	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tseems sad.
 22296	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22297	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tVIRAG: (Cynically, his weasel teeth bared yellow, draws down his left
 22298	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\teye with a finger and barks hoarsely.) Hoax! Beware of the flapper
 22299	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand bogus mournful. Lily of the alley. All possess bachelor’s button
 22300	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdiscovered by Rualdus Columbus. Tumble her. Columble her. Chameleon.
 22301	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(More genially.) Well then, permit me to draw your attention to item
 22302	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tnumber three. There is plenty of her visible to the naked eye. Observe
 22303	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe mass of oxygenated vegetable matter on her skull. What ho, she
 22304	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbumps! The ugly duckling of the party, longcasted and deep in keel.
 22305	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22306	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: (Regretfully.) When you come out without your gun.
 22307	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22308	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tVIRAG: We can do you all brands, mild, medium and strong. Pay your
 22309	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmoney, take your choice. How happy could you be with either...
 22310	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22311	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: With...?
 22312	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22313	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tVIRAG: (His tongue upcurling.) Lyum! Look. Her beam is broad. She is
 22314	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcoated with quite a considerable layer of fat. Obviously mammal in
 22315	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tweight of bosom you remark that she has in front well to the fore two
 22316	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tprotuberances of very respectable dimensions, inclined to fall in the
 22317	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tnoonday soupplate, while on her rere lower down are two additional
 22318	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tprotuberances, suggestive of potent rectum and tumescent for palpation,
 22319	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twhich leave nothing to be desired save compactness. Such fleshy parts
 22320	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tare the product of careful nurture. When coopfattened their livers
 22321	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\treach an elephantine size. Pellets of new bread with fennygreek and
 22322	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tgumbenjamin swamped down by potions of green tea endow them during their
 22323	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbrief existence with natural pincushions of quite colossal blubber. That
 22324	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsuits your book, eh? Fleshhotpots of Egypt to hanker after. Wallow in
 22325	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tit. Lycopodium. (His throat twitches.) Slapbang! There he goes again.
 22326	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22327	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: The stye I dislike.
 22328	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22329	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tVIRAG: (Arches his eyebrows.) Contact with a goldring, they say.
 22330	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tArgumentum ad feminam, as we said in old Rome and ancient Greece in the
 22331	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tconsulship of Diplodocus and Ichthyosauros. For the rest Eve’s sovereign
 22332	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tremedy. Not for sale. Hire only. Huguenot. (He twitches.) It is a funny
 22333	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsound. (He coughs encouragingly.) But possibly it is only a wart. I
 22334	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpresume you shall have remembered what I will have taught you on that
 22335	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thead? Wheatenmeal with honey and nutmeg.
 22336	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22337	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: (Reflecting.) Wheatenmeal with lycopodium and syllabax. This
 22338	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsearching ordeal. It has been an unusually fatiguing day, a chapter of
 22339	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\taccidents. Wait. I mean, wartsblood spreads warts, you said...
 22340	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22341	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tVIRAG: (Severely, his nose hardhumped, his side eye winking.) Stop
 22342	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttwirling your thumbs and have a good old thunk. See, you have forgotten.
 22343	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tExercise your mnemotechnic. La causa è santa. Tara. Tara. (Aside.) He
 22344	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twill surely remember.
 22345	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22346	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: Rosemary also did I understand you to say or willpower over
 22347	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tparasitic tissues. Then nay no I have an inkling. The touch of a
 22348	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdeadhand cures. Mnemo?
 22349	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22350	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tVIRAG: (Excitedly.) I say so. I say so. E’en so. Technic. (He taps his
 22351	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tparchmentroll energetically.) This book tells you how to act with all
 22352	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdescriptive particulars. Consult index for agitated fear of aconite,
 22353	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmelancholy of muriatic, priapic pulsatilla. Virag is going to talk about
 22354	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tamputation. Our old friend caustic. They must be starved. Snip off with
 22355	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thorsehair under the denned neck. But, to change the venue to the Bulgar
 22356	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand the Basque, have you made up your mind whether you like or dislike
 22357	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twomen in male habiliments? (With a dry snigger.) You intended to devote
 22358	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tan entire year to the study of the religious problem and the summer
 22359	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmonths of 1886 to square the circle and win that million. Pomegranate!
 22360	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tFrom the sublime to the ridiculous is but a step. Pyjamas, let us say?
 22361	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tOr stockingette gussetted knickers, closed? Or, put we the case,
 22362	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthose complicated combinations, camiknickers? (He crows derisively.)
 22363	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tKeekeereekee!
 22364	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22365	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(Bloom surveys uncertainly the three whores then gazes at the veiled
 22366	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmauve light, hearing the everflying moth.)
 22367	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22368	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: I wanted then to have now concluded. Nightdress was never. Hence
 22369	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthis. But tomorrow is a new day will be. Past was is today. What now is
 22370	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twill then morrow as now was be past yester.
 22371	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22372	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tVIRAG: (Prompts in a pig’s whisper.) Insects of the day spend their
 22373	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbrief existence in reiterated coition, lured by the smell of the
 22374	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tinferiorly pulchritudinous fumale possessing extendified pudendal nerve
 22375	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tin dorsal region. Pretty Poll! (His yellow parrotbeak gabbles nasally.)
 22376	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThey had a proverb in the Carpathians in or about the year five thousand
 22377	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfive hundred and fifty of our era. One tablespoonful of honey will
 22378	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tattract friend Bruin more than half a dozen barrels of first choice malt
 22379	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tvinegar. Bear’s buzz bothers bees. But of this apart. At another time we
 22380	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmay resume. We were very pleased, we others. (He coughs and, bending his
 22381	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbrow, rubs his nose thoughtfully with a scooping hand.) You shall find
 22382	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthat these night insects follow the light. An illusion for remember
 22383	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttheir complex unadjustable eye. For all these knotty points see the
 22384	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tseventeenth book of my Fundamentals of Sexology or the Love Passion
 22385	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twhich Doctor L. B. says is the book sensation of the year. Some, to
 22386	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\texample, there are again whose movements are automatic. Perceive. That
 22387	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tis his appropriate sun. Nightbird nightsun nighttown. Chase me, Charley!
 22388	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(He blows into Bloom’s ear.) Buzz!
 22389	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22390	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: Bee or bluebottle too other day butting shadow on wall dazed self
 22391	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthen me wandered dazed down shirt good job I...
 22392	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22393	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tVIRAG: (His face impassive, laughs in a rich feminine key.) Splendid!
 22394	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tSpanish fly in his fly or mustard plaster on his dibble. (He gobbles
 22395	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tgluttonously with turkey wattles.) Bubbly jock! Bubbly jock! Where are
 22396	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twe? Open Sesame! Cometh forth! (He unrolls his parchment rapidly and
 22397	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\treads, his glowworm’s nose running backwards over the letters which he
 22398	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tclaws.) Stay, good friend. I bring thee thy answer. Redbank oysters will
 22399	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tshortly be upon us. I’m the best o’cook. Those succulent bivalves may
 22400	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thelp us and the truffles of Perigord, tubers dislodged through mister
 22401	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tomnivorous porker, were unsurpassed in cases of nervous debility or
 22402	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tviragitis. Though they stink yet they sting. (He wags his head with
 22403	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcackling raillery.) Jocular. With my eyeglass in my ocular. (He
 22404	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsneezes.) Amen!
 22405	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22406	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: (Absently.) Ocularly woman’s bivalve case is worse. Always open
 22407	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsesame. The cloven sex. Why they fear vermin, creeping things. Yet Eve
 22408	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand the serpent contradicts. Not a historical fact. Obvious analogy
 22409	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tto my idea. Serpents too are gluttons for woman’s milk. Wind their way
 22410	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthrough miles of omnivorous forest to sucksucculent her breast dry. Like
 22411	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthose bubblyjocular Roman matrons one reads of in Elephantuliasis.
 22412	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22413	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tVIRAG: (His mouth projected in hard wrinkles, eyes stonily forlornly
 22414	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tclosed, psalms in outlandish monotone.) That the cows with their those
 22415	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdistended udders that they have been the the known...
 22416	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22417	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: I am going to scream. I beg your pardon. Ah? So. (He repeats.)
 22418	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tSpontaneously to seek out the saurian’s lair in order to entrust their
 22419	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tteats to his avid suction. Ant milks aphis. (Profoundly.) Instinct rules
 22420	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe world. In life. In death.

 22426	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpershon not now impediment so catastrophics mit agitation of firstclass

 22428	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tstares sideways down with dropping underjaw.) Well, well. He doth rest
 22429	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tanon. (He snaps his jaws suddenly on the air.)

 22432	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t

 22434	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t     Ever flying in the spring
 22435	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t     Round and round a ringaring.

 22437	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t     Now I do this kind of thing
 22438	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t     On the wing, on the wing!

 22460	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tSTEPHEN: (To himself.) Play with your eyes shut. Imitate pa. Filling my
 22461	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbelly with husks of swine. Too much of this. I will arise and go to my.
 22462	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tExpect this is the. Steve, thou art in a parlous way. Must visit old
 22463	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tDeasy or telegraph. Our interview of this morning has left on me a deep
 22464	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\timpression. Though our ages. Will write fully tomorrow. I’m partially
 22465	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdrunk, by the way. (He touches the keys again.) Minor chord comes now.
 22466	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tYes. Not much however.

 22484	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tPHILIP SOBER: Take a fool’s advice. All is not well. Work it out with
 22485	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe buttend of a pencil, like a good young idiot. Three pounds twelve
 22486	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tyou got, two notes, one sovereign, two crowns, if youth but knew.
 22487	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMooney’s en ville, Mooney’s sur mer, the Moira, Larchet’s, Holles street
 22488	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thospital, Burke’s. Eh? I am watching you.

 22491	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tIf I could only find out about octaves. Reduplication of personality.
 22492	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tWho was it told me his name? (His lawnmower begins to purr.) Aha, yes.
 22493	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tZoe mou sas agapo. Have a notion I was here before. When was it not
 22494	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tAtkinson his card I have somewhere. Mac Somebody. Unmack I have it. He
 22495	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttold me about, hold on, Swinburne, was it, no?
 22496	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22497	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tFLORRY: And the song?
 22498	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22499	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tSTEPHEN: Spirit is willing but the flesh is weak.
 22500	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22501	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tFLORRY: Are you out of Maynooth? You’re like someone I knew once.
 22502	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22503	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tSTEPHEN: Out of it now. (To himself.) Clever.
 22504	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t

 22506	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof grasshalms.) Clever ever. Out of it out of it. By the bye have

 22508	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\toutofitnow. Keep in condition. Do like us.
 22509	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22510	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tZOE: There was a priest down here two nights ago to do his bit of
 22511	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbusiness with his coat buttoned up. You needn’t try to hide, I says to
 22512	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thim. I know you’ve a Roman collar.
 22513	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22514	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tVIRAG: Perfectly logical from his standpoint. Fall of man. (Harshly, his
 22515	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpupils waxing.) To hell with the pope! Nothing new under the sun. I am
 22516	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe Virag who disclosed the Sex Secrets of Monks and Maidens. Why I left
 22517	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe church of Rome. Read the Priest, the Woman and the Confessional.
 22518	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tPenrose. Flipperty Jippert. (He wriggles.) Woman, undoing with sweet
 22519	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpudor her belt of rushrope, offers her allmoist yoni to man’s lingam.
 22520	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tShort time after man presents woman with pieces of jungle meat. Woman
 22521	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tshows joy and covers herself with featherskins. Man loves her yoni
 22522	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfiercely with big lingam, the stiff one. (He cries.) Coactus volui.
 22523	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThen giddy woman will run about. Strong man grapses woman’s wrist.
 22524	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tWoman squeals, bites, spucks. Man, now fierce angry, strikes woman’s
 22525	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfat yadgana. (He chases his tail.) Piffpaff! Popo! (He stops, sneezes.)
 22526	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tPchp! (He worries his butt.) Prrrrrht!
 22527	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22528	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tLYNCH: I hope you gave the good father a penance. Nine glorias for
 22529	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tshooting a bishop.
 22530	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22531	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tZOE: (Spouts walrus smoke through her nostrils.) He couldn’t get a
 22532	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tconnection. Only, you know, sensation. A dry rush.
 22533	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22534	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: Poor man!
 22535	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22536	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tZOE: (Lightly.) Only for what happened him.
 22537	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22538	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: How?
 22539	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22540	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tVIRAG: (A diabolic rictus of black luminosity contracting his visage,
 22541	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcranes his scraggy neck forward. He lifts a mooncalf nozzle and howls.)
 22542	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tVerfluchte Goim! He had a father, forty fathers. He never existed. Pig
 22543	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tGod! He had two left feet. He was Judas Iacchia, a Libyan eunuch, the
 22544	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpope’s bastard. (He leans out on tortured forepaws, elbows bent rigid,
 22545	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\this eye agonising in his flat skullneck and yelps over the mute world.)
 22546	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tA son of a whore. Apocalypse.
 22547	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22548	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tKITTY: And Mary Shortall that was in the lock with the pox she got from
 22549	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tJimmy Pidgeon in the blue caps had a child off him that couldn’t swallow
 22550	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand was smothered with the convulsions in the mattress and we all
 22551	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsubscribed for the funeral.
 22552	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22553	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tPHILIP DRUNK: (Gravely.) Qui vous a mis dans cette fichue position,

 22555	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22556	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tPHILIP SOBER: (Gaily.) C’était le sacré pigeon, Philippe.

 22558	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(Kitty unpins her hat and sets it down calmly, patting her henna hair.

 22560	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twhore’s shoulders. Lynch puts on her hat. She whips it off.)

 22568	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t

 22570	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22571	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tVIRAG: (Agueshaken, profuse yellow spawn foaming over his bony epileptic
 22572	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlips.) She sold lovephiltres, whitewax, orangeflower. Panther, the Roman
 22573	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcenturion, polluted her with his genitories. (He sticks out a flickering
 22574	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tphosphorescent scorpion tongue, his hand on his fork.) Messiah! He burst
 22575	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ther tympanum. (With gibbering baboon’s cries he jerks his hips in the
 22576	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcynical spasm.) Hik! Hek! Hak! Hok! Huk! Kok! Kuk!
 22577	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22578	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(Ben Jumbo Dollard, rubicund, musclebound, hairynostrilled, hugebearded,
 22579	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcabbageeared, shaggychested, shockmaned, fatpapped, stands forth, his
 22580	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tloins and genitals tightened into a pair of black bathing bagslops.)
 22581	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22582	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBEN DOLLARD: (Nakkering castanet bones in his huge padded paws, yodels
 22583	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tjovially in base barreltone.) When love absorbs my ardent soul.
 22584	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22585	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(The virgins Nurse Callan and Nurse Quigley burst through the
 22586	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tringkeepers and the ropes and mob him with open arms.)
 22587	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22588	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTHE VIRGINS: (Gushingly.) Big Ben! Ben my Chree!
 22589	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22590	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tA VOICE: Hold that fellow with the bad breeches.
 22591	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22592	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBEN DOLLARD: (Smites his thigh in abundant laughter.) Hold him now.
 22593	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22594	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHENRY: (Caressing on his breast a severed female head, murmurs.) Thine
 22595	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\theart, mine love. (He plucks his lutestrings.) When first I saw...
 22596	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22597	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tVIRAG: (Sloughing his skins, his multitudinous plumage moulting.) Rats!
 22598	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(He yawns, showing a coalblack throat, and closes his jaws by an upward
 22599	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpush of his parchmentroll.) After having said which I took my departure.
 22600	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tFarewell. Fare thee well. Dreck!
 22601	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22602	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(Henry Flower combs his moustache and beard rapidly with a pocketcomb
 22603	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand gives a cow’s lick to his hair. Steered by his rapier, he glides to
 22604	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe door, his wild harp slung behind him. Virag reaches the door in two
 22605	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tungainly stilthops, his tail cocked, and deftly claps sideways on the
 22606	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twall a pusyellow flybill, butting it with his head.)
 22607	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22608	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTHE FLYBILL: K. 11. Post No Bills. Strictly confidential. Dr Hy Franks.
 22609	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22610	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHENRY: All is lost now.
 22611	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22612	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(Virag unscrews his head in a trice and holds it under his arm.)
 22613	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22614	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tVIRAG’S HEAD: Quack!
 22615	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22616	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(Exeunt severally.)
 22617	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22618	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tSTEPHEN: (Over his shoulder to Zoe.) You would have preferred
 22619	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe fighting parson who founded the protestant error. But beware
 22620	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tAntisthenes, the dog sage, and the last end of Arius Heresiarchus. The
 22621	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tagony in the closet.
 22622	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22623	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tLYNCH: All one and the same God to her.
 22624	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22625	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tSTEPHEN: (Devoutly.) And sovereign Lord of all things.
 22626	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22627	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tFLORRY: (To Stephen.) I’m sure you’re a spoiled priest. Or a monk.
 22628	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22629	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tLYNCH: He is. A cardinal’s son.
 22630	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22631	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tSTEPHEN: Cardinal sin. Monks of the screw.
 22632	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22633	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(His Eminence Simon Stephen Cardinal Dedalus, Primate of all Ireland,
 22634	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tappears in the doorway, dressed in red soutane, sandals and socks. Seven
 22635	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdwarf simian acolytes, also in red, cardinal sins, uphold his train,
 22636	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpeeping under it. He wears a battered silk hat sideways on his head. His
 22637	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthumbs are stuck in his armpits and his palms outspread. Round his
 22638	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tneck hangs a rosary of corks ending on his breast in a corkscrew cross.
 22639	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tReleasing his thumbs, he invokes grace from on high with large wave
 22640	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tgestures and proclaims with bloated pomp:)
 22641	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22642	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTHE CARDINAL:
 22643	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22644	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t     Conservio lies captured
 22645	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t     He lies in the lowest dungeon
 22646	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t     With manacles and chains around his limbs
 22647	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t     Weighing upwards of three tons.
 22648	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22649	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(He looks at all for a moment, his right eye closed tight, his left
 22650	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcheek puffed out. Then, unable to repress his merriment, he rocks to and
 22651	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfro, arms akimbo, and sings with broad rollicking humour:)
 22652	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22653	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t     O, the poor little fellow
 22654	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t     Hihihihihis legs they were yellow
 22655	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t     He was plump, fat and heavy and brisk as a snake
 22656	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t     But some bloody savage
 22657	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t     To graize his white cabbage
 22658	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t     He murdered Nell Flaherty’s duckloving drake.
 22659	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22660	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(A multitude of midges swarms white over his robe. He scratches himself
 22661	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twith crossed arms at his ribs, grimacing, and exclaims:)
 22662	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22663	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tI’m suffering the agony of the damned. By the hoky fiddle, thanks be to
 22664	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tJesus those funny little chaps are not unanimous. If they were they’d
 22665	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twalk me off the face of the bloody globe.
 22666	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22667	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(His head aslant he blesses curtly with fore and middle fingers, imparts
 22668	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe Easter kiss and doubleshuffles off comically, swaying his hat from
 22669	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tside to side, shrinking quickly to the size of his trainbearers. The
 22670	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdwarf acolytes, giggling, peeping, nudging, ogling, Easterkissing,
 22671	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tzigzag behind him. His voice is heard mellow from afar, merciful male,
 22672	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmelodious:)
 22673	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22674	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t     Shall carry my heart to thee,
 22675	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t     Shall carry my heart to thee,
 22676	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t     And the breath of the balmy night
 22677	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t     Shall carry my heart to thee!
 22678	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22679	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(The trick doorhandle turns.)
 22680	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22681	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTHE DOORHANDLE: Theeee!
 22682	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22683	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tZOE: The devil is in that door.
 22684	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22685	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(A male form passes down the creaking staircase and is heard taking the
 22686	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twaterproof and hat from the rack. Bloom starts forward involuntarily
 22687	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand, half closing the door as he passes, takes the chocolate from his
 22688	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpocket and offers it nervously to Zoe.)
 22689	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22690	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tZOE: (Sniffs his hair briskly.) Hmmm! Thank your mother for the rabbits.
 22691	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tI’m very fond of what I like.
 22692	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22693	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: (Hearing a male voice in talk with the whores on the doorstep,
 22694	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpricks his ears.) If it were he? After? Or because not? Or the double
 22695	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tevent?
 22696	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22697	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tZOE: (Tears open the silverfoil.) Fingers was made before forks. (She
 22698	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbreaks off and nibbles a piece, gives a piece to Kitty Ricketts and then
 22699	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tturns kittenishly to Lynch.) No objection to French lozenges? (He nods.
 22700	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tShe taunts him.) Have it now or wait till you get it? (He opens his
 22701	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmouth, his head cocked. She whirls the prize in left circle. His head
 22702	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfollows. She whirls it back in right circle. He eyes her.) Catch!
 22703	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22704	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(She tosses a piece. With an adroit snap he catches it and bites it
 22705	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthrough with a crack.)
 22706	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22707	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tKITTY: (Chewing.) The engineer I was with at the bazaar does have lovely
 22708	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tones. Full of the best liqueurs. And the viceroy was there with his
 22709	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlady. The gas we had on the Toft’s hobbyhorses. I’m giddy still.
 22710	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22711	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: (In Svengali’s fur overcoat, with folded arms and Napoleonic
 22712	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tforelock, frowns in ventriloquial exorcism with piercing eagle glance
 22713	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttowards the door. Then rigid with left foot advanced he makes a swift
 22714	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpass with impelling fingers and gives the sign of past master, drawing
 22715	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\this right arm downwards from his left shoulder.) Go, go, go, I conjure
 22716	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tyou, whoever you are!
 22717	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22718	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(A male cough and tread are heard passing through the mist outside.
 22719	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBloom’s features relax. He places a hand in his waistcoat, posing
 22720	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcalmly. Zoe offers him chocolate.)
 22721	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22722	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: (Solemnly.) Thanks.
 22723	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22724	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tZOE: Do as you’re bid. Here!
 22725	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22726	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(A firm heelclacking tread is heard on the stairs.)
 22727	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22728	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: (Takes the chocolate.) Aphrodisiac? Tansy and pennyroyal. But I
 22729	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbought it. Vanilla calms or? Mnemo. Confused light confuses memory. Red
 22730	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tinfluences lupus. Colours affect women’s characters, any they have. This
 22731	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tblack makes me sad. Eat and be merry for tomorrow. (He eats.) Influence
 22732	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttaste too, mauve. But it is so long since I. Seems new. Aphro. That
 22733	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpriest. Must come. Better late than never. Try truffles at Andrews.
 22734	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22735	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(The door opens. Bella Cohen, a massive whoremistress, enters. She
 22736	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tis dressed in a threequarter ivory gown, fringed round the hem with
 22737	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttasselled selvedge, and cools herself flirting a black horn fan like
 22738	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMinnie Hauck in Carmen. On her left hand are wedding and keeper rings.
 22739	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHer eyes are deeply carboned. She has a sprouting moustache. Her
 22740	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tolive face is heavy, slightly sweated and fullnosed with orangetainted
 22741	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tnostrils. She has large pendant beryl eardrops.)
 22742	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22743	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBELLA: My word! I’m all of a mucksweat.
 22744	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22745	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(She glances round her at the couples. Then her eyes rest on Bloom with
 22746	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thard insistence. Her large fan winnows wind towards her heated faceneck
 22747	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand embonpoint. Her falcon eyes glitter.)
 22748	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22749	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTHE FAN: (Flirting quickly, then slowly.) Married, I see.
 22750	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22751	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: Yes. Partly, I have mislaid...
 22752	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22753	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTHE FAN: (Half opening, then closing.) And the missus is master.
 22754	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tPetticoat government.
 22755	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22756	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: (Looks down with a sheepish grin.) That is so.
 22757	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22758	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTHE FAN: (Folding together, rests against her left eardrop.) Have you
 22759	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tforgotten me?
 22760	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22761	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: Nes. Yo.
 22762	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22763	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTHE FAN: (Folded akimbo against her waist.) Is me her was you dreamed
 22764	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbefore? Was then she him you us since knew? Am all them and the same now
 22765	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twe?
 22766	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22767	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(Bella approaches, gently tapping with the fan.)
 22768	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22769	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: (Wincing.) Powerful being. In my eyes read that slumber which
 22770	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twomen love.
 22771	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22772	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTHE FAN: (Tapping.) We have met. You are mine. It is fate.
 22773	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22774	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: (Cowed.) Exuberant female. Enormously I desiderate your
 22775	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdomination. I am exhausted, abandoned, no more young. I stand, so to
 22776	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tspeak, with an unposted letter bearing the extra regulation fee before
 22777	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe too late box of the general postoffice of human life. The door
 22778	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand window open at a right angle cause a draught of thirtytwo feet per
 22779	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsecond according to the law of falling bodies. I have felt this instant
 22780	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ta twinge of sciatica in my left glutear muscle. It runs in our family.
 22781	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tPoor dear papa, a widower, was a regular barometer from it. He believed
 22782	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tin animal heat. A skin of tabby lined his winter waistcoat. Near the
 22783	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tend, remembering king David and the Sunamite, he shared his bed with
 22784	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tAthos, faithful after death. A dog’s spittle as you probably... (He
 22785	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twinces.) Ah!
 22786	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22787	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tRICHIE GOULDING: (Bagweighted, passes the door.) Mocking is catch. Best
 22788	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tvalue in Dub. Fit for a prince’s. Liver and kidney.
 22789	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22790	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTHE FAN: (Tapping.) All things end. Be mine. Now.
 22791	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22792	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: (Undecided.) All now? I should not have parted with my talisman.
 22793	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tRain, exposure at dewfall on the searocks, a peccadillo at my time of
 22794	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlife. Every phenomenon has a natural cause.
 22795	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22796	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTHE FAN: (Points downwards slowly.) You may.
 22797	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22798	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: (Looks downwards and perceives her unfastened bootlace.) We are
 22799	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tobserved.
 22800	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22801	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTHE FAN: (Points downwards quickly.) You must.
 22802	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22803	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: (With desire, with reluctance.) I can make a true black knot.
 22804	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tLearned when I served my time and worked the mail order line for
 22805	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tKellett’s. Experienced hand. Every knot says a lot. Let me. In courtesy.
 22806	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tI knelt once before today. Ah!
 22807	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22808	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(Bella raises her gown slightly and, steadying her pose, lifts to the
 22809	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tedge of a chair a plump buskined hoof and a full pastern, silksocked.
 22810	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBloom, stifflegged, aging, bends over her hoof and with gentle fingers
 22811	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdraws out and in her laces.)
 22812	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22813	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: (Murmurs lovingly.) To be a shoefitter in Manfield’s was my
 22814	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlove’s young dream, the darling joys of sweet buttonhooking, to lace
 22815	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tup crisscrossed to kneelength the dressy kid footwear satinlined, so
 22816	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tincredibly impossibly small, of Clyde Road ladies. Even their wax model
 22817	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tRaymonde I visited daily to admire her cobweb hose and stick of rhubarb
 22818	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttoe, as worn in Paris.
 22819	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22820	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTHE HOOF: Smell my hot goathide. Feel my royal weight.
 22821	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22822	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: (Crosslacing.) Too tight?
 22823	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22824	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTHE HOOF: If you bungle, Handy Andy, I’ll kick your football for you.
 22825	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22826	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: Not to lace the wrong eyelet as I did the night of the bazaar
 22827	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdance. Bad luck. Hook in wrong tache of her... person you mentioned.
 22828	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThat night she met... Now!
 22829	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22830	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(He knots the lace. Bella places her foot on the floor. Bloom raises
 22831	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\this head. Her heavy face, her eyes strike him in midbrow. His eyes grow
 22832	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdull, darker and pouched, his nose thickens.)
 22833	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22834	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: (Mumbles.) Awaiting your further orders we remain, gentlemen,...
 22835	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22836	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBELLO: (With a hard basilisk stare, in a baritone voice.) Hound of
 22837	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdishonour!
 22838	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22839	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: (Infatuated.) Empress!
 22840	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22841	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBELLO: (His heavy cheekchops sagging.) Adorer of the adulterous rump!
 22842	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22843	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: (Plaintively.) Hugeness!
 22844	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22845	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBELLO: Dungdevourer!
 22846	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22847	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: (With sinews semiflexed.) Magmagnificence!
 22848	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22849	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBELLO: Down! (He taps her on the shoulder with his fan.) Incline feet
 22850	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tforward! Slide left foot one pace back! You will fall. You are falling.
 22851	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tOn the hands down!
 22852	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22853	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: (Her eyes upturned in the sign of admiration, closing, yaps.)
 22854	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTruffles!
 22855	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22856	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(With a piercing epileptic cry she sinks on all fours, grunting,
 22857	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsnuffling, rooting at his feet: then lies, shamming dead, with eyes shut
 22858	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttight, trembling eyelids, bowed upon the ground in the attitude of most
 22859	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\texcellent master.)
 22860	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22861	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBELLO: (With bobbed hair, purple gills, fat moustache rings round his
 22862	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tshaven mouth, in mountaineer’s puttees, green silverbuttoned coat, sport
 22863	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tskirt and alpine hat with moorcock’s feather, his hands stuck deep in
 22864	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\this breeches pockets, places his heel on her neck and grinds it in.)
 22865	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tFootstool! Feel my entire weight. Bow, bondslave, before the throne of
 22866	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tyour despot’s glorious heels so glistening in their proud erectness.
 22867	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22868	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: (Enthralled, bleats.) I promise never to disobey.
 22869	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 22870	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBELLO: (Laughs loudly.) Holy smoke! You little know what’s in store for
 22871	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tyou. I’m the Tartar to settle your little lot and break you in! I’ll bet
 22872	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tKentucky cocktails all round I shame it out of you, old son. Cheek me,
 22873	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tI dare you. If you do tremble in anticipation of heel discipline to be
 22874	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tinflicted in gym costume.

 22899	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe balance of your natural life. (His forehead veins swollen, his face
 22900	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcongested.) I shall sit on your ottoman saddleback every morning after

 23117	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHandle hrim. This downy skin, these soft muscles, this tender flesh. If
 23118	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tI had only my gold piercer here! And quite easy to milk. Three newlaid
 23119	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tgallons a day. A pure stockgetter, due to lay within the hour. His
 23120	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsire’s milk record was a thousand gallons of whole milk in forty weeks.

 23143	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcurly teapot gone to or who docked it on you, cockyolly? Sing, birdy,
 23144	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsing. It’s as limp as a boy of six’s doing his pooly behind a cart. Buy
 23145	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ta bucket or sell your pump. (Loudly.) Can you do a man’s job?

 23151	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tgay young fellow! He is something like a fullgrown outdoor man. Well for
 23152	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tyou, you muff, if you had that weapon with knobs and lumps and warts all
 23153	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tover it. He shot his bolt, I can tell you! Foot to foot, knee to knee,

 23433	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ta place and no hair there either. We are stonecold and pure. We eat
 23434	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\telectric light. (She arches her body in lascivious crispation, placing
 23435	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ther forefinger in her mouth.) Spoke to me. Heard from behind. How then
 23436	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcould you...?
 23437	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23438	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: (Pawing the heather abjectly.) O, I have been a perfect pig.
 23439	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tEnemas too I have administered. One third of a pint of quassia to which
 23440	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tadd a tablespoonful of rocksalt. Up the fundament. With Hamilton Long’s
 23441	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsyringe, the ladies’ friend.
 23442	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23443	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTHE NYMPH: In my presence. The powderpuff. (She blushes and makes a
 23444	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tknee.) And the rest!
 23445	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23446	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: (Dejected.) Yes. Peccavi! I have paid homage on that living altar
 23447	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twhere the back changes name. (With sudden fervour.) For why should the
 23448	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdainty scented jewelled hand, the hand that rules...?
 23449	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23450	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(Figures wind serpenting in slow woodland pattern around the treestems,
 23451	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcooeeing.)
 23452	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23453	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTHE VOICE OF KITTY: (In the thicket.) Show us one of them cushions.
 23454	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23455	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTHE VOICE OF FLORRY: Here.
 23456	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23457	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(A grouse wings clumsily through the underwood.)
 23458	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23459	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTHE VOICE OF LYNCH: (In the thicket.) Whew! Piping hot!
 23460	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23461	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTHE VOICE OF ZOE: (From the thicket.) Came from a hot place.
 23462	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23463	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTHE VOICE OF VIRAG: (A birdchief, bluestreaked and feathered in war
 23464	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpanoply with his assegai, striding through a crackling canebrake over
 23465	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbeechmast and acorns.) Hot! Hot! Ware Sitting Bull!
 23466	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23467	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: It overpowers me. The warm impress of her warm form. Even to sit
 23468	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twhere a woman has sat, especially with divaricated thighs, as though to
 23469	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tgrant the last favours, most especially with previously well uplifted
 23470	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twhite sateen coatpans. So womanly, full. It fills me full.
 23471	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23472	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTHE WATERFALL:
 23473	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23474	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t     Phillaphulla Poulaphouca
 23475	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t     Poulaphouca Poulaphouca.
 23476	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23477	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTHE YEWS: Ssh! Sister, speak!
 23478	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23479	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTHE NYMPH: (Eyeless, in nun’s white habit, coif and hugewinged wimple,
 23480	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsoftly, with remote eyes.) Tranquilla convent. Sister Agatha. Mount
 23481	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tCarmel. The apparitions of Knock and Lourdes. No more desire. (She
 23482	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\treclines her head, sighing.) Only the ethereal. Where dreamy creamy gull
 23483	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twaves o’er the waters dull.
 23484	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23485	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(Bloom half rises. His back trouserbutton snaps.)
 23486	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23487	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTHE BUTTON: Bip!
 23488	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23489	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(Two sluts of the Coombe dance rainily by, shawled, yelling flatly.)
 23490	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23491	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTHE SLUTS:
 23492	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23493	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t     O, Leopold lost the pin of his drawers
 23494	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t     He didn’t know what to do,
 23495	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t     To keep it up,
 23496	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t     To keep it up.
 23497	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23498	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: (Coldly.) You have broken the spell. The last straw. If there
 23499	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twere only ethereal where would you all be, postulants and novices? Shy
 23500	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbut willing like an ass pissing.
 23501	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23502	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTHE YEWS: (Their silverfoil of leaves precipitating, their skinny arms
 23503	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\taging and swaying.) Deciduously!
 23504	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23505	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTHE NYMPH: (Her features hardening, gropes in the folds of her habit.)
 23506	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tSacrilege! To attempt my virtue! (A large moist stain appears on her
 23507	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\trobe.) Sully my innocence! You are not fit to touch the garment of a
 23508	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpure woman. (She clutches again in her robe.) Wait. Satan, you’ll sing
 23509	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tno more lovesongs. Amen. Amen. Amen. Amen. (She draws a poniard and,
 23510	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tclad in the sheathmail of an elected knight of nine, strikes at his
 23511	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tloins.) Nekum!
 23512	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23513	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: (Starts up, seizes her hand.) Hoy! Nebrakada! Cat o’ nine lives!
 23514	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tFair play, madam. No pruningknife. The fox and the grapes, is it?
 23515	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tWhat do you lack with your barbed wire? Crucifix not thick enough? (He
 23516	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tclutches her veil.) A holy abbot you want or Brophy, the lame gardener,
 23517	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tor the spoutless statue of the watercarrier, or good mother Alphonsus,
 23518	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\teh Reynard?
 23519	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23520	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTHE NYMPH: (With a cry flees from him unveiled, her plaster cast
 23521	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcracking, a cloud of stench escaping from the cracks.) Poli...!
 23522	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23523	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: (Calls after her.) As if you didn’t get it on the double
 23524	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tyourselves. No jerks and multiple mucosities all over you. I tried it.
 23525	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tYour strength our weakness. What’s our studfee? What will you pay on
 23526	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe nail? You fee mendancers on the Riviera, I read. (The fleeing nymph
 23527	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\traises a keen.) Eh? I have sixteen years of black slave labour behind
 23528	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tme. And would a jury give me five shillings alimony tomorrow, eh? Fool
 23529	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsomeone else, not me. (He sniffs.) Rut. Onions. Stale. Sulphur. Grease.
 23530	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23531	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(The figure of Bella Cohen stands before him.)
 23532	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23533	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBELLA: You’ll know me the next time.
 23534	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23535	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: (Composed, regards her.) Passée. Mutton dressed as lamb. Long
 23536	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tin the tooth and superfluous hair. A raw onion the last thing at night
 23537	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twould benefit your complexion. And take some double chin drill. Your
 23538	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\teyes are as vapid as the glasseyes of your stuffed fox. They have the
 23539	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdimensions of your other features, that’s all. I’m not a triple screw
 23540	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpropeller.
 23541	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23542	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBELLA: (Contemptuously.) You’re not game, in fact. (Her sowcunt barks.)
 23543	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tFbhracht!
 23544	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23545	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: (Contemptuously.) Clean your nailless middle finger first, your
 23546	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbully’s cold spunk is dripping from your cockscomb. Take a handful of
 23547	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thay and wipe yourself.
 23548	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23549	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBELLA: I know you, canvasser! Dead cod!
 23550	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23551	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: I saw him, kipkeeper! Pox and gleet vendor!
 23552	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23553	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBELLA: (Turns to the piano.) Which of you was playing the dead march
 23554	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfrom Saul?
 23555	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23556	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tZOE: Me. Mind your cornflowers. (She darts to the piano and bangs
 23557	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tchords on it with crossed arms.) The cat’s ramble through the slag. (She
 23558	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tglances back.) Eh? Who’s making love to my sweeties? (She darts back to
 23559	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe table.) What’s yours is mine and what’s mine is my own.
 23560	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23561	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(Kitty, disconcerted, coats her teeth with the silver paper. Bloom
 23562	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tapproaches Zoe.)
 23563	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23564	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: (Gently.) Give me back that potato, will you?
 23565	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23566	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tZOE: Forfeits, a fine thing and a superfine thing.
 23567	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23568	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: (With feeling.) It is nothing, but still, a relic of poor mamma.
 23569	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23570	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tZOE:
 23571	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23572	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t     Give a thing and take it back
 23573	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t     God’ll ask you where is that
 23574	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t     You’ll say you don’t know
 23575	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t     God’ll send you down below.
 23576	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23577	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: There is a memory attached to it. I should like to have it.
 23578	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23579	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tSTEPHEN: To have or not to have that is the question.
 23580	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23581	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tZOE: Here. (She hauls up a reef of her slip, revealing her bare thigh,
 23582	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand unrolls the potato from the top of her stocking.) Those that hides
 23583	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tknows where to find.
 23584	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23585	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBELLA: (Frowns.) Here. This isn’t a musical peepshow. And don’t you
 23586	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsmash that piano. Who’s paying here?
 23587	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23588	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(She goes to the pianola. Stephen fumbles in his pocket and, taking out
 23589	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ta banknote by its corner, hands it to her.)
 23590	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23591	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tSTEPHEN: (With exaggerated politeness.) This silken purse I made out
 23592	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof the sow’s ear of the public. Madam, excuse me. If you allow me. (He
 23593	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tindicates vaguely Lynch and Bloom.) We are all in the same sweepstake,
 23594	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tKinch and Lynch. Dans ce bordel où tenons nostre état.
 23595	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23596	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tLYNCH: (Calls from the hearth.) Dedalus! Give her your blessing for me.
 23597	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23598	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tSTEPHEN: (Hands Bella a coin.) Gold. She has it.
 23599	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23600	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBELLA: (Looks at the money, then at Stephen, then at Zoe, Florry and
 23601	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tKitty.) Do you want three girls? It’s ten shillings here.
 23602	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23603	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tSTEPHEN: (Delightedly.) A hundred thousand apologies. (He fumbles again
 23604	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand takes out and hands her two crowns.) Permit, brevi manu, my sight is
 23605	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsomewhat troubled.
 23606	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23607	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(Bella goes to the table to count the money while Stephen talks to
 23608	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thimself in monosyllables. Zoe bends over the table. Kitty leans over
 23609	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tZoe’s neck. Lynch gets up, rights his cap and, clasping Kitty’s waist,
 23610	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tadds his head to the group.)
 23611	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23612	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tFLORRY: (Strives heavily to rise.) Ow! My foot’s asleep. (She limps over
 23613	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tto the table. Bloom approaches.)
 23614	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23615	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBELLA, ZOE, KITTY, LYNCH, BLOOM: (Chattering and squabbling.) The
 23616	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tgentleman... ten shillings... paying for the three... allow me a
 23617	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmoment... this gentleman pays separate... who’s touching it?... ow!
 23618	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t... mind who you’re pinching... are you staying the night or a short
 23619	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttime?... who did?... you’re a liar, excuse me... the gentleman paid down
 23620	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlike a gentleman... drink... it’s long after eleven.
 23621	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23622	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tSTEPHEN: (At the pianola, making a gesture of abhorrence.) No bottles!
 23623	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tWhat, eleven? A riddle!
 23624	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23625	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tZOE: (Lifting up her pettigown and folding a half sovereign into the top
 23626	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof her stocking.) Hard earned on the flat of my back.
 23627	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23628	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tLYNCH: (Lifting Kitty from the table.) Come!
 23629	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23630	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tKITTY: Wait. (She clutches the two crowns.)
 23631	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23632	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tFLORRY: And me?
 23633	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23634	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tLYNCH: Hoopla!
 23635	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23636	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(He lifts her, carries her and bumps her down on the sofa.)
 23637	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23638	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tSTEPHEN:
 23639	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23640	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t     The fox crew, the cocks flew,
 23641	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t     The bells in heaven
 23642	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t     Were striking eleven.
 23643	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t     ‘Tis time for her poor soul
 23644	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t     To get out of heaven.
 23645	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23646	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: (Quietly lays a half sovereign on the table between Bella and
 23647	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tFlorry.) So. Allow me. (He takes up the poundnote.) Three times ten.
 23648	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tWe’re square.
 23649	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23650	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBELLA: (Admiringly.) You’re such a slyboots, old cocky. I could kiss
 23651	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tyou.
 23652	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23653	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tZOE: (Points.) Him? Deep as a drawwell. (Lynch bends Kitty back over the
 23654	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsofa and kisses her. Bloom goes with the poundnote to Stephen.)
 23655	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23656	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: This is yours.
 23657	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23658	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tSTEPHEN: How is that? Le distrait or absentminded beggar. (He fumbles
 23659	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tagain in his pocket and draws out a handful of coins. An object falls.)
 23660	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThat fell.
 23661	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23662	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: (Stooping, picks up and hands a box of matches.) This.
 23663	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23664	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tSTEPHEN: Lucifer. Thanks.
 23665	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23666	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: (Quietly.) You had better hand over that cash to me to take care
 23667	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof. Why pay more?
 23668	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23669	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tSTEPHEN: (Hands him all his coins.) Be just before you are generous.
 23670	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23671	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: I will but is it wise? (He counts.) One, seven, eleven, and five.
 23672	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tSix. Eleven. I don’t answer for what you may have lost.
 23673	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23674	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tSTEPHEN: Why striking eleven? Proparoxyton. Moment before the next
 23675	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tLessing says. Thirsty fox. (He laughs loudly.) Burying his grandmother.
 23676	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tProbably he killed her.
 23677	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23678	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: That is one pound six and eleven. One pound seven, say.
 23679	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23680	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tSTEPHEN: Doesn’t matter a rambling damn.
 23681	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23682	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: No, but...
 23683	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23684	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tSTEPHEN: (Comes to the table.) Cigarette, please. (Lynch tosses a
 23685	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcigarette from the sofa to the table.) And so Georgina Johnson is dead
 23686	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand married. (A cigarette appears on the table. Stephen looks at it.)
 23687	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tWonder. Parlour magic. Married. Hm. (He strikes a match and proceeds to
 23688	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlight the cigarette with enigmatic melancholy.)
 23689	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23690	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tLYNCH: (Watching him.) You would have a better chance of lighting it if
 23691	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tyou held the match nearer.
 23692	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23693	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tSTEPHEN: (Brings the match near his eye.) Lynx eye. Must get glasses.
 23694	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBroke them yesterday. Sixteen years ago. Distance. The eye sees all
 23695	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tflat. (He draws the match away. It goes out.) Brain thinks. Near: far.
 23696	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tIneluctable modality of the visible. (He frowns mysteriously.) Hm.
 23697	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tSphinx. The beast that has two backs at midnight. Married.
 23698	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23699	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tZOE: It was a commercial traveller married her and took her away with
 23700	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thim.
 23701	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23702	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tFLORRY: (Nods.) Mr Lambe from London.
 23703	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23704	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tSTEPHEN: Lamb of London, who takest away the sins of our world.
 23705	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23706	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tLYNCH: (Embracing Kitty on the sofa, chants deeply.) Dona nobis pacem.
 23707	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23708	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(The cigarette slips from Stephen’s fingers. Bloom picks it up and
 23709	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthrows it in the grate.)
 23710	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23711	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: Don’t smoke. You ought to eat. Cursed dog I met. (To Zoe.) You
 23712	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thave nothing?
 23713	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23714	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tZOE: Is he hungry?
 23715	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23716	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tSTEPHEN: (Extends his hand to her smiling and chants to the air of the
 23717	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbloodoath in the Dusk of the Gods.)
 23718	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23719	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t     Hangende Hunger,
 23720	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t     Fragende Frau,
 23721	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t     Macht uns alle kaputt.
 23722	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23723	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tZOE: (Tragically.) Hamlet, I am thy father’s gimlet! (She takes
 23724	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\this hand.) Blue eyes beauty I’ll read your hand. (She points to his
 23725	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tforehead.) No wit, no wrinkles. (She counts.) Two, three, Mars, that’s
 23726	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcourage. (Stephen shakes his head.) No kid.
 23727	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23728	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tLYNCH: Sheet lightning courage. The youth who could not shiver and
 23729	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tshake. (To Zoe.) Who taught you palmistry?
 23730	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23731	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tZOE: (Turns.) Ask my ballocks that I haven’t got. (To Stephen.) I see it
 23732	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tin your face. The eye, like that. (She frowns with lowered head.)
 23733	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23734	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tLYNCH: (Laughing, slaps Kitty behind twice.) Like that. Pandybat.
 23735	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23736	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(Twice loudly a pandybat cracks, the coffin of the pianola flies open,
 23737	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe bald little round jack-in-the-box head of Father Dolan springs up.)
 23738	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 23739	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tFATHER DOLAN: Any boy want flogging? Broke his glasses? Lazy idle little
 23740	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tschemer. See it in your eye.
 23741	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t

 23763	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tabruptly.) I won’t tell you what’s not good for you. Or do you want to
 23764	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tknow?

 23766	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBLOOM: (Detaches her fingers and offers his palm.) More harm than good.

 23774	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t

 23794	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tyears ago he sixteen fell off his hobbyhorse. (He winces.) Hurt my hand

 24033	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tSIMON: That’s all right. (He swoops uncertainly through the air,
 24034	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twheeling, uttering cries of heartening, on strong ponderous buzzard
 24035	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twings.) Ho, boy! Are you going to win? Hoop! Pschatt! Stable with those
 24036	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thalfcastes. Wouldn’t let them within the bawl of an ass. Head up! Keep

 24040	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 24041	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(The fronds and spaces of the wallpaper file rapidly across country.
 24042	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tA stout fox, drawn from covert, brush pointed, having buried his
 24043	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tgrandmother, runs swift for the open, brighteyed, seeking badger earth,
 24044	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tunder the leaves. The pack of staghounds follows, nose to the ground,
 24045	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsniffing their quarry, beaglebaying, burblbrbling to be blooded. Ward
 24046	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tUnion huntsmen and huntswomen live with them, hot for a kill. From Six
 24047	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMile Point, Flathouse, Nine Mile Stone follow the footpeople with knotty
 24048	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsticks, hayforks, salmongaffs, lassos, flockmasters with stockwhips,
 24049	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbearbaiters with tomtoms, toreadors with bullswords, grey negroes
 24050	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twaving torches. The crowd bawls of dicers, crown and anchor players,
 24051	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthimbleriggers, broadsmen. Crows and touts, hoarse bookies in high
 24052	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twizard hats clamour deafeningly.)
