 25161	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25162	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t— III —
 25163	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25164	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25165	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25166	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25167	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25168	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t[ 16 ]
 25169	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25170	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tPreparatory to anything else Mr Bloom brushed off the greater bulk of
 25171	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe shavings and handed Stephen the hat and ashplant and bucked him up
 25172	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tgenerally in orthodox Samaritan fashion which he very badly needed. His
 25173	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(Stephen’s) mind was not exactly what you would call wandering but a bit
 25174	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tunsteady and on his expressed desire for some beverage to drink Mr
 25175	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBloom in view of the hour it was and there being no pump of Vartry water
 25176	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tavailable for their ablutions let alone drinking purposes hit upon an
 25177	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\texpedient by suggesting, off the reel, the propriety of the cabman’s
 25178	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tshelter, as it was called, hardly a stonesthrow away near Butt bridge
 25179	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twhere they might hit upon some drinkables in the shape of a milk and
 25180	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsoda or a mineral. But how to get there was the rub. For the nonce he
 25181	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twas rather nonplussed but inasmuch as the duty plainly devolved upon him
 25182	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tto take some measures on the subject he pondered suitable ways and means
 25183	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tduring which Stephen repeatedly yawned. So far as he could see he was
 25184	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\trather pale in the face so that it occurred to him as highly advisable
 25185	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tto get a conveyance of some description which would answer in their
 25186	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthen condition, both of them being e.d.ed, particularly Stephen, always
 25187	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tassuming that there was such a thing to be found. Accordingly after a
 25188	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfew such preliminaries as brushing, in spite of his having forgotten
 25189	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tto take up his rather soapsuddy handkerchief after it had done yeoman
 25190	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tservice in the shaving line, they both walked together along Beaver
 25191	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tstreet or, more properly, lane as far as the farrier’s and the
 25192	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdistinctly fetid atmosphere of the livery stables at the corner of
 25193	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMontgomery street where they made tracks to the left from thence
 25194	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdebouching into Amiens street round by the corner of Dan Bergin’s. But
 25195	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tas he confidently anticipated there was not a sign of a Jehu plying for
 25196	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thire anywhere to be seen except a fourwheeler, probably engaged by some
 25197	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfellows inside on the spree, outside the North Star hotel and there was
 25198	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tno symptom of its budging a quarter of an inch when Mr Bloom, who was
 25199	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tanything but a professional whistler, endeavoured to hail it by emitting
 25200	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ta kind of a whistle, holding his arms arched over his head, twice.
 25201	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25202	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThis was a quandary but, bringing common sense to bear on it, evidently
 25203	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthere was nothing for it but put a good face on the matter and foot it
 25204	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twhich they accordingly did. So, bevelling around by Mullett’s and the
 25205	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tSignal House which they shortly reached, they proceeded perforce in the
 25206	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdirection of Amiens street railway terminus, Mr Bloom being handicapped
 25207	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tby the circumstance that one of the back buttons of his trousers had,
 25208	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tto vary the timehonoured adage, gone the way of all buttons though,
 25209	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tentering thoroughly into the spirit of the thing, he heroically made
 25210	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlight of the mischance. So as neither of them were particularly pressed
 25211	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfor time, as it happened, and the temperature refreshing since it
 25212	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcleared up after the recent visitation of Jupiter Pluvius, they dandered
 25213	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\talong past by where the empty vehicle was waiting without a fare or a
 25214	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tjarvey. As it so happened a Dublin United Tramways Company’s sandstrewer
 25215	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thappened to be returning and the elder man recounted to his companion
 25216	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tà propos of the incident his own truly miraculous escape of some little
 25217	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twhile back. They passed the main entrance of the Great Northern railway
 25218	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tstation, the starting point for Belfast, where of course all traffic was
 25219	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsuspended at that late hour and passing the backdoor of the morgue
 25220	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(a not very enticing locality, not to say gruesome to a degree, more
 25221	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tespecially at night) ultimately gained the Dock Tavern and in due course
 25222	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tturned into Store street, famous for its C division police station.
 25223	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBetween this point and the high at present unlit warehouses of Beresford
 25224	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tplace Stephen thought to think of Ibsen, associated with Baird’s the
 25225	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tstonecutter’s in his mind somehow in Talbot place, first turning on the
 25226	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tright, while the other who was acting as his fidus Achates inhaled with
 25227	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tinternal satisfaction the smell of James Rourke’s city bakery, situated
 25228	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tquite close to where they were, the very palatable odour indeed of
 25229	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tour daily bread, of all commodities of the public the primary and most
 25230	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tindispensable. Bread, the staff of life, earn your bread, O tell me
 25231	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twhere is fancy bread, at Rourke’s the baker’s it is said.
 25232	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25233	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tEn route to his taciturn and, not to put too fine a point on it, not
 25234	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tyet perfectly sober companion Mr Bloom who at all events was in complete
 25235	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpossession of his faculties, never more so, in fact disgustingly sober,
 25236	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tspoke a word of caution re the dangers of nighttown, women of ill fame
 25237	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand swell mobsmen, which, barely permissible once in a while though not
 25238	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tas a habitual practice, was of the nature of a regular deathtrap for
 25239	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tyoung fellows of his age particularly if they had acquired drinking
 25240	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thabits under the influence of liquor unless you knew a little jiujitsu
 25241	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfor every contingency as even a fellow on the broad of his back could
 25242	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tadminister a nasty kick if you didn’t look out. Highly providential
 25243	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twas the appearance on the scene of Corny Kelleher when Stephen was
 25244	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tblissfully unconscious but for that man in the gap turning up at the
 25245	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\televenth hour the finis might have been that he might have been a
 25246	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcandidate for the accident ward or, failing that, the bridewell and
 25247	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tan appearance in the court next day before Mr Tobias or, he being the
 25248	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsolicitor rather, old Wall, he meant to say, or Mahony which simply
 25249	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tspelt ruin for a chap when it got bruited about. The reason he mentioned
 25250	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe fact was that a lot of those policemen, whom he cordially disliked,
 25251	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twere admittedly unscrupulous in the service of the Crown and, as Mr
 25252	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBloom put it, recalling a case or two in the A division in Clanbrassil
 25253	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tstreet, prepared to swear a hole through a ten gallon pot. Never on
 25254	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe spot when wanted but in quiet parts of the city, Pembroke road for
 25255	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\texample, the guardians of the law were well in evidence, the obvious
 25256	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\treason being they were paid to protect the upper classes. Another thing
 25257	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\the commented on was equipping soldiers with firearms or sidearms of
 25258	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tany description liable to go off at any time which was tantamount to
 25259	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tinciting them against civilians should by any chance they fall out over
 25260	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tanything. You frittered away your time, he very sensibly maintained, and
 25261	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thealth and also character besides which, the squandermania of the thing,
 25262	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfast women of the demimonde ran away with a lot of £. s. d. into the
 25263	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbargain and the greatest danger of all was who you got drunk with
 25264	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthough, touching the much vexed question of stimulants, he relished a
 25265	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tglass of choice old wine in season as both nourishing and bloodmaking
 25266	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand possessing aperient virtues (notably a good burgundy which he was
 25267	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ta staunch believer in) still never beyond a certain point where he
 25268	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tinvariably drew the line as it simply led to trouble all round to say
 25269	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tnothing of your being at the tender mercy of others practically. Most
 25270	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof all he commented adversely on the desertion of Stephen by all his
 25271	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpubhunting confrères but one, a most glaring piece of ratting on the
 25272	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpart of his brother medicos under all the circs.
 25273	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25274	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—And that one was Judas, Stephen said, who up to then had said nothing
 25275	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twhatsoever of any kind.
 25276	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25277	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tDiscussing these and kindred topics they made a beeline across the back
 25278	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof the Customhouse and passed under the Loop Line bridge where a brazier
 25279	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof coke burning in front of a sentrybox or something like one attracted
 25280	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttheir rather lagging footsteps. Stephen of his own accord stopped for
 25281	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tno special reason to look at the heap of barren cobblestones and by
 25282	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe light emanating from the brazier he could just make out the darker
 25283	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfigure of the corporation watchman inside the gloom of the sentrybox. He
 25284	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbegan to remember that this had happened or had been mentioned as having
 25285	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thappened before but it cost him no small effort before he remembered
 25286	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthat he recognised in the sentry a quondam friend of his father’s,
 25287	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tGumley. To avoid a meeting he drew nearer to the pillars of the railway
 25288	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbridge.
 25289	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25290	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Someone saluted you, Mr Bloom said.
 25291	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25292	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tA figure of middle height on the prowl evidently under the arches
 25293	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsaluted again, calling:
 25294	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25295	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Night!
 25296	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25297	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tStephen of course started rather dizzily and stopped to return the
 25298	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcompliment. Mr Bloom actuated by motives of inherent delicacy inasmuch
 25299	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tas he always believed in minding his own business moved off but
 25300	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tnevertheless remained on the qui vive with just a shade of anxiety
 25301	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthough not funkyish in the least. Though unusual in the Dublin area he
 25302	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tknew that it was not by any means unknown for desperadoes who had next
 25303	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tto nothing to live on to be abroad waylaying and generally terrorising
 25304	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpeaceable pedestrians by placing a pistol at their head in some
 25305	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsecluded spot outside the city proper, famished loiterers of the
 25306	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThames embankment category they might be hanging about there or simply
 25307	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmarauders ready to decamp with whatever boodle they could in one fell
 25308	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tswoop at a moment’s notice, your money or your life, leaving you there
 25309	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tto point a moral, gagged and garrotted.
 25310	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25311	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tStephen, that is when the accosting figure came to close quarters,
 25312	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthough he was not in an over sober state himself recognised Corley’s
 25313	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbreath redolent of rotten cornjuice. Lord John Corley some called him
 25314	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand his genealogy came about in this wise. He was the eldest son of
 25315	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tinspector Corley of the G division, lately deceased, who had married
 25316	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ta certain Katherine Brophy, the daughter of a Louth farmer. His
 25317	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tgrandfather Patrick Michael Corley of New Ross had married the widow
 25318	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof a publican there whose maiden name had been Katherine (also) Talbot.
 25319	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tRumour had it (though not proved) that she descended from the house of
 25320	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe lords Talbot de Malahide in whose mansion, really an unquestionably
 25321	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfine residence of its kind and well worth seeing, her mother or aunt or
 25322	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsome relative, a woman, as the tale went, of extreme beauty, had enjoyed
 25323	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe distinction of being in service in the washkitchen. This therefore
 25324	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twas the reason why the still comparatively young though dissolute
 25325	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tman who now addressed Stephen was spoken of by some with facetious
 25326	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tproclivities as Lord John Corley.
 25327	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25328	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTaking Stephen on one side he had the customary doleful ditty to tell.
 25329	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tNot as much as a farthing to purchase a night’s lodgings. His friends
 25330	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thad all deserted him. Furthermore he had a row with Lenehan and called
 25331	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thim to Stephen a mean bloody swab with a sprinkling of a number of other
 25332	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tuncalledfor expressions. He was out of a job and implored of Stephen to
 25333	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttell him where on God’s earth he could get something, anything at all,
 25334	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tto do. No, it was the daughter of the mother in the washkitchen that
 25335	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twas fostersister to the heir of the house or else they were connected
 25336	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthrough the mother in some way, both occurrences happening at the same
 25337	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttime if the whole thing wasn’t a complete fabrication from start to
 25338	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfinish. Anyhow he was all in.
 25339	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25340	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—I wouldn’t ask you only, pursued he, on my solemn oath and God knows
 25341	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tI’m on the rocks.
 25342	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25343	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—There’ll be a job tomorrow or next day, Stephen told him, in a boys’
 25344	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tschool at Dalkey for a gentleman usher. Mr Garrett Deasy. Try it. You
 25345	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmay mention my name.
 25346	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25347	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Ah, God, Corley replied, sure I couldn’t teach in a school, man. I was
 25348	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tnever one of your bright ones, he added with a half laugh. I got stuck
 25349	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttwice in the junior at the christian brothers.
 25350	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25351	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—I have no place to sleep myself, Stephen informed him.
 25352	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25353	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tCorley at the first go-off was inclined to suspect it was something to
 25354	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdo with Stephen being fired out of his digs for bringing in a bloody
 25355	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttart off the street. There was a dosshouse in Marlborough street, Mrs
 25356	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMaloney’s, but it was only a tanner touch and full of undesirables but
 25357	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tM’Conachie told him you got a decent enough do in the Brazen Head over
 25358	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tin Winetavern street (which was distantly suggestive to the person
 25359	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\taddressed of friar Bacon) for a bob. He was starving too though he
 25360	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thadn’t said a word about it.
 25361	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25362	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThough this sort of thing went on every other night or very near it
 25363	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tstill Stephen’s feelings got the better of him in a sense though he knew
 25364	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthat Corley’s brandnew rigmarole on a par with the others was hardly
 25365	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdeserving of much credence. However haud ignarus malorum miseris
 25366	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsuccurrere disco etcetera as the Latin poet remarks especially as luck
 25367	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twould have it he got paid his screw after every middle of the month on
 25368	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe sixteenth which was the date of the month as a matter of fact though
 25369	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ta good bit of the wherewithal was demolished. But the cream of the joke
 25370	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twas nothing would get it out of Corley’s head that he was living in
 25371	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\taffluence and hadn’t a thing to do but hand out the needful. Whereas.
 25372	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHe put his hand in a pocket anyhow not with the idea of finding any food
 25373	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthere but thinking he might lend him anything up to a bob or so in lieu
 25374	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tso that he might endeavour at all events and get sufficient to eat but
 25375	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe result was in the negative for, to his chagrin, he found his cash
 25376	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmissing. A few broken biscuits were all the result of his investigation.
 25377	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHe tried his hardest to recollect for the moment whether he had lost
 25378	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tas well he might have or left because in that contingency it was not a
 25379	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpleasant lookout, very much the reverse in fact. He was altogether too
 25380	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfagged out to institute a thorough search though he tried to recollect.
 25381	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tAbout biscuits he dimly remembered. Who now exactly gave them he
 25382	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twondered or where was or did he buy. However in another pocket he came
 25383	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tacross what he surmised in the dark were pennies, erroneously however,
 25384	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tas it turned out.
 25385	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25386	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Those are halfcrowns, man, Corley corrected him.
 25387	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25388	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tAnd so in point of fact they turned out to be. Stephen anyhow lent him
 25389	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tone of them.
 25390	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25391	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Thanks, Corley answered, you’re a gentleman. I’ll pay you back one
 25392	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttime. Who’s that with you? I saw him a few times in the Bleeding Horse
 25393	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tin Camden street with Boylan, the billsticker. You might put in a good
 25394	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tword for us to get me taken on there. I’d carry a sandwichboard only
 25395	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe girl in the office told me they’re full up for the next three weeks,
 25396	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tman. God, you’ve to book ahead, man, you’d think it was for the Carl
 25397	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tRosa. I don’t give a shite anyway so long as I get a job, even as a
 25398	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcrossing sweeper.
 25399	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25400	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tSubsequently being not quite so down in the mouth after the two and six
 25401	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\the got he informed Stephen about a fellow by the name of Bags Comisky
 25402	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthat he said Stephen knew well out of Fullam’s, the shipchandler’s,
 25403	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbookkeeper there that used to be often round in Nagle’s back with O’Mara
 25404	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand a little chap with a stutter the name of Tighe. Anyhow he was lagged
 25405	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe night before last and fined ten bob for a drunk and disorderly and
 25406	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\trefusing to go with the constable.
 25407	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25408	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMr Bloom in the meanwhile kept dodging about in the vicinity of the
 25409	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcobblestones near the brazier of coke in front of the corporation
 25410	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twatchman’s sentrybox who evidently a glutton for work, it struck him,
 25411	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twas having a quiet forty winks for all intents and purposes on his own
 25412	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tprivate account while Dublin slept. He threw an odd eye at the same time
 25413	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tnow and then at Stephen’s anything but immaculately attired interlocutor
 25414	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tas if he had seen that nobleman somewhere or other though where he was
 25415	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tnot in a position to truthfully state nor had he the remotest idea when.
 25416	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBeing a levelheaded individual who could give points to not a few in
 25417	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpoint of shrewd observation he also remarked on his very dilapidated
 25418	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\that and slouchy wearing apparel generally testifying to a chronic
 25419	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\timpecuniosity. Palpably he was one of his hangerson but for the
 25420	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmatter of that it was merely a question of one preying on his nextdoor
 25421	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tneighbour all round, in every deep, so to put it, a deeper depth and for
 25422	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe matter of that if the man in the street chanced to be in the dock
 25423	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thimself penal servitude with or without the option of a fine would be
 25424	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ta very rara avis altogether. In any case he had a consummate amount of
 25425	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcool assurance intercepting people at that hour of the night or morning.
 25426	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tPretty thick that was certainly.
 25427	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25428	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThe pair parted company and Stephen rejoined Mr Bloom who, with his
 25429	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpractised eye, was not without perceiving that he had succumbed to the
 25430	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tblandiloquence of the other parasite. Alluding to the encounter he said,
 25431	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlaughingly, Stephen, that is:
 25432	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25433	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—He is down on his luck. He asked me to ask you to ask somebody named
 25434	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBoylan, a billsticker, to give him a job as a sandwichman.
 25435	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25436	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tAt this intelligence, in which he seemingly evinced little interest, Mr
 25437	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBloom gazed abstractedly for the space of a half a second or so in the
 25438	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdirection of a bucketdredger, rejoicing in the farfamed name of Eblana,
 25439	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmoored alongside Customhouse quay and quite possibly out of repair,
 25440	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twhereupon he observed evasively:
 25441	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25442	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Everybody gets their own ration of luck, they say. Now you mention it
 25443	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\this face was familiar to me. But, leaving that for the moment, how much
 25444	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdid you part with, he queried, if I am not too inquisitive?
 25445	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25446	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Half a crown, Stephen responded. I daresay he needs it to sleep
 25447	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsomewhere.
 25448	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25449	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Needs! Mr Bloom ejaculated, professing not the least surprise at
 25450	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe intelligence, I can quite credit the assertion and I guarantee he
 25451	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tinvariably does. Everyone according to his needs or everyone according
 25452	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tto his deeds. But, talking about things in general, where, added he with
 25453	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ta smile, will you sleep yourself? Walking to Sandycove is out of
 25454	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe question. And even supposing you did you won’t get in after what
 25455	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\toccurred at Westland Row station. Simply fag out there for nothing. I
 25456	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdon’t mean to presume to dictate to you in the slightest degree but why
 25457	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdid you leave your father’s house?
 25458	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25459	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—To seek misfortune, was Stephen’s answer.
 25460	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25461	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—I met your respected father on a recent occasion, Mr Bloom
 25462	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdiplomatically returned, today in fact, or to be strictly accurate, on
 25463	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tyesterday. Where does he live at present? I gathered in the course of
 25464	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tconversation that he had moved.
 25465	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25466	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—I believe he is in Dublin somewhere, Stephen answered unconcernedly.
 25467	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tWhy?
 25468	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25469	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—A gifted man, Mr Bloom said of Mr Dedalus senior, in more respects than
 25470	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tone and a born raconteur if ever there was one. He takes great pride,
 25471	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tquite legitimate, out of you. You could go back perhaps, he hasarded,
 25472	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tstill thinking of the very unpleasant scene at Westland Row terminus
 25473	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twhen it was perfectly evident that the other two, Mulligan, that is, and
 25474	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthat English tourist friend of his, who eventually euchred their third
 25475	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcompanion, were patently trying as if the whole bally station belonged
 25476	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tto them to give Stephen the slip in the confusion, which they did.
 25477	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25478	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThere was no response forthcoming to the suggestion however, such as it
 25479	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twas, Stephen’s mind’s eye being too busily engaged in repicturing his
 25480	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfamily hearth the last time he saw it with his sister Dilly sitting by
 25481	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe ingle, her hair hanging down, waiting for some weak Trinidad shell
 25482	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcocoa that was in the sootcoated kettle to be done so that she and he
 25483	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcould drink it with the oatmealwater for milk after the Friday herrings
 25484	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthey had eaten at two a penny with an egg apiece for Maggy, Boody and
 25485	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tKatey, the cat meanwhile under the mangle devouring a mess of eggshells
 25486	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand charred fish heads and bones on a square of brown paper, in
 25487	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\taccordance with the third precept of the church to fast and abstain
 25488	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ton the days commanded, it being quarter tense or if not, ember days or
 25489	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsomething like that.
 25490	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25491	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—No, Mr Bloom repeated again, I wouldn’t personally repose much trust
 25492	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tin that boon companion of yours who contributes the humorous element, Dr
 25493	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMulligan, as a guide, philosopher and friend if I were in your shoes. He
 25494	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tknows which side his bread is buttered on though in all probability he
 25495	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tnever realised what it is to be without regular meals. Of course you
 25496	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdidn’t notice as much as I did. But it wouldn’t occasion me the least
 25497	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsurprise to learn that a pinch of tobacco or some narcotic was put in
 25498	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tyour drink for some ulterior object.
 25499	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25500	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHe understood however from all he heard that Dr Mulligan was a versatile
 25501	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tallround man, by no means confined to medicine only, who was rapidly
 25502	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcoming to the fore in his line and, if the report was verified, bade
 25503	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfair to enjoy a flourishing practice in the not too distant future as
 25504	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ta tony medical practitioner drawing a handsome fee for his services
 25505	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tin addition to which professional status his rescue of that man from
 25506	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcertain drowning by artificial respiration and what they call first
 25507	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\taid at Skerries, or Malahide was it?, was, he was bound to admit, an
 25508	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\texceedingly plucky deed which he could not too highly praise, so that
 25509	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfrankly he was utterly at a loss to fathom what earthly reason could be
 25510	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tat the back of it except he put it down to sheer cussedness or jealousy,
 25511	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpure and simple.
 25512	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25513	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Except it simply amounts to one thing and he is what they call picking
 25514	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tyour brains, he ventured to throw out.
 25515	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25516	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThe guarded glance of half solicitude half curiosity augmented by
 25517	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfriendliness which he gave at Stephen’s at present morose expression
 25518	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof features did not throw a flood of light, none at all in fact on the
 25519	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tproblem as to whether he had let himself be badly bamboozled to judge by
 25520	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttwo or three lowspirited remarks he let drop or the other way about saw
 25521	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthrough the affair and for some reason or other best known to himself
 25522	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tallowed matters to more or less. Grinding poverty did have that effect
 25523	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand he more than conjectured that, high educational abilities though he
 25524	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpossessed, he experienced no little difficulty in making both ends meet.
 25525	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25526	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tAdjacent to the men’s public urinal they perceived an icecream car round
 25527	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twhich a group of presumably Italians in heated altercation were getting
 25528	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\trid of voluble expressions in their vivacious language in a particularly
 25529	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tanimated way, there being some little differences between the parties.
 25530	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25531	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Puttana madonna, che ci dia i quattrini! Ho ragione? Culo rotto!
 25532	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25533	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Intendiamoci. Mezzo sovrano più...
 25534	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25535	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Dice lui, però!
 25536	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25537	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Mezzo.
 25538	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25539	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Farabutto! Mortacci sui!
 25540	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25541	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Ma ascolta! Cinque la testa più...
 25542	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25543	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMr Bloom and Stephen entered the cabman’s shelter, an unpretentious
 25544	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twooden structure, where, prior to then, he had rarely if ever been
 25545	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbefore, the former having previously whispered to the latter a few
 25546	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thints anent the keeper of it said to be the once famous Skin-the-Goat
 25547	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tFitzharris, the invincible, though he could not vouch for the actual
 25548	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfacts which quite possibly there was not one vestige of truth in. A few
 25549	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmoments later saw our two noctambules safely seated in a discreet corner
 25550	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tonly to be greeted by stares from the decidedly miscellaneous collection
 25551	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof waifs and strays and other nondescript specimens of the genus homo
 25552	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\talready there engaged in eating and drinking diversified by conversation
 25553	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfor whom they seemingly formed an object of marked curiosity.
 25554	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25555	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Now touching a cup of coffee, Mr Bloom ventured to plausibly suggest
 25556	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tto break the ice, it occurs to me you ought to sample something in the
 25557	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tshape of solid food, say, a roll of some description.
 25558	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25559	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tAccordingly his first act was with characteristic sangfroid to order
 25560	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthese commodities quietly. The hoi polloi of jarvies or stevedores
 25561	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tor whatever they were after a cursory examination turned their eyes
 25562	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tapparently dissatisfied, away though one redbearded bibulous individual,
 25563	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tportion of whose hair was greyish, a sailor probably, still stared for
 25564	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsome appreciable time before transferring his rapt attention to the
 25565	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfloor. Mr Bloom, availing himself of the right of free speech, he having
 25566	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tjust a bowing acquaintance with the language in dispute, though, to be
 25567	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsure, rather in a quandary over voglio, remarked to his protégé in an
 25568	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\taudible tone of voice à propos of the battle royal in the street which
 25569	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twas still raging fast and furious:
 25570	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25571	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—A beautiful language. I mean for singing purposes. Why do you not write
 25572	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tyour poetry in that language? Bella Poetria! It is so melodious and
 25573	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfull. Belladonna. Voglio.
 25574	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25575	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tStephen, who was trying his dead best to yawn if he could, suffering
 25576	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfrom lassitude generally, replied:
 25577	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25578	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—To fill the ear of a cow elephant. They were haggling over money.
 25579	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25580	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Is that so? Mr Bloom asked. Of course, he subjoined pensively, at the
 25581	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tinward reflection of there being more languages to start with than were
 25582	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tabsolutely necessary, it may be only the southern glamour that surrounds
 25583	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tit.
 25584	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25585	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThe keeper of the shelter in the middle of this tête-à-tête put a
 25586	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tboiling swimming cup of a choice concoction labelled coffee on the table
 25587	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand a rather antediluvian specimen of a bun, or so it seemed. After
 25588	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twhich he beat a retreat to his counter, Mr Bloom determining to have
 25589	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ta good square look at him later on so as not to appear to. For which
 25590	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\treason he encouraged Stephen to proceed with his eyes while he did
 25591	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe honours by surreptitiously pushing the cup of what was temporarily
 25592	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsupposed to be called coffee gradually nearer him.
 25593	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25594	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Sounds are impostures, Stephen said after a pause of some little time,
 25595	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlike names. Cicero, Podmore, Napoleon, Mr Goodbody. Jesus, Mr Doyle.
 25596	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tShakespeares were as common as Murphies. What’s in a name?
 25597	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25598	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Yes, to be sure, Mr Bloom unaffectedly concurred. Of course. Our name
 25599	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twas changed too, he added, pushing the socalled roll across.
 25600	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25601	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThe redbearded sailor who had his weather eye on the newcomers boarded
 25602	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tStephen, whom he had singled out for attention in particular, squarely
 25603	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tby asking:
 25604	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25605	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—And what might your name be?
 25606	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25607	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tJust in the nick of time Mr Bloom touched his companion’s boot but
 25608	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tStephen, apparently disregarding the warm pressure from an unexpected
 25609	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tquarter, answered:
 25610	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25611	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Dedalus.
 25612	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25613	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThe sailor stared at him heavily from a pair of drowsy baggy eyes,
 25614	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\trather bunged up from excessive use of boose, preferably good old
 25615	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHollands and water.
 25616	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25617	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—You know Simon Dedalus? he asked at length.
 25618	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25619	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—I’ve heard of him, Stephen said.
 25620	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25621	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMr Bloom was all at sea for a moment, seeing the others evidently
 25622	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\teavesdropping too.
 25623	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25624	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—He’s Irish, the seaman bold affirmed, staring still in much the same
 25625	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tway and nodding. All Irish.
 25626	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25627	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—All too Irish, Stephen rejoined.
 25628	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25629	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tAs for Mr Bloom he could neither make head or tail of the whole business
 25630	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand he was just asking himself what possible connection when the sailor
 25631	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof his own accord turned to the other occupants of the shelter with the
 25632	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tremark:
 25633	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25634	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—I seen him shoot two eggs off two bottles at fifty yards over his
 25635	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tshoulder. The lefthand dead shot.
 25636	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25637	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThough he was slightly hampered by an occasional stammer and his
 25638	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tgestures being also clumsy as it was still he did his best to explain.
 25639	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25640	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Bottles out there, say. Fifty yards measured. Eggs on the bottles.
 25641	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tCocks his gun over his shoulder. Aims.
 25642	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25643	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHe turned his body half round, shut up his right eye completely. Then he
 25644	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tscrewed his features up someway sideways and glared out into the night
 25645	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twith an unprepossessing cast of countenance.
 25646	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25647	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Pom! he then shouted once.
 25648	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25649	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThe entire audience waited, anticipating an additional detonation, there
 25650	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbeing still a further egg.
 25651	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25652	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Pom! he shouted twice.
 25653	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25654	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tEgg two evidently demolished, he nodded and winked, adding
 25655	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbloodthirstily:
 25656	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25657	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t      —Buffalo Bill shoots to kill,
 25658	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t      Never missed nor he never will.
 25659	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25660	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tA silence ensued till Mr Bloom for agreeableness’ sake just felt like
 25661	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tasking him whether it was for a marksmanship competition like the
 25662	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBisley.
 25663	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25664	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Beg pardon, the sailor said.
 25665	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25666	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Long ago? Mr Bloom pursued without flinching a hairsbreadth.
 25667	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25668	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Why, the sailor replied, relaxing to a certain extent under the magic
 25669	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tinfluence of diamond cut diamond, it might be a matter of ten years. He
 25670	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttoured the wide world with Hengler’s Royal Circus. I seen him do that in
 25671	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tStockholm.
 25672	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25673	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Curious coincidence, Mr Bloom confided to Stephen unobtrusively.
 25674	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25675	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Murphy’s my name, the sailor continued. D. B. Murphy of Carrigaloe.
 25676	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tKnow where that is?
 25677	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25678	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Queenstown harbour, Stephen replied.
 25679	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25680	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—That’s right, the sailor said. Fort Camden and Fort Carlisle. That’s
 25681	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twhere I hails from. I belongs there. That’s where I hails from. My
 25682	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlittle woman’s down there. She’s waiting for me, I know. For England,
 25683	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thome and beauty. She’s my own true wife I haven’t seen for seven years
 25684	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tnow, sailing about.
 25685	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25686	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMr Bloom could easily picture his advent on this scene, the homecoming
 25687	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tto the mariner’s roadside shieling after having diddled Davy Jones,
 25688	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ta rainy night with a blind moon. Across the world for a wife. Quite a
 25689	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tnumber of stories there were on that particular Alice Ben Bolt topic,
 25690	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tEnoch Arden and Rip van Winkle and does anybody hereabouts remember Caoc
 25691	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tO’Leary, a favourite and most trying declamation piece by the way of
 25692	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpoor John Casey and a bit of perfect poetry in its own small way.
 25693	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tNever about the runaway wife coming back, however much devoted to the
 25694	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tabsentee. The face at the window! Judge of his astonishment when he
 25695	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfinally did breast the tape and the awful truth dawned upon him anent
 25696	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\this better half, wrecked in his affections. You little expected me but
 25697	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tI’ve come to stay and make a fresh start. There she sits, a grasswidow,
 25698	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tat the selfsame fireside. Believes me dead, rocked in the cradle of the
 25699	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdeep. And there sits uncle Chubb or Tomkin, as the case might be, the
 25700	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpublican of the Crown and Anchor, in shirtsleeves, eating rumpsteak and
 25701	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tonions. No chair for father. Broo! The wind! Her brandnew arrival is
 25702	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ton her knee, post mortem child. With a high ro! and a randy ro! and my
 25703	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tgalloping tearing tandy, O! Bow to the inevitable. Grin and bear it. I
 25704	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tremain with much love your brokenhearted husband D B Murphy.
 25705	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25706	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThe sailor, who scarcely seemed to be a Dublin resident, turned to one
 25707	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof the jarvies with the request:
 25708	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25709	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—You don’t happen to have such a thing as a spare chaw about you?
 25710	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25711	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThe jarvey addressed as it happened had not but the keeper took a die of
 25712	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tplug from his good jacket hanging on a nail and the desired object was
 25713	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpassed from hand to hand.
 25714	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25715	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Thank you, the sailor said.
 25716	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25717	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHe deposited the quid in his gob and, chewing and with some slow
 25718	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tstammers, proceeded:
 25719	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25720	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—We come up this morning eleven o’clock. The threemaster Rosevean from
 25721	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBridgwater with bricks. I shipped to get over. Paid off this afternoon.
 25722	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThere’s my discharge. See? D. B. Murphy. A. B. S.
 25723	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25724	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tIn confirmation of which statement he extricated from an inside pocket
 25725	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand handed to his neighbour a not very cleanlooking folded document.
 25726	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25727	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—You must have seen a fair share of the world, the keeper remarked,
 25728	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tleaning on the counter.
 25729	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25730	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Why, the sailor answered upon reflection upon it, I’ve circumnavigated
 25731	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ta bit since I first joined on. I was in the Red Sea. I was in China and
 25732	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tNorth America and South America. We was chased by pirates one voyage.
 25733	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tI seen icebergs plenty, growlers. I was in Stockholm and the Black Sea,
 25734	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe Dardanelles under Captain Dalton, the best bloody man that ever
 25735	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tscuttled a ship. I seen Russia. Gospodi pomilyou. That’s how the
 25736	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tRussians prays.
 25737	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25738	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—You seen queer sights, don’t be talking, put in a jarvey.
 25739	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25740	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Why, the sailor said, shifting his partially chewed plug. I seen queer
 25741	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthings too, ups and downs. I seen a crocodile bite the fluke of an
 25742	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tanchor same as I chew that quid.
 25743	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25744	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHe took out of his mouth the pulpy quid and, lodging it between his
 25745	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tteeth, bit ferociously:
 25746	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25747	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Khaan! Like that. And I seen maneaters in Peru that eats corpses and
 25748	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe livers of horses. Look here. Here they are. A friend of mine sent
 25749	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tme.
 25750	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25751	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHe fumbled out a picture postcard from his inside pocket which seemed to
 25752	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbe in its way a species of repository and pushed it along the table. The
 25753	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tprinted matter on it stated: Choza de Indios. Beni, Bolivia.
 25754	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25755	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tAll focussed their attention at the scene exhibited, a group of savage
 25756	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twomen in striped loincloths, squatted, blinking, suckling, frowning,
 25757	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsleeping amid a swarm of infants (there must have been quite a score of
 25758	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthem) outside some primitive shanties of osier.
 25759	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25760	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Chews coca all day, the communicative tarpaulin added. Stomachs like
 25761	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbreadgraters. Cuts off their diddies when they can’t bear no more
 25762	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tchildren.
 25763	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25764	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tSee them sitting there stark ballocknaked eating a dead horse’s liver
 25765	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\traw.
 25766	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25767	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHis postcard proved a centre of attraction for Messrs the greenhorns for
 25768	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tseveral minutes if not more.
 25769	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25770	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Know how to keep them off? he inquired generally.
 25771	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25772	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tNobody volunteering a statement he winked, saying:
 25773	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25774	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Glass. That boggles ‘em. Glass.
 25775	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25776	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMr Bloom, without evincing surprise, unostentatiously turned over the
 25777	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcard to peruse the partially obliterated address and postmark. It ran
 25778	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tas follows: Tarjeta Postal, Señor A Boudin, Galeria Becche, Santiago,
 25779	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tChile. There was no message evidently, as he took particular notice.
 25780	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThough not an implicit believer in the lurid story narrated (or the
 25781	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\teggsniping transaction for that matter despite William Tell and the
 25782	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tLazarillo-Don Cesar de Bazan incident depicted in Maritana on which
 25783	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\toccasion the former’s ball passed through the latter’s hat) having
 25784	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdetected a discrepancy between his name (assuming he was the person
 25785	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\the represented himself to be and not sailing under false colours
 25786	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tafter having boxed the compass on the strict q.t. somewhere) and
 25787	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe fictitious addressee of the missive which made him nourish some
 25788	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsuspicions of our friend’s bona fides nevertheless it reminded him in a
 25789	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tway of a longcherished plan he meant to one day realise some Wednesday
 25790	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tor Saturday of travelling to London via long sea not to say that he had
 25791	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tever travelled extensively to any great extent but he was at heart a
 25792	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tborn adventurer though by a trick of fate he had consistently remained
 25793	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ta landlubber except you call going to Holyhead which was his longest.
 25794	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMartin Cunningham frequently said he would work a pass through Egan but
 25795	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsome deuced hitch or other eternally cropped up with the net result that
 25796	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe scheme fell through. But even suppose it did come to planking
 25797	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdown the needful and breaking Boyd’s heart it was not so dear, purse
 25798	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpermitting, a few guineas at the outside considering the fare to
 25799	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMullingar where he figured on going was five and six, there and back.
 25800	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThe trip would benefit health on account of the bracing ozone and be in
 25801	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tevery way thoroughly pleasurable, especially for a chap whose liver was
 25802	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tout of order, seeing the different places along the route, Plymouth,
 25803	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tFalmouth, Southampton and so on culminating in an instructive tour of
 25804	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe sights of the great metropolis, the spectacle of our modern Babylon
 25805	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twhere doubtless he would see the greatest improvement, tower, abbey,
 25806	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twealth of Park lane to renew acquaintance with. Another thing just
 25807	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tstruck him as a by no means bad notion was he might have a gaze around
 25808	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ton the spot to see about trying to make arrangements about a concert
 25809	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttour of summer music embracing the most prominent pleasure resorts,
 25810	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMargate with mixed bathing and firstrate hydros and spas, Eastbourne,
 25811	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tScarborough, Margate and so on, beautiful Bournemouth, the Channel
 25812	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tislands and similar bijou spots, which might prove highly remunerative.
 25813	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tNot, of course, with a hole and corner scratch company or local ladies
 25814	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ton the job, witness Mrs C P M’Coy type lend me your valise and I’ll post
 25815	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tyou the ticket. No, something top notch, an all star Irish caste, the
 25816	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTweedy-Flower grand opera company with his own legal consort as leading
 25817	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlady as a sort of counterblast to the Elster Grimes and Moody-Manners,
 25818	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tperfectly simple matter and he was quite sanguine of success, providing
 25819	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpuffs in the local papers could be managed by some fellow with a bit of
 25820	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbounce who could pull the indispensable wires and thus combine business
 25821	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twith pleasure. But who? That was the rub.
 25822	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25823	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tAlso, without being actually positive, it struck him a great field was
 25824	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tto be opened up in the line of opening up new routes to keep pace with
 25825	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe times apropos of the Fishguard-Rosslare route which, it was mooted,
 25826	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twas once more on the tapis in the circumlocution departments with the
 25827	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tusual quantity of red tape and dillydallying of effete fogeydom and
 25828	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdunderheads generally. A great opportunity there certainly was for push
 25829	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand enterprise to meet the travelling needs of the public at large, the
 25830	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\taverage man, i.e. Brown, Robinson and Co.
 25831	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25832	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tIt was a subject of regret and absurd as well on the face of it and no
 25833	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsmall blame to our vaunted society that the man in the street, when the
 25834	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsystem really needed toning up, for the matter of a couple of paltry
 25835	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpounds was debarred from seeing more of the world they lived in instead
 25836	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof being always and ever cooped up since my old stick-in-the-mud took me
 25837	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfor a wife. After all, hang it, they had their eleven and more humdrum
 25838	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmonths of it and merited a radical change of venue after the grind
 25839	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof city life in the summertime for choice when dame Nature is at her
 25840	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tspectacular best constituting nothing short of a new lease of life.
 25841	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThere were equally excellent opportunities for vacationists in the home
 25842	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tisland, delightful sylvan spots for rejuvenation, offering a plethora
 25843	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof attractions as well as a bracing tonic for the system in and around
 25844	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tDublin and its picturesque environs even, Poulaphouca to which there was
 25845	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ta steamtram, but also farther away from the madding crowd in Wicklow,
 25846	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\trightly termed the garden of Ireland, an ideal neighbourhood for elderly
 25847	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twheelmen so long as it didn’t come down, and in the wilds of Donegal
 25848	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twhere if report spoke true the coup d’œil was exceedingly grand though
 25849	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe lastnamed locality was not easily getatable so that the influx of
 25850	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tvisitors was not as yet all that it might be considering the
 25851	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsignal benefits to be derived from it while Howth with its historic
 25852	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tassociations and otherwise, Silken Thomas, Grace O’Malley, George IV,
 25853	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\trhododendrons several hundred feet above sealevel was a favourite haunt
 25854	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twith all sorts and conditions of men especially in the spring when young
 25855	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmen’s fancy, though it had its own toll of deaths by falling off the
 25856	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcliffs by design or accidentally, usually, by the way, on their left
 25857	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tleg, it being only about three quarters of an hour’s run from the
 25858	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpillar. Because of course uptodate tourist travelling was as yet merely
 25859	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tin its infancy, so to speak, and the accommodation left much to be
 25860	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdesired. Interesting to fathom it seemed to him from a motive of
 25861	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcuriosity, pure and simple, was whether it was the traffic that created
 25862	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe route or viceversa or the two sides in fact. He turned back the
 25863	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tother side of the card, picture, and passed it along to Stephen.
 25864	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25865	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—I seen a Chinese one time, related the doughty narrator, that had
 25866	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlittle pills like putty and he put them in the water and they opened and
 25867	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tevery pill was something different. One was a ship, another was a house,
 25868	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tanother was a flower. Cooks rats in your soup, he appetisingly added,
 25869	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe chinks does.
 25870	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25871	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tPossibly perceiving an expression of dubiosity on their faces the
 25872	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tglobetrotter went on, adhering to his adventures.
 25873	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25874	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—And I seen a man killed in Trieste by an Italian chap. Knife in his
 25875	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tback. Knife like that.
 25876	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25877	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tWhilst speaking he produced a dangerouslooking claspknife quite in
 25878	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tkeeping with his character and held it in the striking position.
 25879	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25880	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—In a knockingshop it was count of a tryon between two smugglers. Fellow
 25881	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thid behind a door, come up behind him. Like that. Prepare to meet your
 25882	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tGod, says he. Chuk! It went into his back up to the butt.
 25883	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25884	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHis heavy glance drowsily roaming about kind of defied their further
 25885	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tquestions even should they by any chance want to.
 25886	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25887	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—That’s a good bit of steel, repeated he, examining his formidable
 25888	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tstiletto.
 25889	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25890	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tAfter which harrowing dénouement sufficient to appal the stoutest he
 25891	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsnapped the blade to and stowed the weapon in question away as before in
 25892	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\this chamber of horrors, otherwise pocket.
 25893	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25894	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—They’re great for the cold steel, somebody who was evidently quite in
 25895	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe dark said for the benefit of them all. That was why they thought
 25896	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe park murders of the invincibles was done by foreigners on account of
 25897	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthem using knives.
 25898	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25899	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tAt this remark passed obviously in the spirit of where ignorance
 25900	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tis bliss Mr B. and Stephen, each in his own particular way, both
 25901	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tinstinctively exchanged meaning glances, in a religious silence of the
 25902	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tstrictly entre nous variety however, towards where Skin-the-Goat, alias
 25903	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe keeper, not turning a hair, was drawing spurts of liquid from his
 25904	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tboiler affair. His inscrutable face which was really a work of art, a
 25905	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tperfect study in itself, beggaring description, conveyed the impression
 25906	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthat he didn’t understand one jot of what was going on. Funny, very!
 25907	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25908	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThere ensued a somewhat lengthy pause. One man was reading in fits and
 25909	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tstarts a stained by coffee evening journal, another the card with the
 25910	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tnatives choza de, another the seaman’s discharge. Mr Bloom, so far as he
 25911	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twas personally concerned, was just pondering in pensive mood. He
 25912	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tvividly recollected when the occurrence alluded to took place as well
 25913	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tas yesterday, roughly some score of years previously in the days of the
 25914	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tland troubles, when it took the civilised world by storm, figuratively
 25915	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tspeaking, early in the eighties, eightyone to be correct, when he was
 25916	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tjust turned fifteen.
 25917	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25918	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Ay, boss, the sailor broke in. Give us back them papers.
 25919	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25920	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThe request being complied with he clawed them up with a scrape.
 25921	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25922	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Have you seen the rock of Gibraltar? Mr Bloom inquired.
 25923	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25924	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThe sailor grimaced, chewing, in a way that might be read as yes, ay or
 25925	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tno.
 25926	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25927	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Ah, you’ve touched there too, Mr Bloom said, Europa point, thinking he
 25928	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thad, in the hope that the rover might possibly by some reminiscences but
 25929	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\the failed to do so, simply letting spirt a jet of spew into the sawdust,
 25930	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand shook his head with a sort of lazy scorn.
 25931	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25932	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—What year would that be about? Mr B interrogated. Can you recall the
 25933	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tboats?
 25934	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25935	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tOur soi-disant sailor munched heavily awhile hungrily before answering:
 25936	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25937	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—I’m tired of all them rocks in the sea, he said, and boats and ships.
 25938	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tSalt junk all the time.
 25939	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25940	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTired seemingly, he ceased. His questioner perceiving that he was not
 25941	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlikely to get a great deal of change out of such a wily old customer,
 25942	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfell to woolgathering on the enormous dimensions of the water about the
 25943	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tglobe, suffice it to say that, as a casual glance at the map revealed,
 25944	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tit covered fully three fourths of it and he fully realised accordingly
 25945	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twhat it meant to rule the waves. On more than one occasion, a dozen
 25946	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tat the lowest, near the North Bull at Dollymount he had remarked a
 25947	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsuperannuated old salt, evidently derelict, seated habitually near the
 25948	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tnot particularly redolent sea on the wall, staring quite obliviously at
 25949	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tit and it at him, dreaming of fresh woods and pastures new as someone
 25950	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsomewhere sings. And it left him wondering why. Possibly he had tried to
 25951	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfind out the secret for himself, floundering up and down the antipodes
 25952	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand all that sort of thing and over and under, well, not exactly under,
 25953	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttempting the fates. And the odds were twenty to nil there was really no
 25954	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsecret about it at all. Nevertheless, without going into the minutiae of
 25955	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe business, the eloquent fact remained that the sea was there in all
 25956	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tits glory and in the natural course of things somebody or other had to
 25957	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsail on it and fly in the face of providence though it merely went to
 25958	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tshow how people usually contrived to load that sort of onus on to the
 25959	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tother fellow like the hell idea and the lottery and insurance which were
 25960	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\trun on identically the same lines so that for that very reason if no
 25961	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tother lifeboat Sunday was a highly laudable institution to which the
 25962	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpublic at large, no matter where living inland or seaside, as the case
 25963	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmight be, having it brought home to them like that should extend its
 25964	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tgratitude also to the harbourmasters and coastguard service who had
 25965	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tto man the rigging and push off and out amid the elements whatever the
 25966	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tseason when duty called Ireland expects that every man and so on and
 25967	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsometimes had a terrible time of it in the wintertime not forgetting the
 25968	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tIrish lights, Kish and others, liable to capsize at any moment, rounding
 25969	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twhich he once with his daughter had experienced some remarkably choppy,
 25970	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tnot to say stormy, weather.
 25971	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25972	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—There was a fellow sailed with me in the Rover, the old seadog, himself
 25973	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ta rover, proceeded, went ashore and took up a soft job as gentleman’s
 25974	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tvalet at six quid a month. Them are his trousers I’ve on me and he gave
 25975	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tme an oilskin and that jackknife. I’m game for that job, shaving and
 25976	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbrushup. I hate roaming about. There’s my son now, Danny, run off to
 25977	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsea and his mother got him took in a draper’s in Cork where he could be
 25978	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdrawing easy money.
 25979	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25980	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—What age is he? queried one hearer who, by the way, seen from the side,
 25981	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbore a distant resemblance to Henry Campbell, the townclerk, away from

 25986	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHe’d be about eighteen now, way I figure it.

 25988	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThe Skibbereen father hereupon tore open his grey or unclean anyhow
 25989	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tshirt with his two hands and scratched away at his chest on which was to
 25990	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbe seen an image tattooed in blue Chinese ink intended to represent an

 25992	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 25993	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—There was lice in that bunk in Bridgwater, he remarked, sure as nuts. I
 25994	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmust get a wash tomorrow or next day. It’s them black lads I objects to.
 25995	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tI hate those buggers. Suck your blood dry, they does.
 25996	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t

 26000	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tyoung man’s sideface looking frowningly rather.
 26001	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26002	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Tattoo, the exhibitor explained. That was done when we were Iying
 26003	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbecalmed off Odessa in the Black Sea under Captain Dalton. Fellow, the
 26004	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tname of Antonio, done that. There he is himself, a Greek.
 26005	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26006	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Did it hurt much doing it? one asked the sailor.
 26007	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26008	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThat worthy, however, was busily engaged in collecting round the.
 26009	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tSomeway in his. Squeezing or.
 26010	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26011	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—See here, he said, showing Antonio. There he is cursing the mate. And
 26012	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthere he is now, he added, the same fellow, pulling the skin with his
 26013	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfingers, some special knack evidently, and he laughing at a yarn.
 26014	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26015	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tAnd in point of fact the young man named Antonio’s livid face did
 26016	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tactually look like forced smiling and the curious effect excited the
 26017	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tunreserved admiration of everybody including Skin-the-Goat, who this
 26018	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttime stretched over.
 26019	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26020	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Ay, ay, sighed the sailor, looking down on his manly chest. He’s gone
 26021	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttoo. Ate by sharks after. Ay, ay.
 26022	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26023	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHe let go of the skin so that the profile resumed the normal expression
 26024	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof before.
 26025	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26026	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Neat bit of work, one longshoreman said.
 26027	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26028	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—And what’s the number for? loafer number two queried.
 26029	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26030	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Eaten alive? a third asked the sailor.
 26031	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26032	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Ay, ay, sighed again the latter personage, more cheerily this time with
 26033	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsome sort of a half smile for a brief duration only in the direction of

 26035	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26036	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tAnd then he added with rather gallowsbird humour considering his alleged

 26040	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t      For he left me on my ownio.
 26041	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26042	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThe face of a streetwalker glazed and haggard under a black straw hat
 26043	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpeered askew round the door of the shelter palpably reconnoitring on
 26044	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ther own with the object of bringing more grist to her mill. Mr
 26045	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBloom, scarcely knowing which way to look, turned away on the moment
 26046	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tflusterfied but outwardly calm, and, picking up from the table the pink
 26047	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsheet of the Abbey street organ which the jarvey, if such he was, had
 26048	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlaid aside, he picked it up and looked at the pink of the paper though
 26049	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twhy pink. His reason for so doing was he recognised on the moment
 26050	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tround the door the same face he had caught a fleeting glimpse of that
 26051	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tafternoon on Ormond quay, the partially idiotic female, namely, of the
 26052	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlane who knew the lady in the brown costume does be with you (Mrs B.)
 26053	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand begged the chance of his washing. Also why washing which seemed
 26054	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\trather vague than not, your washing. Still candour compelled him to
 26055	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tadmit he had washed his wife’s undergarments when soiled in Holles
 26056	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tstreet and women would and did too a man’s similar garments initialled
 26057	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twith Bewley and Draper’s marking ink (hers were, that is) if they really
 26058	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tloved him, that is to say, love me, love my dirty shirt. Still just
 26059	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthen, being on tenterhooks, he desired the female’s room more than her
 26060	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcompany so it came as a genuine relief when the keeper made her a rude
 26061	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsign to take herself off. Round the side of the Evening Telegraph he
 26062	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tjust caught a fleeting glimpse of her face round the side of the door
 26063	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twith a kind of demented glassy grin showing that she was not exactly all
 26064	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthere, viewing with evident amusement the group of gazers round skipper
 26065	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMurphy’s nautical chest and then there was no more of her.
 26066	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26067	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—The gunboat, the keeper said.
 26068	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26069	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—It beats me, Mr Bloom confided to Stephen, medically I am speaking,
 26070	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thow a wretched creature like that from the Lock hospital reeking with
 26071	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdisease can be barefaced enough to solicit or how any man in his sober
 26072	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsenses, if he values his health in the least. Unfortunate creature! Of
 26073	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcourse I suppose some man is ultimately responsible for her condition.
 26074	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tStill no matter what the cause is from...
 26075	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26076	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tStephen had not noticed her and shrugged his shoulders, merely
 26077	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tremarking:
 26078	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26079	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—In this country people sell much more than she ever had and do a
 26080	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\troaring trade. Fear not them that sell the body but have not power to
 26081	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbuy the soul. She is a bad merchant. She buys dear and sells cheap.
 26082	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26083	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThe elder man, though not by any manner of means an old maid or a prude,
 26084	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsaid it was nothing short of a crying scandal that ought to be put a
 26085	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tstop to instanter to say that women of that stamp (quite apart from any
 26086	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\toldmaidish squeamishness on the subject), a necessary evil, were not
 26087	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlicensed and medically inspected by the proper authorities, a thing, he
 26088	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcould truthfully state, he, as a paterfamilias, was a stalwart advocate
 26089	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof from the very first start. Whoever embarked on a policy of the sort,
 26090	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\the said, and ventilated the matter thoroughly would confer a lasting
 26091	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tboon on everybody concerned.
 26092	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26093	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—You as a good catholic, he observed, talking of body and soul, believe
 26094	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tin the soul. Or do you mean the intelligence, the brainpower as such,
 26095	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tas distinct from any outside object, the table, let us say, that cup. I
 26096	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbelieve in that myself because it has been explained by competent men as
 26097	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe convolutions of the grey matter. Otherwise we would never have such
 26098	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tinventions as X rays, for instance. Do you?
 26099	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26100	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThus cornered, Stephen had to make a superhuman effort of memory to try
 26101	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand concentrate and remember before he could say:
 26102	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26103	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—They tell me on the best authority it is a simple substance and
 26104	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttherefore incorruptible. It would be immortal, I understand, but for the
 26105	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpossibility of its annihilation by its First Cause Who, from all I
