 26106	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcan hear, is quite capable of adding that to the number of His other
 26107	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpractical jokes, corruptio per se and corruptio per accidens both being
 26108	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\texcluded by court etiquette.
 26109	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26110	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMr Bloom thoroughly acquiesced in the general gist of this though the
 26111	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmystical finesse involved was a bit out of his sublunary depth still
 26112	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\the felt bound to enter a demurrer on the head of simple, promptly
 26113	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\trejoining:
 26114	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26115	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Simple? I shouldn’t think that is the proper word. Of course, I grant
 26116	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tyou, to concede a point, you do knock across a simple soul once in a
 26117	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tblue moon. But what I am anxious to arrive at is it is one thing for
 26118	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tinstance to invent those rays Röntgen did or the telescope like Edison,
 26119	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthough I believe it was before his time Galileo was the man, I mean,
 26120	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand the same applies to the laws, for example, of a farreaching natural
 26121	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tphenomenon such as electricity but it’s a horse of quite another colour
 26122	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tto say you believe in the existence of a supernatural God.
 26123	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26124	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—O that, Stephen expostulated, has been proved conclusively by several
 26125	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof the bestknown passages in Holy Writ, apart from circumstantial
 26126	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tevidence.
 26127	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26128	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tOn this knotty point however the views of the pair, poles apart as they
 26129	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twere both in schooling and everything else with the marked difference in
 26130	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttheir respective ages, clashed.
 26131	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26132	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Has been? the more experienced of the two objected, sticking to his
 26133	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\toriginal point with a smile of unbelief. I’m not so sure about that.
 26134	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThat’s a matter for everyman’s opinion and, without dragging in the
 26135	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsectarian side of the business, I beg to differ with you in toto there.
 26136	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMy belief is, to tell you the candid truth, that those bits were genuine
 26137	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tforgeries all of them put in by monks most probably or it’s the big
 26138	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tquestion of our national poet over again, who precisely wrote them like
 26139	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHamlet and Bacon, as, you who know your Shakespeare infinitely better
 26140	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthan I, of course I needn’t tell you. Can’t you drink that coffee, by
 26141	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe way? Let me stir it. And take a piece of that bun. It’s like one
 26142	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof our skipper’s bricks disguised. Still no-one can give what he hasn’t
 26143	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tgot. Try a bit.
 26144	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26145	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Couldn’t, Stephen contrived to get out, his mental organs for the
 26146	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmoment refusing to dictate further.
 26147	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26148	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tFaultfinding being a proverbially bad hat Mr Bloom thought well to stir
 26149	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tor try to the clotted sugar from the bottom and reflected with something
 26150	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tapproaching acrimony on the Coffee Palace and its temperance (and
 26151	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlucrative) work. To be sure it was a legitimate object and beyond yea or
 26152	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tnay did a world of good, shelters such as the present one they were in
 26153	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\trun on teetotal lines for vagrants at night, concerts, dramatic evenings
 26154	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand useful lectures (admittance free) by qualified men for the lower
 26155	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\torders. On the other hand he had a distinct and painful recollection
 26156	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthey paid his wife, Madam Marion Tweedy who had been prominently
 26157	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tassociated with it at one time, a very modest remuneration indeed for
 26158	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ther pianoplaying. The idea, he was strongly inclined to believe, was
 26159	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tto do good and net a profit, there being no competition to speak
 26160	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof. Sulphate of copper poison SO4 or something in some dried peas he
 26161	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tremembered reading of in a cheap eatinghouse somewhere but he couldn’t
 26162	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tremember when it was or where. Anyhow inspection, medical inspection,
 26163	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof all eatables seemed to him more than ever necessary which possibly
 26164	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\taccounted for the vogue of Dr Tibble’s Vi-Cocoa on account of the
 26165	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmedical analysis involved.
 26166	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26167	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Have a shot at it now, he ventured to say of the coffee after being
 26168	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tstirred.
 26169	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26170	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThus prevailed on to at any rate taste it Stephen lifted the heavy mug
 26171	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfrom the brown puddle it clopped out of when taken up by the handle and
 26172	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttook a sip of the offending beverage.
 26173	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26174	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Still it’s solid food, his good genius urged, I’m a stickler for solid
 26175	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfood, his one and only reason being not gormandising in the least but
 26176	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tregular meals as the sine qua non for any kind of proper work, mental
 26177	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tor manual. You ought to eat more solid food. You would feel a different
 26178	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tman.
 26179	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26180	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Liquids I can eat, Stephen said. But O, oblige me by taking away that
 26181	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tknife. I can’t look at the point of it. It reminds me of Roman history.
 26182	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26183	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMr Bloom promptly did as suggested and removed the incriminated article,
 26184	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ta blunt hornhandled ordinary knife with nothing particularly Roman or
 26185	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tantique about it to the lay eye, observing that the point was the least
 26186	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tconspicuous point about it.
 26187	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26188	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Our mutual friend’s stories are like himself, Mr Bloom apropos of
 26189	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tknives remarked to his confidante sotto voce. Do you think they are
 26190	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tgenuine? He could spin those yarns for hours on end all night long and
 26191	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlie like old boots. Look at him.
 26192	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26193	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tYet still though his eyes were thick with sleep and sea air life was
 26194	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfull of a host of things and coincidences of a terrible nature and it
 26195	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twas quite within the bounds of possibility that it was not an
 26196	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tentire fabrication though at first blush there was not much inherent
 26197	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tprobability in all the spoof he got off his chest being strictly
 26198	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\taccurate gospel.
 26199	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26200	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHe had been meantime taking stock of the individual in front of him and
 26201	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tSherlockholmesing him up ever since he clapped eyes on him. Though a
 26202	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twellpreserved man of no little stamina, if a trifle prone to baldness,
 26203	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthere was something spurious in the cut of his jib that suggested a jail
 26204	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdelivery and it required no violent stretch of imagination to associate
 26205	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsuch a weirdlooking specimen with the oakum and treadmill fraternity. He
 26206	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmight even have done for his man supposing it was his own case he told,
 26207	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tas people often did about others, namely, that he killed him himself
 26208	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand had served his four or five goodlooking years in durance vile to say
 26209	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tnothing of the Antonio personage (no relation to the dramatic personage
 26210	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof identical name who sprang from the pen of our national poet) who
 26211	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\texpiated his crimes in the melodramatic manner above described. On the
 26212	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tother hand he might be only bluffing, a pardonable weakness because
 26213	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmeeting unmistakable mugs, Dublin residents, like those jarvies waiting
 26214	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tnews from abroad would tempt any ancient mariner who sailed the ocean
 26215	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tseas to draw the long bow about the schooner Hesperus and etcetera. And
 26216	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twhen all was said and done the lies a fellow told about himself couldn’t
 26217	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tprobably hold a proverbial candle to the wholesale whoppers other
 26218	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfellows coined about him.
 26219	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26220	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Mind you, I’m not saying that it’s all a pure invention, he resumed.
 26221	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tAnalogous scenes are occasionally, if not often, met with. Giants,
 26222	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthough that is rather a far cry, you see once in a way, Marcella the
 26223	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmidget queen. In those waxworks in Henry street I myself saw some
 26224	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tAztecs, as they are called, sitting bowlegged, they couldn’t straighten
 26225	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttheir legs if you paid them because the muscles here, you see, he
 26226	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tproceeded, indicating on his companion the brief outline of the sinews
 26227	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tor whatever you like to call them behind the right knee, were utterly
 26228	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpowerless from sitting that way so long cramped up, being adored as
 26229	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tgods. There’s an example again of simple souls.
 26230	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26231	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHowever reverting to friend Sinbad and his horrifying adventures (who
 26232	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\treminded him a bit of Ludwig, alias Ledwidge, when he occupied
 26233	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe boards of the Gaiety when Michael Gunn was identified with the
 26234	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmanagement in the Flying Dutchman, a stupendous success, and his host
 26235	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof admirers came in large numbers, everyone simply flocking to hear him
 26236	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthough ships of any sort, phantom or the reverse, on the stage usually
 26237	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfell a bit flat as also did trains) there was nothing intrinsically
 26238	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tincompatible about it, he conceded. On the contrary that stab in the
 26239	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tback touch was quite in keeping with those italianos though candidly he
 26240	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twas none the less free to admit those icecreamers and friers in the fish
 26241	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tway not to mention the chip potato variety and so forth over in little
 26242	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tItaly there near the Coombe were sober thrifty hardworking fellows
 26243	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\texcept perhaps a bit too given to pothunting the harmless necessary
 26244	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tanimal of the feline persuasion of others at night so as to have a good
 26245	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\told succulent tuckin with garlic de rigueur off him or her next day on
 26246	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe quiet and, he added, on the cheap.
 26247	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26248	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Spaniards, for instance, he continued, passionate temperaments like
 26249	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthat, impetuous as Old Nick, are given to taking the law into their own
 26250	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thands and give you your quietus doublequick with those poignards they
 26251	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcarry in the abdomen. It comes from the great heat, climate generally.
 26252	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMy wife is, so to speak, Spanish, half that is. Point of fact she could
 26253	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tactually claim Spanish nationality if she wanted, having been born in
 26254	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(technically) Spain, i.e. Gibraltar. She has the Spanish type. Quite
 26255	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdark, regular brunette, black. I for one certainly believe climate
 26256	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\taccounts for character. That’s why I asked you if you wrote your poetry
 26257	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tin Italian.
 26258	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26259	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—The temperaments at the door, Stephen interposed with, were very
 26260	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpassionate about ten shillings. Roberto ruba roba sua.
 26261	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26262	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Quite so, Mr Bloom dittoed.
 26263	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26264	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Then, Stephen said staring and rambling on to himself or some unknown
 26265	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlistener somewhere, we have the impetuosity of Dante and the isosceles
 26266	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttriangle miss Portinari he fell in love with and Leonardo and san
 26267	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTommaso Mastino.
 26268	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26269	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—It’s in the blood, Mr Bloom acceded at once. All are washed in the
 26270	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tblood of the sun. Coincidence I just happened to be in the Kildare
 26271	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tstreet museum today, shortly prior to our meeting if I can so call it,
 26272	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand I was just looking at those antique statues there. The splendid
 26273	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tproportions of hips, bosom. You simply don’t knock against those kind of
 26274	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twomen here. An exception here and there. Handsome yes, pretty in a way
 26275	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tyou find but what I’m talking about is the female form. Besides they
 26276	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thave so little taste in dress, most of them, which greatly enhances a
 26277	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twoman’s natural beauty, no matter what you say. Rumpled stockings, it
 26278	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmay be, possibly is, a foible of mine but still it’s a thing I simply
 26279	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thate to see.
 26280	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26281	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tInterest, however, was starting to flag somewhat all round and then the
 26282	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tothers got on to talking about accidents at sea, ships lost in a fog,
 26283	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcollisions with icebergs, all that sort of thing. Shipahoy of course
 26284	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thad his own say to say. He had doubled the cape a few odd times and
 26285	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tweathered a monsoon, a kind of wind, in the China seas and through all
 26286	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthose perils of the deep there was one thing, he declared, stood to him
 26287	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tor words to that effect, a pious medal he had that saved him.
 26288	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26289	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tSo then after that they drifted on to the wreck off Daunt’s rock, wreck
 26290	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof that illfated Norwegian barque nobody could think of her name for
 26291	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe moment till the jarvey who had really quite a look of Henry Campbell
 26292	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tremembered it Palme on Booterstown strand. That was the talk of the town
 26293	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthat year (Albert William Quill wrote a fine piece of original verse of
 26294	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdistinctive merit on the topic for the Irish Times), breakers running
 26295	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tover her and crowds and crowds on the shore in commotion petrified with
 26296	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thorror. Then someone said something about the case of the s. s. Lady
 26297	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tCairns of Swansea run into by the Mona which was on an opposite tack
 26298	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tin rather muggyish weather and lost with all hands on deck. No aid was
 26299	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tgiven. Her master, the Mona’s, said he was afraid his collision bulkhead
 26300	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twould give way. She had no water, it appears, in her hold.
 26301	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26302	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tAt this stage an incident happened. It having become necessary for him
 26303	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tto unfurl a reef the sailor vacated his seat.
 26304	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26305	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Let me cross your bows mate, he said to his neighbour who was just
 26306	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tgently dropping off into a peaceful doze.
 26307	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26308	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHe made tracks heavily, slowly with a dumpy sort of a gait to the door,
 26309	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tstepped heavily down the one step there was out of the shelter and bore
 26310	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdue left. While he was in the act of getting his bearings Mr Bloom who
 26311	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tnoticed when he stood up that he had two flasks of presumably ship’s
 26312	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\trum sticking one out of each pocket for the private consumption of his
 26313	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tburning interior, saw him produce a bottle and uncork it or unscrew and,
 26314	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tapplying its nozz1e to his lips, take a good old delectable swig out of
 26315	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tit with a gurgling noise. The irrepressible Bloom, who also had a
 26316	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tshrewd suspicion that the old stager went out on a manœuvre after the
 26317	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcounterattraction in the shape of a female who however had disappeared
 26318	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tto all intents and purposes, could by straining just perceive him, when
 26319	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tduly refreshed by his rum puncheon exploit, gaping up at the piers and
 26320	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tgirders of the Loop line rather out of his depth as of course it was all
 26321	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tradically altered since his last visit and greatly improved. Some person
 26322	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tor persons invisible directed him to the male urinal erected by the
 26323	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcleansing committee all over the place for the purpose but after a brief
 26324	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tspace of time during which silence reigned supreme the sailor, evidently
 26325	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tgiving it a wide berth, eased himself closer at hand, the noise of his
 26326	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbilgewater some little time subsequently splashing on the ground where
 26327	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tit apparently awoke a horse of the cabrank. A hoof scooped anyway for
 26328	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tnew foothold after sleep and harness jingled. Slightly disturbed in his
 26329	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsentrybox by the brazier of live coke the watcher of the corporation
 26330	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tstones who, though now broken down and fast breaking up, was none other
 26331	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tin stern reality than the Gumley aforesaid, now practically on the
 26332	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tparish rates, given the temporary job by Pat Tobin in all human
 26333	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tprobability from dictates of humanity knowing him before shifted about
 26334	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand shuffled in his box before composing his limbs again in to the arms
 26335	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof Morpheus, a truly amazing piece of hard lines in its most virulent
 26336	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tform on a fellow most respectably connected and familiarised with decent
 26337	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thome comforts all his life who came in for a cool £ 100 a year at one
 26338	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttime which of course the doublebarrelled ass proceeded to make general
 26339	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tducks and drakes of. And there he was at the end of his tether after
 26340	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thaving often painted the town tolerably pink without a beggarly stiver.
 26341	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHe drank needless to be told and it pointed only once more a moral
 26342	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twhen he might quite easily be in a large way of business if—a big if,
 26343	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thowever—he had contrived to cure himself of his particular partiality.
 26344	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26345	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tAll meantime were loudly lamenting the falling off in Irish shipping,
 26346	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcoastwise and foreign as well, which was all part and parcel of the same
 26347	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthing. A Palgrave Murphy boat was put off the ways at Alexandra basin,
 26348	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe only launch that year. Right enough the harbours were there only no
 26349	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tships ever called.
 26350	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26351	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThere were wrecks and wreckers, the keeper said, who was evidently au
 26352	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfait.
 26353	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26354	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tWhat he wanted to ascertain was why that ship ran bang against the only
 26355	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\trock in Galway bay when the Galway harbour scheme was mooted by a Mr
 26356	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tWorthington or some name like that, eh? Ask the then captain, he advised
 26357	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthem, how much palmoil the British government gave him for that day’s
 26358	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twork, Captain John Lever of the Lever Line.
 26359	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26360	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Am I right, skipper? he queried of the sailor, now returning after his
 26361	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tprivate potation and the rest of his exertions.
 26362	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26363	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThat worthy picking up the scent of the fagend of the song or words
 26364	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tgrowled in wouldbe music but with great vim some kind of chanty or other
 26365	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tin seconds or thirds. Mr Bloom’s sharp ears heard him then expectorate
 26366	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe plug probably (which it was), so that he must have lodged it for the
 26367	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttime being in his fist while he did the drinking and making water jobs
 26368	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand found it a bit sour after the liquid fire in question. Anyhow in
 26369	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\the rolled after his successful libation-cum-potation, introducing an
 26370	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tatmosphere of drink into the soirée, boisterously trolling, like a
 26371	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tveritable son of a seacook:
 26372	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26373	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t     —The biscuits was as hard as brass
 26374	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t     And the beef as salt as Lot’s wife’s arse.
 26375	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t     O, Johnny Lever!
 26376	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t     Johnny Lever, O!
 26377	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26378	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tAfter which effusion the redoubtable specimen duly arrived on the scene
 26379	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand regaining his seat he sank rather than sat heavily on the form
 26380	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tprovided. Skin-the-Goat, assuming he was he, evidently with an axe to
 26381	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tgrind, was airing his grievances in a forcible-feeble philippic anent
 26382	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe natural resources of Ireland or something of that sort which he
 26383	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdescribed in his lengthy dissertation as the richest country bar none on
 26384	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe face of God’s earth, far and away superior to England, with coal in
 26385	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlarge quantities, six million pounds worth of pork exported every year,
 26386	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tten millions between butter and eggs and all the riches drained out of
 26387	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tit by England levying taxes on the poor people that paid through the
 26388	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tnose always and gobbling up the best meat in the market and a lot more
 26389	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsurplus steam in the same vein. Their conversation accordingly became
 26390	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tgeneral and all agreed that that was a fact. You could grow any mortal
 26391	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthing in Irish soil, he stated, and there was that colonel Everard down
 26392	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthere in Navan growing tobacco. Where would you find anywhere the like
 26393	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof Irish bacon? But a day of reckoning, he stated crescendo with no
 26394	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tuncertain voice, thoroughly monopolising all the conversation, was in
 26395	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tstore for mighty England, despite her power of pelf on account of her
 26396	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcrimes. There would be a fall and the greatest fall in history.
 26397	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThe Germans and the Japs were going to have their little lookin, he
 26398	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\taffirmed. The Boers were the beginning of the end. Brummagem England was
 26399	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttoppling already and her downfall would be Ireland, her Achilles heel,
 26400	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twhich he explained to them about the vulnerable point of Achilles, the
 26401	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tGreek hero, a point his auditors at once seized as he completely gripped
 26402	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttheir attention by showing the tendon referred to on his boot. His
 26403	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tadvice to every Irishman was: stay in the land of your birth and work
 26404	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfor Ireland and live for Ireland. Ireland, Parnell said, could not spare
 26405	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ta single one of her sons.
 26406	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26407	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tSilence all round marked the termination of his finale. The impervious
 26408	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tnavigator heard these lurid tidings, undismayed.
 26409	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26410	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Take a bit of doing, boss, retaliated that rough diamond palpably a bit
 26411	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpeeved in response to the foregoing truism.
 26412	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26413	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTo which cold douche referring to downfall and so on the keeper
 26414	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tconcurred but nevertheless held to his main view.
 26415	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26416	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Who’s the best troops in the army? the grizzled old veteran irately
 26417	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tinterrogated. And the best jumpers and racers? And the best admirals and
 26418	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tgenerals we’ve got? Tell me that.
 26419	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26420	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—The Irish, for choice, retorted the cabby like Campbell, facial
 26421	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tblemishes apart.
 26422	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26423	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—That’s right, the old tarpaulin corroborated. The Irish catholic
 26424	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpeasant. He’s the backbone of our empire. You know Jem Mullins?
 26425	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26426	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tWhile allowing him his individual opinions as everyman the keeper added
 26427	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\the cared nothing for any empire, ours or his, and considered no Irishman
 26428	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tworthy of his salt that served it. Then they began to have a few
 26429	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tirascible words when it waxed hotter, both, needless to say, appealing
 26430	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tto the listeners who followed the passage of arms with interest so long
 26431	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tas they didn’t indulge in recriminations and come to blows.
 26432	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26433	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tFrom inside information extending over a series of years Mr Bloom was
 26434	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\trather inclined to poohpooh the suggestion as egregious balderdash for,
 26435	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpending that consummation devoutly to be or not to be wished for, he was
 26436	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfully cognisant of the fact that their neighbours across the channel,
 26437	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tunless they were much bigger fools than he took them for, rather
 26438	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tconcealed their strength than the opposite. It was quite on a par with
 26439	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe quixotic idea in certain quarters that in a hundred million years
 26440	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe coal seam of the sister island would be played out and if, as
 26441	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttime went on, that turned out to be how the cat jumped all he could
 26442	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpersonally say on the matter was that as a host of contingencies,
 26443	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tequally relevant to the issue, might occur ere then it was highly
 26444	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tadvisable in the interim to try to make the most of both countries even
 26445	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthough poles apart. Another little interesting point, the amours of
 26446	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twhores and chummies, to put it in common parlance, reminded him Irish
 26447	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsoldiers had as often fought for England as against her, more so, in
 26448	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfact. And now, why? So the scene between the pair of them, the licensee
 26449	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof the place rumoured to be or have been Fitzharris, the famous
 26450	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tinvincible, and the other, obviously bogus, reminded him forcibly as
 26451	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbeing on all fours with the confidence trick, supposing, that is, it was
 26452	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tprearranged as the lookeron, a student of the human soul if anything,
 26453	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe others seeing least of the game. And as for the lessee or keeper,
 26454	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twho probably wasn’t the other person at all, he (B.) couldn’t help
 26455	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfeeling and most properly it was better to give people like that the
 26456	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tgoby unless you were a blithering idiot altogether and refuse to have
 26457	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tanything to do with them as a golden rule in private life and their
 26458	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfelonsetting, there always being the offchance of a Dannyman coming
 26459	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tforward and turning queen’s evidence or king’s now like Denis or Peter
 26460	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tCarey, an idea he utterly repudiated. Quite apart from that he disliked
 26461	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthose careers of wrongdoing and crime on principle. Yet, though such
 26462	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcriminal propensities had never been an inmate of his bosom in any
 26463	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tshape or form, he certainly did feel and no denying it (while inwardly
 26464	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tremaining what he was) a certain kind of admiration for a man who
 26465	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thad actually brandished a knife, cold steel, with the courage of his
 26466	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpolitical convictions (though, personally, he would never be a party to
 26467	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tany such thing), off the same bat as those love vendettas of the south,
 26468	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thave her or swing for her, when the husband frequently, after some words
 26469	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpassed between the two concerning her relations with the other lucky
 26470	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmortal (he having had the pair watched), inflicted fatal injuries on his
 26471	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tadored one as a result of an alternative postnuptial liaison by plunging
 26472	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\this knife into her, until it just struck him that Fitz, nicknamed
 26473	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tSkin-the-Goat, merely drove the car for the actual perpetrators of the
 26474	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\toutrage and so was not, if he was reliably informed, actually party to
 26475	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe ambush which, in point of fact, was the plea some legal luminary
 26476	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsaved his skin on. In any case that was very ancient history by now and
 26477	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tas for our friend, the pseudo Skin-the-etcetera, he had transparently
 26478	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\toutlived his welcome. He ought to have either died naturally or on
 26479	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe scaffold high. Like actresses, always farewell positively last
 26480	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tperformance then come up smiling again. Generous to a fault of course,
 26481	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttemperamental, no economising or any idea of the sort, always snapping
 26482	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tat the bone for the shadow. So similarly he had a very shrewd suspicion
 26483	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthat Mr Johnny Lever got rid of some £. s. d. in the course of his
 26484	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tperambulations round the docks in the congenial atmosphere of the Old
 26485	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tIreland tavern, come back to Erin and so on. Then as for the other he
 26486	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thad heard not so long before the same identical lingo as he told Stephen
 26487	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thow he simply but effectually silenced the offender.
 26488	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26489	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—He took umbrage at something or other, that muchinjured but on the
 26490	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twhole eventempered person declared, I let slip. He called me a jew and
 26491	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tin a heated fashion offensively. So I without deviating from plain facts
 26492	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tin the least told him his God, I mean Christ, was a jew too and all his
 26493	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfamily like me though in reality I’m not. That was one for him. A soft
 26494	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tanswer turns away wrath. He hadn’t a word to say for himself as everyone
 26495	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsaw. Am I not right?
 26496	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26497	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHe turned a long you are wrong gaze on Stephen of timorous dark pride
 26498	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tat the soft impeachment with a glance also of entreaty for he seemed to
 26499	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tglean in a kind of a way that it wasn’t all exactly.
 26500	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26501	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Ex quibus, Stephen mumbled in a noncommittal accent, their two or four
 26502	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\teyes conversing, Christus or Bloom his name is or after all any other,
 26503	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsecundum carnem.
 26504	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26505	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Of course, Mr B. proceeded to stipulate, you must look at both sides of
 26506	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe question. It is hard to lay down any hard and fast rules as to right
 26507	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand wrong but room for improvement all round there certainly is
 26508	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthough every country, they say, our own distressful included, has the
 26509	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tgovernment it deserves. But with a little goodwill all round. It’s all
 26510	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tvery fine to boast of mutual superiority but what about mutual equality.
 26511	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tI resent violence and intolerance in any shape or form. It never
 26512	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\treaches anything or stops anything. A revolution must come on the due
 26513	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tinstalments plan. It’s a patent absurdity on the face of it to hate
 26514	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpeople because they live round the corner and speak another vernacular,
 26515	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tin the next house so to speak.
 26516	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26517	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Memorable bloody bridge battle and seven minutes’ war, Stephen
 26518	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tassented, between Skinner’s alley and Ormond market.
 26519	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26520	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tYes, Mr Bloom thoroughly agreed, entirely endorsing the remark, that
 26521	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twas overwhelmingly right. And the whole world was full of that sort of
 26522	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthing.
 26523	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26524	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—You just took the words out of my mouth, he said. A hocuspocus of
 26525	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tconflicting evidence that candidly you couldn’t remotely...
 26526	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26527	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tAll those wretched quarrels, in his humble opinion, stirring up
 26528	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbad blood, from some bump of combativeness or gland of some kind,
 26529	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\terroneously supposed to be about a punctilio of honour and a flag, were
 26530	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tvery largely a question of the money question which was at the back of
 26531	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\teverything greed and jealousy, people never knowing when to stop.
 26532	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26533	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—They accuse, remarked he audibly.
 26534	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26535	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHe turned away from the others who probably and spoke nearer to, so as
 26536	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe others in case they.
 26537	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26538	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Jews, he softly imparted in an aside in Stephen’s ear, are accused of
 26539	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\truining. Not a vestige of truth in it, I can safely say. History, would
 26540	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tyou be surprised to learn, proves up to the hilt Spain decayed when the
 26541	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tinquisition hounded the jews out and England prospered when Cromwell,
 26542	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tan uncommonly able ruffian who in other respects has much to answer for,
 26543	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\timported them. Why? Because they are imbued with the proper spirit. They
 26544	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tare practical and are proved to be so. I don’t want to indulge in any
 26545	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbecause you know the standard works on the subject and then orthodox as
 26546	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tyou are. But in the economic, not touching religion, domain the priest
 26547	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tspells poverty. Spain again, you saw in the war, compared with goahead
 26548	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tAmerica. Turks. It’s in the dogma. Because if they didn’t believe they’d
 26549	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tgo straight to heaven when they die they’d try to live better, at least
 26550	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tso I think. That’s the juggle on which the p.p.‘s raise the wind
 26551	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ton false pretences. I’m, he resumed with dramatic force, as good an
 26552	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tIrishman as that rude person I told you about at the outset and I want
 26553	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tto see everyone, concluded he, all creeds and classes pro rata having a
 26554	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcomfortable tidysized income, in no niggard fashion either, something
 26555	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tin the neighbourhood of £ 300 per annum. That’s the vital issue at stake
 26556	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand it’s feasible and would be provocative of friendlier intercourse
 26557	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbetween man and man. At least that’s my idea for what it’s worth. I
 26558	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcall that patriotism. Ubi patria, as we learned a smattering of in our
 26559	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tclassical days in Alma Mater, vita bene. Where you can live well, the
 26560	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsense is, if you work.
 26561	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26562	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tOver his untastable apology for a cup of coffee, listening to this
 26563	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsynopsis of things in general, Stephen stared at nothing in particular.
 26564	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHe could hear, of course, all kinds of words changing colour like those
 26565	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcrabs about Ringsend in the morning burrowing quickly into all colours
 26566	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof different sorts of the same sand where they had a home somewhere
 26567	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbeneath or seemed to. Then he looked up and saw the eyes that said or
 26568	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdidn’t say the words the voice he heard said, if you work.
 26569	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26570	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Count me out, he managed to remark, meaning work.
 26571	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26572	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThe eyes were surprised at this observation because as he, the person
 26573	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twho owned them pro tem. observed or rather his voice speaking did, all
 26574	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmust work, have to, together.
 26575	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26576	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—I mean, of course, the other hastened to affirm, work in the widest
 26577	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpossible sense. Also literary labour not merely for the kudos of
 26578	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe thing. Writing for the newspapers which is the readiest channel
 26579	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tnowadays. That’s work too. Important work. After all, from the little
 26580	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tI know of you, after all the money expended on your education you are
 26581	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tentitled to recoup yourself and command your price. You have every bit
 26582	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tas much right to live by your pen in pursuit of your philosophy as the
 26583	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpeasant has. What? You both belong to Ireland, the brain and the brawn.
 26584	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tEach is equally important.
 26585	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26586	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—You suspect, Stephen retorted with a sort of a half laugh, that I
 26587	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmay be important because I belong to the faubourg Saint Patrice called
 26588	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tIreland for short.
 26589	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26590	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—I would go a step farther, Mr Bloom insinuated.
 26591	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26592	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—But I suspect, Stephen interrupted, that Ireland must be important
 26593	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbecause it belongs to me.
 26594	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26595	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—What belongs, queried Mr Bloom bending, fancying he was perhaps under
 26596	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsome misapprehension. Excuse me. Unfortunately, I didn’t catch the
 26597	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlatter portion. What was it you...?
 26598	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26599	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tStephen, patently crosstempered, repeated and shoved aside his mug of
 26600	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcoffee or whatever you like to call it none too politely, adding:
 26601	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26602	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—We can’t change the country. Let us change the subject.
 26603	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26604	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tAt this pertinent suggestion Mr Bloom, to change the subject, looked
 26605	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdown but in a quandary, as he couldn’t tell exactly what construction
 26606	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tto put on belongs to which sounded rather a far cry. The rebuke of some
 26607	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tkind was clearer than the other part. Needless to say the fumes of
 26608	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\this recent orgy spoke then with some asperity in a curious bitter way
 26609	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tforeign to his sober state. Probably the homelife to which Mr B attached
 26610	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe utmost importance had not been all that was needful or he hadn’t
 26611	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbeen familiarised with the right sort of people. With a touch of fear
 26612	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfor the young man beside him whom he furtively scrutinised with an air
 26613	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof some consternation remembering he had just come back from Paris,
 26614	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe eyes more especially reminding him forcibly of father and sister,
 26615	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfailing to throw much light on the subject, however, he brought to mind
 26616	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tinstances of cultured fellows that promised so brilliantly nipped in the
 26617	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbud of premature decay and nobody to blame but themselves. For instance
 26618	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthere was the case of O’Callaghan, for one, the halfcrazy faddist,
 26619	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\trespectably connected though of inadequate means, with his mad vagaries
 26620	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tamong whose other gay doings when rotto and making himself a nuisance
 26621	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tto everybody all round he was in the habit of ostentatiously sporting
 26622	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tin public a suit of brown paper (a fact). And then the usual dénouement
 26623	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tafter the fun had gone on fast and furious he got landed into hot water
 26624	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand had to be spirited away by a few friends, after a strong hint to a
 26625	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tblind horse from John Mallon of Lower Castle Yard, so as not to be made
 26626	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tamenable under section two of the criminal law amendment act, certain
 26627	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tnames of those subpœnaed being handed in but not divulged for reasons
 26628	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twhich will occur to anyone with a pick of brains. Briefly, putting two
 26629	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand two together, six sixteen which he pointedly turned a deaf ear to,
 26630	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tAntonio and so forth, jockeys and esthetes and the tattoo which was
 26631	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tall the go in the seventies or thereabouts even in the house of lords
 26632	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbecause early in life the occupant of the throne, then heir apparent,
 26633	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe other members of the upper ten and other high personages simply
 26634	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfollowing in the footsteps of the head of the state, he reflected about
 26635	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe errors of notorieties and crowned heads running counter to morality
 26636	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsuch as the Cornwall case a number of years before under their veneer in
 26637	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ta way scarcely intended by nature, a thing good Mrs Grundy, as the law
 26638	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tstands, was terribly down on though not for the reason they thought
 26639	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthey were probably whatever it was except women chiefly who were always
 26640	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfiddling more or less at one another it being largely a matter of
 26641	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdress and all the rest of it. Ladies who like distinctive underclothing
 26642	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tshould, and every welltailored man must, trying to make the gap wider
 26643	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbetween them by innuendo and give more of a genuine filip to acts of
 26644	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\timpropriety between the two, she unbuttoned his and then he untied her,
 26645	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmind the pin, whereas savages in the cannibal islands, say, at ninety
 26646	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdegrees in the shade not caring a continental. However, reverting to the
 26647	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\toriginal, there were on the other hand others who had forced their way
 26648	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tto the top from the lowest rung by the aid of their bootstraps. Sheer
 26649	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tforce of natural genius, that. With brains, sir.
 26650	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26651	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tFor which and further reasons he felt it was his interest and duty even
 26652	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tto wait on and profit by the unlookedfor occasion though why he could
 26653	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tnot exactly tell being as it was already several shillings to the
 26654	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbad having in fact let himself in for it. Still to cultivate the
 26655	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tacquaintance of someone of no uncommon calibre who could provide food
 26656	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfor reflection would amply repay any small. Intellectual stimulation,
 26657	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tas such, was, he felt, from time to time a firstrate tonic for the mind.
 26658	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tAdded to which was the coincidence of meeting, discussion, dance, row,
 26659	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\told salt of the here today and gone tomorrow type, night loafers, the
 26660	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twhole galaxy of events, all went to make up a miniature cameo of the
 26661	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tworld we live in especially as the lives of the submerged tenth, viz.
 26662	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcoalminers, divers, scavengers etc., were very much under the microscope
 26663	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlately. To improve the shining hour he wondered whether he might meet
 26664	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twith anything approaching the same luck as Mr Philip Beaufoy if taken
 26665	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdown in writing suppose he were to pen something out of the common
 26666	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tgroove (as he fully intended doing) at the rate of one guinea per
 26667	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcolumn. My Experiences, let us say, in a Cabman’s Shelter.
 26668	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26669	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThe pink edition extra sporting of the Telegraph tell a graphic lie
 26670	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlay, as luck would have it, beside his elbow and as he was just puzzling
 26671	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tagain, far from satisfied, over a country belonging to him and the
 26672	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpreceding rebus the vessel came from Bridgwater and the postcard was
 26673	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\taddressed A. Boudin find the captain’s age, his eyes went aimlessly
 26674	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tover the respective captions which came under his special province the
 26675	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tallembracing give us this day our daily press. First he got a bit of a
 26676	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tstart but it turned out to be only something about somebody named H.
 26677	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdu Boyes, agent for typewriters or something like that. Great battle,
 26678	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTokio. Lovemaking in Irish, £ 200 damages. Gordon Bennett. Emigration
 26679	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tSwindle. Letter from His Grace. William &#10016;. Ascot meeting, the Gold Cup.
 26680	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tVictory of outsider Throwaway recalls Derby of ‘92 when Capt. Marshall’s
 26681	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdark horse Sir Hugo captured the blue ribband at long odds. New York
 26682	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdisaster. Thousand lives lost. Foot and Mouth. Funeral of the late Mr
 26683	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tPatrick Dignam.
 26684	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26685	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tSo to change the subject he read about Dignam R. I. P. which, he
 26686	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\treflected, was anything but a gay sendoff. Or a change of address
 26687	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tanyway.
 26688	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26689	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—This morning (Hynes put it in of course) the remains of the late Mr
 26690	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tPatrick Dignam were removed from his residence, no 9 Newbridge Avenue,
 26691	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tSandymount, for interment in Glasnevin. The deceased gentleman was a
 26692	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmost popular and genial personality in city life and his demise after a
 26693	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbrief illness came as a great shock to citizens of all classes by whom
 26694	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\the is deeply regretted. The obsequies, at which many friends of the
 26695	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdeceased were present, were carried out (certainly Hynes wrote it with
 26696	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ta nudge from Corny) by Messrs H. J. O’Neill and Son, 164 North Strand
 26697	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tRoad. The mourners included: Patk. Dignam (son), Bernard Corrigan
 26698	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(brother-in-law), Jno. Henry Menton, solr, Martin Cunningham, John
 26699	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tPower, eatondph 1/8 ador dorador douradora (must be where he called
 26700	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMonks the dayfather about Keyes’s ad) Thomas Kernan, Simon Dedalus,
 26701	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tStephen Dedalus B. A., Edw. J. Lambert, Cornelius T. Kelleher, Joseph
 26702	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tM’C Hynes, L. Boom, CP M’Coy,—M’Intosh and several others.
 26703	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26704	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tNettled not a little by L. Boom (as it incorrectly stated) and the line
 26705	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof bitched type but tickled to death simultaneously by C. P. M’Coy and
 26706	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tStephen Dedalus B. A. who were conspicuous, needless to say, by their
 26707	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttotal absence (to say nothing of M’Intosh) L. Boom pointed it out to his
 26708	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcompanion B. A. engaged in stifling another yawn, half nervousness, not
 26709	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tforgetting the usual crop of nonsensical howlers of misprints.
 26710	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26711	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Is that first epistle to the Hebrews, he asked as soon as his bottom
 26712	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tjaw would let him, in? Text: open thy mouth and put thy foot in it.
 26713	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26714	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—It is. Really, Mr Bloom said (though first he fancied he alluded to the
 26715	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tarchbishop till he added about foot and mouth with which there could
 26716	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbe no possible connection) overjoyed to set his mind at rest and a bit
 26717	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tflabbergasted at Myles Crawford’s after all managing to. There.
 26718	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26719	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tWhile the other was reading it on page two Boom (to give him for the
 26720	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tnonce his new misnomer) whiled away a few odd leisure moments in fits
 26721	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand starts with the account of the third event at Ascot on page three,
 26722	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\this side. Value 1000 sovs with 3000 sovs in specie added. For
 26723	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tentire colts and fillies. Mr F. Alexander’s Throwaway, b. h. by
 26724	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tRightaway-Thrale, 5 yrs, 9 st 4 lbs (W. Lane) 1, lord Howard de Walden’s
 26725	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tZinfandel (M. Cannon) 2, Mr W. Bass’s Sceptre 3. Betting 5 to 4 on
 26726	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tZinfandel, 20 to 1 Throwaway (off). Sceptre a shade heavier, 5 to 4 on
 26727	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tZinfandel, 20 to 1 Throwaway (off). Throwaway and Zinfandel stood close
 26728	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\torder. It was anybody’s race then the rank outsider drew to the fore,
 26729	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tgot long lead, beating lord Howard de Walden’s chestnut colt and Mr
 26730	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tW. Bass’s bay filly Sceptre on a 2 1/2 mile course. Winner trained by
 26731	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBraime so that Lenehan’s version of the business was all pure buncombe.
 26732	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tSecured the verdict cleverly by a length. 1000 sovs with 3000 in specie.
 26733	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tAlso ran: J de Bremond’s (French horse Bantam Lyons was anxiously
 26734	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tinquiring after not in yet but expected any minute) Maximum II.
 26735	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tDifferent ways of bringing off a coup. Lovemaking damages. Though that
 26736	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thalfbaked Lyons ran off at a tangent in his impetuosity to get left. Of
 26737	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcourse gambling eminently lent itself to that sort of thing though as
 26738	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe event turned out the poor fool hadn’t much reason to congratulate
 26739	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thimself on his pick, the forlorn hope. Guesswork it reduced itself to
 26740	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\teventually.
 26741	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26742	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—There was every indication they would arrive at that, he, Bloom, said.
 26743	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26744	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Who? the other, whose hand by the way was hurt, said.
 26745	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26746	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tOne morning you would open the paper, the cabman affirmed, and read:
 26747	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tReturn of Parnell. He bet them what they liked. A Dublin fusilier was in
 26748	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthat shelter one night and said he saw him in South Africa. Pride it was
 26749	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tkilled him. He ought to have done away with himself or lain low for a
 26750	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttime after committee room no 15 until he was his old self again with
 26751	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tno-one to point a finger at him. Then they would all to a man have gone
 26752	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdown on their marrowbones to him to come back when he had recovered
 26753	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\this senses. Dead he wasn’t. Simply absconded somewhere. The coffin they
 26754	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbrought over was full of stones. He changed his name to De Wet, the Boer
 26755	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tgeneral. He made a mistake to fight the priests. And so forth and so on.
 26756	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26757	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tAll the same Bloom (properly so dubbed) was rather surprised at their
 26758	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmemories for in nine cases out of ten it was a case of tarbarrels and
 26759	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tnot singly but in their thousands and then complete oblivion because it
 26760	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twas twenty odd years. Highly unlikely of course there was even a shadow
 26761	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof truth in the stones and, even supposing, he thought a return highly
 26762	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tinadvisable, all things considered. Something evidently riled them in
 26763	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\this death. Either he petered out too tamely of acute pneumonia just when
 26764	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\this various different political arrangements were nearing completion
 26765	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tor whether it transpired he owed his death to his having neglected to
 26766	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tchange his boots and clothes after a wetting when a cold resulted and
 26767	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfailing to consult a specialist he being confined to his room till he
 26768	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\teventually died of it amid widespread regret before a fortnight was at
 26769	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tan end or quite possibly they were distressed to find the job was taken
 26770	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tout of their hands. Of course nobody being acquainted with his movements
 26771	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\teven before there was absolutely no clue as to his whereabouts which
 26772	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twere decidedly of the Alice, where art thou order even prior to his
 26773	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tstarting to go under several aliases such as Fox and Stewart so the
 26774	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tremark which emanated from friend cabby might be within the bounds of
 26775	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpossibility. Naturally then it would prey on his mind as a born leader
 26776	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof men which undoubtedly he was and a commanding figure, a sixfooter
 26777	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tor at any rate five feet ten or eleven in his stockinged feet, whereas
 26778	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMessrs So and So who, though they weren’t even a patch on the former
 26779	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tman, ruled the roost after their redeeming features were very few and
 26780	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfar between. It certainly pointed a moral, the idol with feet of clay,
 26781	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand then seventytwo of his trusty henchmen rounding on him with mutual
 26782	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmudslinging. And the identical same with murderers. You had to come
 26783	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tback. That haunting sense kind of drew you. To show the understudy in
 26784	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe title rôle how to. He saw him once on the auspicious occasion when
 26785	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthey broke up the type in the Insuppressible or was it United Ireland,
 26786	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ta privilege he keenly appreciated, and, in point of fact, handed him his
 26787	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsilk hat when it was knocked off and he said Thank you, excited as he
 26788	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tundoubtedly was under his frigid exterior notwithstanding the little
 26789	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmisadventure mentioned between the cup and the lip: what’s bred in the
 26790	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbone. Still as regards return. You were a lucky dog if they didn’t set
 26791	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe terrier at you directly you got back. Then a lot of shillyshally
 26792	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tusually followed, Tom for and Dick and Harry against. And then, number
 26793	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tone, you came up against the man in possession and had to produce your
 26794	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcredentials like the claimant in the Tichborne case, Roger Charles
 26795	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTichborne, Bella was the boat’s name to the best of his recollection
 26796	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\the, the heir, went down in as the evidence went to show and there was
 26797	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ta tattoo mark too in Indian ink, lord Bellew was it, as he might very
 26798	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\teasily have picked up the details from some pal on board ship and then,
 26799	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twhen got up to tally with the description given, introduce himself with:
 26800	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tExcuse me, my name is So and So or some such commonplace remark. A more
 26801	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tprudent course, as Bloom said to the not over effusive, in fact like the
 26802	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdistinguished personage under discussion beside him, would have been to
 26803	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsound the lie of the land first.
 26804	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26805	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—That bitch, that English whore, did for him, the shebeen proprietor
 26806	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcommented. She put the first nail in his coffin.
 26807	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26808	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Fine lump of a woman all the same, the soi-disant townclerk Henry
 26809	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tCampbell remarked, and plenty of her. She loosened many a man’s thighs.
 26810	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tI seen her picture in a barber’s. The husband was a captain or an
 26811	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tofficer.
 26812	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26813	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Ay, Skin-the-Goat amusingly added, he was and a cottonball one.
 26814	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26815	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThis gratuitous contribution of a humorous character occasioned a fair
 26816	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tamount of laughter among his entourage. As regards Bloom he, without the
 26817	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfaintest suspicion of a smile, merely gazed in the direction of the door
 26818	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand reflected upon the historic story which had aroused extraordinary
 26819	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tinterest at the time when the facts, to make matters worse, were made
 26820	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpublic with the usual affectionate letters that passed between them full
 26821	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof sweet nothings. First it was strictly Platonic till nature intervened
 26822	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand an attachment sprang up between them till bit by bit matters came to
 26823	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ta climax and the matter became the talk of the town till the staggering
 26824	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tblow came as a welcome intelligence to not a few evildisposed, however,
 26825	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twho were resolved upon encompassing his downfall though the thing was
 26826	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpublic property all along though not to anything like the sensational
 26827	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\textent that it subsequently blossomed into. Since their names were
 26828	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcoupled, though, since he was her declared favourite, where was the
 26829	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tparticular necessity to proclaim it to the rank and file from the
 26830	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thousetops, the fact, namely, that he had shared her bedroom which came
 26831	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tout in the witnessbox on oath when a thrill went through the packed
 26832	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcourt literally electrifying everybody in the shape of witnesses
 26833	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tswearing to having witnessed him on such and such a particular date in
 26834	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe act of scrambling out of an upstairs apartment with the assistance
 26835	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof a ladder in night apparel, having gained admittance in the same
 26836	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfashion, a fact the weeklies, addicted to the lubric a little, simply
 26837	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcoined shoals of money out of. Whereas the simple fact of the case was
 26838	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tit was simply a case of the husband not being up to the scratch, with
 26839	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tnothing in common between them beyond the name, and then a real man
 26840	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tarriving on the scene, strong to the verge of weakness, falling a victim
 26841	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tto her siren charms and forgetting home ties, the usual sequel, to bask
 26842	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tin the loved one’s smiles. The eternal question of the life connubial,
 26843	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tneedless to say, cropped up. Can real love, supposing there happens to
 26844	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbe another chap in the case, exist between married folk? Poser.
 26845	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThough it was no concern of theirs absolutely if he regarded her with
 26846	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\taffection, carried away by a wave of folly. A magnificent specimen of
 26847	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmanhood he was truly augmented obviously by gifts of a high order, as
 26848	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcompared with the other military supernumerary that is (who was just the
 26849	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tusual everyday farewell, my gallant captain kind of an individual in
 26850	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe light dragoons, the 18th hussars to be accurate) and inflammable
 26851	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdoubtless (the fallen leader, that is, not the other) in his own
 26852	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpeculiar way which she of course, woman, quickly perceived as highly
 26853	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlikely to carve his way to fame which he almost bid fair to do till the
 26854	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpriests and ministers of the gospel as a whole, his erstwhile staunch
 26855	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tadherents, and his beloved evicted tenants for whom he had done yeoman
 26856	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tservice in the rural parts of the country by taking up the cudgels on
 26857	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttheir behalf in a way that exceeded their most sanguine expectations,
 26858	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tvery effectually cooked his matrimonial goose, thereby heaping coals of
 26859	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfire on his head much in the same way as the fabled ass’s kick. Looking
 26860	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tback now in a retrospective kind of arrangement all seemed a kind of
 26861	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdream. And then coming back was the worst thing you ever did because it
 26862	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twent without saying you would feel out of place as things always moved
 26863	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twith the times. Why, as he reflected, Irishtown strand, a locality he
 26864	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thad not been in for quite a number of years looked different somehow
 26865	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsince, as it happened, he went to reside on the north side. North or
 26866	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsouth, however, it was just the wellknown case of hot passion, pure and
 26867	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsimple, upsetting the applecart with a vengeance and just bore out the
 26868	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tvery thing he was saying as she also was Spanish or half so, types that
 26869	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twouldn’t do things by halves, passionate abandon of the south, casting
 26870	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tevery shred of decency to the winds.
 26871	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26872	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Just bears out what I was saying, he, with glowing bosom said to
 26873	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tStephen, about blood and the sun. And, if I don’t greatly mistake she
 26874	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twas Spanish too.
 26875	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26876	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—The king of Spain’s daughter, Stephen answered, adding something or
 26877	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tother rather muddled about farewell and adieu to you Spanish onions and
 26878	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe first land called the Deadman and from Ramhead to Scilly was so and
 26879	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tso many.
 26880	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26881	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Was she? Bloom ejaculated, surprised though not astonished by any
 26882	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmeans, I never heard that rumour before. Possible, especially there, it
 26883	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twas as she lived there. So, Spain.
 26884	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26885	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tCarefully avoiding a book in his pocket Sweets of, which reminded him
 26886	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tby the by of that Capel street library book out of date, he took out his
 26887	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpocketbook and, turning over the various contents it contained rapidly
 26888	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfinally he.
 26889	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26890	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Do you consider, by the by, he said, thoughtfully selecting a faded
 26891	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tphoto which he laid on the table, that a Spanish type?
 26892	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26893	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tStephen, obviously addressed, looked down on the photo showing a large
 26894	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsized lady with her fleshy charms on evidence in an open fashion as she
 26895	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twas in the full bloom of womanhood in evening dress cut ostentatiously
 26896	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlow for the occasion to give a liberal display of bosom, with more than
 26897	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tvision of breasts, her full lips parted and some perfect teeth, standing
 26898	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tnear, ostensibly with gravity, a piano on the rest of which was In Old
 26899	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMadrid, a ballad, pretty in its way, which was then all the vogue. Her
 26900	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(the lady’s) eyes, dark, large, looked at Stephen, about to smile about
 26901	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsomething to be admired, Lafayette of Westmoreland street, Dublin’s
 26902	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpremier photographic artist, being responsible for the esthetic
 26903	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\texecution.
 26904	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26905	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Mrs Bloom, my wife the prima donna Madam Marion Tweedy, Bloom
 26906	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tindicated. Taken a few years since. In or about ninety six. Very like
 26907	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ther then.
 26908	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 26909	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBeside the young man he looked also at the photo of the lady now his
 26910	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlegal wife who, he intimated, was the accomplished daughter of Major
 26911	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBrian Tweedy and displayed at an early age remarkable proficiency as a
 26912	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsinger having even made her bow to the public when her years numbered
 26913	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbarely sweet sixteen. As for the face it was a speaking likeness in
 26914	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\texpression but it did not do justice to her figure which came in for a
 26915	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlot of notice usually and which did not come out to the best advantage
 26916	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tin that getup. She could without difficulty, he said, have posed for the
 26917	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tensemble, not to dwell on certain opulent curves of the. He dwelt, being
 26918	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ta bit of an artist in his spare time, on the female form in general
 26919	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdevelopmentally because, as it so happened, no later than that afternoon
 26920	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\the had seen those Grecian statues, perfectly developed as works of art,
 26921	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tin the National Museum. Marble could give the original, shoulders, back,
 26922	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tall the symmetry, all the rest. Yes, puritanisme, it does though Saint
 26923	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tJoseph’s sovereign thievery alors (Bandez!) Figne toi trop. Whereas no
 26924	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tphoto could because it simply wasn’t art in a word.

 26926	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThe spirit moving him he would much have liked to follow Jack Tar’s good

 26931	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tetiquette so. Though it was a warm pleasant sort of a night now yet

 26933	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tAnd he did feel a kind of need there and then to follow suit like a

 27029	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t

 27059	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27060	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tLiterally astounded at this piece of intelligence Bloom reflected.

 27143	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tAll kinds of Utopian plans were flashing through his (B’s) busy brain,

 27177	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tSand in the Red Sea done that. One time I could read a book in the dark,
 27178	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmanner of speaking. The Arabian Nights Entertainment was my favourite
 27179	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand Red as a Rose is She.

 27181	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHereupon he pawed the journal open and pored upon Lord only knows what,
