 27190	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27191	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTo cut a long story short Bloom, grasping the situation, was the first
 27192	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tto rise from his seat so as not to outstay their welcome having first
 27193	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand foremost, being as good as his word that he would foot the bill for
 27194	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe occasion, taken the wise precaution to unobtrusively motion to mine
 27195	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thost as a parting shot a scarcely perceptible sign when the others were
 27196	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tnot looking to the effect that the amount due was forthcoming, making a
 27197	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tgrand total of fourpence (the amount he deposited unobtrusively in
 27198	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfour coppers, literally the last of the Mohicans), he having previously
 27199	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tspotted on the printed pricelist for all who ran to read opposite him
 27200	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tin unmistakable figures, coffee 2d, confectionery do, and honestly well
 27201	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tworth twice the money once in a way, as Wetherup used to remark.
 27202	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27203	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Come, he counselled to close the séance.
 27204	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27205	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tSeeing that the ruse worked and the coast was clear they left the
 27206	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tshelter or shanty together and the élite society of oilskin and company
 27207	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twhom nothing short of an earthquake would move out of their dolce far
 27208	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tniente. Stephen, who confessed to still feeling poorly and fagged out,
 27209	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpaused at the, for a moment, the door.
 27210	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27211	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—One thing I never understood, he said to be original on the spur of the
 27212	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmoment. Why they put tables upside down at night, I mean chairs upside
 27213	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdown, on the tables in cafés. To which impromptu the neverfailing Bloom
 27214	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\treplied without a moment’s hesitation, saying straight off:
 27215	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27216	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—To sweep the floor in the morning.
 27217	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27218	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tSo saying he skipped around, nimbly considering, frankly at the same
 27219	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttime apologetic to get on his companion’s right, a habit of his, by the
 27220	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbye, his right side being, in classical idiom, his tender Achilles. The
 27221	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tnight air was certainly now a treat to breathe though Stephen was a bit
 27222	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tweak on his pins.
 27223	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27224	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—It will (the air) do you good, Bloom said, meaning also the walk, in
 27225	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ta moment. The only thing is to walk then you’ll feel a different man.
 27226	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tCome. It’s not far. Lean on me.
 27227	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27228	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tAccordingly he passed his left arm in Stephen’s right and led him on
 27229	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\taccordingly.
 27230	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27231	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Yes, Stephen said uncertainly because he thought he felt a strange kind
 27232	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof flesh of a different man approach him, sinewless and wobbly and all
 27233	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthat.
 27234	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27235	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tAnyhow they passed the sentrybox with stones, brazier etc. where
 27236	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe municipal supernumerary, ex Gumley, was still to all intents and
 27237	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpurposes wrapped in the arms of Murphy, as the adage has it, dreaming
 27238	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof fresh fields and pastures new. And apropos of coffin of stones the
 27239	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tanalogy was not at all bad as it was in fact a stoning to death on the
 27240	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpart of seventytwo out of eighty odd constituencies that ratted at the
 27241	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttime of the split and chiefly the belauded peasant class, probably the
 27242	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tselfsame evicted tenants he had put in their holdings.
 27243	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27244	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tSo they turned on to chatting about music, a form of art for which
 27245	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBloom, as a pure amateur, possessed the greatest love, as they made
 27246	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttracks arm in arm across Beresford place. Wagnerian music, though
 27247	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tconfessedly grand in its way, was a bit too heavy for Bloom and hard
 27248	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tto follow at the first go-off but the music of Mercadante’s Huguenots,
 27249	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMeyerbeer’s Seven Last Words on the Cross and Mozart’s Twelfth Mass he
 27250	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsimply revelled in, the Gloria in that being, to his mind, the acme of
 27251	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfirst class music as such, literally knocking everything else into a
 27252	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcocked hat. He infinitely preferred the sacred music of the catholic
 27253	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tchurch to anything the opposite shop could offer in that line such
 27254	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tas those Moody and Sankey hymns or Bid me to live and I will live thy
 27255	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tprotestant to be. He also yielded to none in his admiration of Rossini’s
 27256	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tStabat Mater, a work simply abounding in immortal numbers, in which his
 27257	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twife, Madam Marion Tweedy, made a hit, a veritable sensation, he might
 27258	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsafely say, greatly adding to her other laurels and putting the others
 27259	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttotally in the shade, in the jesuit fathers’ church in upper Gardiner
 27260	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tstreet, the sacred edifice being thronged to the doors to hear her with
 27261	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tvirtuosos, or virtuosi rather. There was the unanimous opinion that
 27262	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthere was none to come up to her and suffice it to say in a place of
 27263	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tworship for music of a sacred character there was a generally voiced
 27264	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdesire for an encore. On the whole though favouring preferably light
 27265	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\topera of the Don Giovanni description and Martha, a gem in its line,
 27266	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\the had a penchant, though with only a surface knowledge, for the severe
 27267	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tclassical school such as Mendelssohn. And talking of that, taking it
 27268	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfor granted he knew all about the old favourites, he mentioned par
 27269	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\texcellence Lionel’s air in Martha, M’appari, which, curiously enough, he
 27270	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thad heard or overheard, to be more accurate, on yesterday, a privilege
 27271	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\the keenly appreciated, from the lips of Stephen’s respected father, sung
 27272	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tto perfection, a study of the number, in fact, which made all the others
 27273	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttake a back seat. Stephen, in reply to a politely put query, said he
 27274	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdidn’t sing it but launched out into praises of Shakespeare’s songs,
 27275	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tat least of in or about that period, the lutenist Dowland who lived
 27276	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tin Fetter lane near Gerard the herbalist, who anno ludendo hausi,
 27277	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tDoulandus, an instrument he was contemplating purchasing from Mr Arnold
 27278	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tDolmetsch, whom B. did not quite recall though the name certainly
 27279	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsounded familiar, for sixtyfive guineas and Farnaby and son with their
 27280	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdux and comes conceits and Byrd (William) who played the virginals,
 27281	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\the said, in the Queen’s chapel or anywhere else he found them and one
 27282	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTomkins who made toys or airs and John Bull.
 27283	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27284	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tOn the roadway which they were approaching whilst still speaking beyond
 27285	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe swingchains a horse, dragging a sweeper, paced on the paven ground,
 27286	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbrushing a long swathe of mire up so that with the noise Bloom was not
 27287	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tperfectly certain whether he had caught aright the allusion to sixtyfive
 27288	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tguineas and John Bull. He inquired if it was John Bull the political
 27289	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcelebrity of that ilk, as it struck him, the two identical names, as a
 27290	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tstriking coincidence.
 27291	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27292	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBy the chains the horse slowly swerved to turn, which perceiving, Bloom,
 27293	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twho was keeping a sharp lookout as usual, plucked the other’s sleeve
 27294	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tgently, jocosely remarking:
 27295	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27296	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—Our lives are in peril tonight. Beware of the steamroller.
 27297	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27298	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThey thereupon stopped. Bloom looked at the head of a horse not worth
 27299	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tanything like sixtyfive guineas, suddenly in evidence in the dark quite
 27300	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tnear so that it seemed new, a different grouping of bones and even flesh
 27301	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbecause palpably it was a fourwalker, a hipshaker, a blackbuttocker, a
 27302	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttaildangler, a headhanger putting his hind foot foremost the while the
 27303	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlord of his creation sat on the perch, busy with his thoughts. But such
 27304	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ta good poor brute he was sorry he hadn’t a lump of sugar but, as he
 27305	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twisely reflected, you could scarcely be prepared for every emergency
 27306	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthat might crop up. He was just a big nervous foolish noodly kind of a
 27307	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thorse, without a second care in the world. But even a dog, he reflected,
 27308	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttake that mongrel in Barney Kiernan’s, of the same size, would be a holy
 27309	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thorror to face. But it was no animal’s fault in particular if he was
 27310	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbuilt that way like the camel, ship of the desert, distilling grapes
 27311	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tinto potheen in his hump. Nine tenths of them all could be caged or
 27312	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttrained, nothing beyond the art of man barring the bees. Whale with a
 27313	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tharpoon hairpin, alligator tickle the small of his back and he sees the
 27314	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tjoke, chalk a circle for a rooster, tiger my eagle eye. These timely
 27315	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\treflections anent the brutes of the field occupied his mind somewhat
 27316	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdistracted from Stephen’s words while the ship of the street was
 27317	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmanœuvring and Stephen went on about the highly interesting old.
 27318	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27319	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t—What’s this I was saying? Ah, yes! My wife, he intimated, plunging
 27320	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tin medias res, would have the greatest of pleasure in making your
 27321	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tacquaintance as she is passionately attached to music of any kind.
 27322	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27323	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHe looked sideways in a friendly fashion at the sideface of Stephen,
 27324	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\timage of his mother, which was not quite the same as the usual handsome
 27325	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tblackguard type they unquestionably had an insatiable hankering after as
 27326	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\the was perhaps not that way built.
 27327	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27328	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tStill, supposing he had his father’s gift as he more than suspected,
 27329	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tit opened up new vistas in his mind such as Lady Fingall’s Irish
 27330	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tindustries, concert on the preceding Monday, and aristocracy in general.
 27331	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27332	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tExquisite variations he was now describing on an air Youth here has End
 27333	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tby Jans Pieter Sweelinck, a Dutchman of Amsterdam where the frows come
 27334	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfrom. Even more he liked an old German song of Johannes Jeep about
 27335	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe clear sea and the voices of sirens, sweet murderers of men, which
 27336	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tboggled Bloom a bit:
 27337	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27338	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t     Von der Sirenen Listigkeit
 27339	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t     Tun die Poeten dichten.
 27340	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27341	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThese opening bars he sang and translated extempore. Bloom, nodding,
 27342	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsaid he perfectly understood and begged him to go on by all means which
 27343	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\the did.
 27344	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27345	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tA phenomenally beautiful tenor voice like that, the rarest of boons,
 27346	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twhich Bloom appreciated at the very first note he got out, could easily,
 27347	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tif properly handled by some recognised authority on voice production
 27348	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsuch as Barraclough and being able to read music into the bargain,
 27349	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcommand its own price where baritones were ten a penny and procure for
 27350	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tits fortunate possessor in the near future an entrée into fashionable
 27351	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thouses in the best residential quarters of financial magnates in a large
 27352	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tway of business and titled people where with his university degree of
 27353	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tB. A. (a huge ad in its way) and gentlemanly bearing to all the more
 27354	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tinfluence the good impression he would infallibly score a distinct
 27355	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsuccess, being blessed with brains which also could be utilised for the
 27356	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpurpose and other requisites, if his clothes were properly attended
 27357	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tto so as to the better worm his way into their good graces as he, a
 27358	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tyouthful tyro in society’s sartorial niceties, hardly understood how a
 27359	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlittle thing like that could militate against you. It was in fact only a
 27360	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmatter of months and he could easily foresee him participating in
 27361	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttheir musical and artistic conversaziones during the festivities of the
 27362	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tChristmas season, for choice, causing a slight flutter in the dovecotes
 27363	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof the fair sex and being made a lot of by ladies out for sensation,
 27364	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcases of which, as he happened to know, were on record—in fact, without
 27365	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tgiving the show away, he himself once upon a time, if he cared to, could
 27366	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\teasily have. Added to which of course would be the pecuniary emolument
 27367	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tby no means to be sneezed at, going hand in hand with his tuition
 27368	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfees. Not, he parenthesised, that for the sake of filthy lucre he need
 27369	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tnecessarily embrace the lyric platform as a walk in life for any lengthy
 27370	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tspace of time. But a step in the required direction it was beyond yea or
 27371	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tnay and both monetarily and mentally it contained no reflection on his
 27372	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdignity in the smallest and it often turned in uncommonly handy to
 27373	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbe handed a cheque at a muchneeded moment when every little helped.
 27374	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBesides, though taste latterly had deteriorated to a degree, original
 27375	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmusic like that, different from the conventional rut, would rapidly
 27376	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thave a great vogue as it would be a decided novelty for Dublin’s musical
 27377	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tworld after the usual hackneyed run of catchy tenor solos foisted on a
 27378	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tconfiding public by Ivan St Austell and Hilton St Just and their genus
 27379	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tomne. Yes, beyond a shadow of a doubt he could with all the cards in his
 27380	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thand and he had a capital opening to make a name for himself and win a
 27381	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thigh place in the city’s esteem where he could command a stiff figure
 27382	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand, booking ahead, give a grand concert for the patrons of the King
 27383	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tstreet house, given a backerup, if one were forthcoming to kick him
 27384	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tupstairs, so to speak, a big if, however, with some impetus of the
 27385	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tgoahead sort to obviate the inevitable procrastination which often
 27386	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttripped up a too much fêted prince of good fellows. And it need not
 27387	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdetract from the other by one iota as, being his own master, he would
 27388	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thave heaps of time to practise literature in his spare moments when
 27389	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdesirous of so doing without its clashing with his vocal career or
 27390	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcontaining anything derogatory whatsoever as it was a matter for himself
 27391	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\talone. In fact, he had the ball at his feet and that was the very reason
 27392	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twhy the other, possessed of a remarkably sharp nose for smelling a rat
 27393	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof any sort, hung on to him at all.
 27394	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27395	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThe horse was just then. And later on at a propitious opportunity he
 27396	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpurposed (Bloom did), without anyway prying into his private affairs
 27397	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ton the fools step in where angels principle, advising him to sever his
 27398	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tconnection with a certain budding practitioner who, he noticed, was
 27399	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tprone to disparage and even to a slight extent with some hilarious
 27400	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpretext when not present, deprecate him, or whatever you like to call it
 27401	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twhich in Bloom’s humble opinion threw a nasty sidelight on that side of
 27402	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ta person’s character, no pun intended.
 27403	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27404	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThe horse having reached the end of his tether, so to speak, halted and,
 27405	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\trearing high a proud feathering tail, added his quota by letting fall on
 27406	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe floor which the brush would soon brush up and polish, three smoking
 27407	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tglobes of turds. Slowly three times, one after another, from a full
 27408	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcrupper he mired. And humanely his driver waited till he (or she) had
 27409	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tended, patient in his scythed car.
 27410	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27411	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tSide by side Bloom, profiting by the contretemps, with Stephen passed
 27412	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthrough the gap of the chains, divided by the upright, and, stepping
 27413	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tover a strand of mire, went across towards Gardiner street lower,
 27414	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tStephen singing more boldly, but not loudly, the end of the ballad.
 27415	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27416	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t      Und alle Schiffe brücken.
 27417	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27418	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThe driver never said a word, good, bad or indifferent, but merely
 27419	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twatched the two figures, as he sat on his lowbacked car, both black, one
 27420	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfull, one lean, walk towards the railway bridge, to be married by Father
 27421	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMaher. As they walked they at times stopped and walked again continuing
 27422	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttheir tête à tête (which, of course, he was utterly out of) about
 27423	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsirens, enemies of man’s reason, mingled with a number of other topics
 27424	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof the same category, usurpers, historical cases of the kind while the
 27425	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tman in the sweeper car or you might as well call it in the sleeper car
 27426	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twho in any case couldn’t possibly hear because they were too far simply
 27427	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsat in his seat near the end of lower Gardiner street and looked after
 27428	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttheir lowbacked car.
 27429	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27430	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27431	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27432	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27433	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27434	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t[ 17 ]
 27435	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27436	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tWhat parallel courses did Bloom and Stephen follow returning?
 27437	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27438	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tStarting united both at normal walking pace from Beresford place they
 27439	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfollowed in the order named Lower and Middle Gardiner streets and
 27440	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMountjoy square, west: then, at reduced pace, each bearing left,
 27441	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tGardiner’s place by an inadvertence as far as the farther corner of
 27442	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTemple street: then, at reduced pace with interruptions of halt, bearing
 27443	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tright, Temple street, north, as far as Hardwicke place. Approaching,
 27444	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdisparate, at relaxed walking pace they crossed both the circus before
 27445	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tGeorge’s church diametrically, the chord in any circle being less than
 27446	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe arc which it subtends.
 27447	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27448	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tOf what did the duumvirate deliberate during their itinerary?
 27449	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27450	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMusic, literature, Ireland, Dublin, Paris, friendship, woman,
 27451	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tprostitution, diet, the influence of gaslight or the light of arc and
 27452	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tglowlamps on the growth of adjoining paraheliotropic trees, exposed
 27453	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcorporation emergency dustbuckets, the Roman catholic church,
 27454	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tecclesiastical celibacy, the Irish nation, jesuit education, careers,
 27455	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe study of medicine, the past day, the maleficent influence of the
 27456	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpresabbath, Stephen’s collapse.
 27457	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27458	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tDid Bloom discover common factors of similarity between their respective
 27459	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlike and unlike reactions to experience?
 27460	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27461	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBoth were sensitive to artistic impressions, musical in preference to
 27462	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tplastic or pictorial. Both preferred a continental to an insular manner
 27463	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof life, a cisatlantic to a transatlantic place of residence. Both
 27464	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tindurated by early domestic training and an inherited tenacity of
 27465	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\theterodox resistance professed their disbelief in many orthodox
 27466	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\treligious, national, social and ethical doctrines. Both admitted
 27467	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe alternately stimulating and obtunding influence of heterosexual
 27468	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmagnetism.
 27469	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27470	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tWere their views on some points divergent?
 27471	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27472	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tStephen dissented openly from Bloom’s views on the importance of dietary
 27473	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand civic selfhelp while Bloom dissented tacitly from Stephen’s views
 27474	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ton the eternal affirmation of the spirit of man in literature. Bloom
 27475	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tassented covertly to Stephen’s rectification of the anachronism
 27476	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tinvolved in assigning the date of the conversion of the Irish nation to
 27477	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tchristianity from druidism by Patrick son of Calpornus, son of Potitus,
 27478	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tson of Odyssus, sent by pope Celestine I in the year 432 in the reign
 27479	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof Leary to the year 260 or thereabouts in the reign of Cormac MacArt (†
 27480	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t266 A.D.), suffocated by imperfect deglutition of aliment at Sletty
 27481	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand interred at Rossnaree. The collapse which Bloom ascribed to
 27482	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tgastric inanition and certain chemical compounds of varying degrees of
 27483	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tadulteration and alcoholic strength, accelerated by mental exertion and
 27484	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe velocity of rapid circular motion in a relaxing atmosphere, Stephen
 27485	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tattributed to the reapparition of a matutinal cloud (perceived by both
 27486	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfrom two different points of observation Sandycove and Dublin) at first
 27487	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tno bigger than a woman’s hand.
 27488	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27489	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tWas there one point on which their views were equal and negative?
 27490	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27491	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThe influence of gaslight or electric light on the growth of adjoining
 27492	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tparaheliotropic trees.
 27493	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27494	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHad Bloom discussed similar subjects during nocturnal perambulations in
 27495	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe past?
 27496	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27497	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tIn 1884 with Owen Goldberg and Cecil Turnbull at night on public
 27498	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthoroughfares between Longwood avenue and Leonard’s corner and Leonard’s
 27499	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcorner and Synge street and Synge street and Bloomfield avenue. In 1885
 27500	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twith Percy Apjohn in the evenings, reclined against the wall between
 27501	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tGibraltar villa and Bloomfield house in Crumlin, barony of Uppercross.
 27502	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tIn 1886 occasionally with casual acquaintances and prospective
 27503	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpurchasers on doorsteps, in front parlours, in third class railway
 27504	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcarriages of suburban lines. In 1888 frequently with major Brian Tweedy
 27505	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand his daughter Miss Marion Tweedy, together and separately on the
 27506	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlounge in Matthew Dillon’s house in Roundtown. Once in 1892 and once in
 27507	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t1893 with Julius (Juda) Mastiansky, on both occasions in the parlour of
 27508	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\this (Bloom’s) house in Lombard street, west.
 27509	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27510	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tWhat reflection concerning the irregular sequence of dates 1884, 1885,
 27511	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t1886, 1888, 1892, 1893, 1904 did Bloom make before their arrival at
 27512	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttheir destination?
 27513	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27514	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHe reflected that the progressive extension of the field of individual
 27515	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdevelopment and experience was regressively accompanied by a restriction
 27516	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof the converse domain of interindividual relations.
 27517	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27518	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tAs in what ways?
 27519	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27520	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tFrom inexistence to existence he came to many and was as one received:
 27521	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\texistence with existence he was with any as any with any: from existence
 27522	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tto nonexistence gone he would be by all as none perceived.
 27523	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27524	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tWhat act did Bloom make on their arrival at their destination?
 27525	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27526	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tAt the housesteps of the 4th of the equidifferent uneven numbers, number
 27527	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t7 Eccles street, he inserted his hand mechanically into the back pocket
 27528	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof his trousers to obtain his latchkey.
 27529	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27530	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tWas it there?
 27531	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27532	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tIt was in the corresponding pocket of the trousers which he had worn on
 27533	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe day but one preceding.
 27534	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27535	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tWhy was he doubly irritated?
 27536	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27537	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBecause he had forgotten and because he remembered that he had reminded
 27538	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thimself twice not to forget.
 27539	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27540	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tWhat were then the alternatives before the, premeditatedly
 27541	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(respectively) and inadvertently, keyless couple?
 27542	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27543	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTo enter or not to enter. To knock or not to knock.
 27544	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27545	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBloom’s decision?
 27546	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27547	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tA stratagem. Resting his feet on the dwarf wall, he climbed over the
 27548	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tarea railings, compressed his hat on his head, grasped two points at
 27549	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe lower union of rails and stiles, lowered his body gradually by its
 27550	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlength of five feet nine inches and a half to within two feet ten inches
 27551	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof the area pavement and allowed his body to move freely in space by
 27552	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tseparating himself from the railings and crouching in preparation for
 27553	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe impact of the fall.
 27554	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27555	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tDid he fall?
 27556	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27557	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBy his body’s known weight of eleven stone and four pounds in
 27558	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tavoirdupois measure, as certified by the graduated machine for
 27559	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tperiodical selfweighing in the premises of Francis Froedman,
 27560	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpharmaceutical chemist of 19 Frederick street, north, on the last feast
 27561	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof the Ascension, to wit, the twelfth day of May of the bissextile year
 27562	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tone thousand nine hundred and four of the christian era (jewish era five
 27563	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthousand six hundred and sixtyfour, mohammadan era one thousand three
 27564	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thundred and twentytwo), golden number 5, epact 13, solar cycle 9,
 27565	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdominical letters C B, Roman indiction 2, Julian period 6617, MCMIV.
 27566	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27567	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tDid he rise uninjured by concussion?
 27568	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27569	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tRegaining new stable equilibrium he rose uninjured though concussed by
 27570	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe impact, raised the latch of the area door by the exertion of force
 27571	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tat its freely moving flange and by leverage of the first kind applied
 27572	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tat its fulcrum, gained retarded access to the kitchen through the
 27573	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsubadjacent scullery, ignited a lucifer match by friction, set free
 27574	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tinflammable coal gas by turning on the ventcock, lit a high flame which,
 27575	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tby regulating, he reduced to quiescent candescence and lit finally a
 27576	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tportable candle.
 27577	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27578	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tWhat discrete succession of images did Stephen meanwhile perceive?
 27579	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27580	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tReclined against the area railings he perceived through the transparent
 27581	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tkitchen panes a man regulating a gasflame of 14 CP, a man lighting a
 27582	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcandle of 1 CP, a man removing in turn each of his two boots, a man
 27583	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tleaving the kitchen holding a candle.
 27584	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27585	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tDid the man reappear elsewhere?
 27586	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27587	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tAfter a lapse of four minutes the glimmer of his candle was discernible
 27588	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthrough the semitransparent semicircular glass fanlight over the
 27589	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thalldoor. The halldoor turned gradually on its hinges. In the open space
 27590	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof the doorway the man reappeared without his hat, with his candle.
 27591	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27592	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tDid Stephen obey his sign?
 27593	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27594	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tYes, entering softly, he helped to close and chain the door and followed
 27595	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsoftly along the hallway the man’s back and listed feet and lighted
 27596	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcandle past a lighted crevice of doorway on the left and carefully down
 27597	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ta turning staircase of more than five steps into the kitchen of Bloom’s
 27598	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thouse.
 27599	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27600	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tWhat did Bloom do?
 27601	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27602	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHe extinguished the candle by a sharp expiration of breath upon its
 27603	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tflame, drew two spoonseat deal chairs to the hearthstone, one for
 27604	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tStephen with its back to the area window, the other for himself when
 27605	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tnecessary, knelt on one knee, composed in the grate a pyre of crosslaid
 27606	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tresintipped sticks and various coloured papers and irregular polygons
 27607	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof best Abram coal at twentyone shillings a ton from the yard of Messrs
 27608	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tFlower and M’Donald of 14 D’Olier street, kindled it at three projecting
 27609	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpoints of paper with one ignited lucifer match, thereby releasing
 27610	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe potential energy contained in the fuel by allowing its carbon and
 27611	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thydrogen elements to enter into free union with the oxygen of the air.
 27612	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27613	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tOf what similar apparitions did Stephen think?
 27614	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27615	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tOf others elsewhere in other times who, kneeling on one knee or on two,
 27616	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thad kindled fires for him, of Brother Michael in the infirmary of the
 27617	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcollege of the Society of Jesus at Clongowes Wood, Sallins, in the
 27618	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcounty of Kildare: of his father, Simon Dedalus, in an unfurnished room
 27619	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof his first residence in Dublin, number thirteen Fitzgibbon street:
 27620	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof his godmother Miss Kate Morkan in the house of her dying sister Miss
 27621	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tJulia Morkan at 15 Usher’s Island: of his aunt Sara, wife of Richie
 27622	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(Richard) Goulding, in the kitchen of their lodgings at 62 Clanbrassil
 27623	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tstreet: of his mother Mary, wife of Simon Dedalus, in the kitchen of
 27624	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tnumber twelve North Richmond street on the morning of the feast of
 27625	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tSaint Francis Xavier 1898: of the dean of studies, Father Butt, in the
 27626	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tphysics’ theatre of university College, 16 Stephen’s Green, north: of
 27627	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\this sister Dilly (Delia) in his father’s house in Cabra.
 27628	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27629	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tWhat did Stephen see on raising his gaze to the height of a yard from
 27630	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe fire towards the opposite wall?
 27631	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27632	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tUnder a row of five coiled spring housebells a curvilinear rope,
 27633	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tstretched between two holdfasts athwart across the recess beside the
 27634	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tchimney pier, from which hung four smallsized square handkerchiefs
 27635	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfolded unattached consecutively in adjacent rectangles and one pair of
 27636	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tladies’ grey hose with Lisle suspender tops and feet in their habitual
 27637	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tposition clamped by three erect wooden pegs two at their outer
 27638	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\textremities and the third at their point of junction.
 27639	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27640	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tWhat did Bloom see on the range?
 27641	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27642	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tOn the right (smaller) hob a blue enamelled saucepan: on the left
 27643	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(larger) hob a black iron kettle.
 27644	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27645	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tWhat did Bloom do at the range?
 27646	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27647	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHe removed the saucepan to the left hob, rose and carried the iron
 27648	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tkettle to the sink in order to tap the current by turning the faucet to
 27649	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlet it flow.
 27650	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27651	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tDid it flow?
 27652	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27653	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tYes. From Roundwood reservoir in county Wicklow of a cubic capacity of
 27654	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t2400 million gallons, percolating through a subterranean aqueduct of
 27655	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfilter mains of single and double pipeage constructed at an initial
 27656	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tplant cost of £ 5 per linear yard by way of the Dargle, Rathdown, Glen
 27657	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof the Downs and Callowhill to the 26 acre reservoir at Stillorgan, a
 27658	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdistance of 22 statute miles, and thence, through a system of relieving
 27659	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttanks, by a gradient of 250 feet to the city boundary at Eustace bridge,
 27660	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tupper Leeson street, though from prolonged summer drouth and daily
 27661	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsupply of 12 1/2 million gallons the water had fallen below the sill of
 27662	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe overflow weir for which reason the borough surveyor and waterworks
 27663	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tengineer, Mr Spencer Harty, C. E., on the instructions of the waterworks
 27664	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcommittee had prohibited the use of municipal water for purposes other
 27665	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthan those of consumption (envisaging the possibility of recourse being
 27666	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thad to the impotable water of the Grand and Royal canals as in 1893)
 27667	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tparticularly as the South Dublin Guardians, notwithstanding their ration
 27668	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof 15 gallons per day per pauper supplied through a 6 inch meter, had
 27669	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbeen convicted of a wastage of 20,000 gallons per night by a reading of
 27670	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttheir meter on the affirmation of the law agent of the corporation, Mr
 27671	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tIgnatius Rice, solicitor, thereby acting to the detriment of another
 27672	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsection of the public, selfsupporting taxpayers, solvent, sound.
 27673	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27674	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tWhat in water did Bloom, waterlover, drawer of water, watercarrier,
 27675	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\treturning to the range, admire?
 27676	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27677	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tIts universality: its democratic equality and constancy to its nature
 27678	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tin seeking its own level: its vastness in the ocean of Mercator’s
 27679	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tprojection: its unplumbed profundity in the Sundam trench of the Pacific
 27680	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\texceeding 8000 fathoms: the restlessness of its waves and surface
 27681	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tparticles visiting in turn all points of its seaboard: the independence
 27682	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof its units: the variability of states of sea: its hydrostatic
 27683	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tquiescence in calm: its hydrokinetic turgidity in neap and spring tides:
 27684	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tits subsidence after devastation: its sterility in the circumpolar
 27685	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ticecaps, arctic and antarctic: its climatic and commercial significance:
 27686	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tits preponderance of 3 to 1 over the dry land of the globe: its
 27687	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tindisputable hegemony extending in square leagues over all the region
 27688	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbelow the subequatorial tropic of Capricorn: the multisecular stability
 27689	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof its primeval basin: its luteofulvous bed: its capacity to dissolve
 27690	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand hold in solution all soluble substances including millions of
 27691	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttons of the most precious metals: its slow erosions of peninsulas and
 27692	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tislands, its persistent formation of homothetic islands, peninsulas
 27693	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand downwardtending promontories: its alluvial deposits: its weight and
 27694	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tvolume and density: its imperturbability in lagoons and highland tarns:
 27695	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tits gradation of colours in the torrid and temperate and frigid zones:
 27696	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tits vehicular ramifications in continental lakecontained streams and
 27697	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tconfluent oceanflowing rivers with their tributaries and transoceanic
 27698	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcurrents, gulfstream, north and south equatorial courses: its violence
 27699	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tin seaquakes, waterspouts, Artesian wells, eruptions, torrents, eddies,
 27700	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfreshets, spates, groundswells, watersheds, waterpartings, geysers,
 27701	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcataracts, whirlpools, maelstroms, inundations, deluges, cloudbursts:
 27702	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tits vast circumterrestrial ahorizontal curve: its secrecy in springs and
 27703	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlatent humidity, revealed by rhabdomantic or hygrometric instruments
 27704	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand exemplified by the well by the hole in the wall at Ashtown
 27705	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tgate, saturation of air, distillation of dew: the simplicity of its
 27706	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcomposition, two constituent parts of hydrogen with one constituent part
 27707	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof oxygen: its healing virtues: its buoyancy in the waters of the Dead
 27708	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tSea: its persevering penetrativeness in runnels, gullies, inadequate
 27709	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdams, leaks on shipboard: its properties for cleansing, quenching thirst
 27710	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand fire, nourishing vegetation: its infallibility as paradigm and
 27711	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tparagon: its metamorphoses as vapour, mist, cloud, rain, sleet, snow,
 27712	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thail: its strength in rigid hydrants: its variety of forms in loughs
 27713	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand bays and gulfs and bights and guts and lagoons and atolls and
 27714	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tarchipelagos and sounds and fjords and minches and tidal estuaries and
 27715	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tarms of sea: its solidity in glaciers, icebergs, icefloes: its docility
 27716	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tin working hydraulic millwheels, turbines, dynamos, electric power
 27717	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tstations, bleachworks, tanneries, scutchmills: its utility in canals,
 27718	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\trivers, if navigable, floating and graving docks: its potentiality
 27719	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tderivable from harnessed tides or watercourses falling from level
 27720	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tto level: its submarine fauna and flora (anacoustic, photophobe),
 27721	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tnumerically, if not literally, the inhabitants of the globe: its
 27722	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tubiquity as constituting 90 % of the human body: the noxiousness of its
 27723	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\teffluvia in lacustrine marshes, pestilential fens, faded flowerwater,
 27724	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tstagnant pools in the waning moon.
 27725	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27726	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHaving set the halffilled kettle on the now burning coals, why did he
 27727	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\treturn to the stillflowing tap?
 27728	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27729	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTo wash his soiled hands with a partially consumed tablet of
 27730	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBarrington’s lemonflavoured soap, to which paper still adhered, (bought
 27731	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthirteen hours previously for fourpence and still unpaid for), in fresh
 27732	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcold neverchanging everchanging water and dry them, face and hands, in a
 27733	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlong redbordered holland cloth passed over a wooden revolving roller.
 27734	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27735	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tWhat reason did Stephen give for declining Bloom’s offer?
 27736	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27737	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThat he was hydrophobe, hating partial contact by immersion or total by
 27738	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsubmersion in cold water, (his last bath having taken place in the month
 27739	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof October of the preceding year), disliking the aqueous substances of
 27740	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tglass and crystal, distrusting aquacities of thought and language.
 27741	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27742	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tWhat impeded Bloom from giving Stephen counsels of hygiene and
 27743	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tprophylactic to which should be added suggestions concerning a
 27744	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpreliminary wetting of the head and contraction of the muscles with
 27745	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\trapid splashing of the face and neck and thoracic and epigastric region
 27746	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tin case of sea or river bathing, the parts of the human anatomy most
 27747	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsensitive to cold being the nape, stomach and thenar or sole of foot?
 27748	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27749	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThe incompatibility of aquacity with the erratic originality of genius.
 27750	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27751	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tWhat additional didactic counsels did he similarly repress?
 27752	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27753	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tDietary: concerning the respective percentage of protein and caloric
 27754	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tenergy in bacon, salt ling and butter, the absence of the former in the
 27755	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlastnamed and the abundance of the latter in the firstnamed.
 27756	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27757	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tWhich seemed to the host to be the predominant qualities of his guest?
 27758	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27759	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tConfidence in himself, an equal and opposite power of abandonment and
 27760	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\trecuperation.
 27761	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27762	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tWhat concomitant phenomenon took place in the vessel of liquid by the
 27763	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tagency of fire?
 27764	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27765	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThe phenomenon of ebullition. Fanned by a constant updraught of
 27766	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tventilation between the kitchen and the chimneyflue, ignition was
 27767	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcommunicated from the faggots of precombustible fuel to polyhedral
 27768	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmasses of bituminous coal, containing in compressed mineral form the
 27769	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfoliated fossilised decidua of primeval forests which had in turn
 27770	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tderived their vegetative existence from the sun, primal source of heat
 27771	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(radiant), transmitted through omnipresent luminiferous diathermanous
 27772	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tether. Heat (convected), a mode of motion developed by such
 27773	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcombustion, was constantly and increasingly conveyed from the source
 27774	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof calorification to the liquid contained in the vessel, being radiated
 27775	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthrough the uneven unpolished dark surface of the metal iron, in part
 27776	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\treflected, in part absorbed, in part transmitted, gradually raising
 27777	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe temperature of the water from normal to boiling point, a rise in
 27778	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttemperature expressible as the result of an expenditure of 72 thermal
 27779	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tunits needed to raise 1 pound of water from 50° to 212° Fahrenheit.
 27780	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27781	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tWhat announced the accomplishment of this rise in temperature?
 27782	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27783	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tA double falciform ejection of water vapour from under the kettlelid at
 27784	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tboth sides simultaneously.
 27785	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27786	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tFor what personal purpose could Bloom have applied the water so boiled?
 27787	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27788	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTo shave himself.
 27789	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27790	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tWhat advantages attended shaving by night?
 27791	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27792	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tA softer beard: a softer brush if intentionally allowed to remain from
 27793	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tshave to shave in its agglutinated lather: a softer skin if unexpectedly
 27794	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tencountering female acquaintances in remote places at incustomary hours:
 27795	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tquiet reflections upon the course of the day: a cleaner sensation when
 27796	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tawaking after a fresher sleep since matutinal noises, premonitions and
 27797	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tperturbations, a clattered milkcan, a postman’s double knock, a paper
 27798	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tread, reread while lathering, relathering the same spot, a shock, a
 27799	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tshoot, with thought of aught he sought though fraught with nought might
 27800	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcause a faster rate of shaving and a nick on which incision plaster with
 27801	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tprecision cut and humected and applied adhered: which was to be done.
 27802	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27803	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tWhy did absence of light disturb him less than presence of noise?
 27804	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27805	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBecause of the surety of the sense of touch in his firm full masculine
 27806	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfeminine passive active hand.
 27807	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27808	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tWhat quality did it (his hand) possess but with what counteracting
 27809	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tinfluence?
 27810	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27811	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThe operative surgical quality but that he was reluctant to shed human
 27812	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tblood even when the end justified the means, preferring, in their
 27813	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tnatural order, heliotherapy, psychophysicotherapeutics, osteopathic
 27814	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsurgery.
 27815	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27816	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tWhat lay under exposure on the lower, middle and upper shelves of the
 27817	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tkitchen dresser, opened by Bloom?
 27818	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27819	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tOn the lower shelf five vertical breakfast plates, six horizontal

 27823	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcopper, and a phial of aromatic (violet) comfits. On the middle shelf

 27828	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tCo’s white invalid port, half disrobed of its swathe of coralpink tissue
 27829	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpaper, a packet of Epps’s soluble cocoa, five ounces of Anne Lynch’s

 27831	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcanister containing the best crystallised lump sugar, two onions, one,

 27833	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\taugmented surface and more redolent, a jar of Irish Model Dairy’s cream,
 27834	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ta jug of brown crockery containing a naggin and a quarter of soured
 27835	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tadulterated milk, converted by heat into water, acidulous serum and
 27836	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsemisolidified curds, which added to the quantity subtracted for Mr
 27837	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBloom’s and Mrs Fleming’s breakfasts, made one imperial pint, the total
 27838	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tquantity originally delivered, two cloves, a halfpenny and a small dish
 27839	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcontaining a slice of fresh ribsteak. On the upper shelf a battery of
 27840	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tjamjars (empty) of various sizes and proveniences.

 27850	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpreindicative of the result of the Gold Cup flat handicap, the official
 27851	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand definitive result of which he had read in the Evening Telegraph,
 27852	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlate pink edition, in the cabman’s shelter, at Butt bridge.

 27855	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbeen received by him?

 27859	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tstreet lower, outside Graham Lemon’s when a dark man had placed in

 27868	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tinspiration shining in his countenance and bearing in his arms the

 27874	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfollowed its occurrence as variably as the acoustic report followed the
 27875	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\telectrical discharge and of counterestimating against an actual loss
 27876	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tby failure to interpret the total sum of possible losses proceeding
 27877	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\toriginally from a successful interpretation.

 27887	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tothers. Light to the gentiles.

 27920	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlady’s handkerchiefs, if and when ascertained to be in a presentable
 27921	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcondition.
 27922	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27923	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tWho drank more quickly?
 27924	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t

 27926	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfrom the concave surface of a spoon along the handle of which a steady
 27927	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tflow of heat was conducted, three sips to his opponent’s one, six to
 27928	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttwo, nine to three.

 27931	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t

 27933	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tengaged in mental composition he reflected on the pleasures derived from
 27934	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tliterature of instruction rather than of amusement as he himself had
 27935	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tapplied to the works of William Shakespeare more than once for the
 27936	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsolution of difficult problems in imaginary or real life.

 27969	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpoet) sent to Miss Marion (Molly) Tweedy on the 14 February 1888?

 27976	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27977	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tWhat had prevented him from completing a topical song (music by R. G.
 27978	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tJohnston) on the events of the past, or fixtures for the actual, years,
 27979	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tentitled If Brian Boru could but come back and see old Dublin now,
 27980	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcommissioned by Michael Gunn, lessee of the Gaiety Theatre, 46, 47, 48,
 27981	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t49 South King street, and to be introduced into the sixth scene, the
 27982	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tvalley of diamonds, of the second edition (30 January 1893) of the grand
 27983	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tannual Christmas pantomime Sinbad the Sailor (produced by R. Shelton
 27984	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t26 December 1892, written by Greenleaf Whittier, scenery by George
 27985	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tA. Jackson and Cecil Hicks, costumes by Mrs and Miss Whelan under

 27987	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tharlequinade by Thomas Otto) and sung by Nelly Bouverist, principal
 27988	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tgirl?
 27989	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 27990	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tFirstly, oscillation between events of imperial and of local interest,
 27991	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe anticipated diamond jubilee of Queen Victoria (born 1820, acceded
 27992	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t1837) and the posticipated opening of the new municipal fish market:
 27993	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsecondly, apprehension of opposition from extreme circles on the
 27994	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tquestions of the respective visits of Their Royal Highnesses the
 27995	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tduke and duchess of York (real) and of His Majesty King Brian Boru
 27996	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(imaginary): thirdly, a conflict between professional etiquette and
 27997	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tprofessional emulation concerning the recent erections of the Grand
 27998	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tLyric Hall on Burgh Quay and the Theatre Royal in Hawkins street:
 27999	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfourthly, distraction resultant from compassion for Nelly Bouverist’s
 28000	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tnon-intellectual, non-political, non-topical expression of countenance
 28001	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand concupiscence caused by Nelly Bouverist’s revelations of white
 28002	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tarticles of non-intellectual, non-political, non-topical underclothing
 28003	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twhile she (Nelly Bouverist) was in the articles: fifthly, the
 28004	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdifficulties of the selection of appropriate music and humorous
 28005	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tallusions from Everybody’s Book of Jokes (1000 pages and a laugh in
 28006	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tevery one): sixthly, the rhymes, homophonous and cacophonous, associated
 28007	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twith the names of the new lord mayor, Daniel Tallon, the new high
 28008	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsheriff, Thomas Pile and the new solicitorgeneral, Dunbar Plunket
 28009	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBarton.
 28010	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 28011	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tWhat relation existed between their ages?
 28012	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 28013	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t16 years before in 1888 when Bloom was of Stephen’s present age Stephen
 28014	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twas 6. 16 years after in 1920 when Stephen would be of Bloom’s present
 28015	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tage Bloom would be 54. In 1936 when Bloom would be 70 and Stephen 54
 28016	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttheir ages initially in the ratio of 16 to 0 would be as 17 1/2 to 13
 28017	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t1/2, the proportion increasing and the disparity diminishing according
 28018	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tas arbitrary future years were added, for if the proportion existing in
 28019	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t1883 had continued immutable, conceiving that to be possible, till then
 28020	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t1904 when Stephen was 22 Bloom would be 374 and in 1920 when Stephen
 28021	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twould be 38, as Bloom then was, Bloom would be 646 while in 1952 when
 28022	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tStephen would have attained the maximum postdiluvian age of 70 Bloom,
 28023	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tbeing 1190 years alive having been born in the year 714, would have
 28024	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsurpassed by 221 years the maximum antediluvian age, that of Methusalah,
 28025	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t969 years, while, if Stephen would continue to live until he would
 28026	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tattain that age in the year 3072 A.D., Bloom would have been obliged to
 28027	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thave been alive 83,300 years, having been obliged to have been born in
 28028	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe year 81,396 B.C.
 28029	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 28030	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tWhat events might nullify these calculations?
 28031	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 28032	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThe cessation of existence of both or either, the inauguration of a
 28033	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tnew era or calendar, the annihilation of the world and consequent
 28034	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\textermination of the human species, inevitable but impredictable.
 28035	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 28036	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHow many previous encounters proved their preexisting acquaintance?
 28037	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 28038	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTwo. The first in the lilacgarden of Matthew Dillon’s house, Medina
 28039	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tVilla, Kimmage road, Roundtown, in 1887, in the company of Stephen’s
 28040	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmother, Stephen being then of the age of 5 and reluctant to give his
 28041	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thand in salutation. The second in the coffeeroom of Breslin’s hotel on a
 28042	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\trainy Sunday in the January of 1892, in the company of Stephen’s father
 28043	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand Stephen’s granduncle, Stephen being then 5 years older.
 28044	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 28045	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tDid Bloom accept the invitation to dinner given then by the son and
 28046	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tafterwards seconded by the father?
 28047	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 28048	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tVery gratefully, with grateful appreciation, with sincere appreciative
 28049	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tgratitude, in appreciatively grateful sincerity of regret, he declined.
 28050	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 28051	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tDid their conversation on the subject of these reminiscences reveal a
 28052	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthird connecting link between them?
 28053	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 28054	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tMrs Riordan (Dante), a widow of independent means, had resided in the
 28055	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thouse of Stephen’s parents from 1 September 1888 to 29 December 1891 and
 28056	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thad also resided during the years 1892, 1893 and 1894 in the City Arms
 28057	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHotel owned by Elizabeth O’Dowd of 54 Prussia street where, during parts
 28058	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof the years 1893 and 1894, she had been a constant informant of Bloom
 28059	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twho resided also in the same hotel, being at that time a clerk in the
 28060	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\temployment of Joseph Cuffe of 5 Smithfield for the superintendence of
 28061	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsales in the adjacent Dublin Cattle market on the North Circular road.
 28062	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 28063	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHad he performed any special corporal work of mercy for her?
 28064	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 28065	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHe had sometimes propelled her on warm summer evenings, an infirm widow
 28066	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof independent, if limited, means, in her convalescent bathchair
 28067	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twith slow revolutions of its wheels as far as the corner of the North
 28068	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tCircular road opposite Mr Gavin Low’s place of business where she had
 28069	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tremained for a certain time scanning through his onelensed binocular
 28070	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfieldglasses unrecognisable citizens on tramcars, roadster bicycles
 28071	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tequipped with inflated pneumatic tyres, hackney carriages, tandems,
 28072	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tprivate and hired landaus, dogcarts, ponytraps and brakes passing from
 28073	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe city to the Phœnix Park and _vice versa_.

 28391	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tlanguages were cited with modulations of voice and translation of texts
 28392	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tby guest to host and by host to guest?

 28395	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(walk, walk, walk your way, walk in safety, walk with care).
 28396	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t

 28398	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tamid thy hair is as a slice of pomegranate).

 28401	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmade in substantiation of the oral comparison?
 28402	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 28403	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBy juxtaposition. On the penultimate blank page of a book of inferior
 28404	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tliterary style, entituled Sweets of Sin (produced by Bloom and so
 28405	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmanipulated that its front cover came in contact with the surface of
 28406	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe table) with a pencil (supplied by Stephen) Stephen wrote the Irish
 28407	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcharacters for gee, eh, dee, em, simple and modified, and Bloom in turn
 28408	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\twrote the Hebrew characters ghimel, aleph, daleth and (in the absence of
 28409	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmem) a substituted qoph, explaining their arithmetical values as ordinal
 28410	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand cardinal numbers, videlicet 3, 1, 4, and 100.
 28411	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t

 28416	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand syntax and practically excluding vocabulary.

 28423	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttaught on the plain of Shinar 242 years after the deluge in the seminary
 28424	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tinstituted by Fenius Farsaigh, descendant of Noah, progenitor of Israel,

 28565	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tatavistic delinquency, the mitigating circumstances of fanaticism,

 28574	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsomnambulism: once, sleeping, his body had risen, crouched and
 28575	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcrawled in the direction of a heatless fire and, having attained

 28650	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ttradition, in unexpectedness, their differences were similar.

 28703	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tIf he had known the late Mrs Emily Sinico, accidentally killed at Sydney
 28704	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tParade railway station, 14 October 1903.
 28705	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 28706	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tWhat inchoate corollary statement was consequently suppressed by the
 28707	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\thost?
 28708	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 28709	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tA statement explanatory of his absence on the occasion of the interment
 28710	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof Mrs Mary Dedalus (born Goulding), 26 June 1903, vigil of the
 28711	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tanniversary of the decease of Rudolph Bloom (born Virag).
 28712	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 28713	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tWas the proposal of asylum accepted?
 28714	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 28715	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tPromptly, inexplicably, with amicability, gratefully it was declined.
 28716	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 28717	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tWhat exchange of money took place between host and guest?
 28718	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 28719	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThe former returned to the latter, without interest, a sum of money (£
 28720	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t1-7-0), one pound seven shillings sterling, advanced by the latter to
 28721	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe former.
 28722	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 28723	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tWhat counterproposals were alternately advanced, accepted, modified,
 28724	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdeclined, restated in other terms, reaccepted, ratified, reconfirmed?
 28725	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 28726	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tTo inaugurate a prearranged course of Italian instruction, place
 28727	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe residence of the instructed. To inaugurate a course of vocal
 28728	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tinstruction, place the residence of the instructress. To inaugurate a
 28729	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tseries of static, semistatic and peripatetic intellectual dialogues,
 28730	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tplaces the residence of both speakers (if both speakers were resident in
 28731	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe same place), the Ship hotel and tavern, 6 Lower Abbey street (W. and
 28732	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tE. Connery, proprietors), the National Library of Ireland, 10 Kildare
 28733	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tstreet, the National Maternity Hospital, 29, 30 and 31 Holles street, a
 28734	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpublic garden, the vicinity of a place of worship, a conjunction of two
 28735	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tor more public thoroughfares, the point of bisection of a right line
 28736	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdrawn between their residences (if both speakers were resident in
 28737	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdifferent places).
 28738	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 28739	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tWhat rendered problematic for Bloom the realisation of these mutually
 28740	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tselfexcluding propositions?
 28741	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 28742	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThe irreparability of the past: once at a performance of Albert
 28743	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHengler’s circus in the Rotunda, Rutland square, Dublin, an intuitive
 28744	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tparticoloured clown in quest of paternity had penetrated from the ring
 28745	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tto a place in the auditorium where Bloom, solitary, was seated and had
 28746	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpublicly declared to an exhilarated audience that he (Bloom) was his
 28747	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t(the clown’s) papa. The imprevidibility of the future: once in the
 28748	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsummer of 1898 he (Bloom) had marked a florin (2/-) with three notches
 28749	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\ton the milled edge and tendered it in payment of an account due to and
 28750	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\treceived by J. and T. Davy, family grocers, 1 Charlemont Mall, Grand
 28751	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tCanal, for circulation on the waters of civic finance, for possible,
 28752	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcircuitous or direct, return.
 28753	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 28754	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tWas the clown Bloom’s son?
 28755	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 28756	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tNo.
 28757	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 28758	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHad Bloom’s coin returned?
 28759	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 28760	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tNever.
 28761	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 28762	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tWhy would a recurrent frustration the more depress him?
 28763	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 28764	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBecause at the critical turningpoint of human existence he desired to
 28765	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tamend many social conditions, the product of inequality and avarice and
 28766	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tinternational animosity.
 28767	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 28768	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHe believed then that human life was infinitely perfectible, eliminating
 28769	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthese conditions?
 28770	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 28771	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThere remained the generic conditions imposed by natural, as distinct
 28772	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfrom human law, as integral parts of the human whole: the necessity of
 28773	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdestruction to procure alimentary sustenance: the painful character of
 28774	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe ultimate functions of separate existence, the agonies of birth and
 28775	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tdeath: the monotonous menstruation of simian and (particularly) human
 28776	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfemales extending from the age of puberty to the menopause: inevitable
 28777	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\taccidents at sea, in mines and factories: certain very painful maladies
 28778	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tand their resultant surgical operations, innate lunacy and congenital
 28779	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tcriminality, decimating epidemics: catastrophic cataclysms which make
 28780	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tterror the basis of human mentality: seismic upheavals the epicentres
 28781	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tof which are located in densely populated regions: the fact of vital
 28782	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tgrowth, through convulsions of metamorphosis, from infancy through
 28783	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmaturity to decay.
 28784	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 28785	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tWhy did he desist from speculation?
 28786	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 28787	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tBecause it was a task for a superior intelligence to substitute other
 28788	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tmore acceptable phenomena in the place of the less acceptable phenomena
 28789	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tto be removed.
 28790	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 28791	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tDid Stephen participate in his dejection?
 28792	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 28793	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tHe affirmed his significance as a conscious rational animal proceeding
 28794	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tsyllogistically from the known to the unknown and a conscious rational
 28795	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\treagent between a micro and a macrocosm ineluctably constructed upon the
 28796	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tincertitude of the void.
 28797	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 28798	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tWas this affirmation apprehended by Bloom?
 28799	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 28800	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tNot verbally. Substantially.
 28801	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 28802	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tWhat comforted his misapprehension?
 28803	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 28804	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tThat as a competent keyless citizen he had proceeded energetically from
 28805	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tthe unknown to the known through the incertitude of the void.
 28806	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
 28807	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tIn what order of precedence, with what attendant ceremony was the exodus
 28808	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tfrom the house of bondage to the wilderness of inhabitation effected?

 28820	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\tpopulo barbaro.
 28821	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t

 28823	UlyssesbyJamesJoyce.txt\t
